"Did he climb down from the window? This is the third floor; a fall would at least break a bone," Amelia said, astonished.

Isabella shrugged with a bitter smile. "He didn't just climb down. He climbed up when he came. I thought he was a thief and hit him with a lunchbox."

"Michael's pretty agile. If he can climb buildings, why wouldn't he meet Mr. Williams?" Amelia commented.

Isabella sighed. "This can't go on. I'll just ask him what he wants."

Benjamin noticed the wound on Michael's forehead and frowned.

"Why'd you come to me only now?" Benjamin asked in a deep voice.

Michael looked puzzled. "Is my injury serious?"

Benjamin shrugged. "You come to me after it's healed. What's the point? This little wound won't even leave a scar."

Michael looked at the message for a few seconds, then typed a reply: [I can do anything as long as you like it.]

Back in the hospital room, Isabella saw Michael's message and a sweet smile appeared on her face.

"Think Mr. Williams will be so mad about you stealing John's fiancée that he'll hit you with his cane?" Benjamin teased.

Suddenly, Michael's phone rang again. This time, it was a call from John.

John told Michael to hurry back home; Mason had something to discuss with him.

###chapter 48 Conversation

"Benjamin, what should I do? Should I just come clean to Mason?" Michael asked Benjamin, his eyes pleading.

###chapter 49 You Are Everywhere

"I'm swamped at the office. Just hang tight. I'll be there soon. Be patient," Michael said, sounding rushed.

"Ms. Brown, I won't get into the issues between your families. Just do me a favor and let me take these two friends and leave." Benjamin smiled at Pearl and then gestured to Isabella and Amelia.

Isabella nodded and led Amelia out of the store.

"Isabella, who was that guy? He seemed pretty important," Amelia asked, curious.

"He's a top-notch surgeon and a good friend of Michael's. They met at the hospital," Isabella explained.

Isabella noticed Amelia curiously staring at Benjamin and teasingly asked, "Mr. White looks very handsome. Do you have a crush on him?"

Amelia quickly shook her head. "No way, but I did feel like Benjamin was checking me out."

Isabella raised an eyebrow and glanced at Benjamin. He was still talking to Pearl, but her expression suggested she wasn't thrilled with what he was saying.

Soon, Benjamin walked out of the store.

"Let's go; she won't bother you anymore," Benjamin called out, smiling, and turned his gaze to Amelia.

"Ms. Taylor, is this your friend?" Benjamin asked, curious.

Amelia extended her hand. "Hi, I'm Amelia."

"Hello, Benjamin. I'm a friend of Ms. Taylor," he introduced himself simply.

Isabella noticed Benjamin's gaze linger on Amelia for a few seconds before turning back to her.

Benjamin smiled. "Ms. Taylor, I heard you recently entered a cosmetics design competition. Did you ask Michael for help? He knows some of the judges; maybe he can give you a heads-up."

Isabella shook her head, smiling. She knew Michael had connections on the organizing committee, but she had turned down his offer to help.

"Thanks, but I want to do this on my own. I'm confident I'll do well," Isabella said, her smile full of confidence.

Benjamin nodded at her determination and didn't push further. He just changed the subject. Knowing Michael's high regard for Isabella, he was sure Michael would help if needed.

"Well, good luck then. I've got a surgery to prep for, so I need to head out." Benjamin smiled, said his goodbyes, and walked away.

After he was out of sight, Isabella turned to Amelia. "Did you get the wrong idea? I don't think he was interested in you."

Amelia scoffed. "He's playing it cool. Guys are good at that. Didn't you notice he only said goodbye to you and didn't even nod at me? That's not normal behavior."

###chapter 62 Having His Eyes on Amelia

Women can be pretty intuitive around men, and Benjamin had no clue that Amelia was already suspicious of him.

If Benjamin knew what was going through Amelia's mind, he'd probably be amazed at how women can be such mysterious creatures with their uncanny ability to guess things.

Benjamin definitely had his eyes on Amelia.

He walked into this fancy restaurant where Michael was having dinner. Benjamin sat down across from him and started spilling the beans about what just went down.

"That Pearl, I'll deal with her eventually. She's been nothing but trouble," Michael said, a flash of anger in his eyes.

Benjamin waved it off. "We'll get to Pearl later. I got a question for you."

Michael looked at him, curious. "What's on your mind?"

Leaning in, Benjamin asked quietly, "Do you know much about Isabella's friend, Amelia?"

Michael raised an eyebrow but then smirked. "Why do you wanna know? You into her or something?"

Benjamin quickly shook his head. "No, don't get the wrong idea. I just met her today. I'm asking for your sake."

Michael frowned a bit. "What's this got to do with me? If you like her, go for it yourself. You want me to set you up with Amelia?"

Benjamin looked at him, exasperated. "Michael, you know, to win over a woman, you gotta win over her friends too!"

Michael looked intrigued and motioned for him to go on.

Benjamin got serious. "Think about it. If you and Isabella ever have a fight, who do you think she'll vent to? It's gotta be Amelia! If you can get Amelia on your side, then when Isabella's mad at you, Amelia will back you up and help keep things smooth between you two."

Michael had to admit, Benjamin had a point.

Isabella had been hurt by her family and friends before. If she was upset, the only person she'd confide in besides him was Amelia.

"You're onto something, but you're missing one thing," Michael said with a sly smile.

Benjamin raised an eyebrow. "What's that?"

"If I start being nice to Amelia, she might think I have some hidden agenda. Women are pretty cautious about that stuff. And if Isabella finds out, she might think I'm trying to hit on Amelia. That kind of misunderstanding wouldn't be good for any of us," Michael explained, a mysterious glint in his eyes.

Benjamin rubbed his chin, nodding thoughtfully. "Good point. So, you can't be the one to butter up Amelia. You need someone else to do it, someone who knows all about your relationship with Isabella and who you trust completely. So, that person is... me?"

Benjamin pointed at himself, finally catching on to Michael's plan.

Michael patted his shoulder, looking serious. "Benjamin, I'm counting on you to save my marriage!"

Benjamin wanted to kick himself. He'd just meant to give Michael some advice, but now he was roped into the whole thing.

"Hey, Amelia's not bad looking either. It's a win-win. Go for it, Benjamin!" Michael said with a mischievous grin, but then his phone rang.

Michael glanced at the caller ID, and his smile vanished, his brow furrowing.

It was John. When Michael answered, John's anxious voice came through.

"Michael, weren't you supposed to go abroad to help Bianca find a kidney? Have you found one? Her condition's getting worse. I'm worried she won't last much longer," John asked, clearly worried.

A cold glint flashed in Michael's eyes. He knew Bianca was probably manipulating John again, trying to push him into taking Isabella's kidney.

Michael reassured John, "There's a lead. I heard a death row inmate's kidney matches Bianca's. I'm arranging for someone to talk to the inmate's family. I believe we can save Bianca soon."

John was relieved and thanked Michael profusely before hanging up.

Michael's smile disappeared as he turned to Benjamin. "Is Bianca's kidney issue sorted?"

In reality, Michael was lying to John. He hadn't found any death row inmate, but he had plenty of ways to cover up the lie since it was all happening abroad.

Benjamin shook his head. "I've contacted a lot of medical institutions but couldn't find a match. And something's off-Bianca's condition doesn't seem like a typical uremic patient. I need to dig deeper."

Michael nodded, not too worried. After finishing his meal, he stood up to leave.

"I gotta go. Bianca's issue isn't the priority right now. What's crucial is you helping me win over Amelia," Michael said, patting Benjamin's shoulder before leaving the restaurant.

Michael didn't see Isabella for the next few days. The design competition was about to announce its awards, and the organizers were busy prepping for a banquet, keeping Michael tied up.

Two days later, the design competition kicked off, and the awards were announced. Isabella changed into her gown and arrived at the banquet venue, where a lot of people were already gathered, including contestants and guests invited by the organizers.

Amelia tagged along to support Isabella and witness her big moment. She had submitted a design too, but it was pretty half-hearted, just a mix of an invitation, so she wasn't taking the competition too seriously.

Carrying a tray of fruits and snacks, Amelia stuffed her mouth with fruit and asked, "What place do you think you'll get?"

Isabella smiled and shook her head, "I'm being modest. I know there are definitely stronger competitors, so I'll aim for second place."

Amelia rolled her eyes. "You're not modest at all! Try this cheesecake. It's amazing. I heard the chef is some royal chef from a king's palace."

"How can someone come here just to freeload? It's really despicable," a disdainful voice suddenly cut in.

###chapter 63 The First Place is Actually Her

Amelia and Isabella turned around, and when they saw Pearl coming up behind them with a glass of wine, they were both a bit taken aback.

Isabella thought of Amelia's jinxing ability and looked at her in surprise, asking, "Did you mention her again?"

Amelia shook her head, equally shocked. "Why would I? Trying to stir up trouble for us?"

Pearl, meanwhile, was completely ignored by their conversation.

"Are you two just here to freeload? Trust me, I can get security to kick you out," Pearl snapped at Isabella, gripping her glass tightly.

Isabella gave Pearl a cold stare. "We were invited as contestants. Why do we keep running into you everywhere?"

Amelia nodded. "Maybe we should hit up a church tomorrow, get a priest to read us some Bible verses to ward off evil spirits. Maybe even sprinkle some holy water to break the curse."

Isabella agreed with a nod.

Pearl's face darkened. They were treating her like some kind of curse.

Just as Pearl was about to retort, Isabella leaned in and whispered, "Don't forget your current situation. You're the laughingstock of the city's elite. If you keep arguing with us and draw attention, who do you think they'll mock first, me or you?"

Pearl's expression shifted. She didn't want to be here, but there were rumors Michael was hosting. Paxton had ordered her to come to see Michael.

Pearl took a deep breath, her hand gripping the glass so hard her knuckles turned white. She shot a fierce glare at Isabella and Amelia, stomped her foot, and stormed off.

"Wearing stilettos and still stomping around, she's gonna fall," Amelia muttered, rolling her eyes.

As Pearl walked away, she suddenly felt her heel snap, causing her to lose balance and fall sideways into a wheelchair.

Amelia, mid-drink, almost spat out her wine. "Is my mouth really cursed?"

Isabella frowned, not because of Amelia's so-called curse, but because Pearl had fallen on Bianca, who was also at the banquet.

"Is that Bianca? What's she doing here?" Amelia asked, annoyed.

Isabella shrugged. "The host invited some wealthy folks and members of the four major families. Bianca might've come with John."

Isabella never expected Bianca to be a contestant, let alone that Bianca had plagiarized her work.

When Pearl fell on Bianca, she didn't hold back.

"You're just like Isabella. A despicable person, a cripple, both disgusting to look at," Pearl spat at Bianca before limping away to find a place to change her shoes.

Bianca was left speechless and started to resent Isabella, knowing she was being dragged into this mess because of her.

"Just wait, Isabella. When the competition results are announced, you won't believe your eyes," Bianca muttered, a glint of malice in her gaze as she watched Isabella.

Meanwhile, as the guests finally settled in, the banquet officially kicked off.

The host had set aside a section for the contestants, each with their own designated seat. To Isabella's surprise, Bianca wasn't sitting with the invited guests but in the contestants' area.

"Bianca's a contestant? How is that even possible? Can she even draw?" Amelia asked, bewildered.

Isabella rolled her eyes. "She can't even doodle right. You think she can design? Back in school, I used to do her art homework for her."

Amelia gave Bianca a puzzled look. "So, is she just here to freeload like me?"

Isabella glanced at Bianca, her brows knitting together. She certainly didn't think Bianca was here just to freeload at the party; this woman definitely had another motive, but Isabella wasn't sure what it was yet.

Soon, the event host took the stage. After introducing a bunch of new products, he started announcing the winners of the makeup and image design competition.

"Now, announcing the 10th place. The winner is Ellie Thomas." Following the host's announcement, a young woman in a black and white dress walked up to the stage.

All contestants who didn't place would get a set of the host's new cosmetics. For those who did place, the 10th place prize was $10,000, with each higher rank getting an extra $5,000. Starting from 5th place, the prize was $50,000, increasing by $10,000 for each higher rank. The first-place prize was $100,000.

As the host called out names and contestants went up to get their awards, Isabella finally smiled when it was time to announce the second-place winner.

"The second-place winner is Isabella Taylor! She will receive an $80,000 reward! Thank you for your support and for the design you created." At the host's invitation, Isabella went up to receive her award.

Amelia clapped enthusiastically from below. She hadn't expected Isabella to actually win second place.

"Next up is our first-place winner, also our champion tonight, who will receive $100,000 in prize money and an important position in our company! Her name is Bianca Taylor!" As the host announced Bianca's name, the stage erupted in applause once again.

Isabella and Amelia's faces instantly fell.

"How can someone who can't even draw win first place? Is there some shady business going on here?" Amelia fumed.

Watching Bianca being pushed onto the stage, looking all smug, Isabella started to piece things together. 'Bianca must've bought a design from somewhere, entered the competition, and then John must've pulled some strings with the organizers to get her the win. Damn it, I knew there might be some shady dealings, but I never thought she'd actually win!'

###chapter 64 I Want to Thank Isabella

Bianca couldn't help but smirk as she walked past Isabella. Isabella shot her a frosty glare.

But Bianca didn't give a damn. She strutted to the center of the stage, and the host handed her the mic.

With the microphone in hand, Bianca beamed. "Winning this award was a shocker for me since all my entries were guided by my cousin Isabella. Honestly, I think she's way more talented than me, but the organizers liked my stuff better. I snagged her championship; hope she doesn't hold it against me."

She glanced at Isabella, and the crowd burst into applause and laughter, thinking Bianca was just being funny.

Reporters zeroed in on Isabella, snapping away as her face darkened.

"Today's headline is here; Isabella actually thought the first place was hers!" one reporter exclaimed, thrilled with the shots he got.

Everyone knew about the drama between Isabella and Bianca in high society. The media often caught John visiting Bianca, stirring the pot even more.

The cousins had clashed over John before, and people ate up that kind of gossip.

But then, out of nowhere, the host handed the microphone to Isabella.

"Ms. Isabella Taylor, do you want to congratulate Ms. Bianca Taylor on her win?" he asked, echoing the audience's curiosity.

Isabella's lips curled into a faint smile. "Of course, I'll congratulate her. I hope she creates even better works in the future and stays at the top of the design world."

Bianca's face fell; she didn't understand design at all, let alone create a better piece than the current one.

Isabella looked at Bianca coldly and thought, 'A fake is a fake. Sooner or later, she'll be exposed. The higher she stands now, the harder she'll fall then.'

Isabella watched the screen, curious about where Bianca had bought the designs.

Logically, the designs Bianca bought shouldn't be too bad. Even if the organizers were shady, they wouldn't dare put terrible work in first place. That'd be a huge blunder for their new company.

Amelia had seen Isabella's designs before and recognized them instantly.

You thought smashing my computer would keep me from competing, but you didn't count on the organizers extending the deadline, giving me time to finish my designs."

Her words sent shockwaves through the venue.

Right then, Isabella's designs popped up on the big screen. Even folks who didn't know much about design could see the uncanny resemblance between the two sets of work.

The reporters were buzzing with excitement. "This is gold! An invisible 'war' is brewing. Will John get involved? Tomorrow's headline is set!"

The organizers were blindsided by the drama. The event manager whispered something to the host, who nodded and took the stage again.

"Ladies and gentlemen, due to unforeseen circumstances, we're pausing the award ceremony. But the banquet will go on as planned. Enjoy the food!" With that, all the contestants left the stage.

Amelia stormed up to Isabella, fuming. "I can't believe Bianca had the nerve to use your entry! How could the organizers miss the obvious similarities? Didn't they check?"

Isabella shook her head, just as confused. "I'm sure the organizers will explain."

Amelia, still worried, said, "But with John backing Bianca, won't he try to smear you online?"

Isabella's lips curled into a faint smile. "If he tries, I'll just tell Mason. He'll set John straight."

Amelia finally relaxed a bit.

After the banquet, the story of who copied whom between Isabella and Bianca blew up online. Netizens were all over it, debating fiercely.

Some backed Isabella, others sided with Bianca, but everyone agreed to wait for the organizers' investigation.

Later, Jerry filled Michael in on what went down.

"Tell our people to hold off on investigating. Let's see how this plays out. I'll handle it," Michael said before hanging up.

'Even though this mess might help me with Isabella, it's gotta be rough for her,' Michael thought, feeling a pang of guilt. He decided to head over to Isabella's place to be with her.

When Michael got to Isabella's house, she had just said goodbye to Amelia.

To his surprise, Isabella didn't look sad at all.

"I saw the news. I know about you and Bianca. Aren't you worried about the fallout? People are really going at you online," Michael asked, curious.

###chapter 65 Who is the Plagiarist?

But Bianca didn't expect Pearl to be so ruthless. Instead of just defending her, Pearl had turned the tables and accused Isabella of plagiarism.

###chapter 66 The Plan for Isabella

[How did she have the nerve to accuse Bianca of plagiarism on stage?]

###chapter 67 The Truth

The next morning, when Tom walked into the company, he could tell something was off. His coworkers were giving him all sorts of looks-some looked sorry for him, some were pissed, and others had this smug grin.

Just as he was about to hop into the elevator, Jerry showed up with a bunch of people.

Jerry just waved his hand. "Take him away!"

Someone caught the whole thing on video and posted it online.

At first, no one really cared. Tom wasn't exactly a household name. But then the organizers dropped a bombshell, and the internet went nuts.

The organizers: [After our investigation, we found out that a senior executive at our company took bribes and messed with the evaluation results, causing unfair treatment to contestants. Under the chairman's investigation, it turns out the top two designs were both by Isabella Taylor. We sincerely apologize to Isabella Taylor and invite her to be our Chief Design Director.]

Amelia had been glued to the updates, and when she saw the organizers' message, she immediately called Isabella.

"Isabella, check online! They cleared your name, and everyone knows Bianca plagiarized! Bianca's done for!" Amelia shouted excitedly into her phone.

Isabella was thrilled too. She had been keeping it cool, but deep down, she was super anxious.

[How could this happen? Can a senior executive really be bribed?]

[Your new company's credibility is trash!]

[Is Isabella really the victim here?]

[Is this just a power play between these two women?]

[If the organizers say Isabella was wronged, they better show some proof.]

With all the mixed messages, people online were still skeptical. But then the organizers dropped some video evidence.

The video showed Bianca and Isabella in a room, separated by a curtain, each with a whiteboard and a pen.

"Please write down your design concepts for this product," someone off-camera, probably an investigator, said.

In the video, Bianca looked super uneasy. She wrote really slowly, constantly glancing towards Isabella, even though the curtain blocked her view.

Isabella wrote quickly and confidently, showing off her whiteboard after just a few minutes.

She explained her design concept, starting with a female perspective on cosmetics packaging. But then she realized she couldn't speak for all women, so she switched gears and looked at it from a business angle, reworking her draft.

Bianca, on the other hand, was struggling big time. After some prodding from the organizers, she finally showed her whiteboard.

Her design concept was super basic; she just thought some colors looked nice.

With this video out, everyone got the picture. How could someone snag first place with such a lame take on color?

[Wow, Bianca really played us. She doesn't get design at all.]

[We were all fooled by her.]

[Bianca's the biggest fraud!]

But one piece of evidence wasn't enough. The organizers seemed to have it out for Bianca and quickly dropped other bombshells.

"This is the panda you were talking about? It's just a koala painted to look like one!" Isabella exclaimed, pointing at the black-and-white koala in the tree.

The koala lay lazily on a eucalyptus tree, munching on leaves. Its eyes had been painted black, and its fur had been painted white. If it were a bit fatter, it might have actually passed for a panda.

"Well, it does look like a panda, right? You can call it a panda if you like!" Austin laughed heartily, not at all embarrassed.

"This is not funny at all, Austin. When are we going hunting?" Scarlett said impatiently.

Austin waved his hand. "Come with me, I'll take you to choose weapons."

Austin led the group to a warehouse filled with various weapons. There were cold weapons like knives, swords, daggers, and crossbows, while the only firearms were hunting rifles.

"These rifles should be enough for you to enjoy the thrill of hunting," Austin said, handing the rifles to the women.

Michael casually picked up a crossbow hanging on the wall. "I'll use this. It's not much of a challenge to begin with, and using a rifle would just take the fun out of it."

Isabella looked at the rifle in her hand, then at the weapons on the wall, some of which still had traces of blood on them.

"Maybe you all should go hunting without me. I'll wait here. It's a bit too gruesome for me. I think that painted koala is pretty cute, even if it's not a real panda," Isabella said, handing the rifle back to Austin.

Austin shrugged and took the rifle from her. "Alright, Ms. Taylor, I'll get you some food to feed the animals here."

Michael wasn't really interested in hunting. Seeing that Isabella didn't want to participate, he was about to return the crossbow to Austin.

Scarlett stopped him. "Michael, don't give up just yet. Austin said we can have a picnic at the hunting ground. We can hunt some fresh game for a barbecue. Let Isabella wait here."

Austin nodded. "Yes, I released a few young wild boars in the hunting ground today. They make excellent roasted boar. But I suggest you stay within the fenced area. Beyond that is the real wilderness, where large wild animals roam freely."

Michael looked at Isabella, and she smiled and nodded at him.

"I'll wait here and get the grill ready," Isabella said with a smile.

Michael nodded. This time he didn't refuse; he wanted to bring back a young wild boar for the barbecue.

"Austin, make sure Isabella is safe, or I'll tear your hunting ground apart," Michael warned, giving Austin a cold stare.

Austin was frightened by Michael's gaze and shuddered.

"Don't worry, if anyone tries to mess with Ms. Taylor, my rifle will send them straight to God!" Austin reassured, patting his chest.

###chapter 87 Is Michael in danger?

Michael led Scarlett and her two friends into the hunting ground.

Isabella stood quietly outside the cage, eyeing the dyed koala.

"Koalas are Seraphim's animals, right? Seraphim's animals also include kangaroos, but kangaroos have it pretty bad. They end up on dinner tables every year. I've heard they don't taste great," Isabella muttered, leaning on the fence with her chin in her hands, watching the koala snoozing on the tree.

After a bit, Isabella stretched. She was already bored; this koala wasn't nearly as cute as a real panda.

'Compared to seeing news stories about other countries painting crocodiles, dogs, and elephants black and white to pass them off as pandas, this koala looks pretty convincing,' Isabella thought with a wry smile, then wandered over to the other cages.

Isabella walked up to a fence where two kangaroos were hanging out, and their well-developed muscles left her stunned.

'Wow, I've heard kangaroos have no natural enemies. Is it because of their muscles?' Isabella wondered, eyeing the beautifully muscled kangaroos, curious about how Austin managed to feed them.

Just then, Austin strolled over, and Isabella stopped him to ask about the two kangaroos.

"Are you talking about Megatron and Optimus Prime? They're our biggest stars! Every weekend, tons of people come to watch them spar! Trust me, even a boxing champ wouldn't stand a chance against them!" Austin proudly introduced his two kangaroos to Isabella.

Isabella's lips twitched. "Megatron and Optimus Prime, those are some interesting names."

Isabella found Austin to be a pretty funny old guy, so she started chatting with him.

Austin told Isabella about the history and development of the hunting ground, his heroic and great grandfather, and the story of how he once fought a lion on the prairie.

Suddenly, Isabella smelled something burning, like something was on fire.

"Austin, is that your house over there? It looks like it's on fire," Isabella said urgently, pointing to the distance where a plume of thick smoke was rising.

Austin saw the smoke and anxiously covered his head. "Oh no, that's my stable!"

"I'll help you put out the fire!" Isabella offered, but Austin stopped her.

"Ms. Taylor, just stay here and watch the kangaroos fight! If you get hurt, my hunting ground will be in big trouble!" Austin instructed Isabella before grabbing a nearby fire extinguisher and running towards the stable.

Isabella hesitated but decided not to follow. She didn't know how to put out a fire and worried she might just get in Austin's way.

Just then, a bloodied figure came running over. Isabella was startled to see it was one of Scarlett's friends.

"Ms. Taylor, has Scarlett or Mr. Williams come back?" Scarlett's friend, Wren Kelly, asked urgently.

Isabella shook her head.

Wren held her head, screaming in pain. "Oh my god, damn Austin! He didn't check the protective net! There's a tear in it. I found a blood-stained cloth strip and a phone. It looks like a large animal got in."

As Wren spoke, she showed a piece of blue cloth and a phone.

Isabella's face went pale instantly. She recognized the blue cloth strip as Scarlett's clothing, and the phone was Michael's. Both were stained with blood, which meant they were likely in danger.

"Austin went to put out the fire in the stable. What should we do now?" Isabella asked, clearly flustered.

Wren took a deep breath and said calmly, "I've already called the police. They'll be here soon to protect us, but I'm worried that by the time they arrive, Scarlett and Michael may have been taken by the animal. You stay here, I'll go get a hunting rifle!"

Wren's expression was serious as she turned towards the warehouse, but Isabella stopped her. "Wait, I'm coming with you! The more people, the better our chances."

Isabella's expression was determined. She wasn't worried about any potential conspiracy; she was only concerned about Michael's safety.

Wren hesitated but then sighed when she saw Isabella's determination. "Alright, you have a point. I remember Austin has a satellite phone. We can use it in an emergency."

Wren led Isabella to the warehouse, where she prepared hunting rifle bullets, a first aid kit, a compass, and a flashlight for Isabella.

Isabella felt the weight of the backpack on her, but she had no intention of lightening the load. She knew that everything in it could potentially save their lives in a critical moment.

"Alright, everything is ready. Let's go." Wren led Isabella into the hunting ground.

They arrived at a fence that had a large hole, likely made by a big animal like a grizzly bear.

"I'm warning you one last time, this could be dangerous. Are you sure you want to go in?" Wren asked Isabella.

Without hesitation, Isabella slipped through the hole in the fence. Wren followed close behind.

What Isabella didn't notice was that before leaving the fence, Wren placed Michael's phone next to the fence. In the next moment, another woman walked over, took the phone, and disappeared.

Meanwhile, on the other side of the hunting ground, Michael was still tracking the traces of the little boar. Finally, he spotted it and quickly shot his crossbow, hitting its hind leg.

The little boar fell to the ground, squealing in pain.

Michael caught up and grabbed the little boar, then tied it up.

Scarlett walked over, clapping her hands. "Michael, you're amazing! Looks like we'll have roasted boar for dinner tonight."

Michael didn't find it difficult at all. He looked at Scarlett and asked with a frown, "When is your friend coming back? Is she chatting with her boyfriend on my phone?"

Scarlett had two good friends, Wren and Ember. Ember had said she needed to urgently contact her boyfriend but didn't have her phone. Unfortunately, none of the three women had their phones, so Ember had to borrow Michael's.

Just as Michael raised this question, Ember finally rushed back and returned the phone to him.

Michael casually put the phone in his pocket, not noticing the glance Ember exchanged with Scarlett.

###chapter 88 Michael's Fury

Michael decided to call it quits after bagging the wild boar.

"This should be enough for us. If you guys want to keep hunting, go ahead. I'm gonna go find Isabella," Michael said, heading out of the hunting grounds.

"Hold up, Michael! One wild boar? That's it? Let's go for some deer and rabbits too," Scarlett said, trying to keep him from noticing Isabella was missing.

"If you want to keep hunting, be my guest. But I'm out. This is getting boring," Michael said, frowning as he brushed past Scarlett and walked away.

Scarlett watched him leave, her fists clenched tight.

"Are you sure that bitch Isabella went outside the hunting grounds?" Scarlett asked Ember.

Ember nodded. "Wren took her out personally. Don't worry, this forest is huge and crawling with wild beasts. She won't make it out alive."

A cruel glint flashed in Ember's eyes.

Scarlett's plan was to use this hunting trip to lure Isabella deep into the forest. Her friends were in on it too.

Ember set fire to Austin's barn to distract him. Then Wren used a blood-stained cloth and Michael's phone to trick Isabella into thinking Michael was in danger, leading her into the forest.

Everything was going according to Scarlett's plan.

"Good, let's see how a dead woman can compete with me for Michael," Scarlett said with a cold smile.

After leaving the hunting grounds, Michael carried the wild boar and searched for Isabella.

Suddenly, he saw Austin, his face covered in soot. Michael frowned and asked, "What happened to you?"

Austin wiped his face with a towel and said angrily, "My barn caught fire out of nowhere. I'm always careful about fire safety. I even checked the wiring, and everything was fine. It must be one of my competitors trying to burn my horses."

A sense of unease gripped Michael, and he asked urgently, "Where's Isabella?"

Austin pointed toward the kangaroo enclosure. "She should be there, watching Megatron and Optimus Prime fight."

Michael didn't care why the kangaroos had those names. He dropped the wild boar and ran to the enclosure, but Isabella was nowhere to be found.

"Where's Isabella? Didn't I ask you to keep her safe?" Michael's eyes were bloodshot with anger as he glared at Austin.

Austin started to panic too. "I told her not to wander off. Wait here. I'll check the surveillance."

Austin hurried to the surveillance room, and Michael, taking a deep breath, followed him.

But when they got there, they found the surveillance had been tampered with.

"Fuck, am I being targeted?" Austin slumped into his chair, holding his head.

Michael kicked Austin's chair over, sending him crashing to the ground. "If anything happens to Isabella, you're dead meat!"

He pulled out his phone to call for help.

Just then, Wren, covered in blood, came running over. "You need to save Ms. Taylor! She's in trouble."

Hearing Wren's shout, Michael rushed over and grabbed her by the collar. "What happened to her?"

Wren, terrified by Michael's fierce look, trembled as she said, "My gun ran out of bullets, so I went to the warehouse to get more. Ms. Taylor said feeding the animals was boring and wanted to go to the hunting ground with me. While we were hunting, we found a broken fence. Ms. Taylor insisted on exploring outside, and I couldn't stop her, so I went with her. We ran into a wild boar, and it charged at us. We got separated."

Michael's eyes narrowed as he stared silently at Wren.

Wren felt the pressure mounting, causing her to tremble with fear.

"You're lying! Isabella would never have the guts to leave the hunting grounds! If you tell the truth now, I might let you go," Michael's cold voice whispered in Wren's ear.

Wren swallowed hard, her eyes instinctively darting to Scarlett.

Scarlett was also nervous, but she glared at Wren, signaling her to stick to the story.

Wren bit her lip and shook her head. "I'm not lying, I'm telling the truth."

Michael's gaze turned icy. He pulled out his phone and called one of his subordinates. Shortly after, a convoy of vehicles approached. When they stopped, Jerry stepped out of the first car and walked up to Michael.

"Mr. Williams, I've gathered the team, ready to enter the forest to find Mrs. Williams at any time," Jerry said respectfully.

Michael pushed Wren towards Jerry. "In 10 minutes, I want to know the truth out of her. I don't care what methods you use."

Jerry nodded and had two people drag Wren away.

Wren struggled frantically, but the two strong men gave her no chance to break free. "I'm not lying! I'm telling the truth!"

Wren screamed desperately, pleading for Scarlett to help her, but Scarlett was already intimidated by Michael's imposing presence.

Finally, Scarlett bit her lip and decided to plead for Wren. However, as soon as she approached Michael, he pointed the hunting rifle at her.

"You brought these two women here. She lied to me. Are you in on this? If I find out you had anything to do with this, I won't let you off either," Michael's icy tone was like a volcano on the ocean floor, ready to erupt at any moment.

Scarlett was too terrified to speak.

Meanwhile, Isabella was still calling out Michael's name in the forest.

"Michael, where are you?" Isabella used her dagger to push aside the bushes in front of her, stepping deeper into the forest.

As the surroundings grew darker, Isabella suddenly realized that Wren was gone. To make things worse, when she tried to reach Wren with the satellite phone, she found it was broken!

###chapter 89 The Missing Isabella

Isabella stared at the satellite phone in her hand and finally realized something was off. The battery was missing! This rendered the phone completely useless.

A wave of dread washed over her. She thought of Scarlett. If Wren had been brought in by Scarlett to mess with her, it was likely she had tampered with her gear.

Isabella quickly dropped her backpack and checked the hunting rifle in her hand, only to find that all the bullets were blanks except for the one in the chamber. Using these blanks to hunt wild animals would definitely make headlines, and not in a good way.

"Damn Scarlett, does she want me to die out here?" Isabella felt a mix of panic and anger.

If Scarlett really wanted her dead out of jealousy, then Michael would be safe. Scarlett's target was always her.

Isabella immediately checked the rest of her equipment. Luckily, apart from the satellite phone and hunting rifle, the first aid supplies and emergency food were all intact.

But Isabella knew that even with emergency food and medicine, someone with no wilderness survival experience like her wouldn't last long. It would only delay the inevitable.

Suddenly, there was a rustling in the bushes. Isabella gripped her knife, her eyes locked on the moving bushes.

"God, please don't let it be a wild animal," Isabella whispered, her legs shaking with fear.

Maybe God heard her prayer because only a rabbit hopped out of the bushes.

Isabella sighed in relief but knew it was just a stroke of luck. Next time, she might not be so fortunate.

"Stay calm. Think about what to do next! Yes, I need to find my direction!" Isabella took a deep breath, forced herself to calm down, and took out her compass.

Isabella watched as the compass needle swung aimlessly, unable to point to any direction accurately. Frustrated, she angrily threw the compass on the ground.

"Damn Scarlett! She's trying to get me killed out here!" Isabella was furious, realizing even the compass was fake!

Scarlett had prepared too well, which meant they had planned this for a long time. Isabella wondered if Austin was involved too.

At that moment, Austin sneezed in the hunting grounds. He was stuck there, unable to go anywhere, as Michael's people had surrounded the area.

Although there was no evidence linking Austin to Isabella's disappearance, he was still being held.

Feeling dejected, Austin walked to the kangaroo enclosure and opened it.

"Optimus Prime, Megatron, you're free now. I might die here today! I'll release the other animals later! God, if you really exist, please watch over Ms. Taylor. She must not die out there! Damn it! What a cursed fate," Austin muttered as he walked towards the other cages.

The two kangaroos hopped out of the enclosure, glanced at Austin's retreating figure, then looked towards the forest before bounding off into the woods.

Ten minutes later, Scarlett showed up in front of Michael.

Michael glared at her, his eyes cold as ice. "Why did you do it?"

Just moments ago, Jerry had told Michael about Isabella's disappearance. Wren and Ember, unable to withstand Jerry's interrogation, had confessed Scarlett's entire plan.

Scarlett trembled with fear as she looked at the plate in front of her, which held two freshly severed tongues.

"It seems you know whose tongues these are. Your friends lied to me, so I punished them. You know my style! They're still alive for now. But if Isabella turns up dead, they will end up the same way," Michael said in a cold, blood-chilling tone.

Scarlett, filled with fear and anger, glared at Michael and shouted, "I've loved you since we were kids! You didn't give me a chance and instead, you marry Isabella, who came out of nowhere."

Michael grabbed Scarlett by the neck and lifted her up.

"You should be grateful we were friends before. Otherwise, your tongue would be on that plate too," Michael said coldly, throwing Scarlett to the ground.

Without looking at the coughing Scarlett on the floor, Michael walked outside to find Jerry and ask about the search progress.

Jerry, with his head lowered, said in a low voice, "We've found some trampled tracks and are trying to locate her. We haven't found any blood, so Mrs. Williams should still be alive."

Jerry's words carried an implicit warning: "We haven't found Isabella yet. She's safe for now, but that doesn't mean she will be later."

Michael took a deep breath, suppressing his anger and worry. In a hoarse voice, he growled, "Keep sending more people to search!"

Jerry nodded and went to make arrangements.

Meanwhile, in the forest, Isabella was still trying to find her way. She had tried every method she could think of, but it seemed like fate was against her.

The sun, the moon, and the North Star could have been used as navigational markers, but it was a cloudy day. The sky was covered with thick clouds, offering no light at all.

Methods like reading tree rings were also not feasible for Isabella. She couldn't chop down a massive tree, and doing so would attract wild animals with the noise.

'It's completely dark now. I need to find a place to spend the night,' Isabella thought, looking around the forest with frustration.

She had planned to spend the night in a tree, but as she passed a large one, she saw a python hanging from its branches.

Luckily, the python didn't notice Isabella. Although she managed to evade the python, she didn't dare climb any trees after that.

"If I make it through this, I'm definitely signing up for some wilderness survival lessons!" Isabella sighed as she continued to search her backpack, hoping to find something useful.

Suddenly, she caught a strong, foul smell. She turned around in a daze and saw several pairs of green eyes staring at her from the darkness.

###chapter 90 Kangaroos Battle with Wild Boars

When Isabella saw those eyes, her heart skipped a beat. After some moments of peace, she was now facing genuine danger.

The moon peeked through the clouds, casting a sliver of light in front of her.

That's when she saw them: three massive wild boars.

The good news? Wild boars are mostly herbivores.

The bad news? They can eat meat too. And they're super aggressive, ready to charge at anything that ticks them off. Given the size of these three, even a small charge could turn Isabella into a pancake.

A wave of bitterness washed over her. The best way to deal with wild boars? Climb a tree. She didn't care about any snakes that might be up there. However, the trees nearby were tall and smooth, and climbing them would take forever.

The boars had all the time in the world to attack her, but she only had one shot to hide. If one of them hit her, the best-case scenario would be a broken bone.

As the boars closed in, Isabella sighed and gripped her dagger tightly. The best way to scare off wild boars was with a torch, but all she had was an emergency fire starter and no time to make a torch.

"Even if I die, I'm going down like a hero! Bring it on, you beasts!" Isabella shouted, even though fear gripped her heart.

One of the boars lost patience and charged at her.

Isabella held her dagger tight, ready to fight.

Just as the boar was about to hit her, a shadow dropped from above, landing hard on the boar's head, making it skid to a stop, carving a furrow in the ground.

In the moonlight, Isabella was shocked to see her rescuer was a kangaroo. This kangaroo had well-defined muscles and looked oddly familiar.

"Are you Optimus Prime? No, wait, are you Megatron? Sorry, you two look so much alike, I can't tell you apart," Isabella said, almost in tears from excitement.

She had almost been killed by wild boars, but a kangaroo saved her. It sounded ridiculous, but she didn't care. As long as she was saved, it didn't matter if it was by a person or a kangaroo.

Another kangaroo dropped from above, landing on the same wild boar. The two kangaroos started bouncing on the boar like it was a trampoline.

Their powerful legs made the wild boar beneath them howl in pain.

The other two boars decided to help their buddy and charged at the kangaroos.

"Optimus Prime! Megatron, watch out!" Isabella yelled. But her worry was unnecessary.

The kangaroos jumped higher, easily dodging the charging boars.

Then, they simultaneously charged at the other two boars, their powerful legs kicking the boars in the face, knocking their snouts askew.

One of the boars had sharp tusks, but under the kangaroo's attack, its tusks were kicked off.

The boar with the broken tusks had blood flowing from its mouth. It was thoroughly enraged, driven mad by pain and anger.

The wild boar roared and charged at the kangaroo. The kangaroo nimbly leaped onto a tree, using the trunk to spring to another one.

The clever kangaroo kept luring the boar away from Isabella.

There were still two wild boars left. The one that had skidded to a stop slowly got up. Even though wild boars have thick skin, the kangaroo's powerful kicks had done some damage. After being kicked so much, the boar's internal organs were probably messed up.

Isabella hid behind a tree, quietly watching the two wild boars attacking the remaining kangaroo.

The kangaroo moved its mouth, showing no expression, its calm eyes hinting at disdain.

The two wild boars charged at the kangaroo, roaring as they tried to make it pay.

But the kangaroo stayed completely unfazed, standing its ground. This made Isabella start to worry for it.

"Come on, whether you're Megatron or Optimus Prime, just move already!" Isabella shouted from behind the tree.

Just as the two wild boars were about to hit the kangaroo, it finally jumped up, and the two boars crashed into each other like two runaway trains.

Isabella thought she heard the sound of bones shattering.

"This is too brutal!" Isabella muttered, her mouth twitching.

One of the boars slowly got up again. This time, it seemed to have learned its lesson and quickly fled in a different direction, no longer daring to mess with the kangaroo.

The other boar, severely injured, collapsed on the ground and died shortly after.

Isabella waited behind the tree for a bit, making sure it was safe before slowly approaching the wild boar. She gently poked it with a stick to confirm it was dead, then let out a sigh of relief.

Just then, the nearby bushes began to shake, making Isabella nervous again. But in the next moment, another kangaroo jumped out.

"Thank goodness! I can't believe you guys saved me!" Isabella exclaimed excitedly. She rummaged through her backpack and found two energy bars, then placed them in front of the kangaroo.

The kangaroo looked at Isabella, then sniffed the energy bars before taking a bite.

Watching the two kangaroos eat the energy bars, an idea suddenly struck Isabella. Maybe they could lead her out of the forest.

"Optimus Prime, Megatron, can you take me out of here? I'll give you some delicious food as a reward," Isabella said, looking at the kangaroos hopefully.

The two kangaroos tilted their heads, seeming to understand her, then hopped off in a direction.

"Wait for me!" Isabella shouted, chasing after them with her backpack.

The kangaroos hopped quickly, and Isabella struggled to keep up, but she gritted her teeth and kept running, knowing this might be her only chance to escape the forest.

Just as Isabella felt she was about to run out of breath, she saw a light ahead. There were people holding flashlights, seemingly searching for something.

Isabella immediately waved her arms and shouted, "Is anyone there? Help!"

Jerry was leading a search team to find Isabella when he suddenly heard a distant voice. He excitedly waved his flashlight. "Ms. Taylor, we're here to rescue you!"

###chapter 91 Let It Go This Time

Isabella heard Jerry's response and felt a wave of relief wash over her. She sprinted towards him.

When Jerry and his team, flashlights in hand, reached Isabella, she was on the verge of tears.

"Thank God, I'm finally out of this damn forest! I almost got trampled by wild boars," Isabella said, tears welling up.

Jerry quickly fished a tissue out of his pocket and handed it to her.

"Mrs. Williams, Mr. Williams is waiting for you. Maybe you could try to hold on a little longer?" Jerry gently suggested, hinting that she might want to save her tears for when she saw Michael.

Isabella also felt that crying in front of them would be undignified, so she held back her tears and let Jerry lead her to Michael.

Meanwhile, Michael learned through the walkie-talkie that they had found Isabella. He leaped out of his chair in excitement and dashed outside. Scarlett also heard the news of Isabella's return and felt a wave of relief that was quickly replaced by resentment.

When Michael saw Isabella surrounded by the search team, he was overwhelmed with emotion. His usual stern and aloof demeanor was gone as he rushed over and enveloped Isabella in a tight hug.

"Isabella, you have no idea how worried I was when you were missing. Thank goodness you've returned to me in one piece," Michael said, holding her so tightly as if afraid she might vanish again.

Michael then noticed the dirt smudges on Isabella's face, the grass clinging to her clothes, and the scratches on her arms and hands from branches.

Michael felt a pang of heartache, gently wiping the dirt off Isabella's face and removing the leaves from her hair.

"I'm so sorry for what you've been through," Michael said, his heart aching with guilt.

Isabella shook her head. "As long as you're okay, that's all that matters. I thought you were attacked by wild animals in the forest, so I wanted to bring you weapons."

Michael felt even more heartbroken and deeply touched. Isabella, who didn't have much outdoor experience, braved the forest to fetch him gear upon hearing about his injury. Her love ran deep indeed.

"I know, thank you," Michael said, gently touching Isabella's hair. Ignoring the dirt on her face, he planted a firm kiss on her cheek.

Isabella blushed, but her expression quickly changed when she saw Scarlett glaring at her not far away.

"Michael, I was tricked! Wren told me you were attacked by wild animals, so I went deep into the forest. The equipment she gave me, the satellite phone, and the hunting rifle were all broken! If the kangaroos hadn't saved me, I might have died," Isabella said angrily.

Michael's face turned cold. "I know. I've already found out that Scarlett was behind all of this. Whatever you plan to do to them, I've got your back."

Michael's relief at Isabella's safety quickly gave way to a seething anger. If Isabella wanted Scarlett to pay, he'd make sure they disappeared from the world.

Isabella bit her lip, hesitating. She remembered Kenna mentioning Scarlett's connection to their family during dinner. Plus, Scarlett and Michael had been friends since childhood, making it tough for Isabella to decide.

"Let's just call the police and let the law handle it," Isabella sighed, ultimately choosing this approach.

Michael's eyes flickered, and he eventually nodded. He knew that given Isabella's nature, she wouldn't come up with a particularly harsh punishment. Leaving it to the police was one way to handle it.

Knowing Scarlett's family's powerful connections, Michael understood that simply reporting her to the police wouldn't have much impact. Nevertheless, Michael intended to take matters into his own hands as a message to Scarlett's family, so they would know what to do.

Scarlett stood at a distance behind Michael, watching him and Isabella embrace, her fists clenched tightly. The person in Michael's arms should have been her, but she didn't dare approach now.

If Michael hadn't learned the truth from Wren and Ember, Scarlett could have disguised herself as a victim, shifted all the blame onto them, and then expressed concern for Isabella to lower her guard.

But now that Michael knew Scarlett's plan, any act she put on would just make her look like a fool.

'Damn you, Isabella, why didn't you die in the forest? If you had, Michael might have been angry with me at first, but given time, he would have returned to me! I'm the only one who should be Michael's wife!' Scarlett thought, glaring at Isabella with hatred, brewing another crazy plan in her mind.

Just then, someone came rushing over-it was Austin, the owner of the hunting grounds.

"Thank God, Isabella, you're alive! This is great, I won't have to die!" Austin was so excited he was almost in tears.

Michael gave Austin a disapproving glance. He was savoring a sweet moment with Isabella, and Austin's interruption was unwelcome.

Isabella left Michael's embrace and bowed to thank Austin.

Austin was confused by Isabella's actions, and Michael also looked puzzled.

"Ms. Taylor, why are you thanking me? I should be apologizing to you. If I had taken care of you properly, you wouldn't have been in danger," Austin said, looking remorseful.

Isabella shook her head. "Austin, I have to thank you. I encountered three wild boars in the forest. If it weren't for Optimus Prime and Megatron, I would have been trampled to death! They drove the boars away and saved me."

Michael was startled. He suddenly remembered Isabella mentioning earlier that she had encountered wild boars in the forest, but he hadn't realized that it was kangaroos that had saved her.

Austin was stunned for a moment, then exclaimed with joy, "Did my two kangaroos save you? That's amazing! I knew they were the best. Ms. Taylor, do you know where they went?"

###chapter 92 You'll Have to Offer More

Isabella was floored by what Austin said. Those two kangaroos were way faster than her, and she had no clue where they went after they got her out.

"I don't know. They vanished after they got me out of the forest. They were too quick for me to keep up," Isabella said. Just then, she caught sight of two bouncing figures out of the corner of her eye.

Her face lit up with excitement as she pointed and waved. "There they are! Hey, Optimus Prime! Megatron!"

Two strong, muscular kangaroos hopped over to them.

Austin's heart swelled with joy as he ran towards his kangaroos.

"This is incredible! My two darlings, I've missed you so much. You're my heroes!" Austin cried, hugging the two kangaroos tightly.

Austin had thought he wouldn't make it, so he decided to let all the animals in the hunting ground go free. He never imagined that the two kangaroos would end up saving Isabella, and indirectly saving him too!

Isabella quickly told Michael how the kangaroos had rescued her after she ran into wild boars in the jungle.

Michael was amazed. These two kangaroos looked different from any others he'd seen.

"They're even more buff than you," Isabella said, nodding towards the two kangaroos.

Michael rolled his eyes. Why did she have to compare him to kangaroos? Sure, his combat skills were top-notch among humans, but he couldn't match up to a kangaroo.

But Michael could see that Isabella really liked those two kangaroos, and an idea popped into his head.

"You must be starving. Someone just brought me some food, and I hadn't had a chance to eat when I heard you were back. Why don't you eat first?" Michael said, leading Isabella to a temporary resting spot.

Isabella nodded. After a day in the jungle, she was starving. Sure, she could've eaten some energy bars, but they were nothing compared to freshly cooked food.

"Mr. Williams, since Isabella is safe, does that mean I'm safe too?" Austin asked respectfully.

After Michael's men surrounded the hunting ground, Austin gleaned Michael's identity from their conversations. He was the most formidable person in the country, someone who could easily end his life!

Michael looked at Austin with a bit of exasperation. Sure, he could display ruthlessness on occasion, like cutting off someone's tongue, but that didn't mean he was a psycho who derived pleasure from senseless killing.

"Do you want to sell these two kangaroos? How about 2 million dollars?" Michael offered. He could tell that Isabella really liked these two kangaroos, so he wanted to buy them to make her happy.

Michael furrowed his brow. Since Austin wasn't willing to sell, he wouldn't push it. He figured he could just bring Isabella to visit them often.

But Austin's next words caught Michael completely off guard.

"These kangaroos are like family to me, so if you want them to leave me, you'll have to offer more!" Austin's final remark nearly made Michael burst out laughing.

Even more amusing was the reaction of the kangaroos. They seemed to understand what Austin had said.

At first, they looked bored. But after hearing Austin mention more money, their eyes widened, and their mouths opened, showing their teeth.

The next moment, the kangaroos jumped up and kicked Austin hard.

It looked like Austin had taken a beating from those two kangroos a bunch of times, but hey, his ability to bounce back was pretty darn impressive.

###chapter 93 Angry Kenna

After hearing Isabella's words, Michael immediately ordered his crew to search the forest. They soon found the dead wild boar in a pit.

###chapter 94 Buried Alive

Michael, who was lying on the side, had a flash in his eyes, but he didn't say a word.

Amelia's words made Isabella feel pressured.

###chapter 95 Cunning Enemy

Paxton and Pearl were father and daughter, but they couldn't be more different.

Pearl was a total spoiled brat with a mean streak, always acting without thinking about the fallout. She wasn't the sharpest tool in the shed, so dealing with her was a piece of cake.

But Paxton? He was a whole different story. He'd managed to push the Brown Family up to one of the top four families, showing just how ruthless and capable he was. The fact that he planned to bury Isabella's parents alive? That said it all about his cold-blooded nature.

Paxton was sly and dangerous, like a wolf hiding in the shadows, ready to pounce when you least expected it.

You're my best friend, and Paxton might come after you just to get at me," Isabella said, her voice full of concern.

Isabella hesitated, then shook her head. "No, you wouldn't be that cruel. Someone's trying to stir up trouble between the Brown Family and the Williams Family. The real culprit might be from one of the other two families."

Michael opened his mouth but didn't say anything.

In reality, Pearl's tragic situation was indeed connected to him. One of his guys had gotten her plans out of her.

Pearl had planned to have Isabella gang-raped and spread the video all over the city. One of the men she recruited had HIV and other STDs. She wanted to ruin Isabella completely.

When Michael found out about Pearl's plan, he wanted her dead immediately. He found a sadistic murderer from prison and handed Pearl over to him.

Michael later learned what the sadistic murderer did to Pearl. After using the murderer, Michael had him dumped into the sea.

According to Michael's original plan, in that city, the only people Isabella cared about were Amelia and Mason. Mason didn't need his protection, and Benjamin would protect Amelia.

A crazed Paxton would kill everyone associated with Isabella, including her parents, Jasper, Mia, and her cousin Bianca.

But for Michael, getting rid of Paxton was a piece of cake.

"Since everyone thinks this is a conspiracy involving the four major families, let's keep that going," Michael thought, his eyes cold.

Michael was determined to take down the Brown Family that had replaced the Taylor Family. As Isabella's husband, he had to help her restore her family's honor.

Amelia put her phone down on the table and sighed deeply. Even though she hadn't faced any real danger recently, the constant feeling of being followed always made her uneasy.

Suddenly, there was a knock on the door, which startled her.

Alone in the house, Amelia grabbed a kitchen knife and cautiously approached the door.

###chapter 96 Benjamin's Kindness

Amelia let out a big sigh of relief when she heard Benjamin's voice and peeked through the peephole to see him standing outside.

She swung the door open and let him in.

###chapter 97 Scarlett's New Plan
