"No, no, no, this isn't over for you yet." Isabella's lips curled into a mocking smile as she pulled out a USB drive from her pocket and handed it to a nearby servant.

"Play the contents of this USB drive on the TV," Isabella instructed.

The servant took the USB drive and went to the TV to start the playback.

A sudden sense of dread washed over Scarlett. She looked at Isabella, panic creeping into her voice. "What are you trying to do?"

"What am I trying to do? You'll see soon enough," Isabella replied coldly, then leaned against Michael and watched the TV.

As the TV screen lit up, a video started playing.

When Scarlett saw the footage, she froze in place.

The video showed Isabella and Michael's room.

The timestamp on the video indicated it was recorded yesterday afternoon, the exact time when Scarlett and Lyanna came to apologize.

The door to Michael and Isabella's room opened. Scarlett sneaked in, opened Isabella's suitcase, and then pulled a bag of white powder from her handbag, placing it inside the suitcase. After completing this, she left.

At this point, the video sped up. About 20 minutes later, Isabella entered the room.

After taking a phone call in the room, Isabella went straight to her suitcase, opened it, and took out a bag of white powder.

Shortly after, the door opened again, and Michael walked in.

The video ended at this point. Everyone who watched it fell silent.

Scarlett and Lyanna were in a panicked silence, Kenna was in an angry silence, Michael and Isabella were in a mocking silence, and Bob, huddled in the corner, was in a fearful silence.

"So this is it! This is the show Isabella wanted me to see!" Kenna's suppressed anger was like a volcano about to erupt.

Scarlett paled and took a step back, nearly stumbling. She pointed at Isabella, trembling, and questioned, "This video is fake. It must be fake. Who in their right mind would install a camera in their bedroom?"

Michael's lips curled into a smile. He pulled Isabella close, gently touching her chin with one hand, and said, "We wanted to capture our intimate moments on camera. You've got a problem with that?"

Isabella blushed, feeling a mix of embarrassment and annoyance, and lightly slapped Michael's chest.

Of course, the truth was not as Michael said. Isabella had installed the hidden camera in the room just for self-protection.

###chapter 110 Punishment

Ever since Isabella ran into Scarlett's nastiness, she couldn't help but be on guard.

Even though Isabella didn't want to face it, but her enemies were getting totally vicious, like she was playing some crazy death game.

Bianca almost stole her kidney! Then her own parents tried to marry her off to John, pushing her to the edge. After that, Pearl wanted her gang-raped and left to die of some awful disease. And to top it all off, Scarlett wanted her devoured by jungle beasts.

Sometimes, Isabella just wanted to ask God what she did to deserve all this. When she liked John, she was a target. Now that she didn't like him anymore and chose to marry Michael, she was still a target.

Isabella was beyond frustrated; she really wanted to scream about this messed-up world.

There was this saying online that fate was like a relentless boxer. If you couldn't beat him, protect yourself and just hang in there. Eventually, you'd get tougher.

Installing cameras in her room was Isabella's way of protecting herself. It might seem extreme, but in critical moments, it became the most crucial evidence.

Isabella couldn't even imagine what would have happened if she hadn't installed that camera in her room, which caught Scarlett framing her.

Would anyone believe her if they found drugs in her suitcase?

Even if Isabella kept shouting that the drugs weren't hers, who would believe her, especially in a foreign country?

Only the person who framed you knew how innocent you truly were.

What comforted Isabella was that Michael had always been by her side, supporting her. Even when she suggested installing pinhole cameras in the room, he didn't object. He only turned them off during their private moments.

At this point, Scarlett was completely speechless, realizing she had walked right into Isabella's trap. The reason the servant had so easily found the drugs must have been that Isabella had tipped her off. This was a setup against her!

Kenna tapped his cane, his cold eyes fixed on Scarlett and Lyanna. "You owe me an explanation for this."

Before Scarlett could speak, Lyanna slapped her hard.

"How could you do such a thing? Last time you almost killed Ms. Taylor, and now you want to ruin her reputation? Do you really hate her that much?" Lyanna scolded, both anxious and furious. In her anger, she slapped Scarlett twice more.

Scarlett felt the sting on her face. She covered her cheeks and looked at Lyanna with some fear. "Mom, please believe me, I didn't mean for this to happen. Yesterday, when I was in the bathroom on the second floor, Isabella came in. She hit me and kicked me. I had already apologized, so why did she still treat me like that? I felt so hurt, that's why I thought of framing her."

Lyanna frowned at Isabella. "Isabella, is this true?"

Isabella almost laughed out of anger. Scarlett was indeed a master of lying. What she said was true, but she left out the exact timing.

"Ms. Ramirez, do you think I only installed a camera in my room? I also installed one in the hallway, and it just so happens that it also records both time and sound," Isabella said, causing Scarlett's face to change again.

"Because I didn't expect you to use such a method to defend yourself, I haven't yet transferred the footage from the camera outside the bathroom. But that's okay, I can have someone prepare it right now," Isabella continued, calling over a bodyguard to retrieve the surveillance footage.

"No need, I admit it. I do hate you because you took Michael, whom I've always loved!" Scarlett glared at Isabella with fierce eyes, dropping all her pretenses.

Lyanna had planned to slap Scarlett a few times to show Kenna their sincerity, and maybe lessen Scarlett's punishment. But Scarlett seemed to have found a better way.

"Kenna, you know I've grown up with Michael. I've spent more time with you than with my own parents! You even suggested to my parents that I should marry Michael! My parents have always raised me as Michael's wife! All these years, we've never stopped striving, and I believed I was his wife. But what did Michael do? He betrayed me!" Scarlett shouted at Michael through her tears.

Kenna took a deep breath, the anger in his eyes replaced by regret.

Michael stood up from the sofa, his cold gaze fixed on Scarlett. "I have always considered you a friend, and that is why I endured your presence for so long. While my father may have suggested marriage, I never consented, neither as a child nor now. I pursue only what I desire, and that includes the woman I love!"

After speaking, Michael pulled Isabella up from the sofa and held her tightly. "Isabella, tell me, how do you plan to punish Scarlett for harming you a second time?"

Isabella glared at Michael, speechless. How could she punish her? Didn't he see the regret and pity in Kenna's eyes? He must still care about the ties with Scarlett's family.

Suddenly, Michael winked at Isabella.

Isabella immediately understood Michael's intention, thinking, 'He wants me to forgive Scarlett in front of Kenna again to gain more of his favor. Guilt has its limits. Scarlett's two attempts to frame me have already tested Kenna's patience to its breaking point. Michael wants to use this incident to sever the ties between the two families!'

A smile appeared on Isabella's face. She walked over and took Kenna's arm, smiling as she said, "It's okay, Dad. I wasn't seriously hurt this time. I'm sure Scarlett's parents will deal with her fairly."

Lyanna quickly nodded in agreement. "Rest assured, I'll make sure Scarlett learns her lesson when we return. I'll ground her and put a hold on her bank accounts until she grasps the gravity of her actions."

Kenna patted Isabella's arm and sighed, shaking his head. "This is the last time. If it happens again, there will be no more ties between our families."

Lyanna's face changed instantly. She knew this was the best outcome; otherwise, Michael would definitely send Scarlett to jail.

"I'm sorry, we'll leave now," Lyanna said, pulling Scarlett away quickly.

After they left, Michael turned to Bob, who had been silent in the corner. "Almost forgot about you. Isabella, how do you plan to deal with him? Should we bury him alive?"

###chapter 111 Are You Jealous of Yourself?

Bob's legs were shaking like crazy when he heard Michael's threat to bury him alive, and he just collapsed to his knees.

"Mr. Williams, please, have mercy! I don't wanna die. Mrs. Williams, I know I messed up by framing you, but I couldn't risk going against Scarlett. I had no choice. Please, spare me," Bob begged, tears and snot making a mess of his face.

Isabella sighed, clearly exasperated. No matter how good-looking someone was, they always looked awful when they cried like that.

"Don't bother burying him alive. Just hand him over to the cops and let them handle it," Isabella said, waving her hand like she was swatting a fly.

Two bodyguards came in and dragged Bob away.

Bob's voice echoed as he was taken away. "Thank you, Mr. Williams! Thank you, Mrs. Williams! God bless you both. Thank you!"

Honestly, Bob had thought about going to prison before. He just didn't want to lose his freedom, so he never went through with it. But now, Isabella had made the choice for him. At least in prison, he'd be safe from harm.

As for the money Bob owed the mob boss, it wasn't a huge amount. The real problem was the interest. It was a lot for Bob, but just pocket change for the mob boss. He wouldn't bother killing Bob over such a small amount in prison. It wasn't worth the trouble.

After dealing with Scarlett and her mom, Kenna was wiped out. He waved his hand and headed back to his room to rest.

The living room was left with just Michael and Isabella.

"I'm really sorry, Isabella. You've had a rough time here," Michael said, holding her apologetically.

Isabella sighed. "Maybe it's a test from God. I'm used to it by now."

"Isabella, hearing you say that makes me a bit sad," Michael teased with a smile.

Isabella rolled her eyes, slapped Michael's hand away from her chest, and got up from the sofa, heading upstairs. "I've been here too long. I'm starting to miss my friends back home."

Michael raised an eyebrow. Things back home were still dangerous; Paxton was still hunting for Isabella.

'If Isabella keeps hiding abroad, people back home might think she's a coward. With her personality, she wouldn't stand for that. Looks like I need to get ready to send her back at the right time,' Michael thought, narrowing his eyes as he stood up and followed her.

In the bedroom, Isabella lay on the bed playing with her phone, and Michael lay down beside her.

This time, Michael's hand slipped behind Isabella's neck, holding her shoulder, and she leaned against his chest.

Earlier, in the living room with all the servants around, Isabella didn't want to get too cozy with Michael. But now, in the privacy of the bedroom, they were both way more relaxed.

Michael's hand started to slowly slide down Isabella's neck towards her chest, moving like a sneaky snail.

Suddenly, Isabella saw a news notification on her phone and froze. "There's going to be a tech exhibition here! John's uncle is going to be there!"

Michael's hand stopped in its tracks. He was planning to attend that tech exhibition to show off their company's latest tech to the international crowd.

"You seem pretty excited to meet John's uncle!" Michael teased.

Isabella nodded seriously. "Mr. Williams helped me a lot back home! And anyone in business knows his legendary name! People say he's super handsome and has a great physique, like a movie star."

Michael listened to her gush about him, feeling both proud and a bit annoyed.

"You seem to like Mr. Williams a lot!" Michael said, pouting.

Isabella sensed something off in his tone, picking up on the jealousy.

"I just respect him for helping me!" Isabella rolled her eyes.

Michael pulled his hand back and asked, "If you had to choose between me and him as your husband, who would you pick?"

"Of course, I'd choose you! I only feel gratitude towards him, maybe a bit of curiosity at most." Isabella looked at Michael helplessly. How could he be so jealous?

Michael pouted, still looking dissatisfied. "A lot of women fall in love out of curiosity."

"I didn't know you were so jealous! I just look up to him, that's all. You seriously think I'd do something with him or ditch you for his sake? What do you take me for?" Isabella was furious and kicked Michael off the bed.

"If you can't get over your ridiculous jealousy, then don't bother me!" Isabella said angrily, pushing Michael out of the room and slamming the door shut.

Michael looked at the closed door and sighed. He realized he might have gone too far.

Feeling frustrated, Michael scratched his head and pulled out his phone to call Benjamin in another country.

The call was quickly answered, suggesting Benjamin was already on his phone.

"Michael? What's up? Don't tell me you had another fight with Isabella?" Benjamin teased.

Michael sighed and recounted what had happened.

"Tell me, what should I do to get Isabella to forgive me?" Michael asked, noticing Benjamin had gone silent on the other end.

Michael frowned and asked, "Are you still there? Answer me."

Laughter erupted from the other end. "My God, you're jealous of yourself! This has to be the funniest joke of the year! I wish I could open your skull and see what's inside!"

Michael's face darkened from being mocked. "If you keep laughing, when I return, I'll crack open your skull to check out its design."

Benjamin coughed twice, finally holding back his laughter.

###chapter 112 Lucas's Request

On the other end of the phone, Benjamin thought for a moment and came up with a good idea.

"It's perfectly normal for a man to feel jealous if his wife admires another man. Isabella is only angry because you keep harping on it! It makes her feel like you don't trust her," Benjamin analyzed.

Michael frowned, thinking for a moment, and then asked, "So you're telling me I should get into her hobbies and perhaps even root for Mr. Williams like she does."

Benjamin suddenly erupted in laughter, finding the scene so ridiculous it felt like a spoof from a comedy movie. "Root for yourself? No, that would be ridiculous. Seriously, don't do that. If it backfires, Isabella will think you're mocking her. The best approach is to apologize tomorrow and admit you shouldn't be jealous of a man who poses no threat to you," Benjamin suggested, still chuckling.

Michael raised an eyebrow. "Is it really that simple? Just a straightforward apology, no need for gifts?"

Benjamin replied, "Absolutely not necessary. You two are still in the honeymoon phase. During this time, couples tend to forgive each other easily. Just be sincere in your apology. If needed, you could even shed a few tears to plead for forgiveness. That's a popular way to apologize among young people these days."

Michael couldn't help but imagine himself clinging to Isabella, crying and begging for forgiveness.

He shuddered and made a face of disgust. "That idea makes me look foolish."

Benjamin shrugged on the other end of the line, teasing, "Well, it's the only way I can think of. Whether you believe it or not is up to you."

Michael took a deep breath. He could do it. As long as he could win Isabella back, crying wasn't a big deal, especially if no one else saw it.

"By the way, have you tried this method on Amelia?" Michael suddenly asked.

There was silence on the other end of the line.

After a while, Benjamin spoke, "I haven't confessed to her yet. We're not in any kind of relationship. At most, we're just friends."

"Friends who've slept together? Benjamin, psychological studies show that men and women who've slept together can't just be friends," Michael teased.

Benjamin sighed. "I feel like she's been avoiding me, but it's okay. I'll find the right moment to confess to her."

Michael's mouth twitched. He suddenly wondered if seeking relationship advice from Benjamin was a mistake, given that Benjamin couldn't even handle his own relationship well.

"Is Benjamin experimenting with his dating techniques on me?" Michael muttered under his breath.

"Alright, Michael, I have to go now. Looking forward to your return. I need to head into surgery. Goodbye," Benjamin said, hanging up the phone.

Michael put his phone back in his pocket and looked at the closed door in front of him. He raised his hand to knock but sighed and lowered it, letting out a deep breath.

Deciding to practice his apology face, Michael mistook the room's floor-to-ceiling coat rack for Isabella, then hugged the rack and his face pressed against it.

"I'm sorry darling, I was wrong to be jealous of a man who is no threat to me."

Michael mobilized the muscles and in his face did his best to put on a crying expression. He sounded like a child asking his mom for candy.

Suddenly, Michael heard a ringing behind him. He quickly turned around to find Kenna staring at him blankly, with a phone lying at his feet.

"You're apologizing to the hanger?" Kenna asked, surprised.

Michael awkwardly replied, "I just felt a bit hot in the face and wanted to cool down... Dad, what do you need?"

Kenna noticed Michael changing the subject but decided not to press it.

He picked up his phone from the floor and said, "There's something going on at the company that needs your urgent attention."

"Got it, I'll head over now."

Michael immediately ran out of the room, all wanted to now was to get out of this awkward place.

Kenna chuckled as he shook his head after Michael left. "My son's way of apologizing to his wife is just like mine."

By the next day, Isabella's anger from the previous night had mostly dissipated. She was waiting for Michael's apology, but he suddenly said he had to handle some matters at Kenna's company, leaving Isabella alone in the villa.

'I really want to see that tech exhibition. I wonder what Mr. Williams looks like. Is he as handsome as they say? Who's more handsome, him or Michael?' Isabella mused as she lay on the bed, scrolling through her phone out of boredom.

To enter the tech exhibition, one needed an invitation, but Isabella didn't have one. It seemed she would miss another chance to visit her idol.

Just then, a maid came up and knocked on the door. "Mrs. Williams, Mr. Ramirez is here to see you."

Isabella sat up, thinking she had misheard. 

Lucas was Scarlett's brother, and since she and Scarlett were now enemies, why would Lucas come to see her? Could it be that he wanted her to plead for Scarlett?

Isabella frowned slightly but didn't refuse. After all, this was Michael's house, and she wasn't worried about Lucas doing anything to her.

When Isabella came downstairs, Lucas was already sitting in the living room. He looked delighted to see her.

"Isabella, I need your help," Lucas said excitedly.

Isabella sat on the sofa opposite Lucas, her expression cold. "If you're here to plead for Scarlett, you can leave."

Lucas was taken aback and quickly shook his head. "You've got it all wrong. I'm not here for Scarlett. She's been grounded. In fact, I should thank you because now I don't have to listen to her nagging and bossing me around. To me, you and Michael are the real couple."

Isabella looked at Lucas in surprise. He and Scarlett seemed like two extremes-one was sinister and ruthless, the other naive and endearing.

Isabella's expression softened as she asked, "So, what do you need from me?"

Lucas immediately picked up a tablet from the table and handed it to her. "I heard from Michael that you're great at packaging design. This is my favorite car, and I hope you could help me design some cool graphics to put on it. That way, I'll be the coolest among my friends!"

Isabella raised an eyebrow at the sleek, white sports car on the screen. She hadn't expected Lucas to come to her for this reason.

Designing a car's exterior came easily to Isabella. She was about to agree when she remembered Lucas's interest in technological inventions. Maybe he had an invitation to the tech exhibition?

Isabella smiled and said, "I can help you, but you need to get me an invitation to the tech exhibition."

"That's a piece of cake. I can take you in even without an invitation!" Lucas said, then suddenly froze, realizing there might be someone at the exhibition Isabella should not encounter.

###chapter 113 Lucas's Plan

Lucas felt a twinge of regret as something important suddenly hit him.

Before Michael and Isabella came to this country, Michael had warned Lucas not to reveal his true identity. Michael was pretending to be the son of a regular businessman here, which meant he wasn't supposed to attend this tech exhibition.

Lucas asked cautiously, "Isabella, why do you want to go to the tech exhibition?"

Isabella initially wanted to spill her real reason, but remembering Michael's jealousy, she decided to switch up her story.

"I want to check out the design of those tech products. It would be super helpful for my future career," Isabella said with a smile. As a designer, this explanation made perfect sense.

Lucas frowned a bit. If that was all she wanted, he could probably swing it.

Seeing Lucas's expression change, Isabella frowned and asked, "Is this a problem for you? You just promised me. Are you going to back out?"

Lucas scratched his head awkwardly. He didn't want to piss off Michael but he really wanted Isabella's help with designing his car's look.

Suddenly, Lucas slapped his thigh as an idea hit him. "Isabella, all the invitations have already been handed out, so I can't get you a new one. But I can sneak you in. However, you can only stay until 3 PM, because after that, security will start checking invitations."

Isabella frowned. "Why such a weird rule?"

Lucas shrugged. "It's a special rule to deal with industrial espionage. You have to follow it, or we'll both get kicked out."

Isabella nodded. If that was the case, she could roll with it.

A smile spread across Lucas's face. In reality, there was no such rule at the exhibition. He wanted Isabella to leave by 3 PM because that was when Michael would be giving a speech. As long as Isabella didn't see Michael, he wouldn't be breaking his promise.

After hashing out the details, Lucas drove Isabella to the tech exhibition.

Once inside, they found the place packed with tech enthusiasts.

The tech products on display included both items for sale and concept prototypes designed to attract investors for mass production.

Isabella carried a pen and notebook, preferring to jot down her observations. She walked up to various products, noting down their packaging designs and trying to reverse-engineer the concepts behind them to draw inspiration.

Lucas stuck by Isabella at first to avoid any surprise run-ins with Michael.

However, Lucas soon got drawn in by the innovative concept prototypes. The one that caught his eye the most was a concept maglev car. Its futuristic, mech-inspired design lines sparked a strong interest in him.

Guys, at heart, stayed young forever. The appeal of a mech was irresistible. Not even a scantily clad woman could rival it.

Isabella was so focused on product designs that she lost track of time. Soon it was 3 PM. Lucas, equally engrossed, had also forgotten about the plan.

The exhibition hall was massive, and eventually, Isabella and Lucas got separated. She wandered into a new section.

Recognizing the company logo on the booth, Isabella realized it was John's uncle's company. She decided to wait for his appearance, not knowing that John's uncle was actually Michael.

Behind the booth, Jerry was adjusting his suit. He was one of the product presenters. Just as he was about to step out, he quickly retreated, looking alarmed.

Standing behind him was Michael, who frowned at his reaction.

"What are you doing? Get out there!" Michael said impatiently.

Jerry nervously pointed towards the booth. "Mr. Williams, I can't. I saw Mrs. Williams standing in front of the booth!"

Michael's heart skipped a beat. He hid behind Jerry and peeked out, only to be shocked.

"Damn it, why is Isabella here? Who the hell let her in?" Michael angrily clenched his fists.

"Mr. Williams, what should we do? It's time for your presentation," Jerry said anxiously, checking his watch.

Michael frowned, feeling equally flustered. This new tech product showcase was crucial for their company.

Suddenly, Michael glanced at their new product and seemed to get an idea. He whispered something in Jerry's ear, making Jerry's eyes widen.

"Mr. Williams, are you sure about this?" Jerry asked hesitantly.

Michael pushed him out. "Stop talking and do as I say!"

Jerry nodded, took a deep breath, and put on a mask before heading to the booth.

Meanwhile, Michael instructed the staff, "Put this new product on me, quickly!"

Standing in front of the booth, Isabella held her notebook and frowned at the man before her.

This man was Jerry, now wearing a mask.

Since Isabella hadn't interacted much with Jerry, only catching glimpses of him with Michael a couple of times, she didn't realize it was him behind the mask, even though he looked kind of familiar.

'Wasn't John's uncle supposed to be here? Why hasn't he shown up?' Isabella wondered, craning her neck to look behind the booth. Suddenly, a man dressed in black protective gear and wearing a black helmet stepped out.

Michael looked like a futuristic soldier as he stepped towards the booth.

Jerry, holding a microphone, gestured towards Michael and announced loudly, "This is our new tech protective gear! To demonstrate its protective capabilities, our company's president will personally showcase it!"

The crowd around the booth cheered and applauded.

Isabella's mouth twitched, and she thought, 'How am I supposed to know what your president looks like if he's wrapped like that?'

At that moment, Lucas, who had been engrossed in the levitation car, suddenly remembered his plan. Checking his watch, he was horrified.

"Damn it, it's already 3:10. Isabella might have already met Michael!" Lucas's voice trembled with fear as he rushed towards the booth.

###chapter 114 Do You Enjoy Hacking at Me?

When Lucas got to the booth, he saw Isabella totally absorbed in the performance on stage.

"Isabella, we gotta go. Security's gonna check the invites soon. We need to bounce," Lucas said, grabbing her hand. But she yanked it back.

"Hold up, I wanna finish watching this. I don't care if we get kicked out," Isabella said, pointing at the stage, all excited.

Lucas glanced at the stage and was instantly hooked. "Whoa, that exoskeleton armor is sick!"

On stage, Michael looked like a futuristic soldier in black exoskeleton armor, with Jerry next to him holding a sharp military knife.

"This is our new lightweight exoskeleton armor for soldiers. It's got amazing protection. We made it for urban defense. Imagine our counter-terrorism units in this armor; it would seriously boost their safety," Jerry explained, then struck Michael's chest with the knife.

The knife hit the armor with a dull thud, but Michael didn't even flinch.

"Check it out! This is a sharp military knife. Our tests show it can even stop small-caliber bullets without hurting the wearer," Jerry told the crowd, all pumped up.

The audience was totally into the gear.

No one could resist the draw of exoskeleton armor.

Lucas yelled, "You didn't hit hard enough. How do we know you're not bluffing? Go all out!"

Jerry hesitated, then glanced at Michael.

Michael noticed Lucas and Isabella together and quickly figured out Lucas had brought her in.

Michael nodded, signaling Jerry to go harder.

Jerry took a deep breath, excitement flashing in his eyes, and started hacking at Michael with the knife.

'This is my one shot to hit Michael! And he even has to thank me for it!' Jerry thought, getting more excited with each strike, his mind going a bit wild.

The crowd was stunned, jaws dropping. Everyone could see Jerry was giving it his all.

Even though Jerry's face was partly covered by a mask, the exposed parts, like behind his ears, were red-clearly super excited.

Michael swayed a bit, staring at Jerry through his helmet visor. Even though Jerry couldn't really hurt him, it felt like Jerry was taking out his frustrations on him.

After over three minutes of nonstop striking, Jerry finally got tired. He clutched his waist, panting hard, and signaled to the staff by the stage.

"Come on, everyone. Let's beat our boss up!" Jerry joked, but the staff's eyes lit up with excitement.

Some grabbed chairs, others held pens, and a few even took off their high heels.

Just like Jerry thought, this was their one chance to beat up Michael without getting in trouble!

The staff took out all their overtime and work frustrations on Michael.

Michael swayed like a reed in the wind. He wasn't hurt, but he was super annoyed.

'Damn you, Jerry. Just wait!' Michael fumed.

"I wanna play too! I wanna play too!" Lucas's eyes lit up with excitement as he jumped on stage, grabbed the military knife from Jerry, and started striking at Michael.

"This armor is awesome! How much does it cost?" Lucas asked while hitting him.

With Lucas leading the way, the crowd rushed the stage, joining in on the attack.

Even Isabella got into it. She snuck in a couple of kicks at Michael when the crowd was thick, aiming for his groin.

"Oh my god, he's even got protection there. My foot hurts," Isabella said, her face lighting up with excitement.

Michael was beyond frustrated. If it weren't for the groin protection, he might never be able to have sex with Isabella again.

After his initial excitement, Jerry realized things were getting out of hand. He quickly worked with the staff and security to push the crowd back and restore order.

Michael finally managed to get up from the ground.

Seeing the security, Isabella thought they were coming to check invitations, so she quietly slipped away. Meanwhile, Lucas was still on stage, excitedly holding the military knife, wanting to strike a couple more times.

Michael noticed Isabella had left. As Lucas was about to strike him again, he grabbed the knife from Lucas's hand.

Michael then lifted his helmet's visor, revealing a stern face. "You enjoyed hacking at me, didn't you? You struck me 46 times, and I remember every single one!"

Lucas's face turned pale when he saw it was Michael behind the mask.

"Michael, it's you? You actually demonstrated the product yourself!" Lucas said, his legs trembling. He had just been striking the one person he never wanted to cross.

A sinister smile appeared on Michael's face as he signaled for the staff to bring up the second exoskeleton armor.

"Ladies and gentlemen! Let's give a round of applause to this gentleman for bravely stepping up as the second tester of our latest product! He will now don our protective gear and withstand everyone's assaults!" Michael announced to the crowd, then put the exoskeleton armor on Lucas as he watched in horror.

After Lucas was suited up, Michael patted his shoulder and whispered in his ear, "What you're wearing isn't the finished product like mine, but an early prototype! Enjoy!"

Lucas's legs shook with fear. He turned to run but was blocked by a group of excited people, all holding weapons.

"Stay away from me! Help! I need help!" Lucas screamed as he fell to the ground. Then, baseball bats, knives, rocks, and beer bottles rained down on him.

###chapter 115 Michael's Apology

After wrapping up his presentation at the tech expo, Michael headed back to the villa.

Lucas, poor guy, had gotten a serious beatdown. Why? Well, during the scuffle, he took off his helmet and started mouthing off to a woman. The formidable 280-pound woman then pinned him down and slapped him silly.

Lucas took off his helmet for a simple reason: the woman had kissed him! Even though it was just the helmet she kissed, Lucas was seriously freaked out.

When Michael got back to the villa, Isabella was deep into designing a sports car.

"Thinking about getting a sports car?" Michael asked, curious, as he walked over. He glanced at the design and frowned a bit, thinking it didn't quite fit a woman's style.

Without looking up, Isabella kept sketching. "Lucas asked me to design a car for him. I'm using stuff young people like: shooting stars and wild horses. A meteor in the sky, a galloping horse on the ground, surrounded by flames-this sense of freedom should appeal to him."

Seeing Isabella so into designing a car for Lucas made Michael feel a bit jealous.

Michael plopped down next to Isabella, put his arm around her shoulder, and said playfully, "I want one like this too."

Isabella rolled her eyes. "Our car is just a regular sedan; it doesn't need such a design."

"I can buy a sports car, or I can save the design on my computer and get it when I have enough money," Michael said, holding Isabella's arm and rubbing his forehead against it.

Isabella had never seen the usually cool Michael act so childishly. She found it funny but didn't show it. "I went to the tech expo today and met the mysterious Mr. Williams. Are you mad?"

Michael paused, remembering Benjamin's advice.

'Beg her for forgiveness, do whatever it takes.' Michael kept telling himself.

Finally, Michael made up his mind. He squatted down, hugged Isabella's legs, and rubbed his face against them.

Isabella was startled. "What are you doing? Get up!"

"I'm sorry. I was wrong. I won't get up unless you forgive me!" Michael clung tightly to Isabella's legs, not giving her a chance to push him away.

"Get up! There are servants around; this is so embarrassing." Isabella's face turned red. They were in the living room, and the servants were cleaning nearby.

Michael waved his hand, and the servants all scattered, leaving him and Isabella alone in the living room.

"Now no one will disturb us. Isabella, I know I was wrong. I shouldn't be jealous of Mr. Williams, whom you've never even met. I should have been more understanding. Everyone has idols, even if that idol is of the opposite sex!" Michael looked up at Isabella with a pitiful expression.

Isabella's face turned bright red. She found Michael's behavior hilarious but tried hard to keep a stern look, though she couldn't help but smile a bit.

"Alright, I forgive you. Now get up," Isabella said, patting Michael's hair. He looked like a pouting kitten.

But Michael still didn't budge. "I won't get up unless you agree to design a sports car for me too."

"Okay, I'll design one for you. Just get up," Isabella said, covering her face. She felt Michael's behavior was incredibly embarrassing, but she also felt a hint of sweetness inside.

Michael finally smiled happily. Just as he was about to stand up, they heard the sound of a camera shutter.

Michael and Isabella turned around to see Kenna holding a phone, snapping photos of them.

"Isabella, you're amazing! This is the first time I've seen Michael with such an expression! Hahaha," Kenna said excitedly.

"Dad, delete those photos! You'll ruin my image!" Michael chased after Kenna, while Isabella, blushing, ran upstairs.

Michael didn't catch Kenna, who had already locked himself in his room.

Kenna stood before Audrey's photo, skillfully lighting a candle.

"Audrey, Michael has really changed a lot! He's completely devoted to Isabella, and I believe their love will soon bring a new life into the world," Kenna said happily to Audrey's photo.

Meanwhile, Lucas returned home and ran into Scarlett coming down the stairs.

Scarlett frowned as she saw the bruises on Lucas's face. "Who did this to you?"

"It was a bunch of strangers," Lucas said, waving his hand dismissively as he headed to his room. He didn't want to admit he'd been beaten up by a woman.

"Where were your bodyguards? How on earth did you get beaten up by strangers? What happened? Weren't you at the tech exhibition today?" Scarlett demanded, glaring at Lucas.

Lucas, feeling helpless, recounted how he had gone to find Isabella and how they ended up going to the tech exhibition together.

Scarlett was furious. "You went to find Isabella! Don't you know she's our enemy? She hurt me deeply! I'm your sister!"

Lucas felt exasperated. He had expected this reaction from Scarlett.

"Scarlett, you need to face reality! If you can't have Michael, let him go. "Look at the stuff you've been up to lately-none of it's worth praising. I think you should read some books on the philosophy of love; maybe they'll give you some answers," Lucas said before heading back to his room.

Scarlett, in a fit of rage, grabbed a cushion from the sofa and threw it at Lucas, but it bounced off the closed door.

Scarlett's screams echoed through the living room.

The next day, Isabella and Michael were preparing to leave the country and return home. They had work to do in Avalonia.

Upon learning the news of Isabella's departure, Lucas brought a gift to see them off.

Isabella gave Lucas the car design she had created, which he liked very much.

"This is fantastic! I'll surely be the talk of the town among my friends!" Lucas said happily, handing Isabella a rectangular box.

"This is from Scarlett. I don't know what's inside. She asked me to apologize on her behalf," Lucas said.

###chapter 116 Suspicions and Speculations

When the box sailed through security without a fuss, Isabella breathed a sigh of relief. At least it wasn't packed with anything crazy like explosives or drugs.

As Isabella and Michael boarded the plane, Amelia and Benjamin got the news.

Mason went quiet for a moment, his eyes narrowing as he looked at John. "They're both coming back on the same day. Does that make you think of anything?"

Mason thought John had figured something out, but to his surprise, John said, "Is Isabella coming back with Michael to use his bodyguards for protection? When did she get so sneaky?"

Mason was so mad his hands shook. He wanted to grab his cane and knock some sense into John's head.

After making the arrangements, John headed to the hospital to let Bianca know about Isabella's return.

"Isabella has the nerve to show her face again! She almost got us killed. When she returns, I'll make sure she learns her lesson!" Jasper angrily pounded the hospital bed.

Because of Isabella, Jasper and Mia were almost buried alive by Paxton. They now saw Isabella as their enemy.

Late at night, outside the ICU, Paxton stood with a pained expression, looking at Pearl inside. A subordinate came to report that someone had tipped them off that Isabella would soon return.

After a flight of over ten hours, Isabella and Michael finally disembarked.

Not far away, a bodyguard disguised as a passenger nodded at Michael.

Isabella nodded and sent a message to Amelia, telling them not to come.

As Isabella and Michael left the airport, several cars followed them.

Michael's ear twitched slightly; he had a Bluetooth earpiece in. His subordinate reported that everything was normal.

An hour later, another plane landed at the airport. A couple dressed similarly to Isabella and Michael emerged.

They got into a taxi and left the airport, followed by several cars filled with Brown Family's men.

This was all part of Michael's plan. He knew Isabella's return would be leaked. At Seraphim's airport, he used some privileges to get tickets for a faster flight, avoiding the Brown family's tracking.

Meanwhile, Amelia and Benjamin received Isabella's message.

"How did they get here so fast? I thought they wouldn't arrive for another hour," Amelia said, putting down her phone and looking at Benjamin in confusion.

Benjamin had a hunch about Michael's plan. "Someone must have leaked Isabella's whereabouts, so they returned early to avoid being tracked."

###chapter 117 Warning to Some People

After nearly being buried alive last time, Jasper and Mia were too scared to stay in the villa. It was so spacious that if something happened, no one would hear their cries for help.

Following Bianca's suggestion, they moved into Isabella's apartment. The building had many neighbors, and with the security personnel John arranged, they felt much safer.

Isabella smiled at the sight of the box. At least she wouldn't have to pack herself.

###chapter 118 Plan for Paxton

###chapter 119 Dissatisfaction of the Browns

Lucas was showing off pictures of his car design to his friends when he heard a scream coming from Scarlett's room.

Meanwhile, Michael's plan was already in action.

A young guy walked out of a bar with two glamorous women. Just as he led them into a nearby hotel, some guys lying in wait threw a sack over his head and carried him off.

A big guy, hearing that his buddy had been bullied, armed himself and went to help, only to get ambushed and beaten up badly.

A woman found her bar on fire.

All these victims had one thing in common-they were from the Brown family!

Early in the morning, a meeting was held at the Brown Villa. Paxton's siblings and other family members sat around the table, all looking grim.

Paxton's face stayed dark, his hands trembling slightly, showing his inner rage.

###chapter 120 9999 Roses

###chapter 121 Slap Him

Isabella just wanted to grab her package, but she bumped into John, who had just shown up.

John was just as shocked to see Isabella stepping out of the building right when he was about to look for her.

"Perfect timing," they both blurted out at the same time, then went quiet.

John broke the silence first. "What's the deal with you rejecting my gift and blocking my number? Seriously, who do you think you are?"

John looked pissed and gloomy.

In the past, Isabella would've been scared out of her mind seeing John like this.

She'd have totally freaked, apologized a million times, begged for forgiveness, and even gotten down on her knees-completely humiliated herself.

But now, Isabella was different. She'd learned that love wasn't about giving endlessly and hoping for something in return. It was about mutual feelings, like what she had with Michael now.

"You've got some nerve questioning me. What gives you the right?" Isabella shot John a cold, impatient smile.

"I told you on the phone. I'm married now. Sending me flowers will just cause problems! I'm protecting my own love and marriage! And stop acting all high and mighty. I don't like you anymore. Don't think I'm still the old Isabella," she said, trying to get past John to grab her package.

"Hold it right there!" John, furious, grabbed her wrist.

Isabella felt his strong grip, causing her pain. She snapped, "Let go of me, or I'll call security."

John smirked. "Where do you get the nerve to talk to me like that? Nobody crosses me in this city."

Isabella checked out the guards by the door-they were totally spaced out, staring at the sky. Just like John said, nobody around here was messing with him.

"See that? You'd better just be my woman, Isabella! Your husband might even beg you to be with me once he knows who I am!" John said with a smug grin.

His words made Isabella furious.

"You jerk! Don't you dare insult him!" Isabella spat, slapping John hard across the face.

The slap echoed, leaving John stunned.

The old Isabella wouldn't have dared to even look him in the eye, let alone slap him.

Bullies, when unexpectedly challenged, rarely reflect; instead, they react with anger and a sense of being provoked.

John was that bully right now. His long-term oppression of Isabella had made him forget she was a person with her own will and freedom.

In a fit of rage, John grabbed Isabella by the neck and pinned her against a car.

"How dare you turn me down and raise your hand against me? Who do you think you are? A lowly woman, still pretending to be the affluent heiress you once were?" John spat, his face twisted in anger, completely ignoring Isabella's pained expression.

Isabella struggled to breathe, desperately slapping John's arm, but his grip was like a vise on her neck.

The security guards at the entrance felt uneasy. They were scared of John, but if they didn't do something, they'd be out of a job.

One security guard nervously tried to intervene, while the other ran into the building to inform Dwayne.

Dwayne was on the job when he heard about John choking Isabella. It knocked him sideways.

'Is John out of his mind? Doesn't he know who owns this company?' Dwayne thought as he hurried downstairs to the entrance.

Isabella's breathing was becoming increasingly difficult, and her face had turned pale.

"Mr. Williams, let her go now, or I'll call our boss," Dwayne shouted, grabbing John's hand and pulling it away forcefully.

Isabella finally managed to breathe again, clutching her throat and coughing loudly.

John glared angrily at Dwayne. "Know your place. How dare you stop me?"

Dwayne, unafraid, said coldly, "Maybe my status isn't as high as yours, but I don't think you can harm me."

Dwayne wasn't scared. He worked for Michael and knew Michael's character well.

Michael was a boss who clearly separated work from personal feelings. He wouldn't punish Dwayne for standing up to John.

John understood this too but felt deeply annoyed.

Isabella, having regained her breath, stood up and angrily said to John, "This is the last time, John! I'm telling you, one more time messing with my marriage and I'm going straight to Mason!"

John's face twisted with a sinister smile. Ever since Bianca was imprisoned, he had been in a foul mood.

"Go ahead, call my grandfather. Call him as many times as you want. But don't get too happy. Once I find out who you and your husband really are, I'll destroy both of you!" John spat his threats before turning and walking away.

Isabella watched John's departing figure, a hint of uncertainty in her eyes. She wasn't afraid of John but was worried about what he might do to Michael.

Dwayne gently patted Isabella's arm and asked, "Isabella, are you okay? Do you need me to take you to the hospital?"

Isabella shook her head. "I'm fine, no need for the hospital. But I came down to get a package, and there might be a lot. Could you help me carry some? Of course, I'll give you a thank-you gift."

Dwayne was momentarily stunned, then smiled and agreed. But he didn't take Isabella's words seriously.

When Dwayne moved the 30 phones to Isabella's department, Isabella immediately opened the box.

"This is the latest model, with the highest specs. I hope you like it." Isabella handed the phone to Dwayne, clearly seeing the astonishment on his face.

"Are these phones for real? Oh my God. They just got released! How did you get them?" Dwayne asked, staring at Isabella in shock.

###chapter 122 John's Your Nephew

Isabella told Dwayne she had scored over 30 phones in a raffle at some tech expo.

Dwayne's jaw practically hit the floor. He couldn't believe her luck.

'Hold up, even if there was a raffle, no way one person wins 30 phones. Something's fishy,' Dwayne thought, remembering that Michael had also been at that tech expo abroad.

If Michael had hooked Isabella up with those phones because of their relationship, it would all add up.

Even though Dwayne figured it out, he decided to keep quiet. John had just had a run-in with Isabella, and bringing up Michael might just make things worse.

"Thanks, Isabella. I really appreciate the gift, and I'm sure everyone in your department will be stoked too." Dwayne smiled, then grabbed his phone and headed back to his office.

First thing Dwayne did when he got back to his office was call Michael to fill him in on what went down.

Michael was in a meeting when Dwayne's call came through. As he listened, his face turned icy.

"Is Isabella okay?" Michael asked, his voice low and serious.

Just hearing Michael's tone made Dwayne shiver. He could feel the anger.

"She's physically fine, but there's a handprint on her neck," Dwayne quickly replied, forgetting Michael couldn't see him nodding.

"I get it. I'll take care of it. You did good today," Michael said before hanging up.

After hanging up, Michael called Jerry. "Jerry, find out where John is and give him a good beating! Then pin it on the Brown family."

Jerry was stunned for a moment before cautiously asking, "Mr. Williams, are you sure about this? John's your nephew."

"Owen didn't raise him right. As his elder, it's my job to step in," Michael replied coldly.

Jerry shivered and quickly nodded at his phone. "Got it, Mr. Williams. I'll take care of it."

After Michael hung up, Jerry frowned deeply. 'What did John do to piss Michael off so much?'

It wasn't hard for Jerry to get the scoop, since the incident between Isabella and John happened in a busy area with lots of witnesses.

When Jerry found out John had grabbed Isabella by the neck and nearly choked her, he knew John was in for a world of hurt.

"Mr. John Williams, you can't blame me. This is all on Mr. Michael Williams' orders," Jerry muttered, shaking his head as he pulled a solid wooden baseball bat from his cabinet.

Meanwhile, just as Dwayne was about to dive into work after his call, someone rushed in to report a dispute in the design department.

"Design department again? What now?" Dwayne asked, rubbing his forehead in frustration.

The employee who brought the news gave a wry smile. "Apparently, Isabella handed out new phones to her colleagues, but Ms. Eve thinks they're all fakes."

"So Isabella and Madeline are at it?" Dwayne frowned. From what he knew, Isabella wasn't one to start random fights.

The employee shook his head. "No, it's Isabella's assistant Juliet going at it with Ms. Eve and her crew."

Dwayne raised an eyebrow. Juliet was the assistant he had assigned to Isabella. He didn't expect Juliet to stand up for Isabella on her first day. Isabella must have some serious charm.

"Alright, I'll go check it out," Dwayne sighed, shaking his head as he left his office.

In the design department, Juliet was boiling mad. Isabella had tasked her with giving out the 30 phones to everyone, Madeline included, even though Madeline was trying to ice her out. But Madeline was totally unappreciative, calling all those phones fake.

Sometimes, being nice to your haters, who then act like total jerks, can actually make others feel sorry for you. It's a smart move, whether you're at work or in school.

"Ms. Taylor was nice enough to give you those phones. If you don't want them, that's fine, but why be such a jerk and put her down?" Juliet was indignant for Isabella.

Madeline crossed her arms and sneered. "If Isabella had given us anything else, maybe we'd have taken it. But fake phones? She might as well have given us apples; at least we could eat those."

An employee behind Madeline also sneered. "Ms. Eve is right. Isabella claims she won these phones in a raffle. What kind of raffle gives 30 latest-model phones to one person? Couldn't she come up with a better lie?"

Hearing this, some design department employees hesitated as they looked at the new phones in their hands. Madeline's words did make some sense.

Juliet's anger simmered, barely contained, as Isabella finally emerged from the restroom. She had tried to use cold water to remove the handprint on her neck but had failed.

Seeing Juliet and Madeline in the middle of a heated argument, Isabella quickly understood what was happening.

"Juliet, why bother arguing with them? If they don't want my goodwill, just take back the phones and sell them." Isabella waved dismissively, then looked at her colleagues.

Isabella shrugged. "I meant well, I swear. I wouldn't give you all fake phones. If they turn out to be real, blame Madeline for misleading you."

###chapter 123 The Confrontation Between Two Women

Just as Isabella wrapped up her sentence, Dwayne's voice chimed in from behind her.

"Hey, I heard there was some drama, so I thought I'd check it out," Dwayne said, flashing a smile at the design team.

Dwayne knew exactly what had gone down and that Madeline was in for some trouble. He was here to back Isabella up.

"Mr. Larson, Ms. Taylor brought in some fake phones and tried to pass them off as the latest models from a big brand. We only use the real McCoy. You should set her straight," Madeline said with a smug grin.

Dwayne glanced at the phones on the table, raised an eyebrow, and pulled out an identical one from his pocket.

"Is this what you're talking about? I just checked it out. It's the real deal. You can verify the serial numbers on the official site," Dwayne said, pointing to the phone's serial number with a casual shrug.

Madeline's face fell.

Dwayne looked at her, clearly annoyed. "Ms. Eve, did you accuse Isabella without even checking the phones? Even the cops need evidence to arrest someone. Throwing around baseless accusations is called slander, and it can get you in legal trouble."

Madeline's face darkened. She never thought Isabella would hand out real phones.

These phones were crazy expensive, way out of most people's league, and Isabella's story had seemed like a joke to them.

With Dwayne's confirmation, some of the design team started giving Madeline the side-eye. They were kicking themselves for not taking the phones, especially since Isabella wasn't giving them another chance.

Madeline felt the hostile stares around her, like she was about to be roasted alive.

'Damn Isabella,' Madeline thought, feeling the pressure. 'She actually gave away that many phones? My people will turn on me if I don't fix this.'

Madeline quickly put on a remorseful look. She grabbed Isabella's hand and bowed. "I'm really sorry, Ms. Taylor. I misunderstood you. I shouldn't have doubted you! My colleagues refused the phones because of my bad judgment. It's all on me. I'm not asking for your forgiveness, but I hope you can forgive these innocent colleagues."

Isabella narrowed her eyes, seeing through Madeline's act. If she turned down Madeline now, she'd look unforgiving.

But if Isabella accepted, it would make Madeline look good in front of everyone.

Dwayne watched Isabella, curious about her next move.

Isabella grinned and called out to the design team, "Hey everyone, if you missed out on a phone earlier, come grab one now. And let's give a big thanks to Ms. Eve for her heartfelt apology. We could all learn a thing or two from her."

The design team lit up, eagerly stepping forward to reclaim the phones they had turned down before.

'Isabella's so easily manipulated,' Madeline thought. 'That apology was a small price to pay for having my colleagues firmly in my corner. I always win.'

Isabella caught Madeline's fleeting smile and sneered internally.

'You think I'm that easy to fool? You've got another thing coming,' Isabella thought, already plotting her next move.

Once everyone had their phones, Isabella spoke up again, "These phones are just a welcome gift. From now on, anyone who makes outstanding contributions and excels in their work will get even more rewards!"

Her words were met with cheers and applause from her colleagues, who now saw her in a whole new light.

Nothing gets people motivated like some good old-fashioned perks.

Just when Madeline thought it was all over, Isabella continued, "We strive for excellence, but even the best can learn from their mistakes. Ms. Eve's apology is a valuable lesson for all of us. To prevent similar situations, I suggest we share her experience-and her sincere apology-on the company intranet as a reminder of the importance of humility and staying ahead of the competition."

Dwayne's face lit up with amusement, while Madeline's turned a deep shade of red.

Isabella's smile was saccharine, belying the icy satisfaction in her eyes. 'Want to improve your reputation? I can help with that, and ensure it's not just limited to the design department.'

"Ms. Taylor, isn't this a bit much?" Madeline forced a strained smile.

But Isabella's expression was firm. "Ms. Eve, have you forgotten you're a senior leader here? The higher our position, the greater our responsibility. One mistake from us can cause huge losses for the company. I believe this incident will remind everyone that work is serious and personal feelings should never interfere with company operations!"

Isabella then turned to Dwayne. "Mr. Larson, what do you think of my idea?"

"I think you're spot on. As a company leader, I know that one careless order can mess up the whole operation. I'll get in touch with the PR department right now and have them publicize this incident. Of course, we'll highlight Ms. Eve's positive image of owning up to her mistake," Dwayne said, pulling out his phone and making the call right there in front of everyone.

###chapter 124 Sad Amelia

Dwayne had always had a bone to pick with Madeline. She was always challenging him, thinking she was all that because of her skills.

Now that Isabella had a plan to take Madeline down a notch, Dwayne was all in. Plus, Isabella's reasons made perfect sense to him.

"Thanks for backing me up, Mr. Larson. Madeline, you should thank Mr. Larson too," Isabella said, giving Madeline a look that said, "You better show some sincere gratitude."

Madeline's face contorted with rage. They weren't just insulting her; they expected gratitude for it. Was this some kind of sick joke?

Dwayne waved it off with a grin. "No need for that. Just get back to work. This is nothing. I gotta head back to my office; you all carry on."

He walked back to his office, still smiling. He knew Madeline wouldn't thank him, but he had already humiliated her enough. Pushing it further might make her snap.

Isabella watched Madeline's sour expression with a smug smile before heading back to her office, Juliet trailing behind.

Soon, news of Madeline's apology spread through the company like wildfire. Everyone knew the once-proud deputy director of the design department had bowed down to Isabella.

Back in the office, Juliet was all smiles. "Ms. Taylor, you were amazing! Did you see Madeline's face? She and her crew looked like they just swallowed a fly."

Isabella sighed, sinking into her chair. "Honestly, I don't want this drama. I'd rather work in a place where everyone gets along. It's better for the company and the employees. Sometimes I feel like I'm cursed because no matter where I go, I can't escape this kind of drama."

Isabella's voice was filled with resignation. Suddenly, she remembered something and turned to Juliet. "By the way, did you manage to sell those roses I asked you to?"

Juliet nodded. "Piece of cake. As soon as the companies heard about our low prices, they snapped them up. They sold out fast."

Isabella sighed in relief. "From now on, if John sends me anything, just send it back. If he won't take it, sell it."

Juliet nodded, making a mental note.

In the days that followed, with Juliet's help, Isabella started getting the hang of the company's operations. She needed to get up to speed quickly to avoid giving Madeline and her cronies any chance to exploit her weaknesses.

After a long day, Isabella had just about grasped the basics of the company's operations. She was about to head home, exhausted, when her phone rang. It was Amelia.

"Isabella, can you join me for a drink? I'm feeling really down right now." Amelia's voice was filled with despair, like something bad had happened.

Isabella frowned and asked, "What happened? Don't worry, I'll come to you. Send me your address."

After getting the address, Isabella rushed out of the company, where Leo was already waiting for her.

"Ms. Taylor, are we heading home now?" Leo asked with a smile.

Isabella shook her head, looking worried. "No, Leo. I'll give you an address. Take me there right away."

Leo glanced at the address Isabella handed him, started the car, and drove off.

Meanwhile, at a bar, Amelia had already downed several drinks, but the alcohol wasn't doing its job. She kept replaying what she'd seen earlier that day.

With the Brown Family temporarily backing off from their plans against Isabella, Amelia felt like the usual eyes on her had disappeared.

Feeling a bit safer, she decided it was time to move out of Benjamin's place. So, she headed to the hospital to find him.

But when she got there, she saw Benjamin holding a beautiful woman who was crying in his arms.

The scene made Amelia uneasy; a sharp, unexpected stab of jealousy. It was jarring, considering the casual nature of her relationship with Benjamin. They were friends, nothing more, yet here she was, consumed by jealousy.

"I've heard that physical intimacy can sometimes lead to deeper feelings. Is that what's happening to me? I can't believe I'm developing feelings for Benjamin." Amelia couldn't believe she had feelings for Benjamin.

Noticing Amelia, Benjamin gently pushed the woman away and walked over to her.

"Why are you here? You didn't come to see me, did you? Let me explain: that girl is a patient's family member. I saved her father's life, so she was emotional and hugged me out of gratitude. We're not in a romantic relationship. This kind of thing happens to doctors all the time," Benjamin said with a shrug and a smile.

Hearing his explanation, Amelia felt a bit relieved but didn't show it.

"Why are you telling me this? We're just friends. I came to tell you I'm planning to move back to my own place," Amelia said, getting to the point.

Benjamin frowned. "Paxton won't give up so easily."

"But I feel much safer now. I've troubled you too much these days. I feel really bad about it, so just please say yes to this," Amelia said, turning to leave, not daring to meet Benjamin's eyes.

If Amelia had turned back, she would have seen the sadness, anxiety, and reluctance in Benjamin's eyes. She might have even heard the whispers escaping his lips.

"Are we destined to stay in this kind of relationship? Damn it, I spend all day teaching Michael how to date, but when it comes to me, I can't even muster the courage to confess my feelings," Benjamin muttered to himself.

After leaving the hospital, Amelia went straight to a bar and drank until now.

During this time, many guys tried to hit on the drunken Amelia, but she shot them down with harsh words.

Amelia held it together until Isabella arrived, then, overwhelmed, she collapsed into her friend's arms, sobbing uncontrollably.

###chapter 125 Switch Them All to Steel Ones!

Isabella gave Amelia a gentle pat on the back and asked softly, "What's going on?"

"Is it your mom's illness getting worse?" Isabella guessed, her face full of concern.

Amelia shook her head. Isabella was puzzled. Amelia was usually so cheerful and outgoing. She only cried when Isabella suffered injustice.

Isabella thought back over her recent life and realized she had been pretty happy lately, with nothing that should make Amelia cry.

So, it had to be something about a guy.

"Did some guy dump you? When did you start dating? How come I didn't know?" Isabella asked, surprised.

Amelia shook her head. "I haven't been in a relationship."

Isabella was even more confused. Then a thought hit her, and she asked in shock, "Don't tell me you're all lovesick over some guy? Who is this mystery man? Have I met him?"

Amelia blushed. "Let's not talk about it. Just drink with me. I don't want to bring him up."

But Isabella was serious. She grabbed Amelia's hand and said, "Okay, seriously. Even if you won't tell me who he is, I need to know: Is he hot? Rich? Any red flags? What's he like? And MOST importantly, is he married? 'Cause I'm not hearing about you being a side piece."

Amelia couldn't help but smile at Isabella's flood of questions. "Don't worry, I would never fall for a married man. I'm not into breaking up homes. And you're asking too many questions. I don't even know the answers to some of them myself. Let's change the subject."

Isabella looked at Amelia's face, stayed quiet for a few seconds, then sighed and nodded. "Alright, let's change the subject. Did you get drunk because you confessed to him and got rejected?"

Amelia shook her head helplessly. "Actually, I haven't confessed to him. I don't even know if he likes me. I just can't figure out what our relationship is. Anyway, let's not talk about it anymore. Just drink with me."

Amelia handed Isabella a fresh glass of wine.

Isabella had no choice but to drop it. She picked up the glass and downed it in one go.

At that moment, Amelia noticed a handprint on Isabella's neck.

Amelia shot up from her chair, furious. "Why do you have a handprint on your neck? Who grabbed you? It wasn't Michael, was it?"

Isabella shook her head. "It wasn't Michael. He would never lay a hand on me. It was John. He's a lunatic. Even though I'm married, he keeps harassing me!"

Amelia's anger boiled over. "John again! Didn't you tell Mason? He should teach that jerk a lesson."

Isabella shook her head. "No, I feel like John pursuing me is something Mason has silently approved of."

Amelia furrowed her brows. "How could that be? Didn't Mason agree to cancel your engagement with John?"

Isabella sighed, looking defeated. "Remember when John was in the hospital? Mason asked me to cook for him. Even then, I could tell Mason wanted me to be with John."

"Is Mason losing his mind or something? How can he just ignore your feelings?" Amelia grumbled, clearly frustrated.

Isabella traced the rim of her glass, smiling sadly. "Mason means well. I know he genuinely cares about me. He's probably worried that after he's gone, there won't be anyone to protect me. Marrying John, the Williams family heir, would guarantee my safety."

Amelia was speechless. When it came to status, Isabella's current husband, Michael, couldn't compare to Mason.

"Why is our fate so miserable? Never mind, let's drink. Tonight, we drink until we drop," Amelia said, handing Isabella another glass of wine.

The two of them sat at the bar, drinking non-stop. Any guys who tried to hit on them were quietly chased away by Leo.

Meanwhile, Leo informed Michael about Isabella drinking at the bar.

Amelia didn't stop until she was completely drunk. She leaned on the bar, crying, "Isabella, if anyone ever bullies you, you have to tell me. If Michael dares to bully you, I'll kick his balls!"

Michael's voice came from behind them. "I don't think you'll get that chance."

Isabella turned around and saw Michael. "Why are you here?"

Michael looked at the handprint on Isabella's neck, concern flashing in his eyes. "I heard John choked you, so I came to find you. Does it still hurt?"

Michael gently touched Isabella's neck. The memory of John's hands around Isabella's throat choked Michael's heart.

Isabella, a bit tipsy, tried to stand up from her chair but nearly fell. Luckily, Michael caught her.

She fell into Michael's arms, crying, "It doesn't hurt, but I'm scared. John said he would find out your identity and kill us! He humiliated you in front of me, and I couldn't stand it, so I slapped him. Should I not have hit him? Maybe then he wouldn't be so angry. Maybe you should go abroad, to Kenna. He might be able to protect you."

Michael held Isabella tightly, feeling even more heartbroken. He hadn't expected her to suffer because of him.

'John, you truly deserve to die!' Michael thought, a cold, murderous look flashing in his eyes.

While Isabella was crying in his arms, Michael secretly took out his phone and sent a message to Jerry.

Michael: [How's it going?]

Jerry: [Everything is ready. This time, we're using solid wood baseball bats. They hurt a lot but won't cause serious injuries.]

Michael: [Wooden bats? Switch them all to steel ones!]

Jerry, who was about to take action, was stunned when he saw Michael's message.

###chapter 126 Hit Him!

Jerry checked his phone again, making sure the message was really from Michael. He felt a bit annoyed.

'It's just a slight choking. Why's Michael so mad?' Jerry thought. He pondered for a moment and quickly figured it out.

When someone attacks another person, they rarely do it quietly. John must've said something while hurting Isabella, something the onlookers didn't hear, but Michael found out from Isabella. That's why John was in trouble now.

A car pulled up by the roadside, not far from the bar where John would be coming out tonight.

Jerry and his crew waited in the car for about 20 minutes before finally spotting John.

John's steps were wobbly, showing he'd had a lot to drink at the bar. According to Jerry's investigation, ever since Bianca got locked up, John had been in a bad mood and went out drinking every night. Despite his frequent bar visits, John seemed to have a strong attachment to Bianca, as he turned down every woman who tried to approach him.

"Mr. Nelson, when should we move?" a masked guy whispered to Jerry.

Jerry glanced at John's car parked by the roadside. As the heir to a powerful family, John had bodyguards with him. To get to John, they had to distract his bodyguards first.

"Now. Follow Plan A," Jerry said, waving his hand. The van door opened, and a group of men got out.

These guys were seasoned fighters, pros at handling bodyguards and kidnapping targets.

It was prime drinking time, and a crowd had gathered outside the bar. John's bodyguards, alert and on edge, sensed something was off when they saw a group of men approaching.

"Mr. Williams, get in the car!" a bodyguard shouted, pulling John toward the car.

Jerry's men quickly closed in, throwing a handful of lime powder into the bodyguards' eyes to blind them.

John's reactions were slow due to the alcohol. By the time he realized something was wrong, it was too late. A fighter put a black bag over his head, and another knocked him out with a stun gun.

The bodyguards struggled to open their eyes and tried to rush to John's aid, but they were quickly overpowered by the fighters. These fighters fought dirty, using stun guns, lime powder, and even pepper spray.

The fighters' goal was to prevent the bodyguards from rescuing John. They only needed to buy time until two of their companions carried John away and threw him into a van. Afterwards, the fighters dispersed.

One of the bodyguards, trembling with pain, managed to pull out his phone and make a call. Soon, reinforcements arrived to tend to the bodyguards and began searching for John.

John was jolted awake by a splash of cold water. His eyes were covered with a blindfold, preventing him from seeing his surroundings.

Jerry stood nearby, gripping a steel baseball bat. He looked at John, then at the bat, and finally sighed.

'John, don't blame us. You brought this on yourself by hurting Isabella,' Jerry thought, feeling a bit guilty. He then raised the bat and swung it at John.

John felt a sharp pain in his leg and screamed, "Do you know who I am? You're all dead! Just wait!"

No matter how much John cursed or bragged about his Williams family inheritance, the fighters around him acted like they didn't hear a thing, relentlessly beating him with their bats.

Jerry held back a bit, making sure they avoided hitting John's vital areas like his head and groin. Most of the blows landed on John's back and butt.

When the sound of a bone breaking echoed, John clutched his leg, howling in pain.

Jerry decided it was enough. He planted the bat on the ground and used a hoarse voice to say, "Our Brown Family suffered the same treatment from you before. Consider this payback."

Hearing Jerry's words, John thought the Brown family was nuts. Before he could process it further, he heard the sound of a stun gun. A sharp pain shot through his neck, and he blacked out again.

When John woke up, he was in a hospital. His leg was suspended in a sling. He had injured his leg in a car accident before, and now the other leg was hurt, making them somewhat symmetrical.

Mason was shocked to hear that John had been kidnapped, but soon news came that the kidnappers had dumped John at the hospital entrance.

When John woke up, he saw Mason sitting by his bed.

"Grandpa, you have to help me find those guys! The people who kidnapped me are from the Brown family! They're retaliating against me because they think we attacked their members. I won't let them get away with this!" John's face was filled with anger.

Mason's expression was very grim, but he shook his head. "This might not be Paxton and his people. It could be the same group who kidnapped Pearl. They're trying to provoke further conflict between our families."

Mason's words hit John like a ton of bricks. All this time searching for Pearl and the others - for nothing! If it was the same group, finding them was hopeless, and John's revenge would remain a fantasy.

"Have you offended anyone recently?" Mason asked in a deep voice.

John frowned, thinking carefully, and shook his head. "No, I haven't offended anyone recently."

The words were barely out when a jolt of recognition slammed into him. Isabella. He'd offended Isabella today. Because she rejected his roses and slapped him, he had nearly choked her.

But John didn't dare to mention this. He knew Mason was very fond of Isabella. If he revealed this, his other leg might end up broken too.

###chapter 127 Crying Together

Mason watched John's face closely, knowing the guy was definitely hiding something. But since John wasn't spilling, Mason decided not to push it.

"Think it over. If you want to dig into this, go for it. If not, I'll let Paxton know," Mason said.

John looked shocked. "Didn't you say it's unlikely the Browns did this? Why tell Paxton then?"

Mason squinted. "I have my reasons. Spreading the word about your injury does two things. First, it gives the Browns a sense of balance since they've had a lot of injuries lately and probably hold a grudge against us. Second, it helps steer public opinion. With both heirs hurt and both families denying responsibility, suspicion will fall on the other families. This takes some heat off us for now."

As the head of the Williams Family, Mason was always strategic and resourceful. John's status as the sole heir was prestigious, and no one would believe he got hurt on purpose just to gain sympathy.

Mason wanted to use this incident to sway public opinion in favor of the Williams Family.

John took a deep breath. He wasn't thrilled about it, but since Mason had already made up his mind, he decided to go along with the plan.

"I heard you've been sending people to the prison recently? Are you planning to take care of Bianca?" Mason suddenly asked, his eyes cold.

John felt a wave of nerves because it was true. He had secretly visited Bianca in prison, and she told him she was having a hard time. As a disabled person, she was often bullied by other inmates, so he sent people to protect her.

Mason's gaze was icy. "Didn't you tell me you were planning to pursue Isabella again? Why are you still tangled up with Bianca? I expect more dedication from you. If you're not interested in Isabella, stop bothering her. Your engagement is over."

"I understand, Grandpa. Please give me some time to handle this," John said, lowering his head.

Disappointed, Mason stood up and left the hospital.

Meanwhile, Jerry, after dealing with John, reported to Michael.

Michael acknowledged it and hung up.

Michael was still at the bar, where Amelia and Isabella were hugging and crying at the counter.

"What should I do? I may seem bold, but when it comes to love, I'm a coward." Amelia stopped, thinking about what happened to Isabella, and kept crying, "I can't even protect you, my bestie. I really want to take on John, but I just don't have the guts!"

Isabella cried too, holding Amelia. "Honey, you've done more than enough. My pain shouldn't be yours to bear!"

Amelia kept crying. "But it's okay. I can't mess with John, but I can handle Michael. We're on the same level. If he ever bullies you, just tell me, and I'll take him down for you!"

"Don't worry, I will!" Isabella cried, patting Amelia's back.

Michael rubbed his face in frustration. Just then, someone approached from behind him.

"Why'd you call me here so late? What's going on?" Benjamin appeared behind Michael, but his expression stiffened when he saw Amelia.

Benjamin looked embarrassed. "I don't know what's gotten into her today. I think she's even harder to read than Isabella."
