"Can you arrange for Bianca to have another medical exam? With your status and reputation in the medical field, John is unlikely to refuse. If we can prove she's faking her illness, I can bring her down completely," Isabella said, a cold glint flashing in her eyes.

Benjamin readily agreed.

"Give me the phone. I want to talk to Isabella," Amelia's voice came from the other end.

"Isabella, I heard you closed a big deal. Let's celebrate!" Amelia suggested, hoping to help Isabella relax.

As close friends, Isabella understood Amelia's motives and readily agreed.

They planned to spend the weekend at a vineyard in the countryside, picking grapes and making wine by hand.

While Isabella and Amelia were discussing their vineyard trip, Bianca received a call at the hospital.

A deep male voice came through the line, "Benjamin's been digging into your medical records. He might be onto something about your illness. You know he's Michael's friend. If he finds out the truth, he'll definitely tell Michael, and Michael won't stand for you deceiving their family."

Bianca's face drained of color. She knew nothing of this! If Benjamin discovered her deception, their entire bribery and kidney transplant scheme would unravel.  Worse still, if John grew suspicious and ordered compatibility tests for her and Isabella, the mismatch would expose Bianca's treachery, revealing her long-held plan to harm Isabella.

At that point, even if John loved her deeply, he'd be furious. And Mason, who adored Isabella, might even kill her!

"What should I do now?" Bianca asked, trembling.

The voice on the other end stayed calm. "Don't panic. Things are still under control. I've arranged a car to pick you up. Your new identity and passport are ready. Leave the hospital immediately. The car will take you to the airport. You'll fly to Lumaria. Once you arrive, call John and tell him that your parents found a matching kidney donor for you in Lumaria, and due to the urgency, you had to leave right away."

Bianca nodded in agreement. Soon, a car arrived at the hospital entrance, and Bianca's phone rang. Confirming it was the car arranged for her, Bianca wheeled herself towards it.

John's bodyguard, assigned to Bianca, followed her. "Ms. Taylor, where are you going?"

"I need to handle something urgent. You don't need to follow me. I'll inform John," Bianca said before getting into the car and leaving.

The bodyguard immediately reported the situation to John.

John tried calling Bianca, but her phone was off.

Feeling suspicious, John instructed the bodyguard to investigate Bianca's whereabouts. By the time John received news that Bianca was at the airport, she was already on a flight to Lumaria.

After Bianca's plane landed and she left the airport, she turned on her phone and called John.

"Sorry, John, I'm about to go into surgery. My parents found a kidney donor in Lumaria. The donor was in critical condition, so we couldn't afford to wait. Just as I landed, I was informed that the donor had passed away. I'll come back to you after the surgery is done," Bianca said before ending the call.

John had already been informed by Bianca's parents about her trip to Lumaria for the transplant. He had been suspicious because he hadn't heard it directly from Bianca.

Now, hearing it from Bianca herself, John felt relieved. He had been worried that Bianca might have been kidnapped.

With the call ended, John felt excited. Once Bianca had her kidney transplant, she would be healthy again and no longer need a wheelchair.

Meanwhile, after work, Michael returned to the villa. Seeing Isabella, he smiled and asked, "Can you tell me about your plan? I've been very curious."

###chapter 153 The Winery

Isabella got what Michael was talking about-her plan to handle the mess her parents had caused.

"One of our main attractions is hands-on winemaking. You can pick your own grapes, put them in barrels for traditional fermentation, and we'll store them for you. Once the wine's ready, we'll ship it to your home," the staff explained, handing out bags for collecting grapes.

Everyone found the whole grape-picking and winemaking thing pretty cool. Amelia, in particular, was super into it, picking the juiciest grapes she could find.

Even though Isabella owned a vineyard back in Aurora Continent, she'd never actually been there, so this was all new to her.

Michael and Benjamin, on the other hand, had done this kind of thing as kids but hadn't touched it since. It was like a trip down memory lane for them.

Isabella's face turned bright red. She glared at him and spat out the grape skin.

From a distance, Benjamin watched them, his eyes filled with envy.

"Why can't we be like that?" he muttered to himself.

###chapter 154 Benjamin and Amelia

###chapter 158 Overzealous Behavior

Michael wrapped his arm around her shoulder and whispered in her ear, "You're right, babe. Love does make people blind. You've been on your feet all day. Aren't they sore? How about I carry you back?"

Isabella's face turned a bit pink, and she pinched Michael's waist. "You joker! Is your back not sore anymore? Think you've got the energy to tease me?"

Michael felt her hand on his waist, knowing she wasn't really pinching hard. He smirked. "You can test my strength anytime. It's the weekend, after all."

Isabella's face turned even redder, and she glared at him before walking into the doctor's office.

Inside, the doctor and Benjamin were in a heated argument.

Benjamin insisted, "Amelia has to be hospitalized today. Even if God himself tells her to go home, I won't agree. That's final!"

The doctor, fuming, pointed at Benjamin's nose and yelled, "You're a doctor too. Can't you see her condition isn't serious? Stop wasting medical resources. There are plenty of patients who actually need these beds!"

"That just shows how crappy the medical facilities are here. I'm transferring her to my hospital," Benjamin said, trying to push Amelia's wheelchair.

The doctor, just as angry, waved him off. "Fine, transfer her if you want! Get her out of my office!"

Amelia covered her face, too embarrassed to say anything. The office was packed with other patients, their families, and some doctors and nurses, all watching the drama unfold.

The doctor noticed Isabella and Michael standing at the door. He frowned and asked, "Are you two friends with this guy? Why don't you talk some sense into him?"

Isabella and Michael exchanged a look and shook their heads at the same time. "No, no, you've got it wrong! We don't really know him!"

Feeling awkward, they quickly left the hospital.

Benjamin started pushing Amelia's wheelchair, ready to take her to his hospital, but Amelia suddenly stopped him.

"Isabella, Michael, could you two leave us for a moment? I need to talk to Benjamin," Amelia said, looking at them.

Isabella nodded and pulled Michael away. "Let's go and give them some space. If I'm not mistaken, Benjamin's whole lovelife depends on what he does next."

Before leaving, Michael gave Benjamin an encouraging look, hoping he would nail it this time.

Benjamin took a deep breath and pushed Amelia to a quiet spot under a tree.

Michael and Isabella hadn't gone far when Isabella suddenly pulled him onto a different path, sneaking towards the tree.

"Didn't you say to give them space? What are we doing? Eavesdropping?" Michael asked, his mouth twitching slightly.

Isabella rolled her eyes. "I did say to give them space, but that doesn't mean we just sit here doing nothing! Let's at least listen in. That way, if things go south, we'll have a clue what happened."

"You're just being nosy," Michael muttered, rolling his eyes too, but he didn't object.

Meanwhile, Benjamin and Amelia sat under the tree and started talking.

"Benjamin, I want to ask you something. Do you really like me?" Amelia asked directly, looking at him.

Benjamin took a deep breath and nodded firmly. "Yes, I do. I'm very sure of it."

"When did you start liking me?" Amelia asked with a smile, tilting her head.

Benjamin had thought about this question many times. He looked at Amelia seriously and said, "Ever since we first met, I thought you were very beautiful. And the more I got to know you, the more I liked your personality."

Benjamin continued to pour his heart out, and Amelia looked at him with increasingly tender eyes.

Hiding behind the tree, Isabella and Michael exchanged a glance, feeling confident that things would work out between the two.

###chapter 159 Jasper's Call

Amelia and Benjamin finally made it official. Well, sort of.

They both liked each other, but Amelia was still a bit hesitant. She gave Benjamin a trial period to prove himself.

If he could keep his eyes off other women during this time, they'd make it official.

"Let's get out of here. They're probably gonna spend some quality time together now, like grabbing coffee, catching a movie, or just chatting. We shouldn't stick around and cramp their style," Isabella said, smiling at Michael before taking his hand and heading out.

They hopped into the car. On the way, Isabella called Amelia to see if she needed a ride home, but she turned it down.

"I'm gonna chat with Benjamin for a bit. You guys go ahead. He'll take me home, so don't worry about me," Amelia said, hanging up quickly, like she was afraid Isabella might say more.

"See? They don't need us anymore," Isabella shrugged, smiling as she put down her phone.

"If they end up getting married, we can totally take credit for setting them up," Michael said with a grin, genuinely happy for Benjamin.

As Michael and Isabella drove home, they passed by her old apartment building and saw a crowd gathered there.

Michael rolled down the window a bit, listening to the commotion outside. His face gradually darkened.

They could hear people shouting Isabella's name, holding signs with her name, demanding she be punished. Some were even hurling insults, calling her a slut.

Michael rolled up the window and took out his phone, but Isabella grabbed his hand and shook her head.

"I know you want to teach those people a lesson, but hold off. I need to wait until this situation blows up to a point where Jasper and Mia can't control it anymore. That's when it'll be most advantageous for me," Isabella said with a gentle smile.

Michael took a deep breath and put his phone back in his pocket, feeling a deep-seated disgust and hatred for Isabella's parents.

The car started moving again, heading towards the villa. Isabella thought of something, took out her phone, removed Jasper's number from the blacklist, and called him.

The phone rang twice before Jasper's arrogant voice came through. "Why are you calling me? Ready to admit defeat?"

Isabella's fist clenched instinctively. "Mr. Taylor, this is your first and last warning. Take those videos down immediately, and I can pretend this never happened. Otherwise, you won't be able to handle the consequences. I won't let you get away with slandering me online."

On the other end of the line, Jasper scoffed, like he had heard a joke. "Am I lying? Is it a lie that I tried to stop you from being with that man? Is it a lie that you defied us for him? Is it a lie that we almost got buried alive by Paxton because of you?"

"I had no idea about any of this! I didn't think Paxton would come after you. Plus, I'm the victim here! I didn't go abroad to run away. My husband is a foreigner, and I was just with him at his home. You twisted the facts, left out half the story, and made up the rest to fit your narrative. Do you really think that'll get you what you want?" Isabella's voice was full of anger.

"Listen to you now. You don't even want to call me father," Jasper's voice dripped with resentment and mockery.

Isabella took a deep breath, her gaze icy. "I'm not here to play games with you. I have one question: are you going to delete those videos or not?"

"And what if I don't? You deceived me; why should I listen to you?" Jasper sneered, feeling like he had Isabella cornered.

After a long pause, Isabella asked, "If I agree to help Bianca and John get together, will you delete the videos? For your information, Mason hasn't called me in the past two days. That means he hasn't seen the video yet. If he finds out, how do you think he'll react?"

Jasper's tone was laced with resentment. "Don't try to scare me with Mason. As long as everyone believes you're a heartless woman, Mason will be disappointed in you. That'll open the door for Bianca and John, and our family will rise again!"

But as soon as Jasper finished speaking, Isabella started laughing.

"My poor father, do you really think Bianca will keep her promise? Don't forget, Bianca's father also has a claim to my grandfather's inheritance. When my grandfather left everything to you, do you think her father didn't hold a grudge? Think about it, why would Bianca abandon the father who raised her for decades to side with an uncle like you? Do you really think your verbal agreement means anything?" Isabella said.

Jasper suddenly went silent. Isabella didn't say anything either, and the tension between them grew thick.

After several more seconds, Jasper laughed coldly. "Isabella, you think you're so smart, trying to screw up our relationship with Bianca. Think again! Because of what you've done, I'm making more videos. Get ready to be hated by everyone."

Jasper hung up the phone and turned to Mia, who was sitting beside him.

"Isabella might be trying to cause trouble between Bianca and us, but she has a point. Our agreement with Bianca is only verbal. I can't fully trust her. She's in Lumaria, isn't she? When she gets back, we need to sign a contract with her!" Jasper said coldly.

Mia nodded, clearly agreeing with Jasper's plan.

###chapter 160 Private Detective

On the other end, Isabella hung up the phone with a smirk. "My dad is such an arrogant, conceited fool."

She saved the recording of their chat, grinning.

Michael turned to her, smiling. "Looks like you're pretty confident in your plan."

Isabella nodded. "I know my dad too well; he's a control freak. He never trusted me, his own daughter, so there's no way he'd trust Bianca. Just a little nudge from me, and they'll definitely have a falling out. The only way they'll keep working together is with a contract. Remember those hidden cameras?"

She looked at Michael.

Michael nodded. Of course, he remembered. Isabella had set up a hidden camera in her room to avoid getting framed. Those cameras had stopped Scarlett's attempt to set her up.

"Are you thinking about putting hidden cameras in your parents' villa?" Michael asked with a grin.

Isabella nodded. "Yeah, but we need someone to sneak in. Any ideas?"

"I'll take care of it. I know plenty of people for this kind of job." Michael said confidently.

Isabella trusted his connections, so she agreed.

Once they got back to the villa, Michael immediately called Jerry.

"Find me a private investigator, someone who can act and preferably has experience as a thief. I want Jasper's villa filled with cameras!" Michael ordered coldly, his anger towards Jasper and Mia clear.

Jerry nodded. They knew plenty of skilled people abroad and could definitely find the right person.

The next day, Jasper and Mia got a call. A guy claiming to be a journalist named Steve Carter from a newspaper wanted to interview them.

Jasper, eager to teach Isabella a lesson, agreed to the interview.

That afternoon, Steve showed up at Jasper's villa. He was a middle-aged guy in a vest, with a work badge around his neck, looking every bit the dedicated journalist. He had a cameraman with him.

"You must be Ms. Taylor's father! We've heard about the news and are outraged. We can't believe Isabella would do such things! Don't worry, our newspaper has a big audience. The public will make sure Isabella gets what she deserves!" Steve said, even showing the name of his newspaper and its website.

Jasper and Mia were stoked when they saw the website and heard what Steve had to say.

"No, no, I don't want anyone to hurt my daughter. I just hope she realizes her mistakes and comes back to us," Jasper kept up his image as a loving father.

"You are truly a kind father. I'm sure your daughter will appreciate everything you do someday," Steve said, looking impressed.

Steve then started interviewing Jasper and Mia, asking about the struggles they faced raising Isabella and the good times they had together. This was perfect material to create a dramatic contrast for the audience, making Isabella's betrayal seem even worse.

"Alright, would it be possible for us to film some footage inside your villa? We'd like to include Isabella's room as well," Steve asked.

Jasper and Mia didn't hesitate. They'd been interviewed by several journalists recently, all with similar requests.

Steve and the cameraman filmed extensively inside and outside the villa. During this, Steve noted the best spots to place hidden cameras.

"Thanks so much, Mr. and Mrs. Taylor, for letting me interview you. We will report the truth faithfully!" Steve said, looking every bit the champion of justice.

Jasper shook Steve's hand, asking him to use the newspaper's influence to make Isabella realize her mistakes.

Steve agreed to everything. Before leaving, he handed Jasper a business card. "Mr. Taylor, in my years as a journalist, I've seen many dark sides of human nature. We've met parents let down by their own kids. This group is for good-hearted parents like you. Lots of families here have been through what you're going through. Maybe talking to them can help you heal from the hurt."

"Thank you, Mr. Carter," Jasper said gratefully, waving goodbye to Steve as he left.

Mia looked at the business card in Jasper's hand, which had an address, a phone number, and a contact person's name.

"Are you really going to this?" Mia asked.

"Why not?" Jasper smiled slyly.

"I've been clueless on what lies to spin lately. We can attend this support group, pick up some stories, and tweak them to fit our tale. Steve has done us a great favor," Jasper said, feeling very pleased with himself as he dialed the number on the card.

Meanwhile, Steve got into a car after leaving the Taylor Villa. Jerry was waiting in the passenger seat.

"How did it go?" Jerry asked.

Steve smiled confidently. "Don't worry, they've taken the bait. As soon as they leave for that support group, I can install the hidden cameras in no time!"

Jerry nodded, curious. "Does that support group really exist?"

Steve shrugged. "Eight billion people on the planet. Statistically, there should be a group like that, right? But I've never seen one." 

He paused, "Don't worry, those actors I hired are professional. During the chat, they'll exchange small gifts. Trust me, the cameras in those gifts won't fall out like in the movies!"

Jerry looked at the confident Steve, a playful smile on his face, and felt a bit of sympathy for Jasper.

'Poor guy, it looks like every day for them is going to be a live broadcast!' Jerry thought.

###chapter 161 Isabella's Discovery

Steve was the PI Jerry hired to dig up dirt on Jasper and Mia. Being a private investigator didn't exactly require a halo, especially when it came to bugging homes and planting hidden cameras.

Lucky for Jerry, Steve wasn't exactly a saint. He had a bag of tricks, and his targets usually spilled their secrets without even knowing it.

For Steve, this job was a piece of cake. Jasper and Mia were easily manipulated, and he won their trust quickly. Honestly, if Michael hadn't paid him so well, he wouldn't have bothered with this gig.

Meanwhile, Isabella got the update from Michael that everything was going according to plan.

After the weekend, Isabella headed to work. As soon as she got to the entrance, she saw the security guards looking pretty fed up.

They said they'd been dealing with a lot of people causing trouble for her and told her to look out for herself.

While they sounded concerned, Isabella sensed their frustration. The extra troublemakers were making their job much harder.

"Sorry for the extra hassle. I'll do my best to sort this out," Isabella said with a weary smile. She knew the guards would have to put up with this mess a bit longer until her plan was done.

Just as she was about to go inside, she heard a voice that made her cringe.

"Isabella doesn't care about you security guys. She's a big shot here. If she doesn't show up, how's she gonna earn that fat paycheck?" a woman trailing behind Madeline said as they approached Isabella.

Isabella glanced at the woman's name badge: Odette Davis, Assistant.

Isabella didn't think Odette was just trying to mock her; it was clear she was trying to stir up trouble between her and the security team.

Isabella shot a cold look at Madeline. "Last time, you didn't keep your assistant in line, and she got transferred. This new one's even worse!"

Odette's face soured, but Madeline stepped in front of her and said icily, "That's none of your business. I'm quite happy with my current assistant."

Isabella looked at Madeline with disappointment. It seemed Madeline had made her choice and wasn't interested in her goodwill.

Without another word, Isabella turned and walked into the building. She headed to her office, ignoring the whispers from her colleagues. She knew that once the truth came out, everything would be back to normal.

In her office, Isabella noticed something was off. The stack of documents on her desk looked like it had been moved.

Isabella always left her unfinished documents neatly in the top left corner of her desk. But now, the top document was slightly out of place.

She immediately called Juliet into her office.

"Did you come into my office today?" Isabella asked.

Juliet shook her head. "No, I haven't been in here. But Ms. Eve mentioned she had a task for me. I overheard her telling her new assistant, Odette, to drop off a document in your office."

Isabella nodded and said to Juliet, "You're my assistant, and from now on, you only take orders from me. If Madeline asks you to do anything, find an excuse to refuse or just say no. Don't worry about workplace politics; she and I are completely at odds now."

Juliet nodded to show she understood.

Isabella waved her hand, signaling Juliet to leave, and then took out her phone.

After reviewing the footage on her phone, her lips curled into a cold smile.

"Madeline, I gave you a chance, but I didn't expect you to stoop even lower," Isabella muttered as she put her phone away. She had to focus on her work and her parents for now. As for Madeline, she could wait until everything else was settled.

Just then, Juliet returned. "Ms. Taylor, Mr. Larson wants to see you in his office."

Isabella left her office and went to Dwayne's office.

"Mr. Larson, what can I do for you?" Isabella asked politely.

Dwayne nodded, his expression serious. "I just got a notice from the security department. They've been overwhelmed lately because of your situation. People keep showing up to cause trouble, and it's really putting a strain on them. They said if things don't calm down soon, they might not be able to keep you safe. So, I wanted to ask if you'd be willing to work from home for a while."

Isabella pressed her lips together. She'd known this day would come. She could have applied to work from home earlier, but she'd waited to build more public anger and get more attention.

Isabella bit her lip and looked at Dwayne. "Mr. Larson, could you please call the boss and ask for his opinion? Honestly, I don't want to work from home. It would look like I'm avoiding the issue. Everything my parents said online is false, and I need to stand my ground."

Dwayne rubbed his face, feeling a bit helpless. He had already called Michael, but Michael told him to follow Isabella's lead.

"If you really want to stay at the office, we can make it work. But we might need to hire more security," Dwayne said, relaying the boss's message.

Isabella was surprised that the boss valued her opinion so much. This was a great help to her.

Just then, the office door was knocked, and Madeline walked in.

"Mr. Larson, those protesters are back, and there are twice as many as yesterday! They want Isabella fired, saying someone as selfish as she is shouldn't be working here," Madeline said, looking at Isabella with a mocking expression.

Isabella's face remained impassive.

Dwayne sighed and immediately called the police.

After a while, the police arrived and dispersed the crowd outside the building.

###chapter 162 Paxton's Purpose

After getting back to her office, Isabella could totally feel the cold vibes from her coworkers. The crowd outside was all because of her, messing up everyone's day.

Isabella felt stuck. She wasn't some big shot with power, just a regular woman. Anyone with half a brain could see Jasper had set this up to mess with her.

These days, you could hire a bunch of people for cheap to hold signs and make a scene, like those fake fans at airports screaming for random celebrities. It was all about creating buzz and getting noticed.

Honestly, those people probably didn't even know what those celebs were famous for. It was all just a big act, and the best actors got to win.

Speaking of acting, there was another woman hustling for her future in showbiz. Michael had found himself a fake wife, Estella, promising her a bright future if she helped him fool his family.

Estella jumped at the chance. This was nothing compared to sucking up to directors or investors. She even thought if Michael wanted to sleep with her, she'd be down.

On the film set in Aurora Continent, Estella had just wrapped up a scene and was chilling when her assistant rushed over, saying someone wanted to see her.

"If it's a reporter, tell them I've got two hours free tomorrow for an interview. If it's a fan, just give them a signed photo and say I'm busy," Estella said, not even looking up.

She used to be cautious, but now she's brimming with confidence, all thanks to Michael.

Michael had kept his word, hooking her up with a killer PR team that got her name out there. Lately, she'd been all over the news, often mentioned as the wife of some mysterious guy. Reporters were all over her, trying to dig up dirt on him, but she kept them at arm's length, only talking about her movies and dodging any marriage questions.

But her assistant shook her head. "It's a woman named Zoey Foster. She says her husband is Paxton."

Estella was caught off guard. She didn't know Zoey, but she knew Paxton's name.

After making the deal with Michael, Estella had picked up some info about him.

Paxton's daughter, Pearl, had chased after Michael but got turned down, which was a big joke. Zoey showing up here had to be Paxton's idea. Since Pearl had made a fool of herself, it seemed weird they'd try to reach out to Michael again. So, what was Zoey doing here?

"Did she say why she wanted to see me?" Estella asked her assistant in a low voice.

The assistant, not quite getting why Estella was being so cautious, whispered back, "She didn't give a specific reason, just said she wanted to make friends and get to know a future star. She also gave me her card and said you could call her if you wanted."

The assistant handed Estella a fancy platinum card.

Estella raised an eyebrow. Just like a high-ranking family's wife, her business card was flashy as expected.

"Got it. You can go now, and don't mention this to anyone!" Estella warned her assistant firmly.

The assistant nodded and left.

As soon as the assistant was gone, Estella called Jerry to fill him in on the situation.

Jerry acknowledged and hung up. After the call, Estella had a bitter smile on her face.

"Everyone says I'm Michael's wife, but I don't even have his phone number!" Estella muttered to herself, then asked the makeup team to touch up her makeup for the next scene.

Meanwhile, Jerry reported the news to Michael.

"Mr. Williams, what is Paxton up to?" Jerry was just as puzzled as Estella.

Michael had embarrassed Paxton and Pearl before, so it didn't make sense for Paxton to keep trying to get involved with him.

Michael smirked. "Paxton wanted his daughter to marry me for the benefits. Capitalists would sell their own souls for enough profit - Paxton's using Estella to get close to me, hoping to score big for his family, maybe even crack some overseas markets."

Michael easily figured out Paxton's game. As the head of a family, Paxton wouldn't waste his time on petty revenge for his daughter.

As a man, Paxton wouldn't approach Michael's wife directly. Sending his own wife was the best way to avoid public scrutiny.

Michael tapped his fingers lightly on the table, new ideas forming in his mind.

Looking at Jerry, Michael said, "Tell Estella to get friendly with Paxton's wife and find out what she wants. She could be useful against the Browns."

Jerry nodded and was about to make the call when Michael stopped him.

"Also, give her my number and warn her not to call unless it's absolutely necessary," Michael added coldly. He didn't want to get a call from Estella while he was with Isabella, which would only lead to more misunderstandings.

Jerry agreed and went to make the arrangements.

Estella followed Jerry's instructions without hesitation. She was thrilled to have Michael's number, though only for emergencies, it was still a major boost.

###chapter 163 Mason's Resentment

Isabella gave Michael a ring to let him know that Mason had caught wind of the news and was definitely going to have John take care of it. She wanted to make sure Michael didn't get the wrong idea.

"Babe, do you really think I'd doubt you? Don't you trust me?" Michael said, rolling his eyes a bit, sounding a tad annoyed.

Isabella laughed and said, "Of course I trust you, but as your wife, I gotta show some concern to keep you calm."

Michael smiled warmly. Isabella's actions showed how much she cared for him.

"Alright, I get it. I won't be jealous of that guy. I know how much you can't stand him! Do you need me to get you some bodyguards? He nearly strangled you last time," Michael said seriously.

Isabella quickly declined. "No worries, the company has hired a whole new security team. They're much better than the old ones, who are now feeling the pressure. Management's considering replacing them. It's kinda funny. I never thought my situation would cause a job crisis for the company's security staff."

Michael just smiled at her words. He had personally picked these guards, and their pay was better than the original guards. Even if the security department's leadership wanted to replace the old guards, the new ones wouldn't agree!

After chatting for a bit, Michael and Isabella hung up.

Meanwhile, over at the Williams Villa, Mason was fuming. As an older guy, he paid little attention to the internet. Consequently, when he finally came across the viral videos of Jasper and Mia in tears, several days had already passed.

Mason was so mad when he first saw the videos that he almost smashed his phone! He knew Isabella well enough to be sure of her innocence; Jasper and Mia's accusations were blatant lies.

"They're hurting their daughter terribly. Charles, I need you to bring Jasper and Mia. I have to make them see what they've done," Mason barked at Charles, gripping his cane tightly.

But Charles didn't follow the order. Instead, he suggested, "Mr. Williams, there are rumors online that Isabella did those things because she has your favor. If you punish Jasper and Mia, it'll just confirm those rumors and make things worse for Isabella's reputation!"

With Charles' advice, Mason slowly calmed down.

"Go get John for me." Mason waved his hand, and Charles immediately went to get John.

John showed up, looking confused. He asked Mason, "Grandpa, what do you need me for?"

Mason handed John the news about Jasper and Mia.

John took a quick look, not showing much reaction since he already knew about it.

"Looks like you're already aware of what's going on with Isabella. This could be your chance," Mason said, eyeing John.

John got the hint. If he helped Isabella out of this mess, it might bring them closer.

But John shook his head. "Grandpa, you know Isabella's too proud. She's turned down all my help and even blocked my number. It's not that I don't want to help; she just won't let me."

Mason slammed his cane on the floor, fuming. "Your idea of 'help' was to strangle her and mess up her marriage? How could you be so foolish?"

John felt annoyed by the scolding but didn't dare to talk back.

Mason took a deep breath and said sternly, "Listen up. Get a PR team and hand it over to Isabella. Let her handle it herself!"

John pouted. "Grandpa, do we really need to go through all this? With our family's influence, we can just call the media and tell them to stop reporting about Isabella."

Before he could finish, Mason whacked him on the backside with his cane.

Mason stood up, pointing his cane at John, his face darkening. "You idiot! Do I need to teach you how to win her heart? The internet never forgets. Even if you use power to stop the media, Isabella will remain culpable in the public eye until the truth is revealed. The best way is to help her uncover the truth!" Mason said angrily.

John rubbed his sore backside and nodded. "Alright, Grandpa, I get it. I'll contact a PR team right away."

John then quickly left the room, running as if afraid Mason would follow and hit him again.

After John left, Mason sat back on the sofa.

'Could I have been wrong? If Isabella's husband is really Michael, how could he see her being slandered and not react? Or does he have other plans?' Mason wondered, gripping his cane, his face clouded with worry. He once again questioned the relationship between Isabella and Michael.

The next day, Isabella arrived at work. As she entered the design department, Odette approached her, arms crossed, with a mocking expression.

"Ms. Taylor, I didn't expect you could actually get John to help you! It seems the rumors in the company were true. You really became our director because you were once John's fiancée!" Odette said, her tone dripping with sarcasm, the jealousy in her eyes almost palpable.

Isabella frowned, realizing her suspicion was correct. John was indeed getting involved in this matter.

###chapter 164 Isabella's Warning

Isabella's face turned icy as she stared at Odette.

"Hasn't anyone told you that Madeline's last assistant got shipped off to Evernia for running her mouth? This is your last warning. I got this director gig because of my skills, not connections! How dare you bring gossip to me? You wanna end up in Evernia too?" Isabella's cold glare made Odette instinctively step back.

"Go back and tell Madeline I have the power to fire every single one of you! Cross me again, and you'll face the consequences," Isabella said, then stormed back to her office.

Odette clenched her fists, glaring at Isabella with pure hatred.

"Just wait. Let's see how long you can keep that attitude. You bitch, you'll regret this!" Odette muttered under her breath.

The other colleagues in the office looked at Odette with mocking and disdainful eyes.

In the workplace, picking sides was risky business, often resulting in conflict. Even if you did, you shouldn't mess with your superiors.

A smart person wouldn't act like Odette. But her situation was different. She was tight with Madeline's former assistant, Thea, and had been one of Madeline's followers in college. Naturally, she was part of Madeline's crew.

Odette harbored a secret crush on John, a wealthy and handsome heir, though she knew he'd never notice her.

Isabella, as John's ex-girlfriend-or rather, ex-fiancée-naturally became the target of Odette's jealousy. What drove Odette even crazier was that Isabella actually turned down such an amazing guy, which made her even more resentful.

So, Odette's behavior was more extreme than Thea's. And Madeline didn't care to stop any of it. As Isabella had pointed out, Madeline didn't bother to discipline her subordinates.

Meanwhile, Isabella opened her office door to find John sitting in her chair. Beside him stood three men in suits.

"Who let you into my office? This is my private space," Isabella said coldly as she walked up to John.

John waved his hand casually, "Technically, you're borrowing our space! This company was founded by my uncle, so it's part of our family's business. As the family heir, what's wrong with me sitting here?"

Isabella's lips curled into a mocking smile. "If I'm not mistaken, you're not one of the shareholders of this company, are you?"

John's smile stiffened. When Michael founded this company, he didn't include any members of the four major families. John, as a family heir, was the first to be excluded.

John didn't want to argue with Isabella over this. He pointed to the three men beside him and said, "I brought this PR team to help you. They're industry-leading, with a 90%+ satisfaction rate, and I trust them to handle this crisis."

Isabella shook her head. "Tell your grandfather thanks, but I don't need it. My husband already hired a PR team for me."

"Your husband? You mean the driver who dropped you off? What kind of PR team can he hire? Are you sure he hasn't been scammed?" John retorted with a mocking laugh.

The three PR guys in the office also smirked. They were there to help Isabella at John's request, but that didn't mean they worked for her. Naturally, they didn't need to show her any respect. Besides, Isabella might have to follow their instructions in the future.

Isabella frowned but quickly realized John had mistaken the driver, Leo, for her husband.

Leo, who had just parked the car, suddenly shivered.

"Damn, why do I have a bad feeling? Is someone planning to mess with me?" Leo muttered, looking around cautiously.

"The person you mentioned is just a driver assigned to me by the company," Isabella said, denying John's assumption. She didn't want him to trouble Leo.

"Are you kidding me? This company doesn't provide drivers." John sneered, clearly not believing Isabella.

Isabella frowned, thinking, 'The company didn't assign a driver? What's going on?'

"Alright, enough joking around. The PR team your husband hired is probably cheap and incompetent. You should trust the team I found. They're very famous in the industry! "Isabella," Bianca said, all sweetness and light, "I'm so sorry about what happened before. The online harassment freaked me out, so I couldn't face you. But things are calmer now, and I heard about your mess. I feel for you, really. So, I'm here to say sorry. Please, accept my apology." She squeezed Isabella's hand.

To Bianca's surprise, Isabella didn't pull away but instead smiled warmly.

"I didn't expect you to think of me even while undergoing a kidney transplant, Bianca. I'm deeply touched by your concern. Since you care so much about me, of course, I'll accept your apology." Isabella gently patted Bianca's hand, her face showing a kind smile.

Bianca's smile froze, and Isabella's reaction made her uneasy.

"Isabella, it's so good that you think this way." Bianca forced a smile.

"Of course, we're not letting this little thing come between us. We practically grew up together. I even helped you with your homework, remember?" Isabella brought up their childhood, subtly mocking Bianca.

But Isabella wasn't going to forgive Bianca so easily; she had other plans.

"My dear cousin, I can forgive you, but that doesn't mean the public will be so lenient about your past deceit! A quick online apology won't cut it. You need to apologize to the public as well," Isabella said, waving her hand.

"Everyone in the design department, please look over here. If you have friends in other departments, please call them here. I have an important announcement to make," Isabella called out, standing on a chair. The surrounding colleagues looked over curiously.

Madeline and Bianca turned pale, realizing what Isabella intended to do.

"Isabella, there's no need to make such a big scene. You're making me feel very embarrassed," Bianca said, forcing a very awkward smile.

Isabella stepped down from the chair, patted Bianca's head, and said seriously, "Sweetheart, a real apology needs to be heartfelt. You misled so many people online, and they're all waiting to hear from you. I've already told you, apologizing to me isn't enough. You owe those you deceived a proper apology as well."

Isabella then contacted Dwayne to inform him of Bianca's planned apology.

In his office, Dwayne was stunned for several seconds after receiving Isabella's call. After she hung up, his mouth twitched.

"What's going on now? Damn it, who let Bianca in?" Dwayne muttered, thinking that the design department might need a major personnel reshuffle.

Dwayne immediately phoned Michael, updating him on the situation with Isabella. Michael had previously ordered him to report anything concerning Isabella.

Michael smiled upon receiving Dwayne's call.

"Isabella wants you there for her cousin's apology, so you're going. And get people from all departments - everyone, including the cooks andthe cleaning crew," Michael commanded.

Dwayne started to protest, but thought better of it. He just nodded, then ended the call.

"Bianca is such an idiot. Why did she have to mess with Isabella? Isabella's caught in a media storm. Instead of watching the show at home, Biana came here to stir things up. She's just asking for trouble," Dwayne muttered, complaining about Bianca's foolishness while gathering employees from various departments to the design department.

With Dwayne's help, soon all the company's employees gathered in the design department. Due to the limited space, some even stood on tables.

Despite the crowd, the room was silent. Everyone was looking at Bianca with curious and puzzled expressions.

Moments before, all of the employees received directives from management to assemble in the design department and observe. They were instructed to maintain silence until they were told to return to their work.

On the way, some learned about the situation in the design department and shared it with their colleagues. They were all eager to see Bianca apologize, especially since they had been deceived by her and had insulted Isabella online, only to feel foolish when the truth came out.

Bianca's face was extremely grim. With so many people watching her, she felt immense pressure, as if Isabella was publicly humiliating her.

Once all the employees had gathered, Isabella stood on a chair and pointed at Bianca, smiling. "Everyone knows her, right? This is my cousin, Bianca. She stole my designs during the company's design competition. Many people were deceived by her, but there's something I need to say."

Isabella's expression turned serious and kind. "Bianca is my cousin, and I'm willing to give her a chance to admit her mistakes. Today, with Ms. Eve's help, my dear cousin has come here to apologize to me. I'm so glad she's owning up to her mistakes and wants to make things right. Everyone, phones out - let's get this apology on record! Remember how sorry she is, and let's move on."

Isabella then jumped off the chair, held Bianca's hand, and smiled. "Bianca, are you ready? You can start your apology now."

Bianca glared at Isabella with venomous eyes, her fists clenched so tightly that her knuckles turned white.

###chapter 172 Bianca's Apology

Under everyone's watchful eyes, Bianca shut her eyes tight, took a deep breath, and gritted her teeth. "I'm Bianca, and I'm here today to apologize to my cousin..."

Before she could finish, Isabella cut her off with a wave.

"Wait a sec, Bianca. Something's off," Isabella said, tilting her head as she looked Bianca over. Then, as if struck by a brilliant idea, she clapped her hands.

"That's it! You shouldn't be standing on the ground. You need to be up higher, like I was, so everyone can see you properly. People in the back can't see you. You need to be up higher to make this apology count," Isabella said, dragging over a taller stool for Bianca.

Bianca was about to lose it. Inside, she fumed, 'This woman is just trying to humiliate me!'

She shot Isabella a look that could kill. If looks could do damage, Isabella would be full of holes by now.

"Come on, my dear cousin, don't be shy. Get up there. Everyone's waiting for your apology," Isabella said, patting the stool.

Madeline suddenly realized the stool looked familiar. Wasn't that her office chair? What was Isabella up to, making Bianca stand on her chair?

"Isabella, you..." Madeline started, but a cold stare cut her off.

She turned to see Dwayne watching her quietly.

Earlier, Isabella had hinted that Bianca was brought in by Madeline. Dwayne didn't believe for a second that Bianca was here just to apologize. He could guess what Madeline was up to.

Dwayne was furious about this behavior that messed with the company's harmony.

Madeline stopped mid-sentence, giving Isabella the opening she needed.

"Ms. Eve, got something to say?" Isabella smiled at her.

Everyone else turned their attention to Madeline.

Madeline felt like she was being pricked by a thousand needles, making her squirm.

Taking a deep breath, she forced a strained smile. "Ms. Taylor, I was just going to say your idea is spot on. Bianca should definitely stand higher so everyone can see her."

"Ms. Eve, I'm glad you're on the same page. Thanks for bringing my cousin into the company. Without your help, security might have turned her away at the entrance. I'm truly grateful for the opportunity you've given her," Isabella said, feigning gratitude as she held Madeline's hand.

The colleagues around them looked at Madeline with mocking eyes, their gazes like flames, almost melting her.

Bianca's expression clearly indicated that she wasn't there to offer a sincere apology.  She was there to taunt Isabella, who had previously humiliated her.

Everyone knew about the beef between Isabella and Madeline.

Isabella kept hammering home that Madeline was the one who brought Bianca in, just to make her look bad in front of the higher-ups.

"Alright, Isabella, enough already. Let your cousin apologize so we can all get back to work," Madeline said with a forced smile.

Isabella's lips curled into a cold smile as she turned to Bianca.

"Come on,why aren't you on the stool yet? Get up there! We're all waiting for your apology," Isabella urged.

Bianca's fists clenched so tight that her nails dug into her palms, causing pain.

Once she was on the stool, she saw mocking stares and raised phones, and a wave of dizziness and anger washed over her.

'Just wait, Isabella. I'll pay you back for this humiliation tenfold, a hundredfold!' Bianca cursed inwardly, though she kept her face calm.

Finally, as the employees started to get restless, Bianca took a deep breath and began her apology.

"Hey everyone, I'm Bianca, Isabella's cousin. In the last design competition, I stole my cousin's work and claimed it as mine. I thought it was just a prank, but I didn't realize how much it would affect her. I'm sorry for taking up your time. I've learned my lesson and will do better in the future. Please forgive me," Bianca said, bowing to everyone.

"Alright, now that the apology is done, let's all get back to work," Madeline called out, trying to wrap things up.

But Isabella wasn't done. "Hold on, this isn't over yet. I just had an idea."

She turned to Bianca with a smile. "My dear cousin, remember the media attention after your plagiarism and lies? I was the focus of the news then. Well, since the media was involved last time, they should be involved this time too. There are reporters outside; we can use them to publicize your apology. I'm sure they'll love this story."

"Are you out of your mind? What are you trying to do?" Bianca screamed, trying to jump off the stool.

"Watch your tone. Lots of people are recording this!" Isabella said coldly, her icy stare making Bianca freeze.

Isabella pointed to the phones recording the scene. "Even if our colleagues post your video online, it won't get much attention. You're not a big star, after all. But using the media will make sure the public sees your sincerity."

Turning to Dwayne, Isabella said, "Mr. Larson, could you bring in the reporters from outside to film my cousin's apology?"

A smile played on Dwayne's lips. He nodded and headed for the door.

###chapter 173 Excited Reporter

Glenn Cole was an intern reporter at the newspaper, and his editor had sent him out to cover a story. He thought it might be something big, but to his dismay, it turned out to be just a couple griping about their daughter-pretty much the kind of boring stuff they always dumped on interns like him.

But now, Glenn was buzzing with excitement. Because earlier, Dwayne had called him and a few other reporters into the company building, where they caught Bianca on camera, apologizing.

Glenn knew all about the beef between Bianca and Isabella. The plagiarism scandal had just started to die down, but people still remembered it. And with Isabella being so popular right now, Bianca's apology was bound to make waves.

"Reporters, you should have recorded my cousin's apology. Please make sure to show her in a good light, as her apology is sincere," Isabella said, sounding like she was trying to be nice but really just making Bianca squirm.

"Don't worry, Ms. Taylor. We're professionals, and we'll report this accurately," Glenn replied with a polished smile.

"Alright, since the apology is over, everyone please get back to your work. Bianca, since you're done with your apology, please leave the company. These reporters might have some questions for you, but to avoid further disruption, please answer them outside," Isabella said, dismissing the employees with a smile directed at Bianca.

Bianca didn't dare show any anger in front of the reporters. She kept her head down and quickly bolted out of the building.

"A post-kidney transplant patient with uremia running that fast-she's not even trying to hide it," Isabella muttered, rolling her eyes.

Isabella's voice was so low that the surrounding reporters didn't catch it. They were all focused on Bianca. After she left, the reporters said their goodbyes to Isabella and chased after her.

Among the reporters, Glenn was the fastest. He was the first to catch up to Bianca, shoving his microphone in her face and asking, "Ms. Taylor, was your apology sincere?"

Other reporters quickly crowded around her.

"Ms. Taylor, why did you choose to apologize when your cousin is in the middle of a media storm? Is there any special reason?"

"Ms. Taylor, do you really have a good relationship with your cousin?"

Bianca clenched her fists, clearly fed up with the reporters. She grabbed her hair and screamed, "Get away from me! All of you, get lost!"

As she screamed, she flailed her arms wildly. The reporters dodged, and she took the chance to dash to a nearby taxi, urging the driver to take off quickly.

As the taxi sped away, a grin spread across Glenn's face. His newspaper would definitely have a headline-grabbing story today.

Meanwhile, in Dwayne's office, Madeline and Isabella stood in front of him.

"Isabella, I get where you're coming from, but next time, run these things by me first," Dwayne sighed. This whole mess was going to need some serious damage control from the PR team to avoid another scandal.

Isabella smiled and nodded. "I'm sorry, Mr. Larson. I didn't think it through."

Dwayne waved Isabella off but motioned for Madeline to stay.

Once they were alone, Dwayne's expression turned icy.

"Madeline, why did you let Bianca into the company? Don't you know she caused a scandal before?" Dwayne glared at her.

Madeline fidgeted with her fingers and bit her lip, filled with regret. She understood that scheming with Bianca against Isabella should have been kept private, not in the workplace. She hadn't thought about the consequences.

Dwayne stared at her in silence, his anger growing. "Don't tell me you brought her here to apologize. I can see through insincerity. I know what you're planning! Whether it's you or Isabella, anyone endangering the company's interests will face consequences! Take this as a warning. If it occurs again, don't expect leniency from me."

Dwayne finished speaking and slammed the table, the loud noise making Madeline jump.

"Get out." Dwayne waved his hand, dismissing her.

Madeline gritted her teeth and left the office, heading back to the design department.

Odette approached her, asking, "Ms. Eve, how did it go?"

Madeline shot her an angry look. Technically, it was Odette who brought Bianca in, but as her superior, Madeline had to take the heat.

"I hope you'll be smarter next time and not make such a dumb mistake again!" Madeline snapped, glaring at Odette.

Odette shrank back, knowing Madeline was furious.

"Ms. Eve, I've got some news from the other colleagues. I think you'll find it interesting," Odette quickly said.

Madeline gave her a cold look. "What is it? Spit it out."

Odette hurriedly shared the info. "I overheard two colleagues saying they saw Isabella and Mr. Hamilton leaving a hotel together."

Madeline immediately turned to look at Odette. "Are you sure?"

Odette nodded. "That colleague lives near the hotel. He saw it clearly-it was definitely Isabella and Kevin."

Madeline's fists clenched. She'd never bought that Isabella had beaten her fair and square.  She'd always suspected something was up between Isabella and Kevin, and now it looked like she'd been right.  Things weren't as simple as they seemed.

"Ms. Eve, you're far too talented to have lost to Isabella! It's obvious now - she cheated to get Kevin's favor. Let's expose her and clear your name," Odette said.

###chapter 174 Jasper's Contract

Madeline thought for a second and then shook her head.

"Let's not mess with Isabella right now. She's in a bad spot with the media and could get unpredictable. Desperate people do desperate things. Plus, all we saw was her leaving the hotel with Kevin; that's not enough proof. Let's wait until we have something solid," she said, deciding to give Isabella a break for now.

Odette nodded, still a bit hesitant but accepting the decision.

Meanwhile, Isabella had no clue about any of this. If she did, she'd probably laugh at them for giving her more time.

"Hey, guess why I'm calling?" Michael's voice had a playful tone.

Isabella smiled, "You must have some good news, right? Let me guess, did my parents meet with Bianca?"

A few minutes earlier, Bianca had shown up at Jasper and Mia's villa. They had heard she went to Lumaria and didn't know when she'd be back, so her sudden visit was a surprise.

"Jasper, Mia, I just came from Isabella's company. She's still not owning up to her mistakes. You need to turn up the media heat on her," Bianca said with a cold smile.

Jasper and Mia exchanged a look; their silence was neither a yes nor a no. This made Bianca uneasy.

"What's wrong? Is the media campaign not working?" Bianca frowned. Media pressure was her go-to move against Isabella.

As long as Mason started hating Isabella because of her bad rep, Bianca and John would have more chances.

Jasper waved his hand with a smile. "Bianca, relax. The media campaign is working great; the public's on our side! Adding more pressure won't be an issue."

"But you don't seem too thrilled. Are you feeling sorry for Isabella? Don't forget, she ditched you when she ran," Bianca said coldly, trying to stir up more hatred in Jasper and Mia.

Jasper waved his hand again. "No need to remind me. I'm not letting her off the hook. From the moment we leaked her info to Pearl, we knew there was no going back. Actually, we have something else to talk about."

"What is it?" Bianca asked, frowning at Jasper.

Jasper smiled. "Bianca, I want to know if our previous agreement still stands."

Bianca raised an eyebrow and nodded. "Of course. As long as you help me marry John, I'll use his power to restore your family's honor."

Jasper rubbed his hands together, flashing a professional smile. "Bianca, it's not that I don't trust you, but these days, a verbal promise just doesn't cut it. I'd like to get it in writing."

Bianca's eyes narrowed, and she stood up from the sofa, glaring at Jasper. "Jasper, what are you trying to say? Don't you trust me? Remember, it was my idea to use public opinion against Isabella."

Jasper leaned back, still smiling. "Bianca, don't get mad. We know it was your idea, but you needed our help to pull it off, right? I'm a businessman, and businessmen rely on contracts. A written agreement is the only thing that reassures me."

Bianca stared at him for a moment before smiling. "So, you're worried that once I marry John, I'll ditch you and give all the benefits to my father?" Her smile was faint, but her eyes were cold.

Jasper dropped the act, leaning back with a smirk. "Bianca, this contract is for both our protection. If you won't sign, it means you've got something else up your sleeve. Look, you want John, you need us. Don't blame me for being careful. My own daughter stabbed me in the back, so why wouldn't you, my niece?"

Bianca clenched her fists, feeling a wave of disgust towards Isabella and her family. Isabella was a bitch, and her parents were no better.

After a moment of silence, Bianca nodded. "I get it. When do we sign? Now?"

Jasper stood up, excited. "Yes, right now. Let's not waste any time. I'll go get it."

He rushed into the bedroom and quickly returned with two contracts, a pen, and ink for fingerprints.

Bianca glanced at the contracts on the table and smirked. It seemed Jasper had prepared these well in advance.

She reviewed the contract, which matched her previous verbal agreement with Jasper.

She sighed internally, silently apologizing to her father, then quickly signed her name and pressed her fingerprint on the document. In fact, Jasper had guessed correctly; Bianca had no intention of letting him stay in control of the family. She planned to use him and then discard him. She hadn't expected Jasper to be smart enough to bind her with a contract.

Now, Bianca's mind was focused on marrying John. She decided to deal with the contract later.

None of them noticed the faint red glow in the eyes of a nearby deer head decoration on the wall.

###chapter 175 Severing Parental Ties

The whole scheme between Bianca, Jasper, and Mia got caught on a hidden camera.

Michael saved all the footage. That evening, after Isabella got off work, Michael took her and Juniper out to a restaurant.

"Ms. Fox, now that we have these videos, when can we make our move?" Isabella asked Juniper.

"Alright, got it. This is perfect timing. I'll let Isabella know." Juniper smiled as she hung up.

"Mr. Williams, what can I do for you?" Juniper asked casually.

"Ms. Fox, I assume you've seen the latest video from Jasper and Mia. They're suing Isabella. You're supposed to be a PR queen, but I haven't seen any action from you lately." Mason's calm voice came through the phone.

Juniper chuckled. "Absolutely, I've never been more sure in my entire career."

Isabella, touched by his concern, was about to speak when Michael covered her mouth, and Juniper signaled for silence.

Juniper shook her head with a smile. "John is a very proud person. I've been dragging my feet for days, he's probably questioning my competence. Even though I say I'm confident, he might think I'm bluffing. But if you say it, he's more likely to believe you really have evidence."

Isabella blinked, feeling something was off with Juniper's explanation but couldn't find a reason to argue.

Juniper nodded. "I understand. I'll call him now."

Juniper smiled and dialed Mason's number, explaining her concerns. After confirming that John was not with Mason, she hung up the phone, satisfied.

Meanwhile, in the villa, Mason's eyes darkened. Juniper's call had revealed an important piece of information: Bianca was behind Jasper and Mia's actions against Isabella! He had no idea about this and still thought Bianca was in prison.

###chapter 176 Court Hearing Time

Mason was about to call John to ask about Bianca, but Charles, who had been standing nearby, suddenly stopped him.

Everyone was waiting for the court hearing in three days. To be precise, it wasn't a full-blown trial, more like a court-supervised mediation.

Regardless of the format, the dispute between Isabella and her parents had become a hot topic, drawing a lot of attention.

Recently, Isabella, who was involved in a plagiarism scandal, has once again become the center of public attention. News about the four major families always dominated the city's trending topics. Although Isabella's family had fallen from their ranks, her former glory wasn't easily forgotten. Everyone was curious to see what kind of drama this once-glorious family would present.

The couple stepped out, wearing faint smiles and formal attire, as if attending a banquet rather than a court session.

Suddenly, someone noticed Juniper standing next to Isabella. At first, the reporters only found her familiar, but soon recognized her identity.

"Isabella, is this Ms. Fox beside you? The renowned PR queen?" a reporter asked excitedly.

Juniper, known as the PR queen, also had high news value. Everyone figured Isabella was outmatched against her parents, but with Juniper on the case, nobody knew what would happen.

Reporters simultaneously thought of two possible stories: Isabella's amazing comeback, or her spectacular crash and burn.

At this point, the reporters were no longer concerned with the process of the court session; they only cared about the result. If Isabella won, it would be another victory for Juniper. If they lost, it would still be big news.

"Alright, everyone, no more questions. We will update you through a live broadcast. Please keep following the trial," Juniper said with a smile, waving her hand. The bodyguards immediately cleared a path through the reporters.

Jasper and Mia, standing outside the courthouse, also noticed Juniper.

"Jasper, who is that woman?" Mia asked, puzzled.

Jasper frowned, finding Juniper familiar but couldn't place her. It wasn't until the reporters mentioned the title "PR queen" that he remembered.

"She's Juniper, the famous PR queen who has helped many celebrities and tycoons with their public image! Damn it, how did Isabella get her involved?" Jasper frowned, feeling a sudden sense of unease.

Mia, unfamiliar with Juniper and her reputation, scoffed. "It doesn't matter who she is. We're going to win this trial!"

Jasper thought for a moment, then smiled and nodded. Public opinion and the masses were on their side. What difference could Juniper make? Isabella would definitely be the one to lose.

###chapter 177 Three Major Families

Isabella and Juniper trudged up the courthouse steps, spotting Jasper and Mia, but neither group said a word.

Jasper just snorted and led Mia inside.

Isabella, looking pretty down, followed Juniper with a sad look on her face.

As the courtroom doors swung open, the staff showed everyone to their seats. Once they were all settled, the audience started to file in.

The reporters had their cameras all set up, ready to stream the trial live.

When the first audience member walked in, the reporters gasped.

"Oh my God, that's Mason Williams!" one of them blurted out.

Mason, leaning on a cane and helped by John and Charles, slowly made his way in. Even though he was old, his calm gaze made everyone a bit uneasy.

The old lion might have aged, but his presence still sent shivers down spines.

Jasper and Mia, already seated, jumped up in surprise when they saw Mason.

"I thought Mr. Williams didn't like Isabella. What's he doing here?" Mia asked, worried, looking at Jasper.

Jasper was nervous too but tried to play it cool. "Maybe John brought him along to show how awful Isabella really is," he said.

Mia nodded, looking convinced.

Truth be told, John had no clue why Mason wanted to be part of this insignificant broadcast.

After helping Mason to his seat, John whispered, "Grandpa, you should be resting at home. Why are you watching this? It's Isabella's family drama, not ours. And you being here could influence the judge."

Mason shot John a cold look. "Who do you think you are to tell me that?"

The authority in Mason's eyes made John's heart skip a beat. He didn't dare say more and quietly sat next to Mason, waiting for the broadcast to start.

###chapter 178 Call Records

Bianca's eyes sparkled with a daring idea, completely unaware that her downfall was just around the corner.
