Just as Isabella was about to sit down, Juliet remembered something.

"Oh, Ms. Taylor, Mr. Larson wants to see you. He asked me to tell you to go to his office when you arrive," Juliet said.

"Mr. Larson wants to see me? I wonder what it's about," Isabella said, puzzled. If it were an urgent work matter, Dwayne would have called her directly. Since he asked Juliet to relay the message, it probably wasn't serious.

"Got it. I'll go see him," Isabella said with a smile, heading to Dwayne's office.

Dwayne was reading a document in his office. When he heard a knock, he told the person to come in and saw it was Isabella.

"Mr. Larson, you wanted to see me?" Isabella asked with a smile.

Dwayne placed a document in front of Isabella. "First, congratulations on winning the lawsuit. Second, there's a design competition coming up. Do you have any interest in participating?"

Isabella picked up the document and read it. It was a design competition organized by several of the world's top cosmetics companies.

The winner would receive high-end cosmetics from each participating company.

The real purpose of the competition was to showcase new products to the public, much like an auto show.

Although everyone knew what it was about, designers were more focused on the rankings. Winning would bring significant recognition in the industry.

After reading the document, Isabella smiled and placed it back on the table. "Sorry, Mr. Larson, but I don't plan to participate in this design competition."

###chapter 190 Who Sent Her Flowers?

Dwayne looked at Isabella with confusion, not understanding why she would give up on the competition.

Isabella's next words shocked him even more.

"Mr. Larson, I've decided to resign. I was planning to tell you later, but I think it's best to let you know now," Isabella said with a smile.

Dwayne stood up from his chair in shock. "What did you say? You're resigning? Why?"

Isabella was puzzled; she didn't understand why her resignation would surprise him so much.

Dwayne reacted so strongly because Isabella was their boss Michael's favorite, and he feared being blamed for her resignation.

"Isabella, may I ask why you're resigning? Did Madeline upset you? If she's not cooperating with your work, we can transfer her to another department or even fire her," Dwayne said seriously.

Isabella was shocked by his words.

Madeline's talent was highly sought after in the design industry, but Dwayne was actually willing to fire Madeline for her!

Isabella was confused. Did she really have that much influence?

Although she had had conflicts with Madeline, she had always maintained a delicate balance and never thought of firing her.

Isabella put up with Madeline to repay her boss, who'd helped her out several times.

Isabella wanted Madeline to stay in the company. She didn't want to lose her to a competitor.

Though Isabella didn't understand why Dwayne would do this, she decided to give a reason for her resignation.

"Mr. Larson, this has nothing to do with Madeline. I'm resigning because I plan to start my own business," Isabella said with a smile.

"Are you considering starting your own studio? Well, you could maintain an affiliation with the company and utilize our resources." Dwayne suggested. 

However, Isabella shook her head. "No, Mr. Larson, I'm not opening a studio. I'm going back to take over the three remaining companies of my family."

Dwayne was even more surprised. He knew Isabella's background, but he remembered that those three companies were nearly bankrupt. Were they worth saving?

"I understand you want to revive your family, but have you considered how difficult it is?" Dwayne earnestly advised Isabella, hoping she would reconsider.

But Isabella shook her head firmly. "I've thought it through, Mr. Larson. Also, I'd like to take the afternoon off to visit my parents in the detention center."

Dwayne looked at Isabella's determined expression and sighed helplessly, sitting back in his chair.

"You're incredibly talented; I'll really miss you. But since you've made up your mind, I can't force you. I wish you all the best in the future," Dwayne said with a bitter smile.

Isabella smiled. "Mr. Larson, I'll still be here for a while to handle the handover. Why do you sound like I'm leaving right now?"

They shared a lighthearted moment, chatting briefly before Isabella left the office.

When Dwayne was alone in his office, he scratched his head in frustration.

"Damn it, how am I going to explain this to Mr. Williams?" Dwayne took out his phone but hesitated for a long time, unable to dial Michael's number.

He lit a cigarette, and as the smoke swirled around him, he finally gathered the courage to call Michael after finishing it.

The phone rang twice before it was answered.

Dwayne took a deep breath and said, "Mr. Williams, Isabella is resigning to take over her family's businesses. I've tried to change her mind, but she's determined to revive the family companies. What should we do?"

Dwayne explained the situation in detail, hoping Michael wouldn't blame him for it.

To Dwayne's surprise, Michael's reaction was very calm.

"I'm aware. Isabella's leaving, whether we agree or not. When she submits her resignation, hold onto it and don't forward it to HR. Let's leave the door open for her to come back if things don't work out," Michael said before hanging up.

Dwayne stared at the ended call screen, stunned for a long time.

"How ridiculous? I've never heard of an employee being able to come back after resigning," Dwayne muttered, then began to wonder why Michael was so good to Isabella.

'Strange. Isabella's broken things off with his nephew, yet he's still so kind. Is it really family care? And they're the same age... ' Dwayne's thoughts trailed off as a terrifying possibility crossed his mind.

'Could Isabella's mysterious husband actually be Mr. Williams?' Dwayne felt his heart pounding. He knew it was just a wild guess with no evidence, so he buried the thought deep in his mind, vowing never to tell anyone. Otherwise, if Michael found out, he wouldn't go easy on him either way. 

Meanwhile, Isabella, after leaving Dwayne's office, intended to return to her own office.

As she passed through the office area, a security guard came over holding a bouquet of flowers.

"Isabella, a man outside asked me to give you these flowers," the guard said, handing the bouquet to Isabella.

Her colleagues looked curiously at the flowers, wondering who sent them.

Isabella's expression turned cold. "Did John send these? If so, return them to him."

But the guard shook his head. "No. The sender said his name is Joseph."

###chapter 191 A Bug That Flew into My Eye

Isabella was visibly taken aback when she heard that the flowers were from Joseph. Her colleagues also felt the name sounded familiar but couldn't quite place it.

"Joseph? Why is he sending me flowers?" Isabella frowned.

The security guard shrugged and pointed downstairs. "I don't know. Maybe you can ask him in person, he's still downstairs."

"I'll go see him now." Holding the flowers, Isabella headed downstairs. As soon as she stepped outside, she saw Joseph.

Joseph was leaning against a white sports car, dressed in a teal casual outfit, with a fresh smile on his face, looking radiant.

"You said you'd call after court, but it's been days and I haven't heard from you. So, I decided to come find you," Joseph said with a smile as soon as he saw Isabella.

Isabella had planned to ask Joseph about the flowers, but his words left her momentarily speechless.

"I'm really sorry, I've been so busy that I forgot about it. Thank you for your help last time," Isabella said with a smile.

Joseph waved his hand dismissively. "Never mind, I was just joking. Consider the flowers a congrats on your win. How about dinner tonight?"

Isabella thought for a moment and then shook her head. "I'm sorry, Mr. Davis, my husband has already prepared dinner for tonight. I'll have to take a rain check on your invitation."

Joseph raised an eyebrow in surprise. Few people ever turned him down, which piqued his curiosity about Isabella's husband.

"Could you tell me your husband's name? I'm curious about who could be more charming than me," Joseph asked with a smile.

Isabella shook her head without hesitation. "Sorry, I don't want to disclose his information for now. I'm afraid the media will disrupt his life."

Isabella was very aware of the nature of the four top families. If she revealed anything about Michael to Joseph today, he might leak it, and soon all the four families would know.

Joseph looked a bit disappointed. "Oh, come on, you really can't have dinner with me? We haven't seen each other in nearly 20 years."

Isabella shook her head again. "Forget dinner. My parents have turned themselves in, and that's just the beginning. I'll be way too busy."

"Alright, looks like there's no chance then. Your husband really keeps a tight rein on you," Joseph said with a hint of regret in his voice.

Isabella laughed and shook her head. "He trusts me completely. It's just inappropriate to get close to other men while I'm married. I don't want any misunderstanding."

"Wow, you're really loyal to your love," Joseph sighed.

Isabella thought for a moment, then joked, "I'm probably being followed by the press already. Having dinner with me would put you right in the middle of it. You wouldn't want that kind of attention, would you?"

Joseph laughed as if he had heard a joke. "Do you think people like us are afraid of the press? Those gossip hounds are insane, always wanting to make up stories about me. They'll spread rumors no matter what. If I get close to any girl, they'll gossip. If I don't, they'll say I'm gay."

Isabella was amused by his words, laughing so hard she almost doubled over. "You're hilarious! But seriously, I don't want any drama with you. It always happens-I get close to a guy, and some woman starts targeting me. So annoying!"

Joseph found Isabella's words intriguing.

"So, your husband's got a jealous ex or something? Seems like you have rivals wherever you go," Joseph joked.

Isabella thought about Scarlett-that troublemaker from Aurora Continent. She wondered if Scarlett was still ticked off and if she'd heard about what Isabella's been up to.

Isabella shook her head, pushing thoughts of Scarlett aside. Scarlett was no longer a threat; there was no need to worry about her.

Seeing Isabella shake her head, Joseph assumed she didn't want to talk about it and didn't press further.

"Since there's no chance for dinner, I guess I'll head back..." Joseph was about to leave when he suddenly noticed a small black speck flying towards his eye and then into it.

"Damn, my eye itches," Joseph said, grimacing as he covered his eye.

"What's wrong? Do you need to go to the hospital?" Isabella asked, grabbing his arm with concern.

Joseph shook his head. "No need, probably just a bug that flew into my eye. I can rub it out."

Joseph scrubbed at his eye, tears welling up, but that darn bug wouldn't come out. It was driving him crazy.

"Hold still. let me check your eye for the bug and blow it out," Isabella said, holding Joseph's head and gently pulling his eyelid to look for the bug.

Soon, she found the bug. It had died from Joseph's rubbing and was stuck to his lower eyelid.

"Don't move. I found the bug. I'll blow it out now," Isabella said before starting to blow gently.

Joseph stayed still, feeling the warmth of her fingers and the breeze from her breath.

Unbeknownst to them, a group of people were secretly taking photos of them with their phones.

From the angle behind Isabella, her head completely blocked Joseph's face, making it look like they were kissing.

###chapter 192 Colleagues' Gossip

Behind Isabella, a group of colleagues excitedly held up their phones, capturing the moment. Everyone's face was lit with excitement.

"I finally remember, he's Joseph Davis!"

"They look so close! Who was the idiot that said Ms. Taylor's husband was a driver? She is so beautiful and talented; how could her husband be just an ordinary driver?"

"The idiot you're talking about is probably John! He said Ms. Taylor's husband was a driver last time he was here."

"Alright, forget what I just said. But now it looks like Ms. Taylor's husband is Joseph!"

"Both of them are from wealthy families! Oh my God, I'm so jealous of Ms. Taylor. Two rich guys? Ugh, I wish that were me! Who would I pick?"

The colleagues hid behind doors and windows, chatting non-stop. Among them were Madeline and Odette.

Madeline coldly glanced at the girl daydreaming. This girl was actually fantasizing about being pursued by both John and Joseph. How ridiculous! What was she thinking? Had she ever taken a good look at herself in the mirror?

'Madeline watched Isabella's retreating back, her eyes blazing with resentment. "It's all luck," she seethed. "Born into privilege. You have no talent to justify your superiority. These marriages are all about alliances, not love!' Madeline thought, staring at Isabella's back, her eyes burning with jealousy.

Odette's eyes also burned with jealousy. "That two-faced bitch already has Joseph. What's she still hanging on to John for?"

"Are you sure it's Ms. Taylor who's been chasing after John? Isn't it the other way around?" Juliet shot Odette a disgusted look.

"You bitch, what gives you the right to talk to me?" Odette, furious, raised her hand to teach Juliet a lesson.

However, just as Odette raised her hand, Madeline grabbed it.

"The last person who fought in the company was transferred to Evernia. Do you want to go there too?" Madeline glared at Odette angrily.

Odette remembered the tragic fate of Madeline's previous assistant and fearfully retracted her hand.

After scolding Odette, Madeline turned to Juliet.

"Looks like Isabella hasn't taught you any manners. If you've got nothing better to do, I'll find something to keep you busy," Madeline said coldly.

Juliet swallowed nervously, looking at Madeline, but soon she raised her head and bravely met Madeline's gaze.

"I'm sorry, Ms. Eve, but Ms. Taylor told me to only follow her orders and no one else's. So, you have no authority over me," Juliet said courageously.

"You bitch, how dare you disrespect Ms. Eve? Have you forgotten your place?" Odette pointed at Juliet angrily.

Juliet glared at Odette. "Have you forgotten your place? We're both assistants. You're the assistant to the deputy director, and I'm the assistant to the director. I think my position should be higher than yours. What gives you the right to talk to me like that?"

"I can't stand this anymore. Just you wait. I'm gonna teach you a lesson after work," Odette said menacingly.

"What's going on? Are you threatening her?" Isabella's voice rang out behind them.

Juliet, seeing Isabella, excitedly called out, "Ms. Taylor, you're back. These two were badmouthing you behind your back."

Odette didn't expect Isabella to return so quickly, and Joseph was already gone.

Odette jumped out and questioned, "Isabella, since you already have Joseph, why are you hanging on to John?"

Isabella coldly glanced at Odette. "If you can't see straight, I know a good eye doctor. When have I ever shown any interest in John? Isn't he the one always bugging me? I've told him a million times I'm married and to leave me alone. But he won't take a hint. Maybe I should get a dog leash and tie him up."

Odette's face turned red with anger after being scolded by Isabella.

"Ms. Taylor, don't be too smug. We know exactly how you beat Ms. Eve last time!" Odette said with a mocking smile, her eyes filled with disdain.

Isabella was a bit taken aback. Could it be that Odette already knew Kevin was always following his wife's opinions?

But who cares if Madeline and Odette knew? Isabella earned Kevin and Gabrielle's praise with her own skills. She won fair and square. So why was Odette strutting around with that smug look on her face?

Before Odette could even finish hinting at something inappropriate between Isabella and Kevin, Madeline gave her a sharp kick under the table and shot her a furious look.

There was no evidence of any improper dealings between Isabella and Kevin. If they spoke out now, Isabella might sue them for defamation. Madeline had already lost one assistant; she didn't want Odette, her new assistant, to be transferred to Evernia or fired. That would be a huge humiliation for her!

"Isabella, you should manage your assistant better. She's a bit rude," Madeline said coldly, glancing at Juliet.

To steer Isabella away from Odette's suggestive comment, Madeline swiftly changed the subject to Juliet.

Juliet was angry. Why was Madeline always targeting her, a mere assistant?

Juliet looked at Isabella, hoping she would stand up for her. Isabella's words, however, left Juliet stunned.

"Juliet, let me ask you something. If a dog bites you, would you bite it back?" Isabella asked with a smile.

Juliet shook her head in confusion. "Of course not. I'm not a dog. How could I bite a dog?"

Isabella's smile widened. "Exactly. So next time, if a dog bites you, remember to defend yourself with something like a stick."

###chapter 193 Misunderstanding

Isabella's words stunned everyone for a moment, but soon they realized she was targeting Madeline and Odette.

Juliet just pondered for a moment and understood what Isabella meant.

"I got it, Ms. Taylor. I won't bite the dog in the future." Juliet glanced at Odette when she mentioned the word 'dog'.

Odette's face flushed with anger. She turned to Isabella, her voice rising, "Are you calling me a dog? How dare you say that? I'm reporting this to Mr. Larson!"

Isabella sighed, somewhat annoyed. "Keep your voice down, Odette. Why are you shouting so loud? You're practically spraying me with spittle! Did I actually call you a dog? I was just telling my assistant about a stray dog I saw on the way back to the office.  What's that to you? Of course, if you want to think of yourself as a cute little puppy, I have no objection. It's your choice after all."

Isabella's sarcastic words stabbed into Odette's heart like a knife and kept twisting back and forth.

"Enough. Odette, let's go." Madeline quickly pulled Odette away, afraid that if they stayed longer, Odette would attack Isabella, and then Isabella would find a reason to fire Odette.

After Madeline and Odette left, Juliet approached Isabella, smiling, "Ms. Taylor, you are really amazing. I've never felt so good! It was so satisfying watching you get rid of them."

However, Isabella shook her head very seriously. "Let me make it clear, I never meant to insult my colleagues. I was just chatting with them, but obviously my words may have made them uncomfortable. That's their problem, not mine."

Juliet nodded repeatedly. "Yes, it has nothing to do with you."

After Juliet finished speaking, she leaned in conspiratorially and whispered, "Ms. Taylor, is Mr. Davis really your husband?" Curiosity shone in her eyes.

Isabella frowned slightly and denied directly, "Joseph is my childhood friend, not my husband. You've all got the wrong idea. There's nothing going on between us."

"Then why did you kiss him?" Juliet looked at Isabella with confusion.

Isabella hesitated for a moment, frowning at Juliet. "Kiss him? When did that even happen? We just talked briefly by the door, and now the whole company's buzzing with this gossip? It's spreading like wildfire!"

"It's not a rumor; we saw it with our own eyes." Juliet shook her head, then showed Isabella the photos they had just taken.

Seeing the photo, Isabella felt a wave of helplessness wash over her. Taken from behind, it did look like she was kissing Joseph, but it was all a trick of the angle-a completely misleading perspective.

"You've got it all wrong," Isabella explained. "He had something in his eye, and I was just helping him get it out. The photo's just a bad angle," she added, suddenly realizing how many similar pictures might exist. She didn't care about them being online, but she wondered what Michael would think.

"Damn it, looks like I have to trouble Mr. Larson." Isabella sighed, patted her forehead, and headed to Dwayne's office.

Dwayne felt a bit helpless when he understood Isabella's request.

"So, you want me to send a message in the company chat group for such a small matter, informing all departments?" Dwayne asked, somewhat exasperated.

"Mr. Larson, this is serious," Isabella said, her voice firm. "That photo's all wrong, and it could easily cause problems with Joseph. I just got through a huge media mess, and I really don't want another one. And if my husband saw it, he'd be upset and hurt."

After hearing Isabella's explanation, Dwayne sighed and nodded. "Alright, I'll tell the whole company to stop spreading the rumor."

"Thank you, Mr. Larson," Isabella said with a smile before leaving Dwayne's office.

Dwayne looked at the photo Isabella had given him, rubbed his chin thoughtfully, and figured it was a small thing-no need to bother Michael.

Dwayne then texted the whole company on the internal chat.

Dwayne: [To clarify recent rumors concerning Isabella and Mr. Davis, I want to state that they are not married. A photograph circulating within the company has been misinterpreted. Ms. Isabella was simply helping Mr. Davis with a bug in his eye. Please refrain from further dissemination of this image or any related speculation.]

Dwayne's announcement reached everyone in the company, effectively shutting down the rumor mill.

Meanwhile, Madeline and Odette also received the message.

"She thinks we'll just drop it because she says so? Who does she think she is? I don't care what she says, I'm posting this!" Odette, fuming and irrational, was about to post the photo on social media when Madeline slapped her hand away.

"Enough! Do you have to lose this job to be happy?" Madeline scolded Odette sternly.

"That bitch cursed me, but I have no proof! I am so mad! I need to vent!" Odette looked at Madeline, her eyes were a bit red.

Madeline sighed as she looked at the aggrieved Odette. "My point is, you don't need to do this. The press is all over Isabella; they've probably already got pictures. Let them be the ones to release it-it'll have the same effect. And for heaven's sake, remember what we're really trying to accomplish!"

###chapter 194 Angry Michael

Odette started to chill out after hearing what Madeline had to say. They had another plan to take down Isabella, and if it worked, she'd be kicked out of her director spot in no time.

Odette took a deep breath, trying to calm herself. "Sorry, Ms. Eve. I got a little carried away."

Madeline nodded, her eyes serious. "Isabella's no pushover. We need to tread carefully with her."

Meanwhile, Isabella felt a wave of relief after reading Dwayne's message. With the rumors dying down at work, the whole mess could be contained.

But she couldn't help but glance out the window, wondering if any reporters were lurking around. If they snapped similar photos, would they post them online?

The answer was a big fat yes!

Despite Dwayne's attempts to suppress the office rumors, some reporters still managed to get shots of her helping Joseph with the bug.

Ethical concerns held little sway with these entertainment reporters; they prioritized sensationalism, selecting the most provocative image and crafting a lurid story to attract readers.

Soon enough, a headline blared online: #Mystery Solved! Isabella's Husband Unveiled!

Meanwhile, after leaving Isabella's company, Joseph was on his way to meet some friends when he saw the news alert on his phone and froze.

"When did I become Isabella's husband?" Joseph blinked, then a grin spread across his face.

"I'm not her husband now, but who knows what the future holds?" Joseph chuckled and made sure the news spread even more, so Isabella's real husband would see it.

Even though people talked a lot online about Isabella's husband, articles about it usually didn't grab much attention.

But thanks to Joseph, that photo of Isabella and Joseph "kissing" went viral, and it left everyone speechless.

Before, news about Isabella and her mysterious husband was just rumors and personal pics of Isabella. This was the first time a photo of her kissing another guy popped up, making many think it was legit.

But not Michael.

When Michael saw the news, his hands shook with anger. He almost smashed his phone, but Jerry stopped him just in time.

"Mr. Williams, there must be some mistake! You have to trust Mrs. Williams; she wouldn't do something like this!" Jerry said, grabbing Michael's hand.

Michael shot Jerry a cold look. "Of course, I trust her. I'm pissed because there's definitely some plot behind this! That guy's using her to get to me!"

Michael jumped up from the couch. He just noticed the news article had racked up over a hundred million clicks in no time. That kind of attention was insane! Michael didn't believe for a second this wasn't planned.

Michael knew someone was trying to trick him into revealing who he was, but if they thought that would work, they were dead wrong.

"Mr. Williams, this photo might've been doctored. AI editing is pretty advanced these days. Should we dig into Joseph's background?" Jerry asked cautiously.

Michael nodded. "Yeah, go ahead. All I know is he's from the Davis Family. Dwayne mentioned Joseph visited Isabella today. It's definitely fishy."

Jerry nodded and left to start investigating Joseph.

After Jerry left, Michael grabbed his phone and called Isabella.

"Hey, have you seen the news? Please tell me it's not true." Michael's voice was icy.

Isabella had just wrapped up her work and was stretching in her office. Hearing Michael's words, she couldn't help but picture a guy who seemed cold but was actually nervous and a bit resentful inside.

Isabella chuckled at her own thoughts and laughed into the phone. "Are you talking about the kissing photo?"

She had just caught the news alert and was pretty ticked off, not seeing this blow-up coming.

"So, you've seen it too. Tell me that photo's fake! You didn't kiss him, right?" Michael asked again, sounding urgent.

Isabella covered her mouth, laughing. "I'll answer your questions one by one. First, the photo's not fake; it's real."

On the other end, Michael's eyes widened, and his hand holding the phone shook.

But luckily, Isabella quickly answered the second question. "But I didn't kiss Joseph. He had a bug in his eye and looked like he was in pain, so I blew it away. I had no idea someone would snap that moment from an angle that made it look like a kiss."

After explaining, Isabella could practically feel Michael relax on the other end.

"I knew you wouldn't do what the news said, but I'm still upset you helped him," Michael said, sounding a bit sulky.

Isabella rolled her eyes. "I just blew into his eye. He helped me before, and we were childhood friends. Ignoring him would've made me seem really cold."

"I don't care; you have to blow into my eye too," Michael said with a playful tone.

Isabella laughed, covering her forehead. "There's no bug in your eye. What am I supposed to blow? How about... I blow somewhere else instead?"

###chapter 195 Going to the Detention Center

Michael's breath hitched when he heard Isabella's words, and his mind went straight to the gutter. He could feel the blood rushing south, making things... complicated.

Taking a deep breath, Michael tried to get a grip on himself.

'Damn it! The doc said I can only get busy once a week. It's only day two! Gotta hold it together!' he kept reminding himself.

Isabella didn't hear Michael's response, but she seemed to know exactly what was going on in his head. She teased, "Are you imagining it? How about we give it a go when you get home tonight?"

"Let's hold off a bit, babe. You know those meds I got are pricey. I need to finish them all before... No, wait, I don't need to finish them all. Next week, okay? Just one more week, please!" Michael said, covering his face in embarrassment.

Isabella's laughter rang through the phone.

"Alright, darling, I can wait! It's for your health! I have some stuff to do, so I'll hang up now," Isabella said and ended the call.

Michael looked at his phone and let out a deep sigh.

He suddenly felt someone watching him. Turning around, he saw Jerry.

Jerry looked awkward and gave a nervous smile. "Mr. Williams, I'm here to remind you about the meeting."

Michael's expression turned icy, and he became all business. "What did you hear just now?"

Jerry shook his head frantically. "Mr. Williams, I didn't hear anything. I came in right after you finished the call."

Jerry explained anxiously, not wanting to get into trouble. Michael stared him down, saying nothing. It wasn't until Jerry felt sweat trickling down his back, soaking through his shirt, that Michael finally looked away.

"It's fine if you heard. Just keep it to yourself," Michael said with a smile.

Jerry wasn't buying it and kept shaking his head. "Mr. Williams, I really didn't hear anything. The meeting's about to start, and everyone's waiting for you."

Michael patted Jerry's shoulder, satisfied. "Got it. Let's go."

Jerry followed Michael respectfully, but his mind was elsewhere.

'Seems Mr. Williams is having trouble in the bedroom. That's gotta hurt his pride. Should I find some meds for him?' Jerry wondered.

Meanwhile, after wrapping up her work, Isabella left the office. She had taken a half-day off from Dwayne to visit Jasper.

Leo was already waiting downstairs. Once Isabella got in the car, he started driving toward the detention center.

Leo glanced in the rearview mirror and quickly realized they had a tail. He wasn't sure if it was reporters or someone from the four families.

Isabella noticed Leo's frequent mirror checks and asked, "What's up, Leo? Something off?"

Leo nodded. "Yeah, Ms. Taylor. We're being followed, probably by reporters. Buckle up. I'm gonna try to lose them."

Isabella quickly fastened her seatbelt and grabbed the handle. Leo floored it, and the car took off.

Isabella peeked through the rear windshield and saw the cars behind them speeding up too. But Leo knew the roads like the back of his hand and managed to shake them off pretty quickly.

"Leo, what did you do before this?" Isabella asked, curious.

Leo had his answer ready. "I used to be a bodyguard for a rich guy. Took a bullet for him once and got pretty messed up. My family thought it was too dangerous, so I switched to driving. Didn't think my old skills would come in handy again."

"Thanks, Leo," Isabella said sincerely, grateful for his help in losing their tail.

Isabella made a mental note to ask Dwayne about giving Leo a raise. She'd been followed lately, which meant a lot more work for Leo.

Soon, Leo pulled up at the detention center. Isabella had arranged a private meeting with Jasper.

Inside, she found Jasper in a uniform and handcuffs, sitting at a table.

She sat down across from him.

Jasper sneered, "Happy now? Must be a thrill seeing me in here."

Isabella didn't react to his taunts. "You know who really crossed the line between us."

Jasper sneered again, leaning back and tilting his head. "So, you came here just to gloat?"

He spread his hands. "If so, congrats. It's safe here, but the food sucks, and the uniforms are awful. I miss my wine collection. Guess I'll have to wait a few days to enjoy it again."

Isabella, unfazed by Jasper's attitude, pulled a document from her bag and slid it over to him.

"This is why I came today. I hope you'll agree to this, Dad," Isabella said calmly.

Jasper picked up the document, curious.

After reading it, he smiled coldly. "You put me in this hellhole, and now you want me to hand over all the company shares? You're dreaming."

###chapter 196 Negotiation with Jasper

Isabella shot Jasper a calm look. "You know, those three companies are bleeding money under your watch, and you keep throwing cash at them. Why not let me take over?"

Jasper was floored. Sure, the companies were tanking, but why should he hand them over to Isabella? His anger flared, and he felt the urge to put her down.

"Even if these companies are in the red, I'm not giving them to you. It'd look like I'm handing over the family's power to you, a woman. What makes you think you're up to the task?" Jasper wanted to cross his arms defiantly, but with his hands cuffed, he settled for crossing his legs and lifting his chin.

Mason patted her hand. "What else? It's about Bianca."

"Bianca? I thought she was avoiding John. Did she show up?" Isabella asked, surprised.

Mason nodded. "Yeah, and John forgave her again. I should've seen it coming. Ever since I tried to keep them apart, things have been tense between John and me. Now, it's completely broken."

Mason slapped his thigh in frustration, and Isabella held his hand tighter.

"Mason, don't worry. Just tell me what John said," she urged.

Thinking about John's visit, Mason started coughing violently. Isabella patted his back until he calmed down.

"Forget it, Mason. I won't pry. I don't want to upset you again," she said, quickly handing him a glass of water.

Mason looked at her, his eyes distant, and sighed deeply.

"It's my fault. If I had realized sooner that you and John had no feelings for each other, I wouldn't have kept pushing you," Mason said, then began recounting John's visit.

After breakfast, John had shown up out of the blue. Under Mason's puzzled gaze, John told him he would never marry anyone but Bianca.

Mason, furious, grabbed his cane and struck John's back. Normally, John would dodge, but this time he took it.

"Hit me if you want. But I'm not here to talk. I'm just informing you of my decision because it's made! Bianca knows she was wrong. It was Isabella's parents who forced her. Grandpa, you shouldn't blame her. It's not her fault she was born into that family," John said, looking at Mason with determination.

Mason was so angry he trembled all over. After John left, Mason couldn't catch his breath and fainted.

In the hospital, Mason angrily patted Isabella's hand. "Can you believe what that brat said? He said he wasn't here to talk, just to tell me what to think! What gives him the right to lecture me?"

###chapter 203 The Function of the Ring

Isabella's lips twitched a bit. She never thought John, who was always scared of Mason, would actually stand up to him.

'If I told you what John and Bianca did to me, you'd probably freak out and end up in the ER again,' Isabella thought to herself, deciding to keep quiet for now.

Suddenly, an idea popped into Isabella's head. She glanced around the room, puzzled, and then asked Mason, "Didn't you tell your nephews about this? They could totally put John in his place!"

Mason just smiled and shook his head. "Forget it. John grew up with me, and his dad and uncle are always busy. He might respect them, but he doesn't fear them. If he's willing to go against me, he definitely won't listen to his dad or uncle."

"No, Mason, I'm not talking about educating John. I mean, they should really teach him a lesson. Break his legs or something! Keep him stuck at home so he can't see Bianca!" Isabella said, dead serious.

Mason opened his mouth, then gave a bitter smile. "Now I see you really don't like him."

Isabella flashed a sweet smile. John had already broken one leg in a car accident and the other in a street fight. She really wanted to kick him where it hurts and break his manhood.

Even though Mason was mad, he wouldn't go as far as breaking John's legs himself.

"I haven't told my kids and nephews about me being in the hospital. They're too busy, so let's not drag them into this. Besides, even if they came back, it wouldn't change much. I have my annual check-up around this time anyway, so I'll just think of this hospital stay as a big check-up. Don't worry too much about me. By the way, Charles said you had something to talk to me about. Now's a good time. What is it?" Mason changed the subject.

Isabella then remembered the ring Mason had sent her through Charles. She immediately asked about its origin and purpose.

Mason's face lit up with understanding. He knew Isabella would ask about it.

"That ring was left by your grandparents. It's actually a key, but I have no idea what it opens. When your grandpa gave it to me, he said none of his descendants were fit to manage the family business. He thought the family would fall apart if left to them. So, he gave the ring to me, telling me to pass it on to a Taylor who could restore the family's honor," Mason explained with a smile.

Isabella gave a wry smile. "Sounds like a secret society thing."

Mason nodded with a grin. "You're not too far off. It's like something from those novels you young folks read. This ring's a symbol, a way for your grandfather to control his loyal followers - each of the top four families has them."

Mason's words piqued Isabella's interest, but she quickly shook her head with a bitter smile.

"Forget it, Mason. Loyalty's the last thing you can rely on. My grandfather's been gone for ages. I can't guarantee this ring still holds any sway over those people," Isabella said, not taking it too seriously.

Mason got where she was coming from. He couldn't be sure if those people would still respond to the ring's call either.

"I know you want to inherit everything your grandfather left behind and bring the family's glory back. If you need my help with anything, just let me know. I'll definitely help you!" Mason said.

Seeing Isabella about to speak, Mason waved his hand to stop her. "Don't rush to refuse. Think of it as an investment. You've got more potential than your father."

He'd convinced her. She nodded appreciatively and expressed her thanks with a smile.

After spending some time at the hospital, Isabella headed back to the company since she had only taken a half-day off.

Not long after Isabella left the hospital, Michael showed up.

Mason was surprised to see him. "How did you know I was here?"

Michael smiled as he sat down next to Mason. "Did you forget our family sponsors this hospital? The director called me, saying he couldn't stand seeing you upset and asked me to come and cheer you up."

Mason smiled wryly. "You all treat me as if I were senile. It's true I'm getting on in years, but it's infuriating! Why won't anyone let me decide for myself?"

"Because we all care about you," Michael said with a smile, then his expression turned serious.

"Mason, do you want me to teach John a lesson?" Michael asked.

Mason shook his head. "Forget it. Are you planning on breaking John's legs, too?"

Michael was taken aback. "What are you talking about? Did someone else suggest breaking his legs?"

Mason found it amusing. "Isabella said the same thing when she visited me earlier. I don't know if she was serious or just trying to please me. If you think the same, then you two are on the same page."

Michael smiled. "Seems like Isabella cares about you too. Mason, I've always wondered-you know John loves Bianca, right? So why push him to marry Isabella? It's obvious she's happy with her husband."

Michael wanted to get some answers from Mason, as his father Kenna had only given him part of the story last time.

###chapter 204 Break Your Legs

Mason's eyes flickered for a second when he heard Michael's question. He just waved it off. "No big reason. I just think they make a good pair. Plus, Isabella's grandpa and I had this old agreement that if our kids were a boy and a girl, they'd get hitched. It's a promise I made to him."

But Michael wasn't buying it.

He'd always thought it had something to do with Isabella's grandma, probably some leftover drama from the past.

Mason had explained that he wanted John to marry Isabella because her family had many enemies, and only the Williams family's power could protect them.

Now, Michael could see Mason had his own reasons. But Mason wasn't spilling, and pushing him might make things worse.

"Why do old folks love keeping secrets?" Michael muttered, scratching his head as he left the hospital.

He got into the car parked on the street, and Jerry leaned over from the driver's seat.

"Mr. Michael Williams, what's the plan? Should we go find Mr. John Williams?" Jerry asked.

Michael sat in the back, tapping his knee with his fingers, thinking about whether to give John a piece of his mind.

Finally, he shook his head. "Nah, if Mason's not gonna teach John a lesson..."

Before he could finish, his phone rang. He saw it was Leo calling.

Michael's heart skipped a beat, and he quickly answered.

"What's up? Is Isabella in trouble?" Michael asked, worried.

Leo's hesitant voice came through. "Mr. Williams, I'm not sure if I should tell you this, but Ms. Taylor got a call and then went to find John. The caller seemed to be Joseph."

Michael raised an eyebrow. He doubted Isabella went to John for a friendly chat. She was probably planning to break his legs.

Michael took a deep breath. "Did Isabella bring any weapons?"

Leo hesitated, not because of Michael's calm reaction, but because he was right!

"Yeah, she brought a baseball bat. She said she was gonna break John's legs," Leo said.

Michael sighed. He knew he was right. Mason treated Isabella so well, but John had angered him so badly that he ended up in the hospital. Isabella wouldn't let John get away with it easily.

"Listen, you must protect Isabella and make sure she doesn't get hurt, got it?" Michael said firmly.

Leo's voice came through the phone. "Don't worry, Mr. Williams. I've been following Ms. Taylor closely, staying hidden. If John or anyone else tries to hurt her, I'll step in and handle it!"

With Leo's assurance, Michael felt relieved.

After hanging up, Michael turned to Jerry. "Get me a few bodyguards John knows but Isabella doesn't. We're going to find John."

Jerry nodded and got to work.

Meanwhile, after his argument with Mason, John found Bianca again. This time, they were at a friend's yacht party.

Hearing that John had argued with Mason for her, Bianca wept and begged him to apologize, but John refused to be swayed.

"I'm done listening to my grandfather. No one can tell me who to love. It's my choice!" John said firmly.

Bianca was so moved she almost hugged and kissed him right there, but they were surrounded by people.

Just then, a baseball bat came flying, smashing the bottles on their table.

Glass shards flew everywhere, startling everyone. John quickly pulled Bianca back.

"What the hell? Who did that?" John yelled, looking around, only to see Isabella approaching with a cold expression.

"Isabella? Did you throw that bat? What do you want?" John demanded angrily.

Bianca, scared, clung to John, looking at Isabella. "Isabella, I know you're upset about me and John, but you can't do this! The glass almost cut John's face."

"Save your drama and stop talking to me like that, or I'll smash your face with this bat," Isabella said, picking up the bat and pointing it at Bianca with a look of disgust.

Bianca was terrified by the fierceness in Isabella's eyes and didn't dare to speak again.

"Isabella, have you lost it? Do you even know where you are?" John stood in front of Bianca, glaring at Isabella.

Isabella raised the bat and looked at him with disdain. "You're being a complete idiot, letting her walk all over you, while your grandpa's in the hospital because of your dumb moves. And here you are, partying like nothing's wrong? You're such a jerk. You make me sick."

John frowned, confused. "My grandfather is hospitalized? How come I didn't know?"

John's innocent expression only made Isabella angrier. She raised the bat high and swung it at his head.

John was startled and quickly dodged. The bat smashed into the bottles in front of him, shattering another one.

"You didn't know? Too bad, because you're about to pay the price." Isabella, her eyes red with anger, swung the bat at John repeatedly.

Everyone around was shocked by Isabella's fierceness. They had always thought of her as gentle, but today they saw a different side.

"Isabella, I'm warning you, one more move and I'm not holding back!" John dodged continuously, his anger rising. He knew he had done something wrong so he wasn't fighting back.

"You'd better fight back because I'm looking for an excuse to break your legs!" Isabella said, swinging the bat at John's knees.

###chapter 205 Fierce Isabella

Isabella, though tough, wasn't as strong as a guy. In a rush, John grabbed a chair to block Isabella's swing, then quickly snatched the bat from her.

"You crazy woman, you've really pissed me off," John growled, yanking the bat from Isabella's hands and swinging it at her.

Isabella didn't flinch. She grabbed a bottle from the table and chucked it at John.

Just then, a big guy rushed out from behind Isabella and grabbed John's bat.

But Isabella's bottle smashed right onto John's head, shattering and making blood trickle down his forehead.

Bianca screamed and rushed to hold John.

"John, are you okay? Someone call an ambulance, quick!" Bianca cried, but John just patted her head.

"I'm fine. It's just a small cut. Who are you?" John asked coldly, looking at the guy in front of him.

Isabella was shocked to see Leo suddenly appear. "Leo, what are you doing here?"

Leo smiled at John. "Mr. Williams, let me introduce myself. I'm the driver arranged by Ms. Taylor's company."

John's eyes flickered. Leo's words were a reminder that he was there under Michael's orders to protect Isabella.

"Who are you? Are you with Isabella? I'm calling the cops. Isabella will pay for this," Bianca screamed, pulling out her phone to call the police.

John suddenly grabbed Bianca's phone. "Forget it."

Bianca stared at him in disbelief. "Why? You're hurt!"

John sighed. "Serves me right. I ticked Grandpa off so bad he ended up in the hospital."

After speaking, John looked at Isabella. "Are you satisfied now? You've taught me a lesson."

"It's far from enough. What I really want is to break your legs, not just give you a small cut!" Isabella said fiercely.

"Isabella, you're going too far. John's dropped it, so get over it!" Bianca stood in front of John, glaring at Isabella like an angry mother leopard.

Isabella shrugged, barely looking at Bianca. "Oh yeah, you. What are you still doing here? Jasper and Mia are in jail - you should be too!"

Bianca went white. She'd been busted before for trashing Isabella's place and stealing her stuff. Jail was the last place she wanted to be again.

"Enough, Isabella. I'm not going after you for what happened, so back off Bianca," John said, pulling Bianca behind him. He believed that a mature man shouldn't let his woman stand in front to take the hit.

Isabella sneered and shook her head. "Why does it seem like I'm the villain here?"

She looked at John and Bianca with a mocking smile. "This is your final warning. Mason is like a grandfather to me. I won't let anyone hurt him. Especially you, John. Yeah, he's your grandpa - he'll ground you, maybe even belt you, but he won't kill you. I'm not so forgiving. Don't test me."

With a murderous glare at John, Isabella turned and left the yacht.

Leo followed closely behind her, his burly frame shielding her from any sudden attacks.

John's face was pale. Isabella's words had indeed shaken him.

'Shit, I'm seriously freaked out by that woman,' John cursed himself inwardly.

Bianca clung to John's waist, resting her head on his chest, crying, "Isabella's terrifying! John, maybe we should split up. You should go apologize to your grandpa."

"No, not happening. Nobody's breaking us up. Besides, he's probably still mad at me. It'll only make things worse if I show my face," John shook his head helplessly.

John was right. Just mentioning the fight with Mason - that's all it took - and it sent Mason into a coughing fit because of bad memories.

If John went to the hospital now, he was more likely to receive news of Mason fainting rather than his forgiveness. If Mason fainted in the hospital, the entire city's media would converge there. It wouldn't be long before Owen heard the news and returned from abroad.

John had grown up with Mason, and his father Owen hadn't been around much to raise him. Mason's a frail old man now, but Owen was strong as an ox! John shuddered thinking about Owen coming back and beating him up.

'If my father shows up and Isabella is there, that bitch would definitely hand him a baseball bat,' John thought, shivering.

John took a deep breath, trying to dispel the images from his mind. As Mason had said, even if Owen returned, nothing would change. Besides giving him a beating, it wouldn't change anything.

"Forget it. Come on, Bianca, let's go back to the room and rest," John said, pulling Bianca off the yacht.

After Bianca and John left, Michael, who was on his way, received a call from Leo.

Jerry, behind the wheel, heard Leo's report and smirked. "Wow, Mrs. Williams is a real tiger!"

Michael smiled. "That's my wife! Her style is becoming more and more like mine. I love it."

###chapter 206 Investigating Joseph

Michael was pretty stoked about what Isabella did. He'd been ticked off with John for ages. Even if Isabella hadn't stepped in, he would've. But honestly, Michael thought just smashing a bottle over John's head was too easy; John deserved to have his legs broken, just like Isabella suggested.

Jerry, who was behind the wheel, couldn't help but smirk. 'If the Williamses weren't loaded, they'd be the biggest crooks around,' he thought.

But then, Michael's laughter cut off, and he looked annoyed.

"Wait a sec, what did Leo say? Isabella got the info from Joseph? Why's that guy even calling her?" Michael's voice was low, like a brewing storm.

Jerry rolled his eyes discreetly. "Mr. Williams, you gotta have faith in Mrs. Williams. Even if Joseph's got other ideas, she wouldn't go for it."

"No need to remind me. I trust Isabella," Michael said, rolling his eyes. But then something clicked in his mind.

"Didn't I tell you to dig into Joseph? Got anything yet?" Michael asked, frowning.

Jerry silently grumbled to himself, 'I'm drowning! Dealing with your fake wife, running the company, this mess, plus hiring detectives? Give me a break!'

On the outside, Jerry kept his cool. "I've got some leads and I'm checking them out. We should have news soon."

Just as Jerry finished talking, his phone buzzed with an email.

Jerry glanced at it, looking surprised.

Michael noticed and asked, "What's up? What happened?"

Jerry pointed to his phone, grinning. "This email's probably about Joseph. Just came in. Wanna see it?"

"Of course," Michael said, leaning forward to grab Jerry's phone and open the email.

As he read through it, Michael's brow furrowed.

Jerry watched Michael's face change in the rearview mirror, getting curious. He wanted to know what the email said too.

"Eyes on the road. If you wanna know what's in the email, I'll read it to you," Michael said, glaring at Jerry.

Jerry quickly straightened up and focused on driving.

"The email says Joseph and Isabella met when they were eight. Later, Isabella went abroad to study design. That same year, Joseph also went abroad to study. Coincidentally, they were in the same country, and their universities were super close. But according to their roommates, they never seemed to have met," Michael read from the email.

Jerry was shocked. "So much in common, yet they never met?"

Michael grinned. "Guess it means they weren't meant to meet. Isabella's meant for me and me alone!"

Jerry used to dig Michael's bossy vibe, but now that grin of his gave him the creeps.

Of course, Jerry kept his thoughts to himself. He didn't want Michael dumping more work on him. The pay was good, but no time off? Forget it!

'I really need a vacation,' Jerry thought to himself.

At the hospital, Mason was about to get some rest when Charles walked in, looking a bit amused as he recounted Isabella's yacht incident with John.

Mason was taken aback for a moment, then shook his head with a wry smile. "It would be great if Isabella were really my granddaughter."

Mason wasn't too worried about John. If John could be taken down by Isabella that easily, he wasn't worth keeping around.

"Send someone to warn John to stay away from Isabella," Mason said, waving his hand dismissively.

Charles shook his head. "I don't think we need to warn him. According to people on the yacht, Isabella left with a driver-likely arranged by Mr. Williams."

"Michael?" Mason's eyes flickered. He waved his hand, signaling Charles to leave as he wanted to rest.

Meanwhile, Isabella sat in the car after leaving the yacht, still fuming because she really wanted to break John's legs.

Leo, watching Isabella's angry expression in the rearview mirror, couldn't help but smile wryly.

"Ms. Taylor, I know you're really mad, but your safety comes first. You have a husband and friends who care about you," Leo said gently.

Isabella took a deep breath and exhaled slowly. "You're right, Leo. I was just too angry today. But smashing his head did help a lot."

"As long as it helped," Leo said, his mouth twitching slightly.

Soon, Leo brought Isabella back to the company.

"Thanks, Leo. I really appreciate it," Isabella said before getting out of the car. If Leo hadn't grabbed the bat, she might have ended up in the hospital.

"It's nothing, Ms. Taylor. Don't forget, I was a bodyguard before becoming a driver. Compared to those thugs with knives and guns, dealing with a bat is a piece of cake," Leo said with a smile, waving his hand dismissively.

Isabella suddenly remembered that John had thought her husband was a driver. Maybe someone had seen her getting out of Leo's car and told John-that was how it all went wrong.

"Leo, be careful. I'm worried John might try to get back at you," Isabella said, looking at Leo with concern.

Leo smiled and said, "Don't worry, Ms. Taylor. John isn't an idiot. The boss assigned me to you, so I'm kind of his stand-in. John won't cross me unless he wants to break ties with the boss."

Isabella thought about it and agreed with Leo, so she stopped worrying. After their conversation, Isabella went back to the company to finish her work.

Watching Isabella walk away, Leo sighed. "Isabella's a really nice person, and she's got that same kind of charm as Williams. No wonder he fell for her."

###chapter 207 Isabella's Punishment

When Isabella got back to the office, she ran into the ever-annoying Odette and Madeline again.

Odette stepped in front of Isabella. "Isabella, I need your signature on this document. I couldn't find you all morning and heard you left during work hours. As a leader, how can you ignore company rules?"

Odette sneered, raising her voice to make Isabella look bad.

Isabella shot her a cold look. "Hand me the document."

Odette was caught off guard.

Isabella frowned. "Didn't you say you had a document for me to sign? Bring it over."

Odette was kind of embarrassed. She was just messing with Isabella, didn't think she'd actually want to sign anything. But she had a whole bunch of stuff needing Isabella's signature, so she gave her the latest forms.

Isabella barely glanced at them before slamming the papers on the table in front of Odette. "Is this the design your team came up with? The client's requirements were clear. Did you even look at them? Tell Madeline to come to my office."

"That woman is infuriating. How dare she order me around?" Odette muttered, clenching her fists in anger.

Isabella was having a rotten day, and Odette had the bad luck to rub her the wrong way. Their company did packaging design, and Isabella, as director, was in charge of all the projects.

Before, Isabella would calmly walk employees through their mistakes, explaining client requirements and helping them create designs that worked. But with Odette, she didn't bother with kid gloves.

Isabella didn't care whether Odette and Madeline would come to her office as she told them. If they did, Isabella would give them a good talking-to. If they didn't, it would give Isabella more reason to target them.

Now, it was clear this was a work issue, not a personal one.

Madeline picked up the documents, her expression darkening.

Madeline was skilled in design and could see that the designs were overly complicated, lacking any minimalist style, and looked like a child's scribbles.

Madeline glared at Odette. "Odette, what's going on? How could you make such a basic mistake?"

Odette was embarrassed. Her team had barely looked at the client's product before diving into the design, totally ignoring the extra requirements. She'd never thought Isabella would notice.

"Actually, I thought a minimalist style didn't suit the client's new product, so our team came up with a new theme..." Odette started, but Isabella cut her off.

"Actually, you didn't even bother to look at the client's requirements, did you? Before you came, I asked your team members about the client's needs, and none of them could answer. This level of disregard is unacceptable." Isabella glared coldly at Odette and Madeline.

"Do you think just because the client is a small company, you can ignore them?" Isabella slammed her hand on the desk in anger.

Madeline knew they were at fault this time, so she didn't argue with Isabella.

"This was our oversight. I will take responsibility and personally design what the client needs," Madeline said.

"Of course, it's your responsibility, but what about your team? That kind of attitude? Unacceptable. How can we trust them?"

She then announced, "Ms. Eve, your bonus will be reduced by 20% this month. The rest of the team members will have their bonuses reduced by 10% each."

After Isabella announced the punishment, Madeline and Odette felt a surge of intense anger.

###chapter 208 The Video of the Altercation

Back at Madeline's office, Odette stormed in, slamming a stack of papers on the desk. She stood there, hands on her hips, and yelled, "Isabella, that witch! She deserves to rot in hell! I hope she gets hit by a car the second she steps outside!"

"Ms. Taylor, you were amazing. I just walked past Madeline's office-her team looked utterly crushed," Juliet said with a big smile.

As for who would take over as director after Isabella left, she trusted Dwayne would handle that.

Dwayne nodded and handed her a freshly printed piece of paper from his desk.

"I've got a video here that might interest you," Isabella said, opening a video on her phone and handing it over.

"Funny, I have a video for you too," Dwayne said with a smile, handing over his phone.

They swapped phones and watched each other's videos.

After watching, Isabella was a bit surprised, while Dwayne looked really grim.

"Was it Odette? The USB drive she plugged into your computer must have had a Trojan virus, right?" Dwayne asked, his face stern.

Isabella nodded and took back her phone.

"I thought you'd ask why I secretly installed a camera in the office," Isabella joked with a smile.

Dwayne snorted and waved his hand. "You must have had your reasons. I actually thought about putting cameras in every office area, but I was worried about privacy issues. But now it seems cameras can be pretty handy."

Isabella placed Dwayne's phone back on the desk.

The video Dwayne sent was of Isabella's altercation with John on the yacht.

Isabella was shocked that someone had the guts to film and share it online. That video showed John totally humiliated. Didn't they worry he'd get revenge?

"What do you think about this video?" Dwayne asked.

"Not much. John pissed Mason off so bad he ended up in the hospital. Mason's always been good to me, so it's only fair I taught John a lesson. People won't blame me. Besides, I've heard it all before-I don't care what they think," Isabella smiled with a shrug.

###chapter 209 Dwayne's Cooperation

Dwayne looked at Isabella's confident smile and shook his head with a chuckle. "I'm not talking about the yacht incident; I'm talking about Odette. Whoever filmed that video and put it online has to be from one of the top families-they wouldn't be scared of John. It's obviously a power play. With Mason having your back, you don't need to worry about John coming after you."

Realizing her mistake, Isabella smiled but then quickly turned serious. "The priority now is to get that USB drive from Odette, proving she planted a Trojan virus on my computer. I have a plan to deal with her, but I might need your help."

Dwayne raised an eyebrow. "Can you tell me your plan?"

Isabella's lips curled into a smile. "Of course."

That evening, when Isabella got home from work, Michael had already prepared dinner.

"What did my dear husband make for dinner today?" Isabella eagerly put down her bag and approached the dining table.

"Oh, my favorite, corn truffle soup!" Isabella exclaimed and quickly served herself a bowl, savoring the aroma.

Michael, sitting on the sofa watching a video on his phone, looked up and smiled at Isabella. "You know, washing your hands before eating can lower your chances of getting sick."

Isabella rolled her eyes. "I'm using utensils. As long as your food is clean, I won't get sick."

Despite her words, she put down her utensils and went to wash her hands.

"What's got you so glued?" Isabella asked curiously as she dried her hands and walked over to Michael.

When Isabella saw the video on Michael's phone, her face turned slightly red.

Michael wasn't watching anything inappropriate; it was the video of Isabella hitting John on the yacht.

What embarrassed Isabella was that the video had been edited by netizens, adding special effects to the wine bottle in her hand and the baseball bat in John's hand, making it look like a wizard duel.

"I have different versions, like a Tom and Jerry version and a SpongeBob version. Want to see them?" Michael teased, kissing Isabella on the cheek.

Isabella rolled her eyes, grabbed his phone, and exited the video. "You're so childish!"

Michael laughed, jumped off the sofa, and hugged Isabella around the waist. They walked to the dining table together, ready to eat.

"Honey, that was awesome! The way you smashed that bottle... I'm falling for you even harder!" Michael praised her candidly.

Isabella blushed again. "If you ever cheat on me, what happened to John today will happen to you in the future!"

Michael quickly covered his head, feigning a hurt expression. "Honey, I don't have a head as hard as John's! Besides, would you really want to ruin this face?"

Isabella looked at Michael's handsome face and rolled her eyes, but a smile soon played on her lips. "Honey, you should know I love not just your face but also your soul! But if your soul betrays me, then that face of yours will mean nothing to me. And it won't just be your face that pays the price."

Isabella smiled as she sliced through a sausage on her plate. As the knife cut through, the sausage burst open, releasing a spray of red juices.

Michael instinctively squeezed his legs together, a look of discomfort crossing his face. "Honey, please believe me, I am completely faithful to you."

Isabella nodded, picking up the sliced sausage with her fork and holding it up to Michael's mouth. "Here, love, let me feed you."

Michael opened his mouth and bit into the sausage.

As Isabella was about to take a bite of her own food, her eyes caught a marked date on the wall calendar.

"Why did you circle a date on the calendar? Does it have any special meaning?" Isabella asked curiously, pointing at the calendar.

Michael's lips curled into a mischievous smile. "That date marks the end of this week and the start of a new one."

Isabella's face turned red instantly as she knew what Michael meant. Feeling a bit annoyed, she kicked him lightly under the table.

Michael didn't dodge and gave her a silly grin.

Isabella rolled her eyes and told Michael about the plan she had discussed with Dwayne to deal with Odette.

After hearing the plan, Michael nodded. "So you're planning to use Mr. Hamilton? Do you need me to call him?"

Isabella shook her head. "We exchanged contact information last time. Mrs. Hamilton knows I can paint and has been inviting me to do a portrait for her. This is a perfect opportunity."

Knowing Isabella had her plans, Michael didn't say much more.

After dinner, Isabella also circled a date on the calendar.

"What does your marked date mean?" Michael asked, hugging Isabella around the waist.

Isabella's lips curled into a mischievous smile. "Honey, I just realized something."

"What is it?" Michael suddenly felt a sense of foreboding.

Isabella turned and hugged Michael's neck, smiling. "The date you circled is the first day of my period! The date I circled is when it ends!"

Michael's eyes widened, and he quickly did the math in his head. To his dismay, Isabella was right.

"No, this can't be happening. Oh my God, I have to wait another week!" Michael clenched his fists in frustration.

Isabella took his hand and placed it on her chest. "Alright, dear, I know you're anxious, but you've already waited this long. What's one more week? Besides, there's something else we need to do when my period ends."

Michael took a few deep breaths to calm himself and looked at Isabella curiously. "What else do we have to do? Wait, I remember now-it's the day your parents get out of the detention center!"

###chapter 210 Negotiation between Bianca and Jasper

Michael and Isabella had finalized their plan to snag the Taylor family's company shares.

The plan was set to roll out the day Jasper and Mia got out of the detention center.

But Isabella had no clue someone else was eyeing those shares too.

John drove Bianca to the detention center himself.

"We're here. Let's get out," John said, giving Bianca a gentle pat on the head with a warm smile.

After leaving the yacht, Bianca and John headed back to their room. While Bianca was tending to John's injuries, she brought up Isabella.

"I'm not like Isabella, who gets all the love from your grandpa. I need to do something big to get his attention," Bianca suddenly said to John.

John looked up at her, surprised. "What are you planning to do?"

"I'm going to become the head of the Taylor Family!" Bianca said, dead serious.

"My family may be shattered, but its past glory and some of its bonds remain. If I can take control of the remaining three companies, I can become the head of the family. With your help, I'll beat Jasper, hands down. And after we've grown the business, we'll get married. Your grandpa and dad will be on board by then, right?" Bianca asked, locking eyes with John.

John met her gaze, thinking it over. Finally, he nodded, agreeing with her plan. It did seem like a solid strategy.

"You're right. I don't know what Mason's thinking, but even if he still doesn't like us being together, I can give up the family inheritance. With you and your companies, I've got a great start to build something new. I believe I can make your family even bigger and better than the Williams Family!" John said, a confident smile spreading across his face.

John had every reason to be confident. His business skills were way better than his dad, Owen's. That was why Mason had raised him so closely.

"Thank you, my dear!" Bianca hugged John tightly, burying her face in his chest.

John gently stroked her hair.

If Isabella or Mason had overheard their conversation, they would have been blown away. John was a business whiz, but when it came to women, he was totally clueless!

After finalizing their plan, John and Bianca went to the detention center to get Jasper to hand over the family shares.

As the heir to the Williams Family, John had certain perks. Unlike Isabella, who had to apply to visit Jasper in detention, John could see him anytime with just a phone call.

"Mr. Williams, Jasper is inside. We only allow one visitor normally, but given who you are... you're both good to go. I'll be just outside; let me know if you need anything," the detention center official said respectfully to John.

John gave a quick nod and waved his hand, signaling the official to stand guard outside.

When John and Bianca stepped into the interrogation room, they found Jasper already seated, waiting for them.

"Well, look who it is. My dear niece and her future husband," Jasper sneered, clearly unaware of Mason's recent public statement.

"Mr. Williams, you saw what Isabella showed us, right? So, you still think your little girlfriend's some angel?" Jasper's tone was dripping with sarcasm as he eyed John.

Jasper had already made up his mind. Once he was out of the detention center, he planned to leave the country and live a life of luxury abroad. He had nothing to lose and no reason to hold back.

John's expression stayed cold, while Bianca wore a faint smile.

"Jasper, you should know that in a powerful family, no one can afford to be purely good," Bianca said with a calm smile, cutting straight to the point.

Bianca hadn't forgotten that she had previously blamed everything on Jasper and Mia. She was worried that Jasper might say too much and expose her lies.

"So you want my shares too? Why is everyone after my shares?" Jasper looked at Bianca with some surprise.

Bianca was puzzled. "What do you mean, Jasper? Has someone else asked you for the shares?"

Jasper crossed his arms and sneered. "Isabella came to me a few days ago, also wanting the shares! She gave me some unrealistic promise, saying she could lead the family to greatness with her talent. So, are you going to make the same promise?"

Jasper then shifted his gaze from Bianca to John. "Well, with Mr. Williams on your side, the sky's the limit, huh?"

Bianca met Jasper's stare, her voice steady. "Now you should believe that I can bring the family business back. I think we both know I'm the better choice here. So, will you transfer your shares to me?"

Jasper crossed his arms, his eyes darting around. "I originally thought those three nearly bankrupt companies weren't worth much, but since you all want them so badly, why not buy them? That's what Isabella suggested too."

John's face twisted into a contemptuous smile. "How much did she offer? Whatever her price, I can pay ten times that amount."

Jasper's face lit up with joy, but his smile quickly froze.

He suddenly remembered that Isabella had uncovered his embezzlement. If John and Bianca announced they had inherited the family companies, Isabella might hand over the evidence to the court in a fit of anger. The court would then seize his assets and throw him back in prison.

'Damn it! I can't sell my shares now. I need to wait until I'm out and in a safe place before I deal with John!' Jasper thought, gritting his teeth.

###chapter 211 Implementation of the Plan

John noticed Jasper's silence and the sour look on his face, which really ticked him off.

"Jasper, you should know your company's pretty much worthless now. Getting some cash to live the good life is your best bet," John said, glaring at Jasper.

Jasper sighed internally. He knew John was right, but now just wasn't the time.

"Give me a few days to think it over, at least until I'm out of this detention center," Jasper finally said.

John got even more irritated, but Bianca tugged at his sleeve and shook her head.

John snorted and stormed out of the detention center with Bianca.

With the detention center official respectfully seeing them off, John and Bianca hopped into the car.

"Didn't think Isabella would want the family shares too. Looks like I've got some competition," Bianca said, glancing at John with a smirk.

Bianca's smile widened. "Isabella's already cut ties with her parents, so her claim's gone. I'm way luckier to have you on my side!"

Bianca's hand rested gently on John's thigh. The simple touch sparked a sudden, intense feeling within him.

"How are you feeling? Any pain left?" John leaned in closer, his hand finding its place on her thigh.

Bianca blushed and whispered, "It barely hurts anymore. I'm almost all better. We can head back to the room... or, if you can't wait, right here."

John's breathing quickened, but he managed to keep his desire in check. "Let's head back to the room. I'd rather not end up on the internet as 'that couple in the car.'"

He flashed a mischievous grin and quickly started the car, driving towards the nearest hotel.

Meanwhile, Isabella had already lined up Kevin and Gabrielle for the portrait painting the next day. She texted Dwayne after she'd made all the arrangements.

Dwayne quickly replied to Isabella.

The next day, as soon as Odette and Madeline arrived at the company, Dwayne called them over.

"Isabella is on leave today, so I have an important task for you," Dwayne said, placing a file in front of Madeline.

"That woman takes leave all the time and still gets to be a director?" Odette muttered under her breath.

"What did you say?" Dwayne frowned at Odette. Her voice had been too low for him to hear clearly.

"I said we will definitely complete this task diligently," Odette replied with a polite, fake smile.

She hadn't forgotten that Madeline's previous assistant had been sent to Evernia for gossiping in the office.

Dwayne leaned back in his chair and said calmly, "If you're feeling swamped, you can pass this task to one of your team members. It's important, but not particularly tough. The main hassle is all the running around. But the reward for finishing it is pretty sweet."

Odette's eyes lit up. She had just lost 10% of her bonus thanks to Isabella yesterday and was stressing about money. A good reward now meant she could finally splurge on those fancy designer accessories and handbags she'd been eyeing.

"Okay, I get it," Madeline nodded. Since she could delegate the task, it wouldn't be too hard for her.

Madeline had just stepped out of Dwayne's office with the file when Odette immediately grabbed her hand.

"Ms. Eve, please, let me handle this task," Odette said eagerly.

Madeline handed the file to Odette without a second thought. "Alright, if you want to do it, go ahead. Just be careful and don't give Isabella any reason to catch you out."

Odette nodded and quickly started flipping through the file.

After Madeline and Odette left, Dwayne picked up his phone and typed a message to Isabella.

Isabella replied quickly.

'Madeline, we've given you so many chances. Why don't you appreciate them?' Dwayne thought, shaking his head in resignation, though his eyes were cold.

Meanwhile, Odette, having received the task details, immediately drove to the assigned locations. The task was to poach talent from other design companies!

Odette had jumped at this mission-not just for the payday, but to help Madeline build a stronger team. If she could bring in top talent under Madeline's leadership, they could take control from Isabella, even if Isabella used her connections to stay.

Odette enthusiastically engaged with each designer. After contracting the third designer, she arrived at a nearby hotel where they were supposed to meet.

"Damn it, where is he? This guy is so unreliable," Odette muttered, glancing at her watch. The designer was already five minutes late.

Just as she was about to make another call to check on his whereabouts, her eyes caught sight of a man and a woman walking into the hotel.

Odette quickly hid behind a nearby potted plant, watching the familiar faces cautiously.

It was Isabella and Kevin, walking and laughing together, looking very close.

Odette's hands trembled with excitement. She'd told Madeline about this before, hoping to use it against Isabella, but Madeline had dismissed it for lack of evidence. Now, with the evidence right in front of her, she wouldn't let this opportunity slip.

Odette immediately took out her phone, silenced it, and began frantically taking photos of Isabella and Kevin.

###chapter 212 Caught Peeping

As Isabella and Kevin waited for the elevator, Isabella couldn't shake the feeling that someone was watching her. She glanced around cautiously.

"What's up, Isabella?" Kevin asked, noticing her unease.

Isabella shrugged. "I don't know, maybe I'm just being paranoid, but I keep feeling like someone's got their eyes on me."

"Probably just some random person who couldn't help but stare. I mean, come on, Isabella, you're a knockout," Kevin said with a grin.

Isabella playfully tapped Kevin's arm. "Oh, Mr. Hamilton, you flatter me! But you're right. If this were a fairy tale, the magic mirror would definitely say I'm the fairest. Snow White would have to settle for second!"

Just then, the elevator doors opened, and they stepped inside, still smiling.

Odette thought, her brows knitting together as she watched the elevator numbers climb to the 27th floor. She was sure Isabella and Kevin were staying there.

Odette pondered for a moment, then hurried to the hotel lobby.

"Hi, I'm from Luminous Beauty. We're planning a company event here, and I noticed your 27th floor looks perfect for us. We'd like to book the whole floor. Is it currently occupied?" Odette asked the receptionist.

The receptionist checked the computer and apologized. "I'm sorry, ma'am, but one room on the 27th floor is occupied. However, the 29th floor is available if you'd like..."

The receptionist tried to persuade Odette to switch floors, but she shook her head firmly.

"I picked the 27th floor because it's our boss's lucky number today! How about this: give me the room number of the guest, and I'll talk to them about switching rooms," Odette suggested.

The receptionist shook his head. "I'm sorry, ma'am, but we can't disclose the room number of our guests."

Odette's eyes narrowed slightly. She had expected this and had a backup plan ready.

Odette smiled and said, "Alright, how about you give that guest a call and ask them to come down? I can talk to them personally."

The receptionist hesitated, then nodded. "I can do that. Please wait a moment."

As the receptionist dialed the room, Odette excused herself to the restroom and hid nearby.

When Kevin stepped out of the room, Odette quickly took the elevator up to the 27th floor.

She waited patiently and saw Kevin return to the room, looking annoyed. She made a mental note of the room number.

Kevin walked back in, still frowning. "Someone wanted to book the whole floor and asked to trade rooms with me, but when I arrived, they'd vanished. Strange."

Inside, Gabrielle was striking a pose while Isabella painted.
