Gabrielle burst into laughter at Isabella's 'modesty.' "Oh, Isabella, that was hilarious! Give me a minute to catch my breath before you continue painting."

Isabella smiled and shook her head. "It's fine. I've got your pose memorized. Just don't move too far, and I can make it work."

As she painted, Isabella thought, 'That call earlier was probably Odette. She knows I'm in the same room as Mr. Hamilton. Time to move to the next phase of the plan.'

"Mr. Hamilton, excuse me for a moment. I need to use the restroom." Isabella stood up and walked to the bathroom, sending a quick message.

Soon, two police officers entered the hotel.

"We received a report about a possible peeping tom. The suspect is a short-haired woman. We're here to investigate," one officer said to the receptionist.

The receptionist thought for a moment and immediately remembered Odette. Her actions were peculiar: she had tried to reserve the entire floor, only to disappear upon the guest's arrival.

To verify, the receptionist called Luminous Beauty and found out there was no event planned.

"I'll take you to the surveillance room. Follow me," the receptionist said, realizing he'd been duped. He quickly led the officers to the surveillance room, where they soon spotted Odette on the 27th floor.

Odette was still using her phone to secretly snap pictures of Kevin's room door.

'How can I get inside and take more pictures? Maybe I can pretend to be room service,' she thought.

Then she had a brilliant idea: steal a staff uniform, wear a mask, and disguise herself as room service. If they hadn't ordered anything, she could say it was complimentary from the hotel.

Just as Odette stood up to put her plan into action, two burly police officers appeared in front of her.

###chapter 213 Odette's Despair

Odette's plan went down the drain before it even got started. The receptionist recognized her, and the cops took her phone.

Kevin answered, looking confused at the two officers. "Uh, is there a problem, officers?"

"Taking pictures of me?" Kevin's face registered shock, then anger. He, like most people, resented being photographed without consent.

Odette's fists clenched, her face pale. She knew she was busted, but she still hoped to expose an affair between Isabella and Kevin. If she could prove that, they wouldn't dare make a big deal out of this.

"We were so close, just one step away from success. Damn it, why did I have to rush?" Odette muttered to herself.

Odette's eyes were icy as she stared back at Isabella. She knew she was completely done for, but she believed Madeline wouldn't abandon her. At the very least, once she was out of detention, Madeline would find her a new job or maybe even give her some money.

Isabella looked at Odette coldly. "You were wrong from the start. Did you really think I would enter that competition? I've been too busy lately to participate in such a trivial contest. I never even signed up, and Mr. Larson knows that."

"You didn't sign up? For such an important design competition?" Odette screamed. If Isabella was telling the truth, they had been fools from the beginning.

Isabella looked at Odette with pity. "So when I found out I won first place, I knew it was a trap. Don't judge me by your standards. I'm different from you-I don't care about fame and fortune!"

###chapter 214 Odette's Compromise

Isabella's words hit Odette like a ton of bricks.

Odette slumped back in her chair, muttering, "So we were doomed from the start."

Everyone thought Isabella would join the competition, but that assumption turned out to be their downfall.

Odette shot a cold glare at Isabella, determined to protect Madeline. As long as Madeline ditched the plan right away, Isabella wouldn't have any dirt on her. Worst case, Isabella would win a prize, which would suck but wouldn't get her fired.

In psychology, this posture creates a sense of pressure. Isabella used it to break down Odette's fragile nerves.

"You know how scary our boss can be. You secretly photographed and pissed off his client. On top of that, you framed me. How much longer do you think your sentence will be? Or which awful prison do you think you'll end up in?" Isabella's smile was ice-cold.

Odette's body shook violently, and she finally broke down. Unable to handle the pressure, she begged Isabella for mercy.

Odette cried and pleaded, "I'm sorry, I was wrong. Please, forgive me. I won't do it again. I'm sorry."

Isabella looked at Odette with indifference. "You're even worse than Madeline's last assistant. A complete idiot. If you want me to let you go, you need to offer something valuable."

Isabella leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, waiting for Odette to make up her mind.

Odette clenched her fists, her eyes full of conflict. She knew what Isabella wanted-to betray Madeline.

"You better think hard. Remember what happened to the last person who stayed loyal to Madeline? Madeline has no connections; she can't protect you." Isabella's mocking smile grew wider.

Isabella's words completely broke down Odette's defenses.

'That's right. Madeline can't save me. I'm the only one who can,' Odette thought, a ruthless glint in her eyes.

Odette suddenly looked up at Isabella. "If I testify against Madeline, will you let me go?"

Isabella stood up and headed for the door.

Isabella paused. She realized she'd overlooked a key point. Then again, she hadn't seen the other entries, so comparing them to Madeline's work was impossible.

Isabella turned around, looking at Odette. "Now you've got my attention."

Isabella sat back down, and Odette let out a sigh of relief.

"Honestly, there's no way Madeline could have won legitimately. She bribed the judges! I have proof," Odette declared.

Isabella looked at Odette, intrigued. "Madeline has no connections. Even if she had money, why would they agree?"

Odette quickly added, "What if Bianca was involved? Don't forget, your dear cousin has a pretty influential boyfriend."

Isabella was stunned. She hadn't expected Bianca to be involved. If that was true, it all made sense.

Through John's connections, Bianca could reach the competition organizers and set up a deal for Madeline, in order to get Isabella out of the company.

"So that's it. Now that I think about it, your tactics seem familiar. Isn't this the same trick Bianca used to plagiarize my work last time?" Isabella shook her head, a disdainful smirk on her lips.

"Now that I've told you everything, will you let me go?" Odette asked, her eyes filled with hope.

Isabella nodded. "Hand over all the evidence you have, testify as a witness, and I'll drop my charges. Your sentence will be significantly reduced."

Odette's face lit up with excitement as she nodded eagerly. "Okay, I'll tell you where the evidence is right now."

###chapter 215 Madeline's Doomsday

The next day, Madeline was on edge, pacing around her office.

'What's going on? Why can't I get ahold of Odette?' she thought, her worry growing by the minute.

Since Odette left yesterday, Madeline hadn't heard a peep from her. Her phone was off, like she had vanished into thin air.

Madeline checked her watch. The competition results were about to be announced. Their plan was about to go down.

Just then, her phone rang. It was Bianca.

"How's everything going?" Bianca asked.

Madeline took a deep breath. "Everything's set. The reporters are ready. As soon as they announce Isabella as the winner, the reporters will swarm her. Then, I'll step in and accuse her of plagiarism. But..."

Madeline trailed off.

Bianca, who had been pleased with the update, caught the hesitation in her voice.

"What's the problem? Are you getting cold feet? Remember everything you've sacrificed to get rid of Isabella? Remember how sickening that old man was?" Bianca's words made Madeline's stomach churn.

Madeline's fists tightened, a flash of humiliation in her eyes. She had sacrificed not just money, but her dignity to bring Isabella down.

"That's enough. I'm in too deep to back out now. What's bothering me is that my assistant has been missing since yesterday," Madeline said, her concern evident.

Bianca was quiet for a moment. She knew about Odette and that she was in on all of Madeline's plans.

"Do you think your assistant would betray you?" Bianca asked.

Madeline shook her head. "She has no reason to."

Bianca let out a sigh of relief. "Then what's the big deal? Maybe she's just caught up in something or had an accident. Either way, a missing person is the cops' problem, not yours. Focus on the task at hand."

Madeline clenched her fists and gave a reluctant nod. She figured she'd deal with the Odette mess later. Today was all about taking Isabella down.

After a few more words with Bianca, Madeline hung up.

She stood by the window, watching Isabella step out of her car, smiling and completely unaware of what was coming.

Madeline's lips curled into a sneer. "Enjoy your last moments of happiness; today is your downfall."

When Isabella walked into the company, her colleagues were unusually enthusiastic, showering her with congratulations.

"Ms. Taylor, wow! You won first place?! That's awesome!"

"Ms. Taylor, you're incredible! I'm so inspired by you!"

"You're officially my hero!"

"Ms. Taylor, you're gorgeous and incredibly talented!"

Isabella accepted the congratulations with a faint smile.

Just then, Madeline stepped out of her office and joined in. "Congrats, Ms. Taylor, on winning first place again!"

Madeline then motioned towards the door, and a flood of reporters poured in.

"Ms. Taylor, how does it feel to win the most prestigious design award in the country?"

"Ms. Taylor, do you have any words for the competitors you beat?"

"Ms. Taylor, some contestants think you didn't deserve to win first place. What's your take on that?"

The last question was pretty sharp, but Isabella just smiled and didn't say a word.

Madeline, sensing something was off, frowned. "Ms. Taylor, why aren't you answering? It's kind of rude to the reporters, don't you think?"

"Rude? I wasn't even in the competition! What's with all the questions? I'm clueless about this," Isabella said, looking at Madeline with a sudden smile.

Madeline was stunned, and the room went dead silent. You could hear a pin drop.

"What does she mean? Ms. Taylor says she didn't enter the competition. Then how did she win first place?" someone asked, clearly puzzled.

"That's a question for Ms. Eve," Dwayne said coldly, stepping out of his office with a file in hand.

"Isabella didn't enter this competition. Someone used her username to submit a design. Madeline, can you explain why Isabella's design looks so much like yours?" Dwayne laid out two design sketches, and the reporters went wild, snapping photos.

"Isabella must have stolen my design. She entered, I know she did! She's lying to those reporters!" Madeline blurted out, panic creeping into her voice.

Isabella stayed calm, her eyes locked on Madeline. "How long are you going to keep this up? You had Odette sneak into my office and plant a Trojan virus on my computer to submit the design in my name. You've been waiting for this moment to accuse me of plagiarism, weren't you?"

Madeline's face went pale, and she took a step back, a terrible thought crossing her mind: Odette had betrayed her.

The reporters smelled a big story and started snapping photos like crazy.

Isabella sighed and pulled out her phone. "Madeline, I gave you chances. But you kept throwing them away, driven by your jealousy."

She played a surveillance video from her office, clearly showing Odette inserting a USB drive into her computer and messing with it.

"If you think this isn't enough, let's hear from Odette herself," Isabella said, looking towards the door.

Two police officers walked in, escorting a handcuffed Odette.

The moment Madeline saw Odette, she felt dizzy and collapsed onto the floor.

Odette bit her lip, avoiding Madeline's gaze. With her eyes closed, she confessed, "It was all Madeline's doing. She told me to plant the virus on Isabella's computer. And Madeline conspired with Bianca; they bribed the competition judges to secure the first place."

###chapter 216 The Crazy Madeline 

Odette's words hit like a bombshell, stirring up chaos in the room.

Everyone turned to Madeline, their faces full of shock.

Madeline's hands shook as she pointed at Odette, "Why are you doing this? Why are you betraying me?"

Odette shut her eyes, unable to face Madeline or answer her.

Isabella smirked, looking at Odette. "Odette, are you ready to back up your claims legally? You say Madeline and Bianca bribed the judges. Got any proof?"

Odette took a deep breath and nodded. When she opened her eyes, they were filled with determination instead of guilt.

"Don't say it. Please, don't say it," Madeline begged Odette.

Odette stared coldly at Madeline and pointed at her computer. "Madeline bribed the judge, Tony, with sex. She recorded it to make sure he wouldn't back out. The video is on her computer."

With that, Odette headed for Madeline's computer.

"You have no right to touch my computer, you bitch!" Madeline screamed, lunging at Odette and grabbing at her clothes and hair.

Odette shoved her away hard.

Odette knew Madeline couldn't save her. Her only chance was to betray Madeline and save her own skin.

Madeline, now on the floor, tried to get up, but Isabella held her down by the shoulders.

"Madeline, if Odette's lying, why won't you let her look at your computer? Something to hide?" Isabella sneered.

"No, please, Ms. Taylor, I'm sorry. I know I was wrong. Please, don't release that video. I'm begging you!" Madeline pleaded, her face pale.

Isabella leaned down and whispered in her ear, "You're not sorry for what you did; you're just sorry you got caught."

Isabella then stood up and looked at Madeline coldly.

By now, Odette had found the video on Madeline's computer.

The reporters turned their cameras to the screen, sensing a big story.

"No, don't play it, please, Odette, don't play it!" Madeline screamed, trying to get up. But two security guards quickly restrained her.

With a final click, Odette played the video.

The room filled with the sounds of a woman's moans and a man's lewd comments.

Tony Gibson: "Who would've thought, Ms. Eve? You always seem so cold, but in bed, you're quite the wild one."

Madeline: "Mr. Gibson, do you like how I am now? Can you give me first place?"

Tony: "Ms. Eve, whether you get first place depends on how you perform in this bed. Oh my, you're amazing. I love this position."

The explicit sounds and dialogue made even the adults in the room blush.

Madeline's face went pale, as if all the blood had drained from her. She sat on the floor in a daze, letting everyone watch her disgrace.

The reporters snapped away, capturing every juicy detail. Finally, Isabella stepped up and shut the laptop.

"These should be enough," Isabella said coolly to the reporters. "I hope you all keep the explicit parts out of your reports."

"Sure thing, Ms. Taylor. We'll blur out the sensitive stuff," one reporter replied with a smirk.

No one felt bad for Madeline. You don't get sympathy for hurting people.

"This is all your doing, isn't it? You planned everything! You knew, so you made Odette betray me, didn't you?" Madeline glared at Isabella, her eyes wild.

Isabella met her gaze with a calm, indifferent look. "I gave you chance after chance. You always dismissed me, saying I only got where I am because of my family. But my talent's obvious to everyone else. You're just insecure, aren't you?"

"You're lying! I'm not insecure. I have great talent; why would I be insecure? It's you who should be insecure. You sit in high positions without real skill, blocking the path for people like me. I just lack the connections. If I had a background, with my talent, I could easily be at the top!" Madeline stood up, pointing at Isabella, her voice rising to a hysterical scream.

"You damn bitch! You and you!" Madeline pointed at Isabella, Odette, and even Dwayne.

"You, as our leader, never paid attention to me. You've always favored Isabella, just because the boss told you to give her special treatment. Why is it that every time she messes up, you let it slide, but when I mess up, I get punished?" Madeline accused Dwayne furiously.

Dwayne's face was icy as he stared at Madeline. "You think I'm biased? Isabella's never screwed up unless you guys pushed her into it! She's gone to bat for you countless times, giving you chances. She was even going to quit and give you her job! But you, you let jealousy get the better of you and tried to torpedo her!"

Madeline stood frozen, staring at Isabella in shock. "You're resigning? That can't be true. It's absolutely impossible."

Isabella nodded. "Yes, I was planning to resign. I even considered recommending you for my position. But as Mr. Larson said, I've given you too many chances, and you squandered them."

"You're lying. You're trying to manipulate me! I don't want your charity! I'll get where I deserve to be, all by myself!" Madeline screamed, her eyes red with rage.

Suddenly, Madeline spotted the paper cutter on the table. In a fit of madness, she grabbed it and charged at Isabella.

###chapter 217 Explosive News

Nobody saw it coming when Madeline went totally nuts.

Odette, who was right next to Isabella, jumped in front of her, taking the hit. The paper cutter sliced through her clothes, leaving a nasty cut on her chest.

Dwayne was quick to act. He kicked Madeline hard, sending her crashing to the ground. The security guards swooped in, pinning her down and snatching the cutter away.

Odette was shaking like a leaf, staring at the blood on her chest, sweat dripping down her face.

"Are you okay? Somebody call a doctor, now!" Isabella yelled, panic in her voice.

Someone in the crowd immediately called 911.

"I'm okay, it's just a scratch," Odette said, her voice trembling.

She looked at Isabella with desperate eyes.

Isabella got the message. She leaned in and whispered, "I'll get you the best lawyer to help reduce your sentence."

Odette's eyes filled with gratitude.

"Odette, why did you betray me? After everything I did for you? What did Isabella offer you? Why? I hate you! You all deserve to rot in hell!" Madeline screamed from the floor, her hair a mess, eyes wild with rage.

"Hand her over to the cops!" Dwayne barked.

The security guards hauled Madeline up and dragged her out.

Even as they dragged her away, her laughter, chilling and unrestrained, filled the air. "You'll all join me in hell! I'll be waiting!" she shrieked.

Isabella turned to the reporters. "Alright folks, you've got your story. Time to go."

The reporters got the hint. They had their scoop and didn't need to stick around. After quick goodbyes, they rushed out of the building.

Like a pack of wolves, they raced to their cars. Once behind the wheel, they sped off, eager to be the first to break the news.

Soon, an ambulance arrived and took Odette away.

Back at the office, Dwayne dispersed the crowd and called Isabella to his office.

"It's all taken care of. I've heard about your plans, but just remember, if things don't pan out, the director's position is always open for you," Dwayne said with a smile.

Isabella smiled back. "Thanks, Dwayne. And thank the boss for his support. But I've got faith in myself."

After a quick chat, Isabella went back to her office. Once she was gone, Dwayne picked up the phone and called Michael, filling him in on what happened.

"Mr. Williams, Isabella doesn't want to press charges against Odette and plans to get her a lawyer to reduce her sentence. Should we help with that?" Dwayne asked carefully.

Michael replied, "If that's what Isabella wants, then let's do it. I'll take care of the lawyer."

Michael hung up the phone, muttering, "You're lucky you took that knife meant for my wife," as he arranged for someone to handle the situation.

Odette had caused too much trouble in the past. But this time, by taking the knife meant for Isabella, she had managed to earn a bit of redemption in Michael's eyes. He decided to follow Isabella's wishes and reduce Odette's punishment.

Michael then called Jerry into his office. "Bianca's got a hand in this mess too. Once the news breaks, make sure her reputation is completely trashed. I want her name to be mud."

Jerry sighed inwardly, knowing he had more work ahead. "Yes, Mr. Williams, I understand," he replied calmly, then left to make the arrangements.

Michael watched Jerry leave, feeling a nagging suspicion that Jerry was hiding something.

Meanwhile, in the newsroom, the reporters were typing up their stories at lightning speed. Editors quickly reviewed and published the articles, almost simultaneously, highlighting the urgency of the situation.

Soon, the public was buzzing about the dramatic events at Isabella's company.

Bianca was in the kitchen, working on a recipe and preparing a meal for John. "I wonder how things are going with Madeline. She's probably suffering now. My poor cousin, now you'll know what it's like to be the target of online hate," she muttered with a cold smile.

She tasted the soup and nodded in satisfaction. "The flavor is great. John will love it," she said, setting down the bowl and turning off the stove.

Just then, the door swung open, and John walked in.

Seeing him, Bianca smiled and picked up the soup pot. "John, I made you some delicious soup..."

Before she could finish, John slapped her hard across the face. Bianca was stunned, dropping the soup pot. The hot soup splashed on her legs, burning her skin.

Clutching her face in pain, Bianca stumbled back, finally noticing the intense anger on John's face.

"John, what happened? Why did you hit me?" she asked, tears streaming down her face.

John clenched his fists, glaring at her with hatred. "Haven't you seen today's news? Why did you conspire with Madeline to frame Isabella?"

Bianca's heart sank. She hadn't expected John to find out about this.

She wanted to deny it, but remembering that John said it was already in the news, she closed her mouth and grabbed her phone to start searching.

###chapter 218 I Am Your Fiancée

After Bianca finished watching the news, her face went pale. She never thought Odette, who Madeline trusted so much, would stab them in the back!

'That idiot! She's such a fool!' Bianca fumed silently, cursing both Madeline and Odette.

Seeing Bianca's pale face and silence, John knew the news had to be true.

"Why did you do this? When did you become so cruel?" John grabbed Bianca by the shoulders, shaking her, his voice a mix of anger and desperation.

Bianca's mind raced for an explanation. She looked at John, tears streaming down her face. "I had no idea I was being used by Madeline! She asked me to contact the competition organizers, but I didn't know she planned to bribe them."

"Why did you contact Madeline in the first place? You two shouldn't have any connection," John said coldly, his eyes piercing into hers.

"Remember when I went to their company to apologize to Isabella? I reached out to Madeline, hoping she could help me get in. She agreed, and I thought she was being kind. I had no idea she was using me all along," Bianca cried out.

John frowned. Whenever Bianca was involved, she managed to shift the blame onto someone else. Too many coincidences made him suspicious.

"I'll ask Madeline about this. I hope you're not lying to me this time," John said coldly before turning and leaving Bianca's house.

After John left, Bianca, trembling, picked up her phone and dialed a number.

"You have to help me! John went to confront Madeline. If she spills about our plan, my image with John will be completely ruined!" Bianca said, her voice frantic.

The voice on the other end scoffed, "That's the downside of building an image! It can bring you short-term benefits, but when it collapses, it's like a tower of sand, easily washed away."

"Now is not the time for your lectures!" Bianca screamed, her anger boiling over.

The voice on the other end screamed back, even more furious. "Not now? Then, when? After you screw things up again? You idiot! Do you even realize how many times you've gone ahead with your stupid plans without my approval? Have any of them ever worked? All you've done is create more mess for us!"

Bianca, thoroughly chastised, broke down in tears. "I really know I was wrong. From now on, I'll follow your instructions completely! Please, just help me this time!"

The other end of the line fell silent, and Bianca waited nervously.

Finally, a cold voice came through. "This is the last time! If there's a next time, you'll never be with John again."

The call ended abruptly, and Bianca sighed in relief. As long as that person helped her, she would get through this crisis.

Meanwhile, John called the police station and then drove there, determined to get to the bottom of things with Madeline.

The officer who received John looked a bit embarrassed.

"Mr. Williams, I'm sorry. Madeline's lost it and might not be able to answer your questions," the officer said, looking troubled.

The officer had no choice but to take John to the interrogation room.

When the door to the interrogation room opened, John was stunned by what he saw.

Madeline was slumped over the table, her wrists bleeding from rubbing against the handcuffs. Her hair was a wild mess, her face twisted in a grotesque expression, eyes vacant, and drool dripped from the corner of her mouth.

"You're all bastards! You all deserve to burn in hell! I'm the smartest person in the world! I just needed a chance! Damn it, why wasn't I born into one of the top four families? I'm prettier than Isabella, more talented than her, why? Yes! I am Isabella! I'm the most famous woman, my fiancé is John! The heir to the Williams Family is my husband! I am Isabella!" Madeline ranted, jumping on the chair like a deranged monkey, her mind clearly shattered.

The officer looked at John, who was standing at the door, unwilling to go in, with a hint of mockery in his eyes.

"Mr. Williams, are you still going in?" the officer asked tentatively from behind.

John hesitated, took a step inside, and asked Madeline, "Madeline, why did you harm Isabella? What deal do you have with Bianca?"

Madeline tilted her head and looked at John, suddenly breaking into a happy smile.

"John, it's me, I'm Isabella! I'm the design director of Luminous Beauty! I'm your fiancée. When are we getting married? Let's get married now! What are you waiting for? Let's go see Mason together!" Madeline excitedly rushed towards John but was restrained by the handcuffs.

"Save me, darling! I'm your fiancée, and I'm not just some nobody. You can get me out of this damn place, right?" Madeline screamed crazily at John.

John clenched his fists, realizing that Madeline was truly insane. She belonged in a mental hospital, not a police station.

"Send her to a mental hospital for treatment," John ordered, leaving the interrogation room. Even as he walked away, Madeline's hysterical screams echoed behind him.

"John! My fiancé, where are you going? Get me out of here. I don't want to stay here. It's so cold. I'm so scared!" Madeline shouted.

After leaving the police station, John got into his car and decided to visit Odette at the hospital. Despite Odette's betrayal of Madeline, she had been someone Madeline trusted and likely knew the details of the deal between Bianca and Madeline.

At that moment, Odette was in the hospital, receiving an IV due to the shock she had experienced.

In the empty hospital corridor, a figure in a nurse's uniform quietly entered Odette's ward. While Odette slept soundly, the nurse surreptitiously added something to her IV drip. The nurse then vanished as quickly and quietly as she'd arrived, leaving no sign of her visit.

###chapter 219 Dead Odette

John drove to the hospital and asked about Odette's room.

When he walked in, he saw her lying there, looking like she was asleep.

Frowning, he went over to her. He wasn't in the mood to wait for her to wake up on her own.

"Odette! Wake up, I need to talk to you." He shook her shoulder, but she didn't move.

Getting frustrated, he slapped her face, but still nothing.

That's when it hit him that something was really wrong. He checked her neck for a pulse, but her skin was cold, and he couldn't find one.

John quickly pulled his hand back. Was she dead?

Just then, he heard a bunch of footsteps coming down the hall. Security guards, doctors, and nurses burst into the room.

They saw Odette on the bed and John standing there, and their looks practically screamed "murderer."

"Damn it! I've been set up," John muttered, his face darkening.

That afternoon, while Isabella's news was still trending, the story of John being a murder suspect blew up.

When Isabella saw the news, she spat out her coffee.

"What did you say? John committed murder?" Isabella looked at Juliet, shocked.

Juliet nodded and handed her tablet to Isabella. "It's true, Ms. Taylor. See for yourself."

According to the report, a nurse was found knocked out in the hospital's storage room, her uniform stolen. The person who found her called the police and alerted hospital security. After checking the surveillance footage, security saw the suspect, dressed as a nurse, going into Odette's room.

When security and medical staff got there, Odette was already dead, and John was the only one there.

Isabella's mouth twitched. She had just contacted a lawyer to reduce Odette's sentence, and now Odette was dead?

"I knew the wicked would get what they deserve. Madeline went crazy, and now Odette is dead. Ms. Taylor, do you think this is karma?" Juliet asked.

Juliet listened to Isabella's analysis, feeling dizzy. This was all more complicated than her most intricate designs.

"Sorry, Ms. Taylor, I don't fully understand, but I just want to know, will you be in danger?" Juliet asked worriedly.

Though Isabella pretended not to care, she was quite nervous inside.

Meanwhile, Michael also received the news of Odette's death.

"Did you do this?" Michael asked Jerry, frowning.

Jerry immediately shook his head. "Mr. Williams, you're giving me too much credit. Without your orders, I wouldn't dare kill anyone."

Jerry observed Michael's furrowed brow, but had no doubt of his innocence. As Michael's closest confidant, he knew there was no reason for Michael to hide something like this from him.

Michael tapped his fingers on the table lightly. "Isabella might face some trouble in the next few days. But that's secondary. Keep a close eye on Bianca. Something about her doesn't feel right."

Michael nodded. "Yes, go ahead. Get all the details."

###chapter 220 John's Plan

After sending Jerry off to investigate, Michael started thinking about who could be behind all this. His mind raced through a list of suspects, including members of the top four families.

Just then, Michael got a call from Mason, asking him to come to the hospital to discuss something important.

"What does Mason want with me at this hour?" Michael narrowed his eyes, feeling like this could be tied to Odette's murder. It might also involve Isabella, so he had to stay on top of it. Without wasting a moment, he drove straight to Mason's hospital.

Meanwhile, John was released from the police station by his lawyer. He was fuming. Luckily, he had an alibi, so the police couldn't hold him. But when he saw the online speculation about the case, he nearly lost it.

"These idiots! Do they think I can't find out who they are just because they're hiding behind screens? Accusing me of murder-I'll track them down and make them pay!" John angrily threw his phone.

'Is this what rich people do? Throw their phones when they're upset? They act like money grows on trees,' the bodyguard thought to himself.

John got back into the car, planning to find Bianca. But then he got a call from Mason, asking him to come to the hospital.

John told the driver to head to the hospital run by the Williams family.

Mason lowered his head, eventually nodding. John had a point; Bianca had no reason to do this.

Mason frowned and instinctively looked at Michael, but Michael's expression stayed the same.

"You suspect Isabella's husband?" Michael asked.

"Yes. And it's not just me. Remember Pearl? Paxton thinks Isabella's husband did that to her. If that's true, then Isabella's husband is a creepy killer! Pearl was left in that horrible state because she kidnapped Isabella. And now Madeline and Odette-one went mad, and the other ended up dead-because they falsely accused Isabella," John analyzed, his face serious.

Mason looked at John with displeasure. "If we follow your logic, then why are Jasper and Mia unharmed?"

John sneered, "They're unharmed for now. Maybe there were assassins in the crowd outside the hospital, but Jasper and Mia were cunning and called the police for protection. Or maybe the man spared them because they're Isabella's parents."

Michael stared silently at John, who had painted him as a total psycho. 'If I were really like you say, the first ones I'd take out would be you and Bianca,' he thought to himself.

"You make a compelling argument. So, what do you plan to do next?" Michael asked calmly.

Mason also looked at John, waiting for his answer.

John smiled. "I plan to help Bianca with her public relations, clear her name, and then guide public attention towards Isabella."

"What? Why would you harm an innocent person?" Mason shouted angrily at John.

A cold glint flashed in Michael's eyes. Maybe it wouldn't be such a bad idea to get rid of this guy; he was always stirring up trouble for his wife.

John didn't notice Michael's expression, and he no longer feared Mason.

"Grandpa, if you think Isabella is innocent, what about Bianca? Isn't she innocent too? This is a dead end for now. All I can do is try to clear Bianca's name for the time being. I don't care if it hurts Isabella. What I need to do is get Bianca in charge of the Taylor Family. It's also my way of securing a fallback," John said, turning to leave.

"That damn little brat is trying to drive me crazy, isn't he?" Mason fumed, his anger triggering a violent coughing fit.

Michael quickly called for a doctor to check on Mason.

Meanwhile, a thought formed in Michael's mind. 'If we can find out who killed Odette, maybe we can pin the Pearl case on them too. If I play my cards right, it'll create a rift between Paxton and those guys. Not only could we catch the killer, but we might also uncover that mysterious force and weaken Paxton's grip at the same time.'

Michael's eyes narrowed again as another thought crossed his mind. John was planning to help Bianca take over the Taylor family, and that would be another headache for Isabella. He needed to step in and fix this for her.
###chapter 221 The Art of Conflict Transformation

The reporters, who had initially left, swarmed back to Isabella's company building like bees to honey after news of Odette's murder broke.

As soon as Isabella stepped out after work, she was hit with a barrage of questions from the press.

"Ms. Taylor, there's a rumor online that your husband killed Odette because she tried to harm you. Is that true?"

"Ms. Taylor, some say you promised Odette a lot of benefits but had her killed to avoid keeping those promises. What's your take on that?"

"Ms. Taylor, now that Madeline has lost it, are you planning to take her out too?"

Isabella was beyond frustrated. Standing in front of the flashing cameras, she kept her cool. "First off, I haven't killed anyone, and I have no idea who did. If you want details, ask the police, not me. Also, my husband is just a regular guy; he has no ties to any assassin groups. In the real world, we go by evidence, not wild guesses."

Just as she finished, Leo pulled up with the car. With security's help, Isabella pushed through the crowd of reporters and got to the vehicle.

Right before getting in, she turned back to the reporters, her eyes cold. "I hope you, as journalists, will stick to the truth instead of using baseless rumors to sway public opinion for clicks. If you keep accusing me without proof, I'll take legal action."

With that, Isabella got into the car and shut the door. Leo started the engine and drove off, quickly disappearing around the corner.

As Isabella left, the reporters, now without a target, scattered quickly.

Sitting in the back seat, Isabella crossed her arms, her face tense. She realized something was off-these reporters had shown up way too fast after Odette's murder, like sharks smelling blood.

"This whole thing reeks of Bianca, not me. Why are all these reporters gunning for me?" Isabella muttered, frowning as a possible explanation hit her.

She quickly pulled out her phone, removed Bianca's number from the blacklist, and dialed it.

Bianca was with John, listening to him explain their PR strategy when her phone rang. She glanced at the screen and hesitated.

"It's Isabella. Should I answer?" Bianca asked John.

John thought for a moment before nodding. "Go ahead. Let's hear what she has to say."

Bianca answered the call, and Isabella's voice came through, cold and accusing. "Bianca, this is your doing, isn't it? You deliberately pointed those reporters at me. This kind of sneaky move is so you."

Bianca snorted. "I have no idea what you're talking about. Unless you've got proof, that's slander."

"The evidence is lying in the morgue. I never thought you'd stoop so low," Isabella shot back with a sneer.

"Isabella, you've got me all wrong. I have no reason to harm Odette. I'm just as innocent as you are," Bianca replied, putting on her best innocent and hurt act.

"Let me talk to her," John cut in, taking the phone from Bianca. "Isabella, I just got back from the police station. Both Bianca and I have alibis for the time of Odette's death. We didn't do it. If you want to find out who did it, go ask the police. We have things to do, so we're done here."

With that, John hung up abruptly.

Isabella sat in the car, staring at her phone in shock. "John and Bianca are living together?"

She quickly realized that Bianca alone wouldn't have been able to mobilize so many reporters. It had to be John's doing.

"Looks like John has completely turned against Mason," Isabella muttered, clenching her fists in anger.

John's tactics weren't particularly clever or effective, but they worked-at least in getting her riled up and off his back.

"Ms. Taylor, should I inform the boss? He could easily silence those media outlets," Leo suggested, glancing at her in the rearview mirror.

Isabella shook her head. "No need. It's just a petty annoyance."

Despite her anger, she remained focused. She had more pressing matters to attend to-Jasper was about to be released from the detention center, and she needed to focus on that.

Meanwhile, John briefed Bianca on the PR strategy. She listened intently, committing every detail to memory.

"Right now, everyone suspects you and Isabella. What you need to do is leverage your bad reputation. Keep reminding people that you had no reason to kill Odette. Steer suspicion toward Isabella's mysterious husband and drop hints about Pearl to push Paxton into investigating," John advised, a hint of resignation in his eyes.

John, as the Williams heir, once controlled all family resources. But after clashing with Mason, his influence had significantly waned, forcing him to rely on Paxton's resources.

Bianca grabbed John's hand, her eyes filled with concern. "I'm so sorry, darling. You've sacrificed so much for me."

John brushed her hair gently. "It's not that bad yet. I'm still the heir, and even without Mason's help, I have enough power."

"Thank you, darling. Thank you so much," Bianca said, throwing her arms around him and sobbing quietly into his chest.

Meanwhile, Isabella returned to her villa, surprised to find Michael had come home early.

He placed his phone on the table, having just finished a call.

"You're home early. I haven't had time to cook. How about we eat out or order in?" he suggested with a smile.

Isabella suddenly hugged him tightly, her voice trembling. "I'm caught in another media storm. They're accusing me of being a murderer!"

###chapter 222 Police Actions

Michael held Isabella close, gently patting her back.

"Don't let those trashy tabloids get to you. I know you'd never do something like that," he said softly, though his eyes flashed with a cold, steely glint.

'Just wait, John,' Michael fumed, his face a mask of barely contained rage. 'You've really ticked off my wife, and you will pay for it.'

Isabella lightly patted his chest. "I don't really care. I've been called a fool and an unwanted daughter for years. I can handle that. But I can't stand them calling you a murderer. You're the brightest light in my life, and I won't let anyone slander you like that." Her eyes were red with emotion as she looked up at him.

Michael's expression softened as he wiped her tears away. "Don't worry about what they say. As long as you believe in me, that's all that matters. I don't care what others think," he said with a gentle smile.

Pulling her back into his arms, he added, "I trust the police will uncover the truth. Once they do, those spreading lies online will face the consequences."

Just then, Isabella's phone rang. She pulled it out, surprised to see Amelia calling.

"What's up, Amelia? Something wrong?" Isabella asked, puzzled.

Amelia's anxious voice came through the phone. "Isabella, are you okay? I just saw the news. They're accusing you and your husband of killing Odette!"

"I suspect this is all John's doing. He's trying to divert attention away from Bianca," Isabella sighed.

"That bastard again!" Amelia fumed, her anger palpable even over the phone.

"Why hasn't that jerk been hit by a car yet? Isn't someone struck by lightning every year? Why not him?" Amelia ranted, her frustration boiling over.

Isabella chuckled bitterly. "Alright, Amelia, enough with the cursing. It's a minor inconvenience at worst. But it's okay. I believe once the hype dies down, the police will uncover the truth."

"But what if they don't? Maybe we should pool some money and hire a few trolls to fight back online, give Bianca a taste of her own medicine," Amelia suggested.

Michael, standing behind Isabella, raised an eyebrow. He hoped Amelia wouldn't go through with that plan, as he had already taken steps to resolve the situation.

"Thanks, Amelia, but no need for that. Besides, we don't have as much money as John," Isabella chuckled, declining Amelia's offer.

At that moment, another call came in. "Hold on, Amelia, I've got another call," Isabella said, switching lines.

A woman's voice came through. "Is this Ms. Taylor? This is Officer Davis from the police department. We met during the investigation of your kidnapping case. I'm also handling the current case with Odette."

Isabella remembered the incident with Pearl and the officers who had questioned her at the hospital.

"I remember now. What can I do for you? You don't actually believe the rumors online, do you? I was at the office all day; there's no way I could've done anything," she joked lightly.

The officer chuckled. "We absolutely believe your alibi, Ms. Taylor. I'm calling because we've taken down a troll farm that was spreading those rumors. They were paid to target you."

Isabella was stunned. She hadn't expected such swift action.

Michael smiled lightly, feeling a bit smug.

"Thank you so much for your hard work. I really appreciate it," Isabella said, expressing her gratitude before ending the call.

Turning to Michael, she said, "Can you believe how fast the police moved on this?"

Michael shrugged nonchalantly. "Who knows? Maybe they've got some tech whizzes on their team."

In truth, Michael had anticipated John's move and had hackers track the source of the rumors, leading to the swift police action.

Isabella quickly called Amelia back, sharing the good news.

"They busted a whole troll farm? Wow, the police really stepped up their game!" Amelia exclaimed, equally surprised.

The rumor had just started circulating online, and not many people knew about it yet. The fact that the police managed to bust the trolls so quickly was nothing short of miraculous.

"Do you think the police are using AI now? I can't think of any other reason for such efficiency," Amelia said, feeling a wave of relief. She hadn't had time to hire trolls to manipulate public opinion for Isabella yet. If she had, she might have ended up getting caught too. "Anyway, we've dodged a bullet for now," Isabella said, feeling lighter.

After chatting with Amelia for a bit, Isabella hung up the phone and turned to Michael.

"What's for dinner, babe?" she asked, wrapping her arms around his neck and lifting one foot off the ground, clearly excited.

Michael started to smile but then remembered something, his expression turning serious. "By the way, honey, a friend at the detention center told me that John and Bianca contacted Jasper a couple of days ago."

###chapter 223 Michael's Analysis

Isabella's head jerked up at Michael's words, her eyes wide with surprise.

"What? Bianca met with Jasper? Why would she do that?" she asked, her brow furrowing.

Michael rolled his eyes and shook his head. "How should I know? My buddy said John and Bianca went into Jasper's interrogation room and shut the door. No one else was allowed in, so we have no clue what they talked about."

Isabella's frown deepened as she thought. "Bianca and Jasper have been at odds since the contract issues. This meeting can't just be a casual catch-up; there must be something more to it."

Michael patted her shoulder. "Do you think it's possible that Bianca also wants control of the Taylor Family? She might be eyeing those last three companies Jasper holds."

Isabella pursed her lips, considering the possibility.

Michael stroked his chin and analyzed, "I think it's possible. Think about it: John's with Bianca now, openly defying Mason. If Mason really intends to disinherit John, what do you think John would do?"

"He'll find a new way to stay in power! Bianca's three companies could be his fallback plan. John has invested in those companies before, so he knows them well. If Bianca gains control of them with John's help, the entire family business would end up under John's control," Isabella said, her eyes flashing with determination. "That's not happening. My grandfather worked his whole life for this; he didn't build it to hand it to just anyone."

Michael watched her with satisfaction. With his prompting, she finally understood what John and Bianca were planning.

"John's helping Bianca with her PR, trying to make her look good," Isabella said, her eyes getting icy. "If they trash my reputation, the company's stock will tank. What a snake!"

"So, we need to think about what to do once Jasper gets out of detention. Our previous plan might not work anymore," Michael said, pulling her onto the couch beside him.

Isabella narrowed her eyes, speaking softly, "John and Bianca still haven't locked down Jasper's shares. If I were him, knowing someone wants his failing companies, I'd set a high price! He wouldn't deal with me last time, didn't trust me, hated my guts. Damn, I should've just thrown more money at him instead of ratting him out about that embezzlement."

She slapped her forehead in frustration, and Michael gently rubbed her head. "Don't beat yourself up. I hate seeing you hurt."

Michael gently massaged Isabella's temples as he spoke, "Since Jasper hasn't sold his shares yet, it means he's wary of the evidence you have against him. If he does plan to deal with John, he'll likely take the money and flee the country as soon as he's out."

"We can't let him leave the country so quickly. We need to grab him the second he's free and stop him from seeing John," Isabella said firmly.

Michael nodded, though he had another idea he hadn't voiced: If they could eliminate Jasper and Mia, Isabella would inherit their shares. Despite her public declaration of severing ties with them, she still had inheritance rights. However, this approach would undoubtedly attract scorn and ridicule, which was why Michael hadn't pursued it.

"We need to find a way to stop all this, but how?" Isabella mimicked Michael's thoughtful pose, touching her chin as she thought.

To Michael, the solution seemed straightforward. If they were on his turf, he could simply have Jasper dragged out of the detention center, beaten, and forced to sign over the shares. But this was John's territory, and such violent tactics weren't an option.

However, Michael had another idea: find someone to pose as one of John's subordinates. They could pick up Jasper and Mia from the detention center, then detain and rough them up to force them to sign the agreement.

Just as Michael was about to share his plan, his phone rang.

He glanced at the caller ID, his eyes narrowing slightly. "Honey, I need to take this call. It's from my boss. Keep thinking; I'll be right back."

Michael ruffled Isabella's hair and stepped out of the living room. Isabella barely noticed; she was deep in thought, trying to figure out how to thwart John.

Once outside the villa, Michael answered the call. Mason's tired voice came through. "Michael, come to the hospital. John is here too. I need to talk to both of you."

Michael agreed and hung up.

After the last argument with John, Mason's health had visibly declined.

"Honey, I need to go to the company for a bit. I'll be back soon," Michael said, kissing Isabella lightly on the lips.

Isabella stood up and headed to the kitchen. "Alright, we'll have dinner together when you get back. I'll cook tonight."

"Looking forward to it," Michael smiled, then left the house.

When Michael arrived at the hospital, John was already waiting by Mason's bed.

Michael ignored John and addressed Mason. "Mason, what's this about?"

Before Mason could speak, John cut in.

"Michael, did you report those trolls to the police?" John demanded, glaring at him.

###chapter 224 John's Bet

Michael glanced up at John, giving him a cool look.

"Why do you ask?" Michael asked, a slight smirk on his face.

"He already asked me the same thing," Mason sighed. "But actually I haven't had the chance to do anything yet."

John kept staring at Michael.

Michael's smirk disappeared. "Yeah, you're right. I did it."

"What the hell were you thinking?" John demanded, his anger obvious.

Michael's expression darkened. "Is that how you talk to me? Think your grandpa's too old to keep you in check? Keep that tone, and I might just teach you a lesson myself. And don't think your dad will save you-I'll call him right now!"

John's face drained of color. He remembered Michael beating him up in that bar-vividly. Michael was known for his ruthlessness abroad; this wasn't a joke.

Mason looked at John and said calmly, "Michael does what I tell him. I told him to watch Isabella and keep her safe."

John gritted his teeth. "So you called me here to humiliate me?"

Mason shook his head. "I don't have time for that. I called you here to make a bet."

"A bet?" John frowned, confused.

Michael raised an eyebrow, interested.

"I know your real reason for helping Bianca isn't just love, but also your own ambitions. The Taylor Family may only have three companies left, but it still has some influence. You want to rebuild your power with Bianca and her family's support. That's understandable. So, the bet is about that," Mason explained, a faint smile on his face.

John's mind raced. He remembered Jasper mentioning Isabella had tried to get shares from him. "You want to bet on whether Isabella or Bianca ends up controlling the family?"

Mason nodded. "Exactly. I believe Isabella will come out on top, and you believe in Bianca. Let's make a bet. During the bet, we'll have a truce. Don't start anything with me, and I won't bother you and Bianca."

The offer was tempting. John felt confident he wouldn't lose. "What's the stake? If I lose, do I have to leave Bianca?"

Mason sighed. "Even if I wanted you to, you wouldn't agree. So let's bet something else: ten percent of what we're worth."

John was stunned, and so was Michael.

One-tenth of their assets was substantial, but not something they couldn't handle.

To John, it seemed like an easy win. "Just one-tenth of our assets?"

Mason nodded. "Yes, ten percent. Lawyers will come to notarize our assets to ensure fairness."

John scrutinized Mason's calm eyes. "Alright, if that's all, I'm in."

Mason smiled. "Good. Then wait here for a bit. The lawyers will be here soon."

John didn't object. He glanced at Michael. "What if you and Michael keep helping Isabella? That wouldn't be fair."

Michael shot him a cold look. "If you can refrain from helping Bianca, we won't assist Isabella."

John narrowed his eyes but eventually nodded. "Fine. I won't give her any financial support."

Mason's smile widened. "Then the bet is on. Now, if you'll excuse us, I need to speak with Michael alone."

John left the room, thinking about eavesdropping, but Charles blocked his way, smiling. "Mr. Williams, there's a private lounge for family remembers. You can wait there. I'll have some refreshments brought in."

John glared at Charles before heading to the lounge.

Back in the room, Mason looked at Michael with a knowing smile. "John's playing word games. He said no financial support, but he didn't mention other kinds of help."

Michael chuckled. "There are plenty of loopholes to exploit within and outside the rules."

Mason's gaze hardened. "I don't really care about the outcome of this bet. Whether John succeeds or fails, his actions will benefit the family."

"Then why the bet? Just for fun?" Michael asked, puzzled.

Mason's smile was mysterious. "I want to see if you're truly committed to helping Isabella."

Michael realized this was another test. Mason wasn't convinced Estella was really his wife.

"So, Mason, are you saying you don't need me to help Isabella?" Michael looked puzzled, gazing at Mason.

###chapter 225 Testing

Michael threw the question back at Mason, his brain already buzzing with calculations.

'Business is war, old man. We've all been through our battles. Trying to test me again? So, if I decide Isabella's on her own and this bet's a joke, you'll just let her sink? Your devotion to her is weird, but I can use that to my advantage.'

Michael's face stayed neutral, but inside, he was grinning.

Mason sighed, realizing his test had flopped again. Michael had dodged the question, and Mason had no answer.

"I can't afford to lose," Mason admitted. "Bianca is too dangerous. John would just keep getting played by her, dragging the family down. So, help Isabella when you need to."

With that, he lay back down. "I'm tired. I need to rest."

"Get well soon," Michael said respectfully, leaving the room.

Michael didn't bother with the lounge. The bet was between Mason and John. It had nothing to do with him.

Once outside the hospital, Michael called Jerry and filled him in on everything.

Jerry was shocked. "Sir, Mason was testing you! He must suspect something between you and Isabella. How should we help her now?"

Michael lit a cigarette, taking a deep drag. Isabella hated the smell of smoke in the house, so he tried to smoke outside whenever he could. He exhaled slowly, the smoke swirling around him.

"Stick to the plan... no, let's ramp it up. Help her even more. We have Mason's permission, after all." Michael's lips curled into a cold smile.

Who said hiding your intentions had to be subtle? A big, flashy distraction worked just as well.

Jerry nodded. "Got it. But it's weird. Why is Mason so concerned about Isabella? If it weren't for his push for her engagement to John, I'd almost think she's his granddaughter."

Michael rolled his eyes, feeling the same frustration. "I'm puzzled too. These old guys all have their secrets. You'll never get the truth out of them."

"Should we investigate?" Jerry suggested cautiously.

Michael thought for a moment, then shook his head. "Better not. Digging up dirt on those old men could kill them."

After giving Jerry his instructions, Michael headed home.

John still had to wait at the hospital for the lawyers.

Meanwhile, Bianca was at home, making a phone call.

"Jasper will be out of detention soon. If he refuses our offer to buy his shares, what's plan B? Maybe we can get rid of Jasper and Mia, then leak the story about Isabella trying to buy shares and getting rejected? That'll make everyone think she's guilty," Bianca suggested, thinking the idea was brilliant.

The voice on the other end of the line laughed coldly. "All you ever think about are these sneaky schemes. Do you really think rumors and public suspicion will bring Isabella down?"

Bianca scowled. "Then what do you suggest? Isn't my plan good? If we get rid of Jasper and Mia, Isabella would inherit their shares. She's publicly stated she wants nothing to do with them, so she wouldn't keep the shares. They'd go to other Taylors, making it easier for us to reclaim them."

The voice on the phone was scathing. "It's not that simple! Have you learned nothing from your past failures with Isabella? She could easily tell the media she's inheriting the shares to honor her grandfather's legacy. She's cutting ties with her parents, not her grandfather. It might draw some criticism, but it's a perfectly reasonable move."

Bianca bit her lip, unwilling to believe Isabella would outsmart her yet again. She still saw Isabella as the naive girl she once knew.

"Your idea was stupid, but it did give me a better one," the voice said, a hint of excitement creeping in.

Bianca was surprised. "What idea?"

"When Jasper and Mia get out, I'll arrange an attack on them. You and John will swoop in and 'rescue' them. This will create a sense of urgency. When you then offer to buy their shares, Jasper will likely agree," the voice explained.

Bianca's eyes lit up. "Perfect! This'll totally work! Let's go with it."

While the various factions were making their moves, another family had also noticed Jasper and Mia's impending release.

Paxton stood outside the ICU, his face grim as he watched Pearl suffer.

A subordinate approached. "Mr. Brown, we still haven't found Odette's killer. But there's speculation online that Isabella's mysterious husband might be involved. Our investigation suggests John's the one who leaked this information, but Mason was displeased and had the troll farm reported."

"So, the Williams Family is infighting?" Paxton's lips twisted into a smile.

The subordinate continued, "Also, the private detective you hired to follow Isabella reported that she visited Jasper in detention. Shortly after, Bianca and John also visited him. The detective bribed a guard and learned it was about the Taylor Family's shares."

Paxton's expression shifted. "The Taylor Family only has three failing companies left. Are they really worth investing in? Or is there some hidden value I'm unaware of?"

His eyes narrowed. The Browns had knocked the Taylors off their perch to become one of the top four. If the Taylors still had secrets, he wanted in on it.

"Order our people to keep a close watch on Jasper," Paxton commanded coldly.

###chapter 226 Plan for Jasper

Jasper sat in his cell, counting down the days. Soon, he'd be out of this detention center and living it up abroad as a wealthy man.

As for reviving the family legacy? Forget it. That family was a lost cause. If Bianca and John wanted to try, they could. It would be their funeral.

Jasper hummed a cheerful tune, his face a picture of smug satisfaction.

His cellmates, however, looked at him with nothing but disdain.

'Selling out your own daughter, what a scumbag,' they thought, but none dared voice it aloud.

Despite his family's decline, Jasper still had the clout of the wealthy elite, a class beyond the reach of these common prisoners.

To make a deal with Jasper, John had specifically instructed the guards in the detention center to protect him.

Therefore, despite the strong disdain for Jasper, his cellmates did not dare to lay a hand on him.

Meanwhile, Michael returned home from the hospital to find Isabella had dinner ready. The aroma of the food drew him straight to the bathroom to wash up before he joined her at the table.

As Isabella set the last dish down, she casually asked, "Did you sort out the company issue?"

Michael nodded. "Nothing major, just a missing document. These young folks, so careless. It was right on the desk, but he turned the office upside down looking for it."

He chuckled, mocking the young employee's carelessness.

Isabella smiled, not pressing for details.

"Hey, you're not exactly ancient yourself," she teased.

"Honey, I'm 30. That's practically middle-aged," Michael said, throwing his hands up in mock despair.

Isabella propped her chin on her hands, nodding seriously. "True. Even though I'm younger than you, I'm nearing 30. Once a woman hits that age, aging speeds up. I need to find ways to keep my beauty intact!"

"Science says women age faster without sex," Michael said with a sly grin.

Isabella blushed and glared at him. "Oh really? Does your brilliant science cover how long sex affects a woman's beauty?"

Michael's grin faltered, and he gave her a wounded look. "I haven't been slacking in that department."

Isabella raised an eyebrow. "You're on maintenance meds now; who knows what you'll need later."

Michael gripped his utensils in mock anger. "Just wait. Once I'm off these meds, I'll prove myself to you!"

Isabella licked her lips, giving him a sultry smile. "Looking forward to that."

Michael almost lost control, the urge to scoop her up and carry her to bed was almost too much.

But Isabella suddenly turned serious. "Alright, enough joking. We need to discuss something important. My father's getting out of detention soon. What's the plan?"

Michael's desire faded as he focused on the issue at hand. He had been thinking about this on his way home.

"Jasper has likely struck a deal with John. He's just holding off on signing the agreement because he's worried you might have evidence of his embezzlement. Once he's out, he'll sign the transfer agreement with John and be on a plane out of the country by the afternoon. So, we should target John instead," Michael said, narrowing his eyes.

Isabella looked at Michael with anticipation. "What do you have in mind?"

Michael started to speak but then paused, a mischievous grin spreading across his face. He pointed to his cheek and said, "Kiss me and say, 'Honey, you're amazing,' and I'll tell you my plan."

Isabella's hopeful look turned into a scowl.

"This is not the time for jokes," she snapped, slapping the table.

Michael leaned back, arms crossed, staring at her. "I am not joking. If you want the plan, you gotta pay up."

Rolling her eyes, Isabella stood, walked over to him, and cupped his face. She gave him a hard kiss on the lips.

"Honey, you're amazing. Now spill," she said through gritted teeth.

Michael winced as she squeezed his face. "Alright, alright. Can you let go? My face is hurting!"

Isabella snorted and released him, returning to her seat.

Rubbing his face, Michael said, "We can have someone pose as John's associate to pick Jasper up. They'll have him sign the prepared transfer agreement. After that, we'll show up and sign our names. How's that?"

Isabella listened intently but rolled her eyes at the end. "That's contract fraud. Even if we sign, my father won't honor it."

Michael shrugged. "The first part is solid. Once we have Jasper, we can take him to Mason. He'll get your father to hand over his shares."

Isabella blinked, considering his suggestion. "I'd rather not involve Mason. This is my family matter."

Michael sighed, standing and gently stroking her hair. "Honey, ever since John went against his grandpa, this isn't just about you and Bianca anymore. It started dragging the whole Williams family into it."

###chapter 227 Michael's Advice

After Michael's convincing pitch and some deep thinking, Isabella finally got on board with the plan.

At first, Isabella wanted to call Mason to fill him in, but Michael stopped her.

"Mason's in the hospital. At his age, he needs his rest. Calling him now might just stress him out. Let's wait until we have Jasper, then we can take him straight to Mason," Michael suggested.

Isabella nodded, seeing the logic in his words.

She was gonna do it herself, but Michael insisted on taking the lead.

"Reporters are all over you, and you're up against Bianca. John's probably keeping an eye on you too. It's better if I handle this. They don't know me, so it'll be easier," Michael said with a grin.

Isabella mulled it over and agreed it made sense.

Meanwhile, John met up with Bianca and spilled the beans about his bet with Mason.

"Sweetheart, I'm so touched you'd make such a big bet for me," Bianca said, her eyes tearing up.

Lying in bed with Bianca snuggled against him, John said coldly, "My grandfather told me not to use my resources to help you, but he underestimated me. I don't need money to help you. My reputation alone will make Jasper hand over the shares."

Bianca had been worried if John could really help, but his words put her at ease. Even if he couldn't help out in the open, he'd have her back behind the scenes.

"Thank you, darling. I'll make sure to show my gratitude," Bianca said with a seductive smile, then disappeared under the covers.

John soon let out a satisfied moan.

Everyone was gearing up for Jasper's release from the detention center.

Time flew by, and soon it was the day Jasper and Mia were to be released.

As the detention center gates swung open, Jasper and Mia stepped out into the sunlight, feeling a wave of relief.

Originally, netizens had been trashing Jasper and Mia, but after Odette's murder, everyone's focus shifted to the murder case, and no one paid attention to the couple who had harmed their daughter.

"Sweetie, you said John would buy your shares. When's he coming? We need to get out of here ASAP. I've already planned where we'll go next!" Mia said, her face lighting up with excitement.

Jasper looked at Mia, a strange look in his eyes.

"He should be here soon," he said, looking away.

Not long after, a black sedan pulled up. A young guy wearing sunglasses, Mike Runyon, rolled down the window and waved at them.

"Are you Mr. and Mrs. Taylor? Mr. Williams sent me to pick you up," Mike said with a friendly smile.

"Why didn't John come himself?" Jasper asked, feeling a bit miffed.

Mike shot Jasper a quick look of disdain but kept his smile. "Haven't you been keeping up with the news? Mr. Williams and Isabella are caught up in a murder case. Reporters are all over them. Do you really want Mr. Williams to bring the press here?"

Jasper and Mia exchanged confused glances. Clearly, something big had gone down while they were locked up.

"A murder case? Who got killed?" Mia asked, curious.

Mike started to answer, then thought better of it and pointed to the back seat. "Why don't you hop in the car first? We can talk on the way. It'll save time."

Realizing they were on a tight schedule, Mia and Jasper figured it was best to sign the contract, get the money, and get out of the country fast.

They quickly got into the back seat. As Mike started the car, he filled them in on what had happened.

"So, Bianca teamed up with Isabella's colleagues to mess with her, but Isabella found out and called the cops. One went nuts, the other died, and now the media thinks Isabella did it? Isabella didn't do it! She's changed, but she doesn't have the guts to kill. Her husband... that's a different story," Jasper said with a sneer.

Mia clung to Jasper's arm, nodding. "That jerk once tricked us into the countryside and tied us to a tree! He's a brute. He's probably the one who messed with Pearl, too."

Mia's motherly love had long since turned into resentment towards Isabella and Michael.

Mike glanced at the couple in the rearview mirror, a hint of contempt and coldness in his eyes.

Suddenly, a car sped up behind them and rammed into their vehicle.

Mike was startled, glaring at the car driving alongside them. He rolled down his window and shouted, "Are you blind? Watch where you're going!"

Jasper and Mia, curious, lowered their windows to see what was happening.

The car next to them also rolled down its window, and a man leaned out from the passenger seat, shouting, "Mr. Taylor, Mrs. Taylor! You've been tricked! We're the ones Mr. Williams sent. This guy is an imposter, sent by your daughter!"

Jasper and Mia's faces turned pale as they looked at Mike.

Mike quickly rolled up the window and said, "Don't listen to them! I'm with Mr. Williams! They're the fakes!"

###chapter 228 Who Are the Fakes?

Jasper and Mia were totally confused by the two drivers' conflicting stories. They had no clue who to trust.

Out of nowhere, Mia had a lightbulb moment. She grabbed Jasper's hand and said, "Babe, call John and ask him what the guy he sent looks like."

Jasper nodded and pulled out his phone.

Mike, the driver, smirked a bit.

Jasper's face dropped when he saw he had no signal.

"I can't call. No signal," he said, giving Mike a suspicious look.

Mike's face turned serious. "Damn it, it must be the car next to us! They must have a signal jammer! Mr. Taylor, Mrs. Taylor, hang on tight. I'm gonna speed up and lose these guys."

Mike slammed the gas pedal, and the car shot forward.

The car next to them sped up too, matching their pace. On the wide road, the two cars started a high-speed chase.

The people in the other car yelled at Mike, shouting to Jasper and Mia that they were the ones sent by John. But the roar of the engines and the wind drowned out their voices.

"Call Mr. Williams and ask what to do," the driver of the other car said urgently.

The guy in the passenger seat pulled out his phone, but his face fell. "Damn it! They have a signal jammer!"

"What do we do?" the driver asked, panic creeping in.

The passenger's face hardened. "Slow down and try to get out of the jamming range, but don't lose them."

"I'll try. Let's hope the jammer's range isn't too wide." The driver took a deep breath and slowed the car a bit.

When they were three car lengths behind, the passenger shouted excitedly, "Got a signal!"

He quickly dialed John's number. "Mr. Williams, someone's posing as us and has taken Jasper and Mia!"

John gripped his phone tightly, a vein throbbing in his forehead. He immediately suspected Isabella or Michael.

"Stay on them. Don't let them take Jasper and Mia away. I'm sending backup now!" John barked, then hung up and started coordinating reinforcements.

Meanwhile, Mike noticed the other car was still on their tail. He tapped the steering wheel lightly, and the signal jamming device turned off.

"Looks like we have a signal now. I'll call Mr. Williams," Mike said, pretending to be excited.

Jasper had planned to make the call himself, but hearing Mike's words, he decided to let Mike handle it.

Mike placed his phone on the dashboard and dialed a contact labeled "John." The call was answered after two rings.

"Did you get them?" a deep voice that sounded like John's asked.

"Yeah, Mr. Williams. We've got them, but there's another group pretending to be us. They claim to be your people and are trying to take Mr. and Mrs. Taylor. I think they might be sent by Isabella," Mike said seriously.

"I understand. I'll send more support. Make sure Mr. and Mrs. Taylor are safe," the voice on the phone replied.

"Yes, sir!" Mike responded loudly.

After the call ended, Jasper couldn't shake the feeling that something was off. He turned to Mia and whispered, "Do you feel like something's weird?"

Mia shook her head. "No. Why?"

Jasper hesitated, then shook his head. He couldn't pinpoint what was bothering him; it was like a cloud over his mind.

Meanwhile, Michael was lounging in a chair with his eyes closed, surrounded by his subordinates waiting for orders.

A subordinate approached him after finishing a call.

"Mr. Williams, Mike reported that John's men have shown up. They might have figured out our plan," the subordinate said in a voice eerily similar to John's.

Michael opened his eyes and waved a hand. "Stick to the plan."

The subordinates nodded and hurried out, jumping into cars and speeding towards Jasper and Mia's location.

Just then, Jerry rushed in. "Mr. Williams, we just heard-John's got a whole army on the move!"

Michael nodded. "I expected as much."

Jerry continued, "But there's something odd about Bianca. She's going off on her own, not sticking with John."

Michael's eyes widened slightly. "Bianca isn't with John?"

Jerry shook his head. "No. She split from John; our team saw it. She's been acting all paranoid, always looking behind her. She'd have lost them if our trackers weren't pros."

"Get to the point. What did she do after separating from John?" Michael asked, narrowing his eyes.

"She met up with a bunch of people who were all real respectful. They talked about something in the development area, but our guy couldn't get close enough to hear. Then they all took off in cars. Our tracker thinks they might be packing heat," Jerry explained.

Michael drummed his fingers on the armrest. "Did our people follow them?"

Jerry shook his head regretfully. "No, the tracker was alone, and the group had strong counter-surveillance measures. To avoid detection, I told him to keep on Bianca's tail."

###chapter 229 Jasper's Suspicion

Michael listened closely to Jerry's report, his eyes narrowing as he mentally mapped out the city.

Michael's eyes snapped open. "If I'm not mistaken, Jasper and Mia should be getting close to the development area, right?"

Jerry quickly checked the map on his phone and nodded. "Yeah, it's on their route."

Michael's brow furrowed in thought. He couldn't quite figure out Bianca's endgame with these armed men.

"Jerry, what do you think those people are after?" Michael asked.

Jerry paused, frowning as he thought it over. "Those guys have guns. Maybe they're here to kill Jasper and Mia? But it doesn't make sense. If that couple died, Bianca wouldn't get their shares. According to inheritance laws, Mrs. Williams would inherit their shares directly."

Michael's eyes narrowed even more. "Exactly! Isabella would inherit the shares. Bianca wants to stop Isabella from getting them!"

Jerry's eyes widened. "You mean Bianca plans to take out Mrs. Williams?"

Michael rolled his eyes. "Think it through, Jerry. Bianca doesn't need to actually kill Jasper and Mia. She could frame Isabella for trying to kill them, then play the hero and rescue them. Jasper'd probably hand over the shares then."

"That's wicked smart. No way a woman came up with that, right?" Jerry said, surprised.

"Never underestimate a woman, Jerry. There have been plenty of smart women in politics. It's interesting - Bianca's got some hidden allies we didn't know about. Think John knows about them?" Michael smirked.

Jerry shook his head. "I have no idea."

Michael's smile turned cold. "I bet John has no clue about them. They might have been the ones who took out Odette."

"Should we capture these people?" Jerry asked.

Michael squinted. "They framed my wife, so why not frame them back? Go find me a knife"

After Michael laid out his plan, Jerry's eyes widened, but he didn't question it and quickly went to carry out the orders.

Once Jerry left, Michael called another subordinate. "If you encounter armed thugs, retreat immediately. Let John's men deal with them."

With that, Michael hung up, confident his subordinates would execute his orders perfectly.

Meanwhile, Mike, who was driving, received the latest instructions through his earpiece. He was curious about the unexpected third party but knew it wasn't his concern. His job was to follow orders.

"How much longer until we get there? That car is still tailing us. When will John's backup arrive?" Jasper asked, glancing anxiously at the rearview mirror.

Mike tapped the steering wheel, his face serious. "They should be on their way. Just hang tight."

"Patience is the last thing I have right now!" Jasper's unease was growing. He decided to call John to speed things up.

Mike frowned as Jasper pulled out his phone, thinking about reactivating the signal jammer. But then he spotted something ahead.

"Our backup's here," Mike said loudly, pointing through the windshield.

Jasper and Mia saw several black sedans approaching. One of them maneuvered behind their car, blocking the pursuers. The rest of the convoy surrounded them, continuing to drive.

Jasper and Mia sighed in relief. With all these guards around, they felt more secure and were anticipating to meet John."

However, as the convoy entered the development area and approached an intersection, another line of black cars appeared, blocking their path.

Mike slammed on the brakes to avoid a collision.

A group of men wielding clubs emerged from the opposing cars. Mike's expression turned steely as he retrieved a baton from under his seat.

"Mr. Taylor, Mrs. Taylor, we're in trouble. Stay in the car; it's the safest place," Mike instructed before exiting the vehicle.

Jasper and Mia felt a surge of panic, especially Mia, who was trembling with fear.

"Are these Isabella's people? Or her husband's? Damn it, are they trying to kill us?" Mia screamed in terror.

"Shut up! Damn it, I should've seen this coming. If they kill us, she will inherit our shares!" Jasper's face was grim.

Mia looked shocked. "But Isabella severed ties with us, didn't she?"

Jasper sneered. "So what? She still has the inheritance right! Looks like she's gone totally heartless and shameless!"

Convinced that the attackers were sent by Isabella, Jasper and Mia locked themselves in the car.

Outside, Mike faced the approaching thugs, smirking coldly. "Looks like we all have the same goal."

One of the thugs snarled, "We're here on Mr. Williams' orders to take Mr. and Mrs. Taylor. Back off if you don't want to die."

Mike nonchalantly picked his nose and flicked the booger onto the man's polished shoe. "Don't try to scare me. We work for the real Mr. Williams. Who the hell are you?"

The man's face twisted with fury at the insult, his patience snapping. "Take them down! Grab Jasper and Mia!"

He raised his club and charged, followed by his men.

"Show these bastards what we're made of!" Mike yelled, raising his baton and rushing forward.

Chaos erupted as the two groups clashed, the sound of metal striking metal filling the air. The expressions on every face were fierce, and no one held back.

###chapter 230 The Sudden Gunshot

Inside the car, Mia covered her ears, shaking with fear, while Jasper's face went white as a sheet. Even though they were hiding, the sounds of metal clashing and people screaming outside were terrifying.

"Are we gonna make it out alive today?" Mia asked, her voice trembling.

Jasper, suddenly struck by an idea, pulled out his phone to call the cops. Maybe with the police around, they'd be safe for a bit.

But Mike had already activated a signal jammer before getting out of the car. Jasper looked at the blocked signal on his phone and cursed under his breath.

"These damn bastards! We need to get out of the car and find a place with a signal to call for help," Jasper said through gritted teeth.

"Are you nuts? Going out there could get us killed!" Mia screamed, not willing to take the risk.
