Mia hesitated, still thinking staying in the car was the safest bet.

Jasper, determined, reached for the door handle, ready to yank it open. Just then, a guy in a black suit ran up and tried to open Jasper's door. Scared the crap out of both of them.

"Damn it, the door's locked," the guy muttered angrily, then raised his club and smashed it against the window.

Jasper and Mia huddled together, trembling as the window shattered.

Just when they thought they were about to be attacked, they heard the guy outside shout, "Mr. Taylor, get out! We're Mr. Williams' people!"

Jasper and Mia were stunned, but before they could process what was happening, Mike swung his baton and struck the guy.

"Idiot, do you think we'd buy that crap? We're the ones Mr. Williams sent," Mike fumed.

Just as Mike finished speaking, he got kicked from behind, sending him sprawling to the ground.

"You're the fakes! I can call Mr. Williams right now!" The guy who had just kicked Mike down held up his phone, putting it on speaker. John's voice boomed out from the device.

"The men in black suits are my real subordinates. Mr. Taylor, don't be fooled!" John shouted angrily from the other end.

But Mike quickly scrambled to his feet and swung his baton, knocking the phone out of the guy's hand. "You morons! Do you really think Mr. Taylor would fall for your tricks? With AI tech so advanced now, voices can be faked, faces can be faked-everything can be faked!" Mike furiously leaped onto the guy in the black suit, punching him square in the nose.

Mia and Jasper were completely bewildered.

Mia clutched Jasper's hand, her voice shaky with urgency. "Honey, who do we trust? The driver was right-voices can be faked. We can't tell who are really John's men."

Suddenly, a thought hit Jasper. He glanced at his phone's screen, which showed no signal. His face went pale. "Wait a minute, if there's no signal, how did John's call come through?"

The guy in the black suit threw Mike off and shouted, "My phone is interference-proof! It's not affected by signal jammers! Mr. Taylor, you have to believe me!"

Jasper was thoroughly confused, his mind spinning. He couldn't decide whom to trust.

Desperate, Jasper jumped out of the car and shouted, "Everyone stop fighting now!"

Though he yelled as loudly as he could, the fighters were too engrossed to listen.

Frustrated, Jasper climbed onto the car roof, waving his arms and shouting, "Whoever stops first, I'll go with them!"

Instantly, the fighting ceased, and the scene fell silent.

The fighters paused, considering Jasper's ultimatum.

Jasper didn't want John to come here; John was constantly followed by reporters who might show up. But Jasper had no choice. He needed to see John in person to sell his shares.

After making his announcement, Jasper jumped down and re-entered the car, ready to wait for John.

John's subordinates smirked. "You're done for. We're the ones who can bring Mr. Williams here!"

Mike and his men also smirked. "Keep dreaming! I'd like to see how you're gonna magic Mr. Williams here."

Mike pressed his earpiece, waiting for the armed men Michael mentioned to arrive.

Inside the car, Mia looked at Jasper with admiration. "Dear, you were amazing! They really stopped fighting. Now we just have to wait for John to arrive, and we'll be safe."

Jasper smiled smugly. "I didn't get where I am by being stupid! When John gets here, I'm going to give him a piece of my mind. How could he mess up something so simple and almost let impostors fool us? Unbelievable!"

Just as Jasper was about to continue boasting, a gunshot rang out, followed by the sound of shattering glass.

The bullet smashed through the front windshield of their car, embedding itself in the seat right between Jasper and Mia.

They stared at the bullet hole, cold sweat dripping from their foreheads.

Outside, upon hearing the gunshot, Mike signaled his men to retreat immediately.

###chapter 231 Intense Firefight

Mike and his crew knew right away it was Bianca's gang when they heard the gunshots. So, Mike quickly ordered everyone to fall back.

But before they bailed, Mike and his team decided to mess with them a bit.

"Mr. Williams' backup is here! Let's get out of here, and make sure the injured get to the hospital ASAP," Mike shouted. The wounded were then dragged away by their buddies, heading off in another direction.

Seeing them leave, the guys in black suits looked confused.

"Damn it, we work for the same family! How dare you use guns!" the leader of the black suits cursed.

Soon after, a bunch of masked dudes showed up, confused by the black suits' presence.

"Mr. Bales, nobody told us there'd be this many people," one thug said to Daron Bales, who was rocking a floral shirt.

Daron was just as puzzled. Bianca had only mentioned grabbing Jasper and Mia for a staged rescue, not that there'd be so many people.

"Mr. Bales, Jasper and Mia are over there," a thug pointed to a black car.

The car window was smashed, and inside were the terrified Jasper and Mia.

Daron didn't jump into action right away, sensing something was off with all these unexpected people around.

As Daron hesitated, he noticed the black suits slowly surrounding them.

"Damn it, what do you want?" Daron shouted, raising his gun, and his crew followed suit.

"Think you're the only ones packing?"  A few of the guys in suits flashed their own guns.

Both sides had their guns drawn, but no one dared to shoot.

Daron and his guys didn't want to start shooting-it wasn't worth it. Bianca hadn't paid them enough.

The black suits hesitated too, wondering if the others were Michael's men.

The standoff dragged on, with Jasper and Mia clinging to each other, shaking.

A sudden idea struck Daron. Bianca had told them to frame Isabella for the murders.

So Daron yelled at the black suits, "You better back off! We got orders from Isabella to kill Jasper and Mia!"

Jasper and Mia, huddled together, shook even more.

"They really came to kill us! Damn Isabella, we're her parents!" Mia cried, tears streaming down her face.

Jasper gritted his teeth and growled, "No one's trustworthy. Money and power-they wipe out everything, even family."

John's men were confused, wondering if the other side had the wrong story.

Both sides had been claiming the other was faking, each saying they were John's men.

But out of the blue, someone from the other side said they were killing for Isabella.

This whole mess left John's men even more puzzled.

"So, the mask's off, huh? We work for Mr. Williams. Get out of here before we lose our patience. If we find out who you really are, you'll be wishing you'd never set foot in this city, let alone this country," one of John's men shot back coldly.

Daron let out a sigh of relief; he'd already fired a shot. Through the shattered car window, he could see Jasper and Mia looking terrified. As long as they stuck to the script, pretended to be scared of John's power, and then retreated, everything would be fine.

"Well, in that case..." Daron started to say, but was cut off by a sudden gunshot from behind.

One of the black suits got hit in the shoulder, screamed, and dropped to the ground.

"Damn it, who fired that shot?" Daron roared, glaring at his henchmen.

But then one of the black suits on the other side yelled, "These idiots shot at us! Everyone, open fire and take them down!"

Daron didn't have time to figure out who the idiot was that fired the shot. He ducked for cover, pulling out his gun to return fire.

In an instant, a fierce gunfight broke out between Bianca's crew and John's men.

Meanwhile, Mike was hiding in an abandoned factory, watching the chaos below through binoculars.

"Fight, the crazier the better. I hope you all blow each other's brains out," Mike muttered with a twisted grin.

At that moment, two of his guys snuck up behind the factory and approached Mike and his group.

"Mr. Runyon, we did it. We got them fighting!" one of them said, grinning and holding a gun.

If those two gangs could hear these guys, they'd know these two started the whole damn thing with their shooting and yelling.

Mike nodded, satisfied. "Good job, guys. The crazier it gets, the better our chances to pull off the next part of the plan."

By now, Jasper and Mia had gotten out of the car. Not because they suddenly found the courage to face the gunfight, but because the car was no protection against bullets.

Those movie scenes where characters hide behind cars while bullets harmlessly bounce off? Total BS.

Someone once tested it-shot at a car, and the bullets went right through the door. Anyone hiding behind it would get hit.

Unless they hid behind the engine; a solid engine could actually stop bullets.

Jasper and Mia didn't know this at first. They were just hiding behind the car until a bullet hole appeared in the door next to them, shattering their movie-inspired illusion.

"Darling, what do we do now?" Mia asked, tears streaming down her face.

"Enough, stop crying. Now's not the time for tears. We need to find a place to hide and wait for John," Jasper said, gritting his teeth and scanning the area. He finally spotted an abandoned building.

Mike, peeping through his binoculars, suddenly frowned.

"What the heck? Where'd all these people come from?" he muttered, eyebrows knit in confusion as he spotted the unexpected arrivals.

###chapter 232 The Fourth Power

Michael was waiting for a call when his phone buzzed. It was Mike.

"Wait, what? A fourth group just showed up?" Michael's eyebrows shot up, his mind racing.

"Could it be Mason's crew?" Michael immediately thought Mason might have sent them to keep tabs on him.

But Mike quickly shot down that idea.

"Mr. Williams, from what we can tell, this group might be from the Brown Family," Mike said.

"The Brown Family? Paxton's people?" Michael was stunned.

He hadn't even considered that. In his mind, Paxton and his gang had no reason to be here.

"Yeah, it's Paxton's people. Paxton's been digging for info on you and Mrs. Williams. We've run into his guys a few times, so we recognize some of them," Mike explained.

Michael thought it over but couldn't figure out why Paxton would send people here. If Paxton was after Isabella because of Odette's death, he should be looking into Isabella, not her parents, who she had already cut ties with.

Maybe Paxton thought Isabella's family had some hidden secrets and wanted to dig them up. That would make sense.

But none of that mattered now.

A cold, calculating smile crept across Michael's face as he glanced at a clear bag next to him, holding a boning knife. The knife gleamed menacingly in the sunlight, with faint traces of blood on the handle.

"Find a way to drag Paxton's people into this mess. I'll send you something. You have to make sure this thing ends up on Bianca's people and gets found by Paxton's people," Michael instructed over the phone.

Even though Michael's plan sounded complicated, Mike agreed.

The gunfire between the two sides had started to die down. They were running low on bullets after the initial intense shootout.

The gunfire at the scene was getting sporadic. John's crew had the upper hand with their numbers and were closing in on Bianca's group.

"Mr. Bales, what do we do now? We're almost out of bullets, and three of our guys are already dead," a thug nervously asked Daron.

Daron's face twisted with anger. They hadn't been told there'd be such heavy gunfire when they took this job.

"That bitch Bianca's gonna get us all killed!" Daron muttered under his breath.

Daron found the guy's behavior a bit suspicious, not remembering his name. But right now, escaping was the priority. Daron didn't have time to worry about it, so he led the thugs to break through in the direction the guy pointed.

Mike watched the chaos through his binoculars, a cold smile creeping across his face.

"Did you all get into your new threads?" Mike asked, checking them out. They were mirror images of John's crew, all decked out in black suits.

Paxton's guys were supposed to be tracking Jasper and Mia, but the gunfire had them stopping in their tracks.

"What do we do now? Sounds like a shootout. Should we check it out?" one of them asked, unsure.

Paxton's crew exchanged looks and decided to wait until the shooting stopped before sneaking in to investigate.

The incident starkly revealed the differences in training and effectiveness among the four families' crews.

John's men were well-trained and took pride in their work. They wouldn't let themselves be humiliated. Their main job was to grab Jasper and Mia, but they also had a team hunting down the thugs, all for family honor.

Paxton's guys, on the other hand, were more about looking out for themselves. They didn't measure up to the long-established families.

"Hey, you notice the gunfire's getting closer?" one of Paxton's men frowned.

They all looked at each other, feeling uneasy.

Then, the sound of heavy footsteps got louder and closer.

Before they knew it, a bunch of armed thugs in floral shirts appeared in front of them.

Both groups stared at each other, momentarily confused.

Paxton's men instinctively reached for their guns.

Daron shouted angrily, "We were supposed to have lost the pursuers! Where the hell did these guys come from?"

###chapter 233 Three-Way Battle!

When Daron let out that roar, Paxton's crew quickly figured out he had the wrong idea.

One of them was about to step up and explain they were just passing through.

But then, out of nowhere, a gunshot echoed from behind the thugs, hitting one of Paxton's guys.

Over in the abandoned factory, Jasper and Mia were running for their lives, dodging through old equipment and empty rooms. It felt like they were the prey in some twisted hunting game.

To make things worse, two men in black suits were closing in.

"Help me!" Mia cried, reaching out to Jasper.

But Jasper, with only a quick glance back, turned and ran, leaving her behind.

###chapter 234 You Smell So Good

Mia's heart was shattered; she couldn't believe her husband had just up and left her.

"Jasper, you jerk! Get back here, now!" Mia screamed, reaching out helplessly.

Two guys in black suits were lurking nearby, hiding around the corner, hesitant to show themselves.

"What do we do now? We were supposed to act like we were chasing them, but now she's just lying there. How do we keep this up?" one of the men whispered to his buddy.

The other guy hesitated, then called Mike. "Mr. Runyon, we've got a situation. Jasper ditched his wife and took off. Should we split up to track them?"

Mike frowned and replied, "Stall for a bit, don't rush. Capture Mia, but make sure she has a chance to escape. The main character hasn't shown up yet!"

The main character Mike was talking about was Isabella. She got a call from Michael, called the cops, and was on her way with them.

After getting Mike's orders, the two guys knew what to do.

They pretended to stumble upon Mia and started shooting in her direction.

Terrified, Mia, despite her pain, forced herself up and kept running. She found a room to hide in, covering herself with old cardboard, hoping it would keep her safe.

When the two men entered the room, they saw a piece of clothing sticking out from the cardboard and exchanged a look.

The TV in the living room flickered, its sound just a background hum. Isabella's mind was elsewhere, seeking distraction in the ambient noise.

Michael walked to the coffee maker, brewed two cups, and brought them over.

"Honey, have some coffee," Michael said, placing a cup in front of Isabella.

"Thanks," Isabella replied with a faint smile, lifting the cup to her lips and sipping slowly.

"You know, you used to be so confident. But now, I don't see that confidence on your face," Michael teased, wrapping an arm around her.

Isabella gave a bitter smile. "I was confident before, but my father's sudden appearance threw me off. Now I get it-plans never keep up with changes."

Isabella furrowed her brows slightly. "I'm sorry, hon. From what I remember, my dad's always been at the company or the villa. I've been abroad for so long, so I don't really know if he has any other places around here."

As Isabella spoke, she suddenly paused, thinking of her mother, Mia. Mia had been with Jasper and probably knew more about him than she did.

"Mom, I need you to tell me where Dad might be hiding. It's really important to us." Isabella stared at Mia intently.

Mia was surprisingly calm. After her husband's betrayal and her own betrayal of him, a strange peace had settled over her. She didn't crave much anymore-just enough money to get by after she got out.

"My dear daughter, I can help you with this, but what's it worth to you?" Mia asked, a sly smile playing on her lips.

Isabella furrowed her brows. "I hired a lawyer for you, paid your fine, what else do you want from me?"

Mia threw her hands up. "I want money, not a ton, just ten million bucks! If the info I give you really helps you nab your dad, then you gotta pay me that reward!"

"Are you out of your mind? How on earth am I supposed to rustle up ten million bucks for you?" Isabella sprang from her chair, her anger reaching a boiling point. She had barely scraped together three million over the years.

Michael, on the other hand, stayed calm and nodded. "Alright, if your info really leads us to Jasper, I can give you ten million."

Isabella turned to Michael, her eyes wide with shock.

Mia gave Michael a frosty look, her voice laced with skepticism. "Why should I trust you? I don't recall you swimming in cash."

"I'm richer than you think. I can wire the ten million straight to you." Michael pulled out his phone and started tapping away.

A few moments later, he showed the screen to Mia.

Mia's eyes widened a bit when she saw the transfer interface. The bank card on the screen was hers, and it showed a deposit of five million dollars.

"That's five million as a down payment. You'll get the other five million once we catch Jasper," Michael said casually, shrugging like it was no big deal.

A smile spread across Mia's face. "It seems I underestimated you. Alright, give me a sec to think about where Jasper might be."

She closed her eyes, her brow knitting in concentration.

Minutes ticked by, the silence growing heavy, even testing Isabella's patience. Then, suddenly, Mia's eyes flew open.

"I got it! Moonlit Lounge. That's probably where your dad is!" Mia rattled off the address to Isabella.

Isabella frowned. "How come I never knew my dad was still into the bar scene?"

Mia chuckled and shrugged. "There's a lot you don't know. Back when your dad was in college, he was a total hippie, always messing around. He and some buddies started a band, and their first gig was at Moonlit Lounge. He loved that place so much he ended up buying it. But it's way out in the sticks, so not many people go there, and it kinda fell apart over time. I haven't heard him talk about it in years, but whenever he's feeling down, he heads there to chill. Middle-aged guys, you know, they've got their own ways of dealing with stuff."

While Mia was talking, Michael had already pulled up the location of Moonlit Lounge on his phone.

"Babe, I found it. Let's roll." Michael grabbed Isabella's hand, and they left the room."

Mia watched the two leave and called out from behind, "Hey, don't forget our deal! If you really find Jasper, make sure I get the rest of that five million dollars."

Once Isabella and Michael were in the car, Isabella turned to Michael with a puzzled look. "Where'd you get five million dollars from?"

Michael grinned. "I got it from my dad! He can easily come up with not just five million, but even fifty million if he wanted to."

Isabella looked like she wanted to say something, but she just sighed. "I really don't want your dad getting mixed up in this."

Michael gently patted her head. "If you wanna pay him back, just give him a grandson soon."

###chapter 259 Body Double

###chapter 260 Battle!

###chapter 261 Hide and Watch

Inside the bar.

John walked into the Moonlit Lounge. Despite its weathered exterior, the interior was remarkably clean. The vintage tables and chairs, though old, were neatly arranged, evoking a sense of a past era.

Two bodyguards flanked John, their eyes vigilant, scanning the dimly lit room.

John approached the counter but didn't touch the glass. Instead, he took two copies of the contract from the bodyguards.

John's laughter held no amusement. "You're asking me for money? You embezzled vast sums of public funds, and now your only concern is escaping the country to enjoy your ill-gotten gains. And you dare to ask me for money?"

Jasper's smile was faint, almost imperceptible. "No one would complain about having too much money, right? Mr. Williams. Greed is the most human of traits."

Jasper tapped his temple lightly, the gesture laden with unspoken meaning.

Just then, things took an unexpected turn.

###chapter 262 Hit Me? Dare You.

###chapter 263 Escalation of War

"From a strategic standpoint, it doesn't make sense for Paxton to mess with us right now. But if there's a bigger payoff, he might go for it. Still, I can't wrap my head around what that could be." John turned to Michael, hoping for some insight.

Michael, ever composed, said, "There's a rumor going around the Brown Family that the old leader of the Taylor Family left behind a secret before he died, something that could bring the family back to its former glory. Paxton wants to uncover this secret, so he sent his guys to grab Jasper."

"Is Paxton out of his mind? If the Taylor Family had something like that, Jasper would've used it by now. Why would he be skimming off the top?" John found the idea ridiculous, not worth taking seriously.

But as he noticed Mason's serious expression, a chill ran down his spine. 

The smile vanished from John's face, replaced by sheer disbelief. "Grandpa, is it true? Does the Taylor Family really have something like that?"

Mason let out a deep sigh. "Yeah, the Taylor Family's got some serious power, hidden away by the old head before he passed. Why Jasper hasn't tapped into it yet, I have no clue. Maybe there's some kind of catch."

Michael's face turned serious too. He'd heard Isabella drop hints about her family's secrets, but hearing it from Mason was a whole different story. He was totally blown away.

###chapter 270 Michael's New Plan

John pondered the situation, considering the current circumstances.

"If Isabella's grandfather left such a substantial legacy, and the current head of the family can't get to it, it probably means someone else is holding it. It's not that Jasper is unwilling to use it; rather, those who control it believe he's not strong or intelligent enough to handle it. They're afraid he'll blow the family fortune, so they refuse to recognize his authority," John speculated, his eyes narrowing with a mix of intrigue and suspicion.

In the past, John had always looked down on the three companies of the Taylor Family, but now he had to reassess his opinion.

"The Taylor Family's legacy can probably only be used by someone from within the family. If what John says is true and the legacy is in someone's hands, then the only ones in the family who could compete for it are Isabella and Bianca," Michael analyzed thoughtfully.

All of John's moves just now were just tests. He needed to confirm Michael knew nothing of the deal between Mike and him.

'Looks like Michael really doesn't know about this. Perfect. Once I strike a deal with Mike, I'll have leverage over him and can use it to keep tabs on Michael!' John thought, a sinister smile spreading across his lips.

"Hey, Mr. Williams, why are you so happy?" Jerry, the driver, asked, glancing in the rearview mirror.

Michael rubbed his chin, eyes narrowing in thought.

Jerry stayed quiet, focusing on driving and giving Michael the space to think.

After a few minutes, Michael's eyes snapped open, his decision made. "Jerry, get someone to contact this guy. If we can bribe him and get him on our side, great. If he refuses, then take him out and assume his identity," Michael said calmly.

Jerry, skilled at reading Michael's intentions, nodded. "Mr. Williams, you think Jasper will keep using this phone after he wakes up?" Jerry asked, curious.

Michael nodded with a cold smile, "Honestly, I doubt Jasper will even call, or even wake up. But if we play our cards right, this could be useful later. I'm curious where he's been hiding the embezzled money."

Jerry caught a glimpse of Michael's expression in the rearview mirror and felt a chill run down his spine.

'The environment back home is just too cushy. John, raised in the lap of luxury, is like a fragile flower in a greenhouse. But Michael, he's like a weed that thrives in the toughest conditions, growing strong despite the wind and snow. How can John even begin to compete with Michael?' Jerry felt a pang of sympathy for John at that moment.

###chapter 271 Mike's Acting

In a sky-high restaurant, John sat by the window, sipping coffee.

Two bodyguards flanked John, their eyes scanning the room with unwavering vigilance. When a waiter approached to offer assistance, they were promptly waved away by the bodyguards.

John's smile softened, but his eyes remained cold. "Nothing dangerous. Just keep me in the loop if my uncle makes any moves. That's all."

"You call this simple? Do you have any idea how terrifying your uncle is? This is the most dangerous job ever! If he finds out I teamed up with you behind his back, I'm dead meat. He'll throw me in a gas drum, fill it with cement, and dump me in the ocean!" Mike's voice shook as he grabbed John's collar.

The two bodyguards immediately stepped forward, grabbed Mike, and tossed him out.

John straightened his collar and adjusted his appearance.

He looked down at Mike, now sprawled on the ground, and spoke with an icy calmness, "If you don't agree, you'll be swimming with the fishes soon. But if you do, at least I can protect you."

Mike sat on the ground, glaring at John. "I was a fool to think the heir of a big family would be someone decent."

John sat back in his chair and replied, "I can let that insult slide, but now tell me, what's your choice?"

Mike struggled with his expression while sitting on the ground, and finally let out a weary sigh. "Do I have any other choice? You're all a bunch of ruthless bastards."

With another sigh, Mike got up from the ground. "Fine, I'll do it. But you better keep your word and bail me out if things go sideways."

John nodded slightly. "Don't worry, I still got a little decency, and besides, you did save my life once."

"Bet John's checking those fingerprints right now. Like cautious Michael would leave such an obvious mistake!" Mike's face twisted into a cold smile.

###chapter 272 Jerry's Bad News

###chapter 273 Isabella's Confidence

###chapter 274 Despicable Jasper

"My family was destitute when I was young," Carol explained briefly. "A serious illness nearly killed me, but your grandfather's charity saved my life, paid for my treatment, and even sent me to school. I joined this company to repay him."

Isabella could only tentatively accept the story, lacking the means to verify it.

Carol held up two fingers and said, "Alright, to answer your second question, what's the deal with this ring?"

Isabella leaned in, her curiosity piqued. This was the answer she was dying to hear.

"This ring is a symbol of authority. Only with this ring can you command people like me," Carol explained, almost making Isabella leap off the couch in surprise.

"Wait, what? Are you saying my grandfather set up a bunch of people like you in secret? Why would he do that?" Isabella pressed, her voice rising.

Carol shook her head, a hint of frustration in her eyes. "I can only tell you that, yes, your grandfather did arrange for many people like me to stay hidden. But we don't know each other. As for why he did this, that brings us to your third question."

Carol held up three fingers and let out a soft sigh. "Honestly, I don't know why your grandfather did it. When I met him, he was dead serious. He gave me the ring and said that whoever reclaimed it after the family's downfall would be the key to the family's revival."

Isabella shot up from the couch, her lips trembling as a wild thought crossed her mind.

"Are you saying my grandfather caused the family's downfall?" Isabella's voice shook with shock.

Carol pursed her lips and nodded. "I don't have hard evidence, but it's not hard to figure out. Your dad might seem clueless in business, but for one of the top four families, the way the Taylor Family fell apart was just too quick. It doesn't add up."

Isabella took a deep breath, leaned back on the couch, and asked seriously, "What else do you know?"

Carol rubbed her forehead, looking unsure. "Honestly, I think your grandpa was trying to dodge some big disaster. Maybe tanking the family was his way of avoiding it."

Isabella squinted, struggling to believe there could be a force strong enough to make a powerful family at its peak take such drastic measures to survive.

Not even the powerful Williams Family could have had that kind of influence.

Carol glanced at Isabella, who was sitting quietly with her head down, and asked with a gentle smile, "Got any other questions?"

Isabella shook her head. "If that's all you know, then I'm good for now. I'll hit you up if I think of anything else later."

Isabella stayed seated, taking deep breaths to calm herself. The information was a lot to take in; she needed time to process everything.

Carol pulled out a business card and handed it to Isabella. "Here's my card with my number. When you're ready, give me a call."

Isabella nodded, took Carol's business card, and just as she was about to leave, Carol stopped her again.

"Hey, just so you know, while those leverage tactics might work on some greedy folks, there are others who won't budge so easy. You might need some cash to sweeten the deal. You got enough funds on your end?" Carol asked, sounding concerned.

Isabella turned back, tilting her head slightly. "Are you saying you have a lot of money? Did my grandfather give you a bunch too?"

A spark lit up in Isabella's eyes; she was desperate for money.

Carol gave a wry smile and shook her head. "No, your grandfather didn't give me any money. What I mean is, if you need some, I can lend you a bit. I've saved up quite a bit over the years. Of course, once you take full control of the company and start making money, you'll have to pay me back. As for whether your grandpa left money with someone else, that's probably true, but I really don't know the details."

A flicker of disappointment crossed Isabella's face. "No, thanks. I've got money too."

###chapter 276 Isabella's Concerns

Isabella thought Carol had her grandfather Patrick Taylor's money, but she didn't expect Carol just wanted to lend her some.

A couple of days ago, Isabella would've been sweating the share buyouts and probably been short on cash. But she got John's bank card from Jasper, and now she had plenty of money.

After leaving the company, Isabella headed home, her mind racing the whole way.

At home, Michael had prepared some desserts for Isabella because he knew she wouldn't become a major shareholder today.

Just as Michael completed the last dessert, Isabella walked in, looking disheveled. She tossed her coat and handbag on the sofa and collapsed onto it, clearly exhausted.

"Michael, you wouldn't believe the day I had at the company," Isabella said, her voice heavy with frustration as she rubbed her forehead.

Michael, though he had a pretty good idea of what she went through, played along. "What happened, babe? Tell me all about it."

Carrying a plate of cake and a cup of coffee, Michael walked over, set the treats down, and sat next to Isabella, gently massaging her forehead.

Isabella let out a heavy sigh, the weight of her father's schemes bearing down on her. "You wouldn't believe how my dad played us all. He sold forty percent of the shares to other companies before selling all of his shares to John. Now I've gotta fight for John's shares and the ones those minority shares. Whoever controls those minority shares will become the second-largest shareholder of the company."

Her frustration was palpable as she ran her fingers through her hair, her grievances against Jasper clear.

Michael chuckled, "So, my dear wife, you're worried about how to get those shares from the minority shareholders?"

His tone shifted to a more serious note. "But you're right to be concerned. Even though you got a lot of money from John, he might have more and can offer better deals. Unless you borrow money from Mason."

"Or I could just threaten them with their weaknesses. But I'm not too thrilled about that idea," Isabella's unexpected suggestion caught Michael off guard.

Michael quickly realized something else had happened to Isabella.

Pointing to the bag beside her, Isabella said, "Honey, I've got a surprise for you. Check out what's inside the bag."

"Did you get me a new razor? Now that you mention it, I do need a shave," Michael said with a grin as he opened the bag.

Isabella sat up from the sofa, wrapping her arms around Michael's neck and planting a kiss on his chin. "Why do you wanna shave? I think you look hotter with a bit of stubble."

Michael's smile faded as he looked through the documents.

"Are these the dirt on those minority shareholders? Where'd you get this stuff?" Michael's voice was serious, his eyes wide with surprise.

Michael knew Jasper had shares held by those minority shareholders, but his investigation had just started, and he hadn't gathered any intel yet.

Pointing to the papers in Michael's hand, Isabella said just as seriously, "This is what I wanted to tell you. You'd never guess my grandfather left me a loyal supporter in that company."

Isabella spilled everything about her and Carol to Michael.

Even though Michael seemed like just another mid-level employee, his sharp mind could help her figure out a lot.

Michael rubbed his stubbled chin thoughtfully and said, "In this world, love and hate don't just happen for no reason. Everything has its own logic. Is someone really helping you out of gratitude? Or is Carol aiming to climb the ladder and gain more power once you take over the company?"

"How would I know? Right now, all I can do is send someone to check if there's any info about Carol in that charity fund." Isabella shrugged, grabbed a plate of cake, and leaned back on the sofa.

Michael set the documents he was holding on the table and smiled. "Since she was brave enough to tell you about her background, it's probably legit. She's likely someone your grandpa sponsored back in the day. With a good reason, the next step is to figure out her intentions. I'll help you verify these documents."

Isabella nodded and fed Michael a piece of cake with a fork. "Thanks. If the documents are real, at least it shows she doesn't mean any harm to me right now. We might even find some common ground. I could really use some capable allies."

Enjoying the cake, Michael's smile widened. "Besides Carol, your grandpa might have left you a bunch of friends. But what I'm more curious about is who your grandpa pissed off to make the company go bankrupt like this."

Isabella shook her head. "I have no idea, but I'm sure the Williams Family couldn't pull this off. If this were a novel, there'd be some secret organization behind it, or maybe..."

"The government," Michael cut in, saying what she was thinking.

"No matter how rich you are, when it comes to power, it's like a sandcastle. One big wave and it's gone," Michael said, his voice casual but full of meaning.

Isabella sighed. "Honey, I think the most important thing right now is to get control of those three companies first, then we can take our time to grow. As for why the family fell apart, we can look into that later. We're already having a hard time competing with John; we don't need another enemy on our plate."

Michael nodded. "You're right. I'll hire a private detective to check if the info Carol gave us is legit. If it is, we need to reach out to those minority shareholders ASAP before John buys them out at a high price."

Isabella nodded, her eyes steady. "Thanks. We must move fast. Even if those shareholders hear John's offer, they'll wait to see what we have to say."

###chapter 277 Paxton's Invitation

Isabella and Michael started to split up. Michael was having people verify the authenticity of the information, while Isabella reached out to the minority shareholders. She needed to confirm if the other party had already contacted John and then offer a high price to buy some time.

Meanwhile, John and Bianca, upon returning to the vineyard, rained curses down on Jasper and then called those same minority shareholders.

For Carol, helping Isabella become the second-largest shareholder was a strategic move. It would position Isabella advantageously within the company, allowing her to gradually consolidate power and eventually reclaim all the company's shares.

But for Isabella or Bianca, what they wanted from the beginning was all the company's shares!

As for becoming the second-largest shareholder?

They never even considered it!

While both sides were busy vying for the shares, a third party was quietly putting their own plan into motion.

On another front, Paxton was equally occupied, but he was busy inviting people to dinner.

In a luxurious restaurant, Paxton had ordered a table full of sumptuous food in a private room, waiting for his distinguished guests.

This dinner was to entertain the heads of the Davis and Larson families, two major families.

Suddenly, there was a knock at the door, and the head of the Davis Family, Richard Davis, and the head of the Larson Family, Anthony Larson, walked in.

"Hey, gentlemen! I've been expecting you. Please, have a seat," Paxton greeted them warmly, gesturing towards the table.

Richard had a gentle expression, while Anthony's face was somewhat indifferent.

"Paxton, I don't have much time. Let's skip lunch and get straight to the point. What do you want?" Anthony said, sitting down with a hint of impatience.

A flicker of annoyance crossed Paxton's eyes. He felt no trace of respect coming from Anthony.

Still, Paxton hid his irritation behind a composed smile.

"Mr. Brown, just tell us what's going on. I'm curious too," Richard, Joseph's father, asked, his polite tone masking his contempt for Paxton.

Paxton didn't want to waste time with pleasantries. "I'm here to discuss the Taylor Family's secrets," he said bluntly.

Richard and Anthony exchanged surprised glances.

They were well aware of the recent conflict between Paxton and John, and Paxton's attempts to uncover the Taylor Family's secrets from Jasper.

If Jasper weren't in a coma and under police guard, Paxton would have likely tried to have someone break him out of the hospital.

Richard gave Paxton a faint, enigmatic smile. "Mr. Brown, you must be joking. The Taylor Family has already fallen. What secrets could they possibly have? If there were any, why wouldn't Jasper have used them?"

Anthony, his fingers drumming on the table with a rhythm of irritation, cut in, "Cut the crap. We know you pissed off John and you're scared he's gonna come after you, so now you're trying to drag both our families into this mess."

A look of understanding crossed Paxton's eyes. Those who rise to power in a prominent family aren't fools, and Anthony was right about that, but Paxton would never admit it.

Paxton sat down, a sly smile creeping onto his lips. "I get it, you think the rumor is nonsense. But what if I told you that Jasper's dad, Patrick, did leave behind a secret? And that secret is hidden within the three companies of the Taylor Family."

Richard's eyes flashed with a hint of doubt, and Anthony's confident facade slipped for just a moment. Did Paxton know something they didn't?

"Enough with the riddles. Just spill it. What do you know? I don't have time for your games," Anthony snapped, his patience wearing thin. He was intrigued by the Taylor Family's secret, but Paxton's cryptic attitude was driving him nuts.

Paxton grinned and said, "You guys know our family only made it to the top because we scooped up a bunch of the Taylor Family's assets. We stumbled upon a weird secret in the process. When Jasper's dad was still around, their family lost a ton of money, and no one had a clue where it went. This shortfall is what gave us the chance to step in and take their place."

At the dining table, Anthony and Richard exchanged uneasy looks. They had indeed played a part in the Taylor Family's downfall and had grabbed some of their assets. But the speed at which the Taylor Family crumbled always seemed fishy, like someone was pulling strings behind the scenes.

"So, you're saying Patrick from the Taylor Family stashed all the assets somewhere and turned it into a treasure hunt?" Anthony's voice dripped with sarcasm.

Paxton shook his head, his face serious. "I don't think Patrick was that childish. He had to have a reason for doing it, but what was it? We're still digging into it. The missing wealth is probably with Jasper, but why hasn't he used it? I think there might be some specific conditions attached to those assets."

Richard tapped the table lightly, stroking his chin as he thought. "Having wealth you can't use is like having treasure locked in a vault with a password. Jasper probably doesn't know the password, but he knows where the vault is."

Anthony waved his hand dismissively. "Even if there is some treasure, what's it got to do with us? You want us to help you grab it? Why are you getting involved with Isabella and Bianca? Even if the Taylor sisters manage to regain their former glory, they're just the fifth family. They pose no threat to us."

Richard nodded in agreement, echoing Anthony's sentiments. "We don't really know what those treasures are. If it's just a pile of money, we have nothing to worry about." He chuckled. "A family can't thrive on wealth alone; connections, resources, and even political influence-those aren't things money can buy."

"What if it's some high-tech product that could change the current social landscape?" Paxton said casually.

Richard and Anthony exchanged shocked glances. "What do you know?" Anthony asked, his urgency palpable.

Paxton pulled out a document and replied nonchalantly, "Through some investigations, I found that the Taylor family's funds have been funneled into a mysterious lab. But I haven't uncovered what exactly they're experimenting on."

Richard and Anthony fell silent, realizing that an experiment capable of bankrupting the Taylor family must be quite extraordinary.

Paxton watched the two of them deep in thought, a smile spreading across his face, his eyes sparkling with a knowing intensity. "Greed's a strong motivator. If Isabella gets the treasure, I'm not worried. But if Bianca gets it? Don't forget her connection with John. If Bianca becomes the head of the Taylor Family, all that wealth goes to John, and then to the Williams Family."

"Aren't you worried about getting swallowed up by the powerful Williams Family?" Paxton's fingers tapped the table lightly, each tap seeming to hit Anthony and Richard right in the heart.

###chapter 278 Targeting John

Paxton's scheme was clear to everyone, but they had no way to counter it.

Among the four major families, the Williams Family was the most powerful, while the Brown Family was the weakest.

The influence wielded by Mason's family was so strong that, simply put, the other three families combined could barely match the Williams Family.

None of them wanted to see the Williams Family rise unchecked.

At its peak, the Taylor Family was just a notch below the Williams in status.

If the two families merged, even the combined strength of the other three families wouldn't be enough. They might end up being absorbed by the Williams Family.

"So, should we get involved in the fight for control of those three companies?" Richard's eyes locked onto Paxton, his question dripping with calculation.

Paxton shook his head slowly. "It's pointless. I've tried sending people to infiltrate those companies, but they were quickly found out. These companies have been teetering on the edge of bankruptcy for years, and even with Jasper secretly siphoning off funds, they still haven't gone under! That alone tells you something's up. Plus, these companies have a lot of loyal old-timers. Taking control won't be easy."

Anthony's voice was icy. "So, what do you think we should do? Help Isabella? Do you really think she'd accept our help? And even if she does, what's in it for us? You think she'd share her grandfather's legacy with us?"

Anthony's concerns were valid, and Richard shared his worries.

Paxton's smile was barely there, just a hint. "We don't need to help Isabella directly. We just need to handle John. Make sure he's too busy to help Bianca fight for control of the three companies. We only need to help indirectly, and whether Isabella appreciates it or not doesn't matter."

"Isabella's tight with the Williams Family. Aren't you worried that if she takes over and inherits all of Patrick's assets, she'll team up with the Williams Family and come after us?" Richard asked, a bit skeptical.

Paxton shook his head. "You're forgetting the huge fallout between Isabella and John. My daughter told me everything. Isabella, Bianca, and John are completely at odds. Isabella can't stand the Williams Family, except for Mason. But Mason's not gonna be around much longer."

Richard and Anthony exchanged looks, getting what Paxton was driving at.

Isabella had always gotten along well with Mason, but after Mason passed away, John, as the family heir, inherited not just the family fortune but also the bad blood between him and Isabella.

Even though Isabella respected Mason enough not to go after John, John knew better than to expect any favors from her.

Anthony's laughter cut through the tension. "If I remember right, your family had a big hand in taking down the Taylors. Aren't you worried that once Isabella gets her family's power back, she'll come for you?"

"Honestly, I'd rather deal with that than see John succeed. Besides, when we took over the Taylor assets, your families were in on it too. We've all got beef with the Taylors. I doubt Isabella can take us all on," Paxton said, sounding completely unfazed.

Anthony and Richard went quiet, the room filled with an uneasy silence, broken only by the clinking of dishes as the waiter served their food.

Richard finally spoke up, "So, if we go with your plan, what's our next move?"

A spark lit up in Paxton's eyes. "I just got word that Jasper's been playing everyone. Before he sold shares to John, he already offloaded some to other companies. Now Isabella and Bianca are probably fighting to become the second-largest shareholder."

Anthony's eyes widened with interest, but before he could say anything, Paxton shut him down.

"I get what you're thinking, but don't get your hopes up too high. The shareholders aren't idiots. They're making bank off the feud between John and Mason. As long as it stays within certain limits, they don't have to worry about any backlash. But if they try to sell shares to other families, they'll be crossing the Williams Family. Once Mason and John team up, those companies won't stand a chance," Paxton shot down Anthony's idea of becoming the second-largest shareholder.

Anthony shrugged. "So, we need to cut John off from the money he'd need to buy those shares, right? That would give Isabella a better shot."

Paxton nodded with a grin. "Exactly. My family's resources alone aren't enough to take on the Williams Family financially. That's why I need both of you on board."

Richard and Anthony exchanged a look, a silent agreement passing between them, and finally, they nodded.

As long as they could keep the enemy from getting stronger, it would work in their favor.

All three were cunning and equally shrewd.

Once Isabella controlled the three companies, they planned to seize the Taylor family's hidden assets from her, potentially surpassing the Williams family.

John had no idea he was about to go up against three powerful enemies. If he found out about Paxton's scheme, he might just get so mad he'd want to take out those three old guys himself.

John and Mason had already laid out their stakes in the bet.

John's wealth, while substantial, was nothing compared to Mason's. Once the three big families started gunning for him, he'd lose his financial edge in no time.

But for now, John was clueless as he and Bianca headed toward the first minority shareholder.

###chapter 279 Arguing Over the Phone

The first small shareholder was Zack Farley, who ran a seafood business.

When John brought Bianca to their company, Zack greeted them warmly.

John's eyes scanned the cramped office with barely concealed disdain. Compared to his own office, which took up nearly an entire floor, this place felt like a closet.

John didn't want to linger. He lifted his chin arrogantly and said, "I don't have time to waste here. Just tell me how much Jasper borrowed from you, and I'll pay you three times that amount."

Zack's eyes practically turned into dollar signs. His greed almost got the better of him, and he nearly nodded in agreement. But he quickly masked his eagerness with a look of reluctance.

"Mr. Williams, you have to understand," Zack began, putting on a troubled expression. "Isabella, backed by Mason, also wants these shares. If I agree to your terms, I'd be crossing Mason. You're putting me in a tough spot here." He pretended to be conflicted.

John sneered. He knew exactly what Zack was up to, trying to turn this into an auction. It was almost laughable how these guys thought they could make a quick buck off him.

John slouched into the chair, kicking his feet up on Zack's desk. Leaning back, he said nonchalantly, "You know I'm the heir to my family's fortune, right? That stuff my grandpa said in the news about cutting me off? Total joke. He doesn't have a choice. The fortune is mine, regardless. So, what makes you think you're in a position to negotiate?"

John's icy stare made Zack shiver a bit.

But Zack clenched his jaw and shook his head. "John, if you were in charge, I wouldn't dare cross you. But you're not. Mason's still running things, and even if he kicks the bucket, your dad's next in line."

Zack's unspoken message was clear: 'Don't try to intimidate me with your future power. By the time you get control, my company might be bankrupt, or I could be sipping cocktails on a beach somewhere.'

John's frustration was palpable as he yanked his feet off the desk and stood up, jabbing a finger at Zack. "Fine, just you wait!"

As John turned to leave, the phone on Zack's desk rang. Zack picked it up, and his eyes widened as he listened.

"Isabella? No way, is that really you? What? You're asking about John? Yeah, he's still here. Oh, and get this-he wants to buy my shares at three times the market price. Tempting, huh?" Zack chuckled into the phone.

John had just reached the door when he suddenly stopped. He spun around, marched back to the desk, and yanked the phone out of Zack's hand.

"Isabella, are you seriously planning to ask my grandfather for money to buy those shares?" John said icily into the phone.

Isabella hadn't expected John to be there. She thought Zack mentioning John's offer was a ploy to get her to bid higher.

But with John right there, Isabella saw no reason to hold back.

"It's none of your concern where I get my funds. Even if I did borrow from Mason, I'm confident I can pay him back with my future earnings," Isabella said calmly.

John sneered, "How about this: I'll just buy all the shares for you, then give you a chunk so you can be the second-largest shareholder. You won't have to compete with Bianca anymore. How does that sound? Those shares would give you more money than you could ever spend."

Isabella replied coolly, "Thanks, but I'd rather borrow from Mason than take your money. And while we're at it, since you're already so rich, why are you competing with me for those three companies? Your assets are more than enough for Bianca, aren't they?"

Bianca, standing next to John, heard Isabella's words and snapped, "Isabella, you don't know me at all."

"Oh, I know everything about you! You're a total business moron. No sense for business at all, but still dreaming of owning company shares!" Isabella snapped at Bianca, not holding back at all.

Bianca's face turned pale with rage, her fists clenched, and her body shook.

"You're just a loudmouth, a lowlife! I don't even want to waste my breath on you," Bianca shot back, furious, and reached to grab the phone from John's hand to hang up.

But John was quicker. He dodged her hand and, with a cold smile, said into the phone, "Isabella, let me tell you something. No matter what you offer, I'll outbid you by double!"

Zack, listening closely, felt a glimmer of hope. He secretly wished Isabella would name a sky-high price.

Isabella didn't let Zack down. She said over the phone, "Alright then, I'll offer one hundred billion dollars."

Zack was almost giddy with excitement, but he quickly realized Isabella was just messing with John.

John's face darkened. Even with all his wealth, there was no way he could spend one hundred billion dollars on shares of a failing company.

After not hearing John's voice on the other end of the phone, Isabella laughed and mocked, "What's the matter, Mr. Williams? Where's all that confidence? Didn't you say you'd outbid me no matter what? Why so quiet after hearing a hundred billion dollars? Scared? Or broke?"

With a derisive snort, John finally spoke, "I'm not playing these childish games with you. Those shares are mine, and nothing's gonna change that. You have my word! Let's see how much my grandpa can back you up!"

John hung up abruptly and pulled Bianca away. They didn't need to stick around any longer. He was sure Zack would take his offer.

After John left, Zack called Isabella again.

"Ms. Taylor, Mr. Williams offered three times the price for my shares. What's your counteroffer?" Zack asked greedily over the phone.

Isabella glanced at the documents Carol had given her and replied with a hint of disdain, "I need to check with Mason on this. Honestly, John's right. I don't have that kind of money. Give me some time; I'll see if I can borrow it."

###chapter 280 Mason's Phone

Isabella needed to buy some time to check if the dirt on these shareholders was legit, so she stalled Zack for a bit.

Zack didn't know what was going on, but he was willing to wait a little longer for Isabella to come up with the cash.

Zack was the first shareholder they contacted. After that, John also made offers to the other shareholders.

Each shareholder got an offer three times their shares' value. But since they had already talked among themselves, they knew the threefold price wasn't quite what they were hoping for.

After Isabella called them, they started looking forward to Mason's next move.

Mason, on the other hand, got wind of Isabella's plan to buy shares.

When Charles filled him in, Mason slapped his leg in frustration. "Man, Jasper's a mess. Trying to sell the same shares to three different groups? That's straight-up fraud!"

Charles just chuckled. "Mr. Williams, no need to get too worked up. This could be a good break for Isabella. Even if she doesn't win the shares this time, she can still become the second-largest shareholder. She can work her way up to the top spot later."

Mason let out a sigh. "Good thing my deal with John only stops us from using our money to pay off the company's debts. I can still lend Isabella the money to buy those shares."

Mason motioned for Charles to hand him the phone. He dialed Isabella's number.

The call connected quickly, and Mason, with a friendly tone, said, "Hey Isabella, I heard about your situation. Do you need some cash right now? I heard John offered those guys three times the price. I'll get you five times that. Think that'll do?"

To Mason's surprise, Isabella declined without a second thought.

"Mason, you don't need to go out of your way for me like that. Actually, I plan to buy these shares at the original price or maybe double," Isabella's voice was calm and determined.

Mason's face showed confusion. "Isabella, are you aware that John is offering three times the price? Or do you think I'm making this up?"

Isabella smiled and shook her head. "Why would I ever doubt you? I just don't need you to spend that much money on these shares."

Mason seemed to catch on. He listened to Isabella's confident tone and said with a grin, "Sounds like you've got a plan."

Isabella admitted frankly, "I do have a way to get those shares for less than what John's offering. I believe money should be spent wisely, not just to feed someone's greed."

Isabella was feeling pretty confident at this point. After more than a day of digging, the private detective had found some dirt on certain people, just as Carol's documents had suggested.

Even if the detective stopped his investigation now, Isabella was confident enough in the dirt Carol had dug up to make those greedy shareholders hand over their shares.

"If John wants to blow his money on these shares, even if he pays ten or a hundred times the price, that's his problem. But, Mason, I don't want you to spend that kind of cash. Even if it's pocket change for you, I can't accept that kind of sacrifice," Isabella said, her voice tinged with guilt. Mason had already gone above and beyond to help her, and she didn't want to owe him any more.

Mason picked up on Isabella's feelings. He gave her a warm smile and said, "It's all good. Just let me know if you need money, and I'll be there for you. Honestly, I see you as a challenge for John. He's had a lot of wins thanks to his family's backing, but he's never really faced a serious setback. Losing this time could be the best lesson he ever gets."

Isabella quipped, "So, you hired me to be John's teacher, huh? Maybe I should start charging you for my services."

Mason's laugh was hearty and genuine. "Sure, how much do you want? Tell you what, I'll have Charles send you a blank check, and you can fill in the amount."

Isabella couldn't help but chuckle at Mason's generosity and humor.

"Alright, Mason, enough joking around. Take care and get some rest in the hospital. I gotta get back to work now." With that, she hung up.

Mason sighed as he stared at the phone.

Charles, who had overheard Mason's conversation with Isabella, walked over and asked, "Mr. Williams, are we really gonna do what Isabella said and not help her out?"

Mason nodded, deep in thought. "I've known Isabella since she was a kid. She might seem delicate, but she's tougher than she looks. If she says she doesn't need my help, it means she's got a plan."

As Mason spoke, his eyes sparkled with memories, bringing to mind a girl who looked and acted a lot like Isabella.

"They're so alike, both in looks and personality. I really hope Isabella can get all the company shares this time, just like she did back then." Mason sighed deeply.

Meanwhile, John, back at the winery with Bianca, was fuming.

John felt cursed. Even those small companies he usually dismissed were taking advantage of the family's internal conflicts to squeeze more out of him!

"When I finally take control of the family, I'm gonna buy out all those companies and make their bosses work in Evernia!" John shouted, kicking a nearby table.

"Hey, babe, don't let it get to you. They're just a bunch of greedy jerks. We'll have plenty of time to deal with them later." Bianca hurried over to comfort John, wrapping her arms around him.

John took a deep breath, then scooped Bianca up and headed towards the bedroom.

Bianca knew exactly what was coming next. She blushed and lay down on the bed, slowly undressing.

Just as John, his breath heavy with desire, was about to let off some steam, his phone suddenly rang.

John frowned as he answered the call, but his eyes soon widened. "What did you say? My funding's been cut off?"

###chapter 281 Annoyed John

John could hardly believe what he was hearing. How could a rich guy like him suddenly be cut off from his money?

The guy on the other end of the line chuckled and confirmed, "Yep, Mr. Williams. Your funds have been cut off because the Brown Group, along with two other companies, have targeted your assets."

John was livid. "Has Paxton lost his mind or something? Why's he been coming after me lately? I haven't done anything to provoke him!"
