"I finally did it, and I've almost spent all my money. The only thing left is to get my father's shares into my hands," Isabella said with a smile as she sat in the car, looking at the stack of contracts beside her.

###chapter 287 Brush Bianca off

As Isabella's rival, Bianca had no clue that Isabella had already scooped up all the shares from the minority shareholders, making her the second biggest shareholder in the family.

She was still crowing about Mason not helping Isabella out.

With John still tangled up in the mess created by the three major families and having no extra cash to help her out, Bianca had to step up and personally call and negotiate with those minority shareholders on John's behalf.

"Mr. Farley, you gotta understand, the influence of the three major families on us is pretty much nothing. Our current situation is just a bump in the road. Give us a few days, and we can buy your shares at three or even five times the price. I believe Mr. Farley can be patient, right?" Bianca sounded super confident on the phone.

Zack on the other end of the line went quiet for a moment, then nodded and said with a smile, "Of course, I trust Ms. Taylor. I'll wait for two more days."

After wrapping up the call with Bianca, Zack hung up, a flicker of disdain in his eyes.

"You're a joke compared to your sister," Zack spat into the phone.

The same thing happened with the other shareholders.

Bianca told each one that John would soon sort out the mess and then buy their shares with cash. Each shareholder agreed, willing to give John some time.

But after hanging up, each shareholder cursed Bianca as a foolish woman.

Because Isabella had leverage over all of them, and even though she promised to return those levers and not use them to threaten them anymore, they were terrified to defy her. They didn't trust her to keep her word. Yeah, businessmen say they value integrity, but it's not always the top priority.

Bianca called James, but after a few rings, no one picked up, which made her frown.

She glanced again at the business card she was holding.

The number was right, it was definitely James's number, his private number. Why wasn't anyone answering?

Just as Bianca was getting puzzled, the phone was finally answered, but a woman's voice came from the other end.

"May I ask who's calling?" the voice asked, sounding polite but distant.

"I'm Mr. Williams' girlfriend, I'm looking for Mr. Finley, are you his secretary?" Bianca asked.

There was a pause, and Bianca thought she heard a faint scream. She frowned slightly, confused by what was happening on the other end of the line.

When Lally heard it was Bianca on the phone, her face turned cold. She didn't have a good tone for people who messed with others' relationships.

"I'm his wife, he's not available right now." Lally's words were icy, each syllable sharp and cutting. Bianca could almost picture Lally, picking up the phone with a look of disdain.

James had been stripped of all his clothes, and he was naked and tied to an iron frame. Various torture tools were placed next to the iron frame.

"I need to talk to Mr. Finley about transferring shares. What's he up to right now?" Bianca's voice had a hint of impatience.

Lally walked over to the torture tools, grabbed a red-hot branding iron, and pressed it against James's stomach.

The searing pain made James tremble and struggle, letting out a desperate scream. "Darling, I was wrong, I really was."

Bianca was startled by the clear scream coming from the phone.

Lally, on the other end, smiled faintly. "I'm sorry, Ms. Taylor. We can only discuss the shares later. We're a bit busy with some... intimate games. You'll have to wait to discuss any business."

Lally said this while searching for a whip among the torture tools, eventually finding a riding crop.

Bianca, hearing the unmistakable crack of a whip followed by James's anguished cries, felt a chill run through her.

"Sorry to bother you. Please tell Mr. Finley that we need a few days, and John will transfer the money to buy the shares," Bianca said before hastily ending the call.

Lally, far from satisfied, continued her "intimate games."

"Darling, how should I punish you?" Lally caressed James's greasy cheek, asking in a sickly sweet tone.

James shook his head, trembling. "Darling, I know I was wrong. You don't want the kids to lose their father early, do you?"

Lally's face turned cold as stone. To prevent the kids from seeing James in his current state, Lally had already ordered the butler to send them out of the country as soon as she got home.

Any mention of the kids now would only fuel Lally's anger.

"Now go outside and bring me a bucket of alcohol," Lally ordered her subordinate behind her.

Soon, the subordinate brought a bucket of medical alcohol, its acrid scent filling the air.

Lally dipped the whip in the bucket, soaking it with alcohol.

"Darling," Lally whispered, "They say alcohol can help clean wounds. To keep you from getting infected, I gotta disinfect those cuts. And, well... it just seems easier to do it with the whip. What do you think?" Lally's pale face revealed a sickly sweet smile, then she fiercely whipped James with the alcohol-soaked whip.

"Damn you, you wretch, I won't let you off even if I become a ghost! It hurts so much! Is there anyone? Help!" James wailed in agony.

"No need to shout for help, sweetie. You built this soundproof basement yourself, remember? Said you needed it for your music. Turns out it was for your little rendezvous with the maid. The soundproofing here is so good, I can't even hear it in the room upstairs, so don't expect anyone to come and save you." Lally caressed James's face, then picked up a pair of scissors from the side.

"Cheaters gotta pay. Chemical castration's too good for them. I prefer the real deal." Lally slowly brought the scissors close to James's genitals.

###chapter 288 The Second-largest Shareholder

Isabella had no clue what Lally was up to. If she did, she probably wouldn't have been able to eat for days.

Luckily, she stayed in the dark. After breakfast, she got right to work, calling a meeting with the senior execs from three companies.

In the conference room, the execs were all huddled together, whispering about what was going on. They'd just had a meeting a few days ago, so why another one now?

Unlike the others who were scratching their heads, Carol seemed to have a hunch about why Isabella called the meeting. She just shrugged and smiled calmly.

Suddenly, the door swung open and in walked Bianca with her bodyguards. She'd also been invited to this high-level meeting by Isabella, and she was just as puzzled as everyone else.

"Ms. Taylor, isn't Mr. Williams coming with you?" one of the shareholders asked, looking confused.

Bianca shot him a sharp look. "John's super busy right now, dealing with attacks from the three big families. But trust me, it's only a matter of time before he handles it."

The execs didn't doubt Bianca's words. After all, John had a powerful family backing him.

"Ms. Taylor, do you have any idea why Isabella called this meeting?" another exec asked.

A lot of folks in the room were rooting for Bianca to take the lead. To them, it didn't matter if they worked for the Taylor Family or the Williams Family. In fact, working for the Williams Family might even mean better pay and a more stable future.

"I have no clue," Bianca said with a light chuckle, covering her mouth. "Maybe Isabella's finally throwing in the towel."

Bianca was so confident in John that the idea of Isabella taking control seemed laughable to her.

Carol, who had been quiet with her arms crossed, glanced at Bianca and then looked away.

Just then, the door opened again, and Isabella walked in.

"Looks like everyone's here. Bianca, I gotta say, I didn't expect to see you," Isabella said, smiling as she took her usual seat.

Bianca, arms crossed and looking frosty, shot back, "Isabella, everyone's really busy. If you don't have anything important, don't waste our time with this pointless meeting."

Isabella sat down and smiled. "I'm not here to waste anyone's time. I've got some big news to share."

Bianca eyed her suspiciously, a bad feeling creeping in.

"Isabella, what news? Don't tell me your dad woke up and handed you the company's shares," Bianca sneered.

Isabella shook her head. "No, my dad hasn't woken up. I have video proof of the share transfer, but you don't believe me, so there's nothing I can do. However, I do have another announcement."

Turning to the execs, Isabella's voice was calm but firm. "I've bought back the 40% of shares my father sold, and now I'm the second-largest shareholder in the company."

As soon as Isabella finished speaking, the room went dead silent. Bianca, stunned for a moment, quickly turned furious. She slammed the table, stood up, and glared at Isabella.

"Isabella, do you have any idea what you're saying? This isn't a game. You claim you bought those shares? Let's hear how you managed that little miracle. Did you rob a bank?" Bianca roared, though deep down, that bad feeling in her gut grew stronger.

Isabella just smiled, clapped her hands, and the door opened again. A secretary walked in, struggling with a huge backpack.

"Sorry, everyone, there are just too many shareholders and too many agreements. I had to have someone bring them in for me," Isabella said, taking the backpack, unzipping it, and dumping all the agreements on the table.

"For those of you who have doubts, feel free to check these agreements yourselves," Isabella said, stepping aside as the execs stared in shock.

Finally, someone couldn't resist and picked up an agreement to read. When they saw the contents and signatures, they were stunned.

"These are real share transfer agreements! How did Ms. Taylor pull this off?" someone asked, looking at Isabella in shock.

"No, this can't be, it's definitely fake," Bianca screamed, rushing over to read the contracts. But no matter which one she opened, all the procedures were legal and compliant.

"How is this possible? How did you do this? How could they do this? They tricked me!"" Bianca's eyes blazed with fury as she confronted Isabella.

Isabella looked at Bianca, offered a thin smile, and then patted her face with a condescending air. "My dear sister, I asked the small shareholders to keep our little transaction quiet. I even told them to put you off if you called-it was a surprise! Now I've reclaimed the family shares. Aren't you thrilled?"

Isabella's mockery made Bianca tremble with rage.

"Those damn guys deceived me! How did you do it? Did Mason give you money again? Why would he do this? Are those rumors true?" Bianca screamed.

Isabella, keeping her cool, met Bianca's gaze with a faint smile before delivering a sharp, resounding slap to her face. "Watch your words, Bianca. Do you know what you're saying? I see Mason as my family, and he treats me like a granddaughter! I only have respect for him as an elder! If you dare to tarnish his reputation with those rumors, I won't let you off."

Bianca was slapped before John's bodyguards could react. Consumed by guilt and worry, they quickly intervened and stepped between the two women.

"Let's wait and see!" Bianca spat, her eyes burning with malice as she cast a final, venomous glare at Isabella before storming out of the room.

###chapter 289 Jasper Awakens

Isabella watched Bianca walk away, not bothering to stop her.

Once all the top execs finished going over the contracts and confirmed Isabella's new status, they were all just waiting for her next move.

With a casual wave, Isabella told them to sit, and they all did, quietly. Then she took her seat and got ready to lay down her first order.

"Now that I'm the company's second-largest shareholder, and with my dad in a coma and his embezzlement messing up the company's operations, I can strip him of all his management rights according to the board's rules! In the next few days, I'll be rolling out a series of reforms and making some new personnel appointments." She stood up, hands on the table, and looked around the room.

Her gaze was cold and firm as she scanned the senior execs.

"Who's with me? Who's against?" Her voice rang out, clear and strong.

The execs exchanged nervous glances. Isabella's presence was intense.

If Jerry were here, he'd be floored. Isabella's vibe was just like Michael's.

Breaking the silence, Carol stood up, nodding at Isabella. "I'm ready to follow Ms. Taylor's orders."

With Carol leading the way, the others snapped out of their shock, stood up, and pledged their support to Isabella.

Isabella was pleased with their reaction. She motioned for them to sit back down.

"Since no one's opposing, starting tomorrow, I'll be working here. Please submit all current reports to me. The company's reform starts now." And with that, she wrapped up the meeting.

After the meeting, the execs looked at each other, some wiping sweat from their brows.

"How did we never see this side of Isabella before?" one exec asked, puzzled.

Someone seemed to get it and said seriously, "Love can mess with a woman's head! Now that Isabella's over John, she's sharp again! As an heiress to a big family, she's got to have some skills. Men just held her back."

The others nodded, agreeing with the theory.

But while Isabella was holding her meeting, an unseen storm was brewing.

Meanwhile, at the hospital, in Jasper's room.

Jasper lay on the bed. His fingers twitched slightly, and his eyelids fluttered.

From confusion to slowly waking up, Jasper realized where he was.

His eyes shifted to the two cops outside the room. They were chatting and didn't notice he was awake.

After the meeting, Isabella rushed back to her workplace.

When Isabella got to the office, she exchanged quick hellos with her colleagues and headed straight to Dwayne's office.

Dwayne looked surprised when she walked in. "Hey, Isabella! You look pretty happy. Something good happen?"

Isabella smiled politely. "Mr. Larson, I just wanted to thank you for all your help since I joined the company."

Dwayne looked puzzled. "Why are you saying this all of a sudden? Wait, you're not quitting, are you?"

He suddenly remembered their initial agreement.

Seeing Isabella nod, he asked in shock, "Did you get your dad's shares?"

Isabella nodded, then shook her head.

Dwayne was confused.

Isabella explained with a smile, "Well, I got some of them. My dad secretly split the shares and sold some off. I managed to get the shares from those small shareholders. Now, I'm the company's second-largest shareholder! Even though I don't have as many shares as my dad, he's in a coma and has been stripped of his rights, so I'm in charge now."

Dwayne took a deep breath, not expecting Isabella to pull this off.

"I have to admit, I never thought you stood a chance against John. Looks like I underestimated you," Dwayne said with a rueful smile.

Isabella handed him her resignation letter.

"Thanks again for everything. By the way, I'm planning a small party before I leave and I'd love to invite our department colleagues. Mr. Larson, it would be great if you could come," she said, her smile bright with the promise of new beginnings.

Dwayne hesitated, then nodded. "Alright, I'll be there. I hope I don't make the employees uncomfortable."

After inviting Dwayne, Isabella happily went back to her office.

As soon as she left, Dwayne called Michael.

"Mr. Williams, Isabella has resigned. She's now the second-largest shareholder in her family. She also invited me to her resignation party tonight," Dwayne said with a wry smile, filling Michael in.

Michael's reaction was calm. "I know. Since she invited you, you should go. You don't need to worry about her anymore."

Dwayne was momentarily stunned but figured Michael, with his strong connections, must have already known about Isabella's new status.

"Got it, Mr. Williams. By the way, do you have any plans for the director position after Isabella leaves?" Dwayne asked.

"You handle it. I trust your judgment," Michael replied decisively before hanging up.

Back in her office, Isabella started packing up her things. As she was tidying up, she noticed Juliet watching her, eyes red with emotion.

Isabella looked at her, confused. "Why are you crying? Did someone bully you again?"

Juliet shook her head, tears streaming down her face. "Ms. Taylor, I heard you're resigning. Is it true? I can't bear to see you go. You're the best leader I've ever had."

###chapter 290 Juliet's Choice

Isabella watched Juliet cry and couldn't help but smile.

"I'm just quitting, not dying. If someone saw you now, they'd think I had a terminal illness. Come on, wipe those tears." Isabella handed Juliet a tissue, still smiling.

Juliet dabbed at her eyes and grabbed Isabella's hand. "But I can't stand to see you go. What if the new director isn't as nice as you? You're like a sister to me."

"Honestly, I've always thought of you as my little sister." Isabella hugged Juliet warmly.

Juliet bit her lip, looking like she had made up her mind.

"Ms. Taylor, can I come with you?" Juliet asked, her eyes full of hope.

Isabella was caught off guard. Instead of saying no right away, she gave a bittersweet smile. "Juliet, do you know what you're asking? My new job might be as CEO, but those companies are almost bankrupt. If you come with me, you might make less money than you do now."

Juliet shook her head firmly, still holding Isabella's hand. "I don't care about the money. If it's less, so be it. I believe that with you in charge, those companyies will get better, and you'll bring back your family's glory. By then, I'll probably make more than I do now!"

"That sounds like an investment, but it's a pretty big one." Isabella shook her head with a wry smile. She wasn't saying no, just amazed at Juliet's bravery.

"Please, Ms. Taylor." Juliet pleaded, still holding Isabella's hand.

Isabella rubbed her forehead. She didn't really want to leave Juliet behind. But Juliet was originally sent by Dwayne to be her assistant. Taking her felt like stealing one of Dwayne's employees, which made her feel guilty.

After some internal struggle, Isabella finally gave in.

"Okay, but I need to talk to Mr. Larson first. It wouldn't be right otherwise." Isabella shrugged and headed to Dwayne's office.

Dwayne was surprised to see Isabella again. When he heard her request, he agreed without hesitation.

"It's fine, young people should make their own choices. I approve. If Juliet wants to go with you, she can. I wish you both the best." Dwayne agreed easily.

Just an assistant, it wasn't a big deal for Dwayne.

Before resigning, Isabella had made all the preparations, recruiting talented new employees and delegating her work.

Now, as soon as the new director was chosen, she could hand over her duties.

After telling her colleagues in the design department about her resignation, everyone expressed their regret and best wishes.

"Tonight, I'll treat everyone to dinner, drinks, and karaoke! Let's have a fun farewell party!" Isabella's suggestion was met with cheers, and everyone started talking about what to eat that night.

Isabella called Michael to see if he wanted to come to her farewell dinner.

"I won't get involved in your company's affairs," Michael said, politely declining Isabella's invitation with a courteous smile.

Michael had his reasons. Mason still hadn't let go of his suspicions about him. If he showed up and got photographed, Mason would find out. Then his cover would be blown.

Isabella didn't mind Michael's refusal. After chatting for a bit, just as they were about to end the call, Michael's tone changed, like he suddenly remembered something.

"Oh, by the way, have you seen the news today?" Michael asked out of the blue.

"There's a lot of news today. Which one are you talking about? Something about the four major families or our company?" Isabella asked, curious.

"It's from the national business department, about a new business law," Michael said, sounding serious.

Isabella picked up on his tone and asked anxiously, "What happened? I haven't been keeping up with the news. Just tell me straight."

"In short, this new law affects your company. Your dad broke the law, and it's serious. His shares will be frozen once the law kicks in. So even if he wants to transfer them, he can't," Michael explained.

Isabella's eyes widened in shock. "My dad's shares are frozen? How are we supposed to get them?"

Michael smiled. "There's good news and bad news. Which one do you want first?"

Rolling her eyes, Isabella snapped, "No time for games. Just spill it."

"Alright, things aren't as bad as they seem. I made a call, and they suggested a competition between you and Bianca. The task is to find the money your dad took and cover the company's losses. The good news is, you don't have to worry about your dad pulling any tricks," Michael said.

Isabella sighed deeply. "That's not exactly good news for me. I have no idea where my dad hid the money. Is the bad news that Bianca has an edge over me? If she finds the money, she'll have more shares than me."

Michael gave a wry smile and touched his nose. "Yeah, that's pretty much it."

Isabella rubbed her forehead. "At least for now, my dad's still unconscious. Once he wakes up, I can ask him where the money is. I'm sure I can get it out of him."

But before Isabella could finish, Juliet burst into the office.

"Ms. Taylor, something's wrong. There are two police officers outside looking for you," Juliet said, out of breath.

Isabella frowned. "Looking for me? Why? I've already told them everything I know. There's no point in them talking to me now."

Juliet shook her head. "No, the police said your dad escaped from the hospital. They want to know if you know where he is."

###chapter 291 Jasper's Escape

Isabella's eyes went wide when she realized her call was still connected. On the other end, Michael caught wind of Jasper's escape from the hospital.

"Well, darling," Michael's voice had a teasing edge, "looks like we've got bigger problems."

Isabella rubbed her face in frustration. "Damn it, I knew taking over the companies wouldn't be that easy! Get those two cops to come see me."

Knowing the police would soon be knocking on her door, Isabella hung up.

As the call ended, Michael's smile vanished. He quickly dialed Jerry.

"Find out how Jasper managed to escape," Michael ordered, his voice cold and furious.

Jasper's situation was complicated. Not only were the police involved, but there were also undercover agents disguised as patients or hospital staff keeping tabs on him.

These people were waiting for Jasper to wake up so they could squeeze information about the family's secrets or any embezzlements out of him.

Michael had his own people watching too, but it was clear they had slacked off, leading to delayed updates.

Jerry rushed to the hospital as soon as he got the call and chewed out all the subordinates who were supposed to be watching Jasper.

The subordinates hung their heads, taking the scolding in silence.

Jasper'd been lying in a coma in the hospital these days, and with the police guarding him, everything seemed so normal that over time, the guards grew bored and gradually slacked off.

In fact, not only did Michael miss the news, but the rest of the Williams Family, including John, only found out after the police showed up.

That day, everyone who had been watching Jasper got a serious dressing-down from their boss.

Soon, Michael got the full story of Jasper's escape.

According to the nurse who was changing his bandages, Jasper suddenly attacked her from behind while she was getting ready to help him.

Jasper knocked the nurse out, stripped her, put on her clothes, laid her in the bed, covered her with a blanket, and pretended he was still lying there.

Disguised as the nurse, Jasper walked out of the room and then the hospital.

Thanks to the police's negligence, no one noticed a thing.

When Michael heard about how Jasper had escaped, a deep sense of frustration washed over him. The whole thing had been too easy, proving that everyone had underestimated Jasper, giving him the perfect opportunity.

Michael drummed his fingers on the table, trying to figure out where Jasper would go next. He had set a trap in advance.

Jasper had gotten info from John about a human smuggler. Michael had his men replace that smuggler, so Jasper might reach out to him any minute now. All Michael had to do was sit tight and wait for updates.

After leaving the hospital, Jasper found an old homeless man, knocked him out with a rock, and stole his clothes.

Jasper ditched the tight nurse's uniform, put on the stolen clothes, and slipped away from the hospital grounds.

With no cash on him after busting out of the hospital, Jasper knew he'd have to get creative to get out of town.

He ducked into a quiet alley and rummaged through a trash can, finding a plastic pipe which he slipped into his pocket.

Jasper waited patiently until he spotted a young guy with glasses taking out the trash nearby.

Keeping his head low, Jasper pressed the plastic pipe against the guy's back.

"Don't move. Hand over your phone and wallet, or I'll shoot," Jasper growled.

The young guy froze, feeling the hard object against his back. He didn't want to risk finding out if it was a gun or a knife.

"Okay, okay, just don't hurt me," the guy stammered, shaking as he handed over his wallet and phone.

Jasper grabbed the wallet and phone, pocketed the wallet, and asked, "What's the password?"

The young guy told him, and Jasper knocked him out with a rock to the back of the head.

Not wanting the guy to be found too soon, Jasper dragged him into the alley and made a call at the entrance.

"Hope this number still works," Jasper muttered.

A gruff voice answered, "Who is this?"

Jasper grinned. "Are you the one John sent to pick me up?"

There was a pause, then the voice said, "Jasper? You got out of the hospital?"

Jasper took a deep breath. "No time for chit-chat. Can the deal with John still go down? Can you help me get outta here?"

"Absolutely. Mr. Williams paid well. I'll make sure you get out safely," the voice assured him.

Jasper pressed on, "Great. How do I contact you?"

The voice gave clear instructions, "At nine p.m., there's a boat at Sapphire Port heading to Lumaria. Look for a guy in a red beret. Tell him who you are. He's my guy, you can trust him."

Jasper memorized the details and hung up.

He was relieved he still remembered the contact info for the smuggler. Without it, he'd be stuck.

Suddenly, Jasper realized he had no idea how long he'd been out. What time was it? Did John get what he wanted?

He quickly searched for news about the Taylor Family on the phone, focusing on Isabella. All he found were rumors about Isabella and Mason, with nothing about any changes in the family's shareholders.

###chapter 292 Jasper's Escape

Jasper had been searching for a while, dreading the news he would find, but came up empty-handed. He let out a sigh of relief.

He was really worried that John would find out about him selling the shares to others. If John found out, he'd be livid. He might even get the agent who helped him escape the country to track Jasper down.

But there was nothing in the news about the Taylor Family's shares. That meant John and Bianca hadn't started any reorganization of the shares yet.

Jasper had no idea why they hadn't done anything after all this time, but as long as no one found out, he was in the clear. What he didn't know was that the rumors about Isabella he had just stumbled upon were actually tied to the shares.

Jasper was clueless that Isabella had snagged 40% of the shares and was now the second biggest shareholder. The press conference hadn't happened yet, so the media was still in the dark.

After wrapping up his search, Jasper looked around cautiously and then slipped out of the alley with his head down. Since he escaped from the hospital, he knew the police would be after him. He couldn't risk taking a taxi or public transport, so he had to dodge the patrolling cops and walk to the harbor.

Just after Jasper left, the young guy in the alley twitched his fingers a bit.

Meanwhile, Michael got a call from his subordinate, confirming that Jasper had reached out to that 'smuggler'.

"Mr. Williams, should I just grab Jasper when he shows up and bring him to you? Or should I interrogate him first and find out where he's hidden the embezzled funds?" the subordinate suggested over the phone.

Michael, tapping his desk thoughtfully, found the idea tempting. But would Jasper really spill the beans? And would he tell the whole truth?

Michael trusted his subordinate's methods, but he was worried that Jasper would hold back some info.

"Don't we have a new research project called Parasite Localization?" Michael suddenly asked over the phone.

The subordinate nodded. "Yeah, Mr. Williams, we do. It's like a spider. Once swallowed, it sticks to the stomach and doesn't get dissolved by stomach acid. But it's still experimental and pretty expensive, so we don't have many."

Michael narrowed his eyes. "I'll arrange for a private plane to deliver the localization device within six hours. Find a way to get that thing into Jasper's mouth."

"Don't worry, Mr. Williams, I'll make sure he swallows it," the subordinate said with a sinister chuckle.

On the other side, Bianca stormed back to the winery and started smashing everything in the bedroom.

"Damn Isabella stole what I wanted again! Damn it, that bitch should go to hell," Bianca fumed, flipping a table in the room.

Just then, Bianca's phone buzzed in her pocket. She quickly answered it.

"Can you just take care of Isabella and get rid of that bitch?" she blurted out before the caller could say anything. "She somehow got the shares from those minority shareholders! Now she's the second largest shareholder of the company. With Jasper out of commission, she could almost take over as the CEO!"

A cold laugh came from the other end of the line, cutting through her rant. "I've long given up on you. It's obvious Isabella has some tricks up her sleeve. When it comes to scheming, you only know some petty tricks. You can't outsmart your sister."

Bianca snapped back, "Enough! I don't need you calling me stupid. I just want to know if you have a way to fix this!"

The voice on the phone turned icy. "I regret choosing a fool like you. Anyway, there's no need to worry. The country's laws have changed. If you can find the embezzled funds Jasper transferred and fix the companies' financial mess, you can get his shares! I called to tell you this good news. But I didn't expect you to hit me with bad news."

Bianca's anger turned to excitement. "So there's still a way, that's great! But where do I find the embezzled funds Jasper took?"

The person on the phone sounded annoyed. "Are you really that dense? No one would know if the money you present is the embezzled fund. You say it is, and it is! Understand? The important thing is to fill the gap!"

Bianca's face darkened. "Have you forgotten that John doesn't have the money to give me now? Where am I supposed to find the money to cover the embezzled funds?"

"That's not my problem. Maybe you can ask John, he might have a solution," the voice on the phone said coldly before hanging up.

Bianca angrily threw her phone on the bed and sat on the edge, running her hands through her hair.

Just then, she heard footsteps outside the door. She immediately recognized them as John's.

Bianca quickly stood up, tidied her hair and clothes, and took a deep breath, trying to calm herself.

The door swung open, and John walked in, his face a mask of displeasure. He took in the wreckage of the room, his brows knitting together in a deep frown.

Bianca hurried to John, took his hand awkwardly, and said, "Darling, I have some bad news. Those minority shareholders have been deceiving me all along. They never respected you. Isabella somehow bought their shares, and now she's the second largest shareholder of the company. She even held a senior management meeting and humiliated me in front of everyone. I was so angry, I couldn't control my emotions."

Despite her words, John's expression remained grim.

"Darling, are you mad at me for breaking things? Is that why you're upset?" Bianca asked sadly.

But John shook his head. "It's not that. I just got news that Jasper has escaped from the hospital, and now a lot of people are looking for him."

###chapter 293 Angry Bianca

When Bianca found out Jasper had busted out of the hospital, it was like getting hit by a lightning bolt.

She felt like even the universe was against her. Just when she had a shot at taking down Isabella, Jasper went and escaped. If they didn't catch him soon, who knows where all that embezzled money would end up?

Bianca's body shook, the weight of despair almost knocking her back onto the bed, but John was quick to catch her.

"What's wrong, babe? Jasper escaping isn't the end of the world," John asked, worry etched on his face.

Bianca's face went pale. She forced a weak smile and explained to John about the chance to become the biggest shareholder in the company by recovering the missing funds.

John, who had been too wrapped up in company issues, hadn't been keeping up with the latest news.

"Dammit, why is everything going wrong at once? If I wasn't being targeted by the three major families, I could've helped you with the funds by now," John said, pounding the wall in frustration, scraping his hands.

Bianca gently took John's injured hand in hers.

"It's okay, babe. Don't stress. The cops are on Jasper's trail. Once they find him, we'll get the info about the funds," she said, trying to soothe him.

John let out a long, tired sigh. The people he had watching Jasper at the hospital had messed up, letting him slip away. Was Jasper playing him again?

A sudden thought hit John. He had once given Jasper a contact, a guy named Zane Hays, who was a human smuggler.

"Could Jasper have reached out to Zane?" John wondered aloud, quickly dialing Zane's number.

Bianca watched him, curious about what he was up to.

After a few rings, a stranger's voice answered. "Who is this?"

John hesitated, surprised by the unfamiliar voice. "Who are you? Isn't this Zane's phone?"

There was a brief silence before the person on the other end asked, "Are you Mr. Williams?"

John's face darkened as he realized this wasn't Zane.

"What's your name? Where's Zane?" John demanded coldly.

The voice on the phone, Joe Roach, sighed before replying, "I'm Joe Roach. Zane died in a gang fight, and I've taken over his business. He mentioned you before, said you were a good client. Need anything, Mr. Williams?"

Joe's voice had a greedy edge, clearly hoping to make some money off John.

John's eyes narrowed. He knew the type-people who'd sell out their own family for the right price.

"I don't need anything right now. I just want to know if you've gotten any calls from a guy named Jasper recently," John asked, his tone icy.

Joe paused, seemingly thinking it over.

"I haven't gotten any jobs related to Jasper lately. If you're talking about your deal with Zane, I had no idea about it! Are you trying to get Jasper out of the country? You'll need to renegotiate the price. Unlike Zane, I haven't been paid by you. I'm not doing it for free," Joe replied, trying to keep it polite.

John paused, then frowned. "Are you sure you haven't heard from Jasper?"

Joe, sounding a bit annoyed, said, "Mr. Williams, like I said, I'm not doing this job for free! If you want to get someone out of the country, you'll need to pay. Money's not an issue for you, right?"

John snorted, "I don't care about the price, but listen up. If Jasper contacts you, you need to tell me. I'll pay you for the info. But if you try to play me, you'll regret it."

Joe's voice perked up. "Don't worry, Mr. Williams. I know the rules. If I hear anything, I'll let you know!"

John, fed up, ended the call.

He knew these guys only cared about money. Since John didn't pay Joe, he wouldn't help Jasper even if Jasper reached out to him.

Jasper didn't have the cash to get out of the country, so he was still around.

John shared this bit of good news with Bianca as he held her.

Bianca felt a bit relieved but still worried. She knew Isabella would be hunting for Jasper too, and with Mason backing her, she had a serious advantage.

Bianca thought Isabella was her only competition for finding Jasper, but she forgot about Paxton and the other two major families.

The leaders of the three major families met up again.

Anthony, looking serious, broke the silence. "Jasper's on the loose. We need to find him before the cops or the Williams family do. He might have clues about the Taylor family's secrets."

Richard, with a slight smile, said, "We don't have much control over this. Finding people is the cops' job. But I've got people watching the police station. If there's news, I'll hear about it."

Paxton chuckled, "I heard Jasper escaped dressed as a nurse. I'd love to see him in women's clothes, hahaha."

Richard and Anthony exchanged looks, clearly unimpressed.

"Your sense of humor is... unique. But are you sure Jasper has the Taylor family's secrets?" Anthony asked, skeptical.

Paxton shook his head, "I'm not sure, but it's a gamble, right? I've heard Isabella got the shares from the minority shareholders, making her the second largest shareholder. John lost this round. If we find Jasper, eliminate him, or stop John's people from finding him, it's a win for us."

Richard and Anthony fell silent, realizing Paxton had a point.

###chapter 294 Looking for Jasper

The three big family heads all knew they each wanted a piece of the Taylor Family's legacy. Each one hoped to grab it all for himself. But if none of them could, they sure as hell weren't going to let the Williams Family get it and become a bigger threat.

Paxton lightly tapped the table and grinned, "I know we've got our people at the police station. But we're not a gang, no need to keep tabs on the cops all the time. A couple of informants there will do. The rest can reach out to our underworld contacts. Don't underestimate them. Sometimes they're better at finding people than the police."

Richard and Anthony nodded in agreement with Paxton's plan.

So, the three families sent their operatives into the city's dark corners, seeking help from the underworld to track down Jasper.

Meanwhile, after hanging up with John, Joe called Michael.

"Mr. Williams, John called asking about Jasper. I told him I haven't heard from Jasper," Joe reported.

Michael, staring out of a big French window, nodded. "Let's hold off for now. Once Jasper swallows the localization device, we can trace the money through him."

The sky outside was a clear blue, not a bird in sight. Michael's eyes seemed to pierce through the vast expanse, imagining a private plane taking off from his hometown airport.

Michael turned away from the window and hung up the phone.

After a moment, he called Isabella.

"Hey babe, what are you up to?" Michael asked with a smile.

Isabella was busy at work, even though she was about to quit, she still had some tasks to wrap up.

"I'm swamped with resigning, moving everything to the new company, and planning tonight's party. It's all a bit much," Isabella sighed.

Michael chuckled, "I'm swamped too. I'm hiding in the bathroom to call you. My boss wouldn't let me take leave this time, otherwise, I'd be there to help you."

Lounging on the sofa, Michael stretched lazily, a contented hum escaping him.

Isabella, on the phone, misunderstood.

"Babe, are you constipated? You sound like you're straining," Isabella teased with a laugh.

"Nope, I'm good in that department. Just a bit tired, need to move around," Michael replied lightly, though his tone soon turned serious.

"Babe, now that your dad's escaped from the hospital, should I hire someone to find him?" Michael asked.

Isabella shook her head. "No need to waste money. Private detectives are expensive and might not even find him. The police are better at this. I'll call Mason and have him send someone to help me find him."

Michael nodded. "Alright, babe. I thought you'd be freaking out, but you seem pretty chill now."

Isabella smiled and asked, "By the way, babe, ever thought about working for me? I could be your boss."

Michael burst out laughing. "Oh really? And what exactly would my job be?"

Isabella tilted her head, thinking seriously. She knew Michael was sharp in business, but where should she put him?

Michael kept joking, "So, would my job be cleaning for you, giving you massages when you're stressed, cooking for you, pouring coffee? Maybe even scrubbing your back in the shower? Or, you know, undressing and lying in bed when you have certain... needs?"

"Stop it! I need an employee for the company, not a house servant!" Isabella shot back, her face turning red.

Michael chuckled, "But I feel like a servant right now. And you haven't even paid me."

Isabella laughed too, "You're right, I haven't paid you. So, I guess I won't be needing you for those things anymore."

Michael's face changed instantly. He jumped up from the sofa and said, "No, no, no, I think being a servant is actually pretty great. I'll massage your shoulders and legs when you're tired, cook for you whenever you're hungry. I'll do anything for you, but please, don't cancel those needs."

Isabella's laughter on the other end of the line grew louder, and Michael could vividly imagine her sitting on the floor, holding her stomach and laughing.

"Please, babe," Michael cooed playfully into the phone.

Isabella, still laughing, said, "You're so cheesy!"

"I'm only cheesy for you. No one else gets to see this side of me," Michael said with a smile, twisting his body, then he turned his head and saw Jerry staring at him, wide-eyed.

The whole office fell into an awkward, eerie silence. Jerry and Michael just stared at each other, neither saying a word.

In the quiet office, only the persistent sounds of Michael's phone could be heard.

"Alright, babe, I gotta go. Don't worry about me, I'm good," Isabella said, kissed the phone, and hung up.

Michael put away his phone, looked at Jerry expressionlessly, and asked, "When did you come in?"

Jerry blinked, hesitating before responding, "Around the 'Please, babe' part?"

Michael turned around, closed his eyes, and took a deep breath. "Forget everything you just saw."

Jerry's mouth twitched, trying not to laugh. "Mr. Williams, you know, I have a really good memory."

Michael opened his eyes and said lightly, "I remember you wanted a vacation, right? There's a project in the wild forest conservation area. Go feed the monkeys. Take a break."

###chapter 295 Escaping Overseas

Jerry never thought he'd end up in this mess just because he saw something he shouldn't have and cracked a joke at the wrong time. Now, he was facing Michael's wrath.

"No, no, no, Mr. Williams, you know me! My idea of a vacation is sunshine, beaches, and bikinis. Not forests, mosquitoes, and monkeys! Please, I swear I can forget everything I saw," Jerry pleaded, his hands outstretched in desperation.

Michael sneered, "Maybe you could wear a bikini in the blazing forest at noon, feeding mosquitoes and monkeys. And as for the beach, that's a piece of cake-I'll get you an hourglass!"

Jerry almost dropped to his knees, his face twisted in desperation. "Mr. Williams, please, I didn't see anything, I swear!"

Suddenly, Jerry had a lightbulb moment and bolted out of Michael's office, only to return a few moments later, knocking on the door like nothing had happened.

When Jerry walked back in, he had a calm expression. "Mr. Williams, these are the new company documents that need your signature."

He acted like he hadn't just been begging for mercy a minute ago.

Michael took a deep breath, grabbed the documents from Jerry, and sighed, "You're shameless to a whole new level."

Jerry shrugged. "C'est la vie."

Michael rolled his eyes, signed the documents, and slapped them against Jerry's chest. "Now get out of my office. As for your vacation, I did plan to let you have a couple of days off. But now, I've changed my mind. You're staying put."

Jerry's face fell. 'Damn capitalist, greedy capitalist, stingy capitalist...'

He kept cursing Michael in his head as he walked out of the office.

Meanwhile, Jasper, who had been running from everyone, finally made it to the meeting point arranged by Joe.

Jasper leaned against a container, panting heavily, his face flushed.

He hadn't dared to take public transportation and hadn't eaten much since leaving the hospital. The money he had was only enough for a loaf of bread.

Luckily, that bread kept him going, or he might have passed out from hunger.

Scanning the crowd with wary eyes, Jasper soon spotted a man wearing a red beret.

Making sure no one was watching, he approached the man cautiously.

"I'm Jasper. Did anyone tell you to pick me up?" Jasper asked carefully.

The man in the red beret smiled and waved. "Alright, Mr. Taylor, no need to be so formal. I'm Joe."

Jasper recognized the voice from their phone call and felt a bit annoyed. "Why didn't you just tell me you were the one picking me up?"

Joe shrugged and smiled, "Does it really matter? Besides, you're a guest arranged by Mr. Williams himself, so I have to personally welcome you. It's a sign of respect for Mr. Williams."

Jasper shot Joe a cold look, took a deep breath, and said, "Where's the boat? I want to leave now."

Joe rolled his eyes. "Come on, Mr. Taylor, do you see what time it is? The ship doesn't leave for another four hours! The cargo ship hasn't even finished loading yet. I can't send you off now."

Jasper sighed, glancing at the half-loaded cargo ship. He knew he had to wait.

"So what am I supposed to do now? Wait in the cabin for four hours? Damn it, I haven't eaten. I'm starving," Jasper muttered, staring at Joe, hoping for some food.

Joe shrugged. "I'll take you to a container where you can hide until we reach another country's port. My people will get you out. Let me take you to that container first, then I'll bring you some food."

Joe led Jasper towards the container.

Jasper kept his head down the whole time, worried about being recognized.

But in reality, Jasper's worries were unnecessary. Everyone on the dock had been replaced by Michael's subordinates.

As for Zane, who Joe replaced, he did die in a gang fight. Poor Zane actually managed to escape, but Joe needed his position, so he took him out and credited the killing to the enemy.

When they reached a red container, Joe ushered Jasper inside. "Stay here and don't move around. I'll get you some food. What do you want to eat?"

Jasper waved his hand dismissively, "Just food and water. By the way, how long is the trip?"

"At this ship's speed, it'll take sixteen days to reach Lumaria," Joe said.

Jasper frowned and shook his head. "I don't need to go to that country. Just get me out of this country and arrange an identity for me so I can take a plane. You don't need to worry about the rest."

Joe frowned. "It's not impossible for you to disembark midway. This ship will resupply at a port in two days. By then, you'll be out of the country. But arranging an identity for you won't be easy."

Jasper gritted his teeth. He dared not make any phone calls now, but Joe was clearly asking for money.

"You just want money, don't you? I'll give it to you now." Jasper seemed to make a hard decision, raised his fist, and hit his own face.

Jasper felt the pain from the punch but nothing else.

"What are you doing? Are you trying to threaten me by self-harm?" Joe asked, confused.

Jasper, his frustration mounting, explained through gritted teeth, "I have two gold teeth in my mouth. That should be enough. But I'm too hungry, I don't have the strength..."

Before Jasper could finish, Joe punched him hard in the face. Jasper screamed in pain and spat out two bloody teeth.

Looking at the two white teeth on the ground, Jasper's anger flared anew. "You idiot," he cursed vehemently, "you hit the wrong side!"

###chapter 296 Two Gold Teeth

Jasper clenched his jaw and leaned in again, and this time Joe put all his strength into a punch that landed hard on the other side of Jasper's face.

The hit was so strong that Jasper was momentarily airborne before crashing to the ground.

"How about that? Did your gold tooth fall out?" Joe asked, grinning.

Jasper staggered up, glaring at Joe while spitting out two bloodied gold teeth.

"This is the price I paid. Get me out of the country ASAP," Jasper growled.

Joe eyed the bloody teeth, bits of gum still clinging to them. He picked them up with a grimace and weighed them in his hand.

"These should do. Well, since you look so pathetic, even if it's not enough, I'll cover the rest," Joe said with a sneer, turning to wash the teeth at a nearby water pipe.

But as he took a few steps, Jasper called out.

"What now? Got more gold teeth?" Joe's eyes lit up with a greedy glint.

Jasper covered his mouth, stepping back in panic, shaking his head. "No, I don't. I really don't. I just need you to get me some liquid food. I can't eat solid stuff right now."

Joe glanced at Jasper's swollen cheek, surprised. "Alright, I'll get you some oatmeal."

Joe walked off with the gold teeth in hand.

Jasper quickly hid inside the container.

Lying there, blood dripped from Jasper's mouth, his cheek grotesquely swollen from the missing teeth.

Staring into the dark container, Jasper muttered to himself, "Once I get out of here and get the money, I can find a good dentist to fix me up with new gold teeth. After all, I'm not short on gold."

Feeling hungry, Jasper touched his stomach, hoping Joe would bring food soon.

About half an hour later, Joe came into the container with a lunch box.

"Come and eat," Joe's voice echoed.

With a swollen face, Jasper slowly emerged.

Seeing Jasper's pitiful state, Joe showed no mercy. He was playing the role of a ruthless criminal involved in illegal emigration, with no need for sympathy.

"Here's your oatmeal. I added some sugar for energy," Joe handed the lunch box to Jasper.

Excited, Jasper opened the box to find a steaming bowl of oatmeal.

He eagerly started gulping it down, not caring about the heat.

As Jasper ate, he didn't notice the sinister smile on Joe's face.

Joe felt like everything was going suprisingly well. They had been wondering how to get Jasper to swallow the tracker, and now, with his missing teeth, Jasper could only eat liquid food. This made it easy for Joe to slip the tracker into the oatmeal.

Soon, Jasper finished the bowl, feeling warm and energized.

"The taste isn't great, too sweet," Jasper grumbled, licking his lips.

Joe rolled his eyes. "Just be glad you have something to eat. Eat less, so you won't have to relieve yourself in the container."

He handed over some plastic bottles and bags.

"What are these for?" Jasper asked, confused.

Joe's frustration was clear. "You'll be at sea for two days. Think you won't need to relieve yourself or get seasick? The bottles are for urine, and the bags... if you dare to mess up the container with your crap, I'll end you!"

Clenching his remaining teeth, Jasper, who had never faced such humiliation, took the bags and bottles back to the container.

Seeing Jasper's dejected look, Joe smirked, then left to inform Michael about the successful execution of their plan.

Back in the container, Jasper tossed the bottles and bags into a corner, then lay down.

"These damn bastards. Once I have the money, I'll hire people to take each one of you out. I'll make you eat your own shit," Jasper muttered under his breath.

Unbeknownst to Jasper, a small round object in his stomach began to expand, and several mechanical claws emerged, attaching to the stomach wall and emitting a red light after swimming around in his stomach.

Meanwhile, Joe called Michael to report on the situation.

"Mr. Williams, everything is done. I got Jasper to swallow the Parasite Localization device. Also, there are two gold teeth here. What do you want to do with them?" Joe asked.

Michael knew why Joe was asking and casually replied, "I don't want those smelly teeth. You can keep them if you want. By the way, have you sorted out Jasper's travel plans?"

Joe chuckled, "Don't worry, Mr. Williams, it's all set. Once Jasper gets off the ship, someone will take him to the airport abroad and put him on a plane. He'll be accompanied the whole time. And you know the guy, it's Tim."

Michael laughed approvingly, "With you two on the job, I can relax. Jasper's in your hands."

Joe and Tim Bridges used to run with some local thugs and steal cars when they were younger. One time, they tried to steal Mike's car, but Mike caught them in the act.

Seeing their young age and clever looks, Mike took them under his wing, made them study, and trained them for more clandestine tasks.

Mike had introduced Joe and Tim to Michael before, and they had helped Michael with some tasks, performing exceptionally well, earning them Michael's enduring trust and admiration.

Meanwhile, Isabella had already found a restaurant for her resignation party with her colleagues.

Since John's card still had some money left, although the amount was insignificant to the Taylor Family's companies, it was enough to treat her colleagues to a meal. So, Isabella generously booked a decent-looking restaurant for her farewell party.

###chapter 297 Family Conversation

Just as Isabella rolled up to the restaurant, ready to party with her old work buddies, Michael was back at the hospital, visiting Mason and John.

The second Michael stepped into the ward, Mason jumped in, "Did you hear? Jasper busted out of the hospital."

Michael nodded. "Yeah, Mason, I heard."

Mason let out a heavy sigh, "And your guys didn't catch wind of it?"

Michael's face darkened, shaking his head, clearly pissed off by the whole mess.

After a beat of silence, Mason suddenly grinned, "Jasper played us all. Not just your crew and John's. Even the other three big families had people watching the hospital, but they never saw it coming. Jasper, who was supposed to be in a coma, slipped out right under their noses."

John's fists clenched, his voice icy and hard. "When I get my hands on Jasper, I'm breaking his legs. That old man has been messing with me, and I'm not letting it slide."

Michael just looked at John, staying silent.

Mason turned to John, his smile both knowing and challenging. "You holding up okay? Being in the crosshairs of the three big families isn't a walk in the park."

John nodded, cool as a cucumber, "It's not a big deal. I can manage my finances for now."

Mason pressed on, "If it gets too much, let me know. We're family, after all. Your uncle and I will back you up."

John's eyes locked onto Mason's, cold and unyielding. "Grandpa, is this some kind of test from you?"

Mason put on an innocent face. "Why would you think that?"

John snorted, "Only you, me, and Michael know about our bet and the property split. I doubt the lawyers and accountants would dare cross the Williams Family. They wouldn't sell out such crucial info to the three big families. So, it had to be you who told Paxton and the others about our property split, right? That's how they targeted my assets so precisely."

Mason suddenly smiled, no shame at all. He waved his hand, "Yep, I did it. I wanted to see how Paxton and the others would handle you, or if you could fend off the three big families. So far, you're doing alright."

Mason openly admitted John's suspicions.

John was fuming, his fists clenched, but he couldn't lash out, not with his grandpa and uncle right there. He couldn't fight back, even if they started it.

John's gaze shifted to Michael, who seemed lost in thought.

"Michael, do you have any way to track down Jasper, or any tricks to deal with the three big families?" John suddenly asked.

Michael's eyes flickered with surprise, a faint smile playing on his lips, "Didn't you say you could handle it yourself? Why are you asking for my help?"

'I'm just trying to remind you not to make things worse for me right now,' John thought, already feeling the pressure from the three major families. The last thing he needed was Michael adding to his problems.

"I just want to hear your advice. You've got way more experience and know-how than I do. Maybe I can learn something from you," John replied, trying to sound humble.

But Michael saw right through him. While he sneered inside, he kept a faint smile on his face.

"I'm afraid I can't offer you any useful advice," Michael said, making John's expression tighten.

Mason watched their exchange with curiosity, clearly interested in the dynamic between uncle and nephew.

"Michael, I'm your nephew. Can't you trust me even a little? Or are you worried I'll use your methods to get out of trouble and then cause problems for Isabella?" John shot back, clearly annoyed.

'You got it. I don't want you causing us any more headaches,' Michael thought, still sneering inside.

Shaking his head, Michael replied, "No need to provoke me. I really can't teach you. My experience comes from overseas, and the chaos there is a whole different ballgame. In my territory, if someone targets me, I send people to their homes, point a gun at their heads, and make them kneel. Simple as that. But here, I can't do that."

John blinked, trying to wrap his head around the kind of chaos Michael was talking about, something he'd never seen firsthand.

"Is it really that bad where you're from? Sounds like a war zone. Your dad must've been even tougher than my grandpa to build a business in that mess," John muttered.

"Talking about this is pointless. Whether it's you, me, or the three major families, we're not pros at finding people. That's a job for the police or the thugs. We just have to wait for news," Michael said with a faint smile.

"But how long do we wait? Relying on the police and thugs means that once one person finds Jasper, everyone else will know too. This city has no secrets from the four major families. Then it's a race to see who can act faster," John argued.

Michael, unfazed, just sighed and said, "Sometimes luck is its own kind of strength. If fate doesn't want you to find something, you won't. But if it does, you might just bump into what you're looking for while taking a walk in the park."

John furrowed his brows. "Michael, are you saying I should leave everything to fate?"

###chapter 298 Uncle's Advice

John was starting to think Michael was talking nonsense. Sure, some of what he said made sense, but when you really thought about it, it was almost laughable.

Michael, with a thoughtful nod, started telling John a story.

"When I was a kid, I lost a key. I looked everywhere in my room but couldn't find it. I tore the whole house apart, but still couldn't find any trace of it. Eventually, I gave up. But a few days later, while changing clothes, I found the key in the pocket of a shirt I wore two days earlier. Since then, whenever I lose something and can't find it after one search, I stop looking. Because eventually, it'll just show up." Michael shrugged, thinking back on that life lesson.

John got what Michael was saying, and Mason looked at Michael with admiration.

"We're always thinking about competing," Mason said, staring off into the distance, "but sometimes, taking a break can give you a new perspective."

John still felt uneasy. He thought maybe he would eventually hear from Jasper, but what if the other three found him first? By then, he'd get nothing.

"Damn those three major families, Paxton and his crew are just a bunch of idiots, making a big deal out of a secret that might not even exist," John angrily pounded the bed.

Mason winced, "Watch it, you hit my leg!"

John quickly pulled his hand back and started massaging Mason's leg.

Michael almost burst out laughing. Suddenly, his phone buzzed, and he checked it. His brow furrowed a bit.

Noticing Michael's change in expression, Mason asked, "What's up?"

Michael put his phone away and said, "It's my wife Estella. She's back from overseas and she's meeting a big director to talk about a new movie where she's the lead. She ran into some trouble at a restaurant, something to do with Paxton's wife."

"Need my help? Last time your wife was here, she didn't stay long. Maybe she should stay with us this time," Mason offered.

Michael shook his head. "It's nothing serious, just some minor issues. I can handle it."

With that, Michael got up, said goodbye to Mason, and left the hospital room.

After Michael left, John turned to Mason, curiosity in his eyes, "How did Michael's wife end up dealing with Paxton's wife? And you didn't seem to know about Michael's wife going abroad."

Mason shook his head with a smile, "How could I find out something Michael wants to keep secret?"

John remembered a time when Mason had doubts about Estella's true identity. But when John asked Mason why he was suspicious, Mason just looked at him and said nothing.

John wanted to ask again, but given his strained relationship with Mason, he figured Mason wouldn't tell him anything, so he kept quiet.

Meanwhile, after leaving the hospital, Michael sat in his car, his expression growing darker.

The info came from Leo, Isabella's driver who was at her farewell gathering.

Leo's message was short and sweet: [Isabella and Estella met, Zoey wants to kick Isabella out of the restaurant, and they had a conflict.]

Michael quickly texted Leo back, asking him to secretly start a video call so he could see what was going on.

Soon enough, Leo sent a video call request. When Michael answered, he saw the restaurant on the screen, with Isabella standing in front of two women, looking like they were in a standoff.

Rewind to half an hour earlier, Isabella had just arrived at the restaurant to meet up with her colleagues.

Dwayne was there too. Once everyone was there, Isabella asked him to say a few words as the leader.

Dwayne hesitated but went for it, raising his glass and saying, "Even though Isabella isn't our director anymore, her contributions have been huge. Honestly, I'll miss her, but I can't stop someone from moving up! Now that Isabella's taken over the family company as the president, let's wish her company even more success in the future!"

After Dwayne's toast, the gathering wrapped up. He wasn't the main event, and since no one really liked hearing him talk, he kept it short.

Dwayne's tactfulness made his colleagues like him more. The gathering was still cheerful until two women showed up.

"Ms. Foster, this restaurant is owned by our Brown Family. It's new, but the food is just as good as any Michelin-starred place. I know you like it quiet, so I'll book the whole place for us later," Zoey greeted Estella with a warm smile.

Estella smiled back faintly.

But when Zoey asked the restaurant manager to clear the place, his face fell, "Mrs. Brown, if you had told me a day earlier, maybe I could've done it, but now it's not possible because the restaurant is already booked." The manager looked stressed. Kicking out all the customers from a newly opened restaurant was a big deal, and the manager couldn't handle that.

As for Zoey? Forget it. As the wife of the family head, she was way more important than a lowly manager. Would Paxton punish his wife? No way. If the restaurant faced backlash, Paxton wouldn't blame his wife; the manager would be the scapegoat.

The manager looked at Zoey, hoping she'd cut him some slack and go to another restaurant.

Estella, seeing it was a lost cause, was ready to let it go, but Zoey saw Isabella and told the manager, "Get these people out now. If you can't do it, I'll call Paxton."

###chapter 299 The Boss's Wife

The restaurant manager felt a wave of dread wash over him when he heard Zoey's demanding tone.

Estella frowned at Zoey, "Zoey, there's no need for this. We can eat anywhere. Kicking out customers will hurt your family's business."

Estella's advice wasn't out of concern for Zoey or the Brown Family's business. Michael had warned her not to damage his reputation as his nominal wife, and she didn't want to upset him over something so trivial.

But Zoey's anger was boiling over. Even though she knew Isabella wasn't directly to blame for Pearl's suffering, Pearl was in this mess because she once kidnapped Isabella, so Zoey held Isabella indirectly responsible.

"Didn't you hear me? Get Isabella and her friends out of here now!" Zoey yelled at the manager.

Zoey's angry voice cut through the air, catching the attention of many.

Isabella noticed Zoey and the somewhat familiar Estella next to her.
