"Just wait, Isabella. This time, you're going down!" Bianca muttered, clenching her fist.

Meanwhile, Isabella strolled back into the CEO's office after the press conference.

Juliet was already there, looking thrilled to see her.

"Ms. Taylor, what do you need me to do?" Juliet asked eagerly.

Isabella settled into her chair, smiling. "Go find Ms. Lester, the head of HR, and ask her to come see me."

"On it, Ms. Taylor," Juliet said, hurrying out.

A few minutes later, Juliet returned with Carol. She knocked and stepped inside.

"Ms. Taylor, Ms. Lester is here," Juliet announced politely.

"Thanks, Juliet. You can go now," Isabella said, waving her off. Juliet left, closing the door behind her.

"I heard this assistant came from your old company. Not bad, she's not too nosy and follows orders well," Carol said with a smile, glancing at the door.

Isabella motioned for Carol to sit on the couch, then joined her, still smiling. "She's got potential. With the right guidance, she could become a top businesswoman someday."

"I trust your instincts, but you didn't call me here just to chat about your assistant, did you?" Carol asked, smiling.

Isabella shook her head, her expression turning serious. "I need to shake up the company's personnel. We need to get rid of those who supported my father, those who broke company rules, and John's people. He's been investing in the company for a long time; I'm sure he's planted his own people here."

Isabella laid out her plan, confident Carol would provide the information she needed.

Carol tilted her head, looking at Isabella with a smile. "Are you sure about this? Many of the rule-breakers are actually members of the Taylor Family. Some are even your elders. After the family fell apart, your father gave them jobs here. If you clear them all out, people might say you're heartless."

Isabella glanced at the gloomy sky outside the window. The gray clouds felt suffocating.

"When there's rot, the best way is to cut it all out and treat the healthy parts. Only then can the body heal. Holding onto the decay will just drag everything down, turning the company into a corpse for crows and vultures," Isabella said calmly.

Carol looked impressed and pulled out a USB drive. "Here's the info you wanted. You can investigate further, but be careful. Some of these people are pretty ruthless."

Isabella took the USB drive without flinching. "It's fine. I've faced death more times than I can count."

###chapter 306 Michael's Concerns

Carol felt something off in Isabella's words.

Carol looked into Isabella's eyes, curious. "What made you the way you are?"

Isabella shrugged with a smile. "When you have a sister who wants you dead and parents who aren't much better, you get desperate."

Carol blinked, remembering the news about Isabella and the shocking details of her trial. Carol had never thought any parents could want their own child to die.

"Surviving that mess must've been tough," Carol sighed.

Isabella smiled, walking behind her desk and plugging a USB drive into the computer. "I've had a lot of close calls, even almost getting killed by a wild boar once. But I always managed to survive, mostly thanks to my husband. Though there was that one time I should thank two kangaroos."

"Wait, kangaroos? Like super kangaroos?" Carol asked, intrigued.

"Yeah, they were like super kangaroos. I named them Optimus Prime and Megatron. They once stomped a wild boar to death," Isabella said casually, scrolling through the USB drive's contents and recounting her wild forest adventures.

"Seems like you've had some divine intervention. Anyway, I have work to do, so I'll leave you to it," Carol said, smiling as she left. But Isabella's smile faded as she looked at the USB drive's contents.

The USB had dirt on the company's top brass, including serious stuff like bribery and inappropriate behavior with female employees.

One supervisor had raped a female subordinate, paid her off, and kept her as his mistress because she had a sick mom. When she got pregnant, he arranged an abortion. Most appallingly, he killed her sick mother..

The subordinate eventually jumped off a building. The police found what looked like a suicide note in her room.

The USB had photos of the note, torn from a notebook, which looked more like diary entries to Isabella.

'My mom is gone. What do I do? I feel so hopeless. Is death my only way out?'

The note ended abruptly, not because she wrote so little, but because part of it was torn off.

Isabella squinted, examining the document. The info pointed to a guy named Duncan Taylor, who was from Isabella's own family.

Isabella stroked her chin, packaged the USB contents into an email, and sent it to Michael.

Soon, Michael called her.

"Hey, what did you send me? Looks like some dirt on your company's people," Michael said with a smile over the phone.

Isabella nodded, speaking seriously. "I need you to help me check if this stuff is true. Some of these people have bad records, but most of it seems like rumors. We need solid proof."

Michael was always there to help Isabella dig up whatever she needed, and he had some top-notch private detectives on speed dial.

"No problem, babe, I got this. By the way, what do you want for dinner? I'm not working late, so I can whip up something special to celebrate your first day as CEO," Michael said, smiling over the phone.

Isabella smiled too, despite being furious about the dirty things her subordinates had done. She wasn't going to let those jerks ruin her mood.

"How about some pan-seared cod?" Isabella suggested.

"Consider it done, babe. It'll be ready when you get home," Michael replied, chatting a bit more before hanging up.

After the call, Michael's face darkened as he read through the email.

"If this stuff is legit, these guys are going to rot in prison," Michael muttered, narrowing his eyes as he dialed his driver, Leo.

Leo, cruising around the city, pulled over to take the call.

Leo's main gig was chauffeuring Isabella to and from work, so he had plenty of downtime to kill.

Michael's tone was serious. "Did you catch Isabella's press conference? She might've pissed off some folks at the company. I have no idea how they'll react, so you need to protect her. Use force if necessary. I'll arrange for some discreet backup too."

Leo's face turned serious. "Got it, Mr. Williams. I'll make sure Ms. Taylor is safe."

Leo hung up, drummed his fingers on the steering wheel, and headed to a hidden spot. When he came back to the car, he had two handguns, extra magazines, and a bulletproof vest.

He put on the vest and covered it with his jacket. Leo thought, 'Maybe I should get a vest for Mrs. Williams too?'

After a moment's hesitation, he went back to the hideout, grabbed another vest from it, tucked it under the car seat, and headed back to Isabella's office.

Meanwhile, in a nearby café, a shady-looking middle-aged man ordered coffee and sat by the window.

He stirred his coffee, making clinking sounds, and kept glancing at his watch, looking impatient.

Just then, a waitress approached and placed a piece of paper in front of him.

He looked at the paper, which had a series of numbers on it. Smiling at the waitress, he asked, "Is this your number?"

The waitress, clearly grossed out by his sleazy grin, kept her cool. "No, sir, someone asked me to give this to you. They said it's about your fate."

###chapter 307 Bianca's Warning

Duncan glanced at the number on the paper and waved the waitress away.

He checked his watch again, annoyed that his appointment was late. But then he looked at the paper again and something clicked.

Duncan pulled out his phone and dialed the number. The call was answered quickly, and a slightly hoarse voice came through.

"Sorry, sir, I can't meet you in person. This is the only way to contact me," the voice said casually.

Fuming, Duncan snapped, "It's really you, you jerk! You emailed me to meet, and now you stand me up? Don't you realize how precious my time is?"

The person on the phone mocked, "Oh, did I mess up your routine of harassing and assaulting female subordinates? If so, my bad."

Duncan's eyes narrowed. "I don't know what you're talking about. I've never done anything like that. Keep slandering me, and I'll gather evidence and sue you."

The voice on the phone laughed, then turned icy. "That girl's name is Maddy Ramos, right? You hired thugs to beat her and cause a miscarriage, threatened her mom, went too far and caused her death, and then pushed Maddy down the stairs. Think no one knows? You still have that torn diary, don't you?"

Duncan's pupils shrank. He looked around nervously, then lowered his voice. "What do you want?"

The voice on the phone was cold. "Relax, I'm not the police. I'm calling about Isabella."

"Isabella? Our new CEO? You want me to target her?" Duncan's eyes narrowed, guessing the guy's intentions.

The voice didn't hide it. "Exactly. I want you to take her out. Not just at work, but completely."

"Are you nuts? You want me to take her out? How am I supposed to do that?" Duncan growled through gritted teeth.

The voice sneered, "What if she's planning to take you out? Remember what she said at the press conference. You're smart, think about all the crap you've pulled over the years. You're worthless to the company, just a dirty bug. Isabella wants to clean house and win over the employees. The best way is to get rid of you bugs. Think those you've bullied won't snitch?"

A flash of nervousness crossed Duncan's eyes. His reputation at the company was trash. If Isabella wanted to clean up, someone would definitely rat him out. Even if they didn't have solid proof, Isabella might find something if she dug around.

"Isabella's been kidnapped before, so she's probably got some serious security. I only know street thugs, and they don't have the guts to kill," Duncan admitted. Most of the killing he had done before was accidental or due to excessive force.

So far, Duncan had only directly caused one death, the poor pregnant girl Maddy. But he wasn't dumb; he wouldn't personally go and kill someone.

The voice on the phone snapped, "Is your brain full of mush? Bugs like you are all over the company, and Isabella will definitely get rid of you. Gather your people, hire some real hitmen. It's not hard. Those thugs won't do it because you're not paying enough!"

The suggestion made Duncan pause. It was a way out. Instead of waiting for Isabella to target him, maybe it was better to take her out first.

"If we do this, Mason might retaliate," Duncan said cautiously.

But the voice on the phone reassured him, "No one will retaliate against you. Once Isabella is dead, the company shares will transfer to Bianca, and she can protect you all."

Duncan's eyes lit up. "Are you with Bianca?" he asked quickly.

The voice neither confirmed nor denied. "Finish this quickly, if you don't want to end up in jail."

With that, the call ended.

Duncan tried calling back, but the phone was off and he couldn't get through.

On the other end, Bianca took out the SIM card, used tweezers to pick it up, held it in front of a lighter, and completely destroyed it.

Then, Bianca removed the voice changer from her neck. "Isabella, let's see how you'll fight me this time. Don't blame me when you meet your maker," Bianca said with a bitter smile.

Realizing he couldn't reach the caller again, Duncan slammed the table hard, then stood up, paid the bill, and left the coffee shop. He needed to gather his allies in the company to figure out how to deal with Isabella. He couldn't do this alone.

Finding those targeted by Isabella wasn't hard. Duncan and Isabella were from the same family, and most of the wrongdoers were too.

Duncan made a few calls, gathered them in an empty meeting room, and explained the crisis. They were all on edge.

"We absolutely have to stop that bitch Isabella. We can't let her find out what we've done," a woman screamed.

"I just took a little money. Her father was corrupt too. Why doesn't she go after him first?" someone complained.

Duncan looked at them coldly. "Complaining won't help now. We need to unite to take down Isabella. I don't have enough money, so let's pool our resources and hire a hitman."

###chapter 308 The Killer Appears

Isabella got home from work and found Michael had whipped up her favorite dish, pan-seared cod. As they ate, she shot him a playful grin.

"Hey babe, my period's over," she said with a wink.

But Michael didn't take the bait. He just smiled, brushed a strand of hair from her face, and said, "You must've had a crazy day at work. You look beat. How about you get some rest? We can pick this up when you're feeling better."

Michael could see how tired she was. He wasn't the kind of guy who let his urges take over. Sure, Isabella made it hard to resist, but he had willpower.

Isabella felt touched. She remembered their promise but knew she was exhausted.

"Thanks, hon," she said with a smile and kept eating.

That night, they just slept, nothing more.

Meanwhile, someone put a hefty bounty on Isabella online, drawing in some dangerous hitmen who started making plans.

The next day at work, Isabella had a weird feeling, like something bad was about to happen.

Juliet came by with some documents and noticed Isabella looked off. "Ms. Taylor, are you feeling okay? You don't look so good," she asked, concerned.

Isabella smiled and shook her head. "I think I just didn't sleep well last night. Probably too tired."

She chalked it up to work stress, not realizing it was a sign of something bigger.

After work, Isabella wrapped up her tasks and headed to the parking lot.

Leo was there to pick her up and drive her home.

But halfway there, Leo's face got serious. "Ms. Taylor, we're being followed."

Isabella's heart skipped a beat. She checked the rearview mirror but couldn't tell which car it was in the rush hour traffic.

"What's going on, Leo? What did you see?" she asked, nervous.

Leo squinted at the mirror. "A black Honda's been tailing us. I saw it in the parking lot but didn't think much of it. It's been on us since we left. I tried losing it, but no luck."

Isabella spotted the black Honda, with two masked figures inside.

"Should we call the cops?" she asked, grabbing her phone.

Leo didn't stop her. Instead, he handed her a bulletproof vest.

"Put this on. It's rush hour, so they probably won't shoot, but we can't be sure," Leo said, dead serious.

Isabella looked at the traffic around them and frowned. "What if we just park somewhere crowded? They probably won't follow us there, right?"

But Leo was busy with something on his phone. Isabella leaned over, confused, and saw he was messaging someone.

Suddenly, Leo put his phone away and said, "It's worse than you think. There's a $3 million bounty on you. That's enough to make some real crazies come after you. Crowded places might actually be more dangerous. You don't want a random pizza guy pulling a knife on you, do you?"

Isabella quickly put on the bulletproof vest. "Three million? Who would do this?"

Leo shook his head. "No idea. Maybe it's related to your press conference. I had a bad feeling after that, so I got this gear ready. Let's hope we're just being paranoid."

"What if we just stay in the car?" Isabella asked, her voice shaking.

Leo gave a bitter smile and shook his head. "I'm worried some nutjob might have planted a bomb under the car."

Before he could finish, the roar of motorcycles filled the air. Leo glanced in the rearview mirror, his face going pale.

"These maniacs!" Leo ignored the traffic lights and floored it.

Two guys on motorcycles, wearing leather jackets and helmets, sped up to their car, swinging steel pipes at the windows.

Isabella ducked down, hugging her head. The pipes cracked the glass but didn't break it.

The thugs looked surprised by the tough glass. While they were stunned, Leo swerved and hit one of them, knocking him down.

The other thug pulled out a disc-like object and threw it at the car.

Leo's face changed. He hit the gas and turned the wheel sharply.

The disc was supposed to stick to the car, but Leo's sudden turn made it fall to the ground. It exploded, startling everyone.

"These lunatics are using bombs! Is $3 million really worth it?" Isabella shouted, both scared and furious.

Leo shook his head. "You don't get it. Three million is life-changing for some people. The money you rich folks lose in a game could be more than some people make in a lifetime."

###chapter 309 Leo Gets Injured

With that, Leo revved up the engine and they sped off.

"Where to next? Maybe we should head straight to the police station. They wouldn't dare follow us there," Isabella suggested, clearly pissed off.

"These guys are nuts; they don't care about their lives. The cops might not be able to protect us, and we're pretty far from the station," Leo replied, noticing a few cars tailing them.

"Shit, these guys are total maniacs," Leo muttered, gritting his teeth as he weaved through the streets. The thugs were trying to push them towards less crowded roads, making it easier to attack.

Leo had no choice. If he headed to crowded place, the heavy traffic would mean stopping and risking bombs being planted on their car.

Facing a bunch of crazies, stopping wasn't an option.

As the car started to slow down, Leo's face turned grim.

"Dammit, the car's got a problem, probably from that explosion earlier," Leo said, slapping the dashboard.

Isabella's heart was racing.

"It's okay, Ms. Taylor, I'll protect you," Leo assured her, scanning their surroundings. The dense forest might be their only shot.

Leo floored it, then parked the car in the forest. He jumped out, pulling a handgun from his waist.

"Let's go, Isabella, we need to get out of here," Leo said, leading her deeper into the woods.

Meanwhile, Michael got Leo's distress call. His eyes were bloodshot with anger.

"You idiots, didn't I tell you to protect Isabella secretly? Is this how you do it?" Michael yelled into the phone.

The subordinate replied, "Mr. Williams, we couldn't get too close or Isabella would notice us. Rush hour traffic separated us from Mrs. Williams, and by the time we got there, Leo had driven too far away."

"I don't want your excuses. Find them and take out those damn killers!" Michael shouted, then slammed his phone on the ground.

After taking a deep breath, Michael picked up the phone and made another call. "Track Leo and Isabella's location. I need to know where they are."

The subordinate quickly provided the info. Michael gathered his team and rushed to their location.

In the depths of the forest, Isabella and Leo were running like crazy. Despite the rough terrain, some of the thugs were skilled trackers, hot on their trail.

Suddenly, Leo tackled Isabella as a bullet whizzed past their heads.

Leo turned, raised his gun, and with two quick shots, two thugs fell to the ground, clutching their chests.

"Exciting, huh? Never thought I'd be back in the bodyguard game," Leo joked, grabbing Isabella's hand and pulling her along.

Isabella gritted her teeth, trying to keep up with Leo. Her high heels were slowing her down, and she wanted to stop and break them off to run faster.

Suddenly, she felt something wet on her hands. She looked down and was shocked to see them covered in blood.

"Why is there blood on my hands? I'm not hurt," Isabella said, turning to Leo.

With a pale face, Leo gave her a weak smile. "Looks like a bullet got lodged in my shoulder."

Isabella finally noticed the wound on Leo's left shoulder, blood trickling out.

"You're hurt! But not in the leg. We need to stop the bleeding," Isabella said, glancing nervously at the approaching thugs.

Leo shook his head and slumped against a tree. "It's not that simple. My leg's injured too."

He pointed to his leg, his black pants already soaked in blood.

Patting Isabella's shoulder, Leo handed her a handgun. "Don't worry about me now, just run. I can hold them off for a bit."

"Think they'll give me a chance to make a run for it?" Isabella rolled her eyes, checking the gun. It had 8 bullets left.

Facing the approaching thugs, Isabella took a deep breath, released the safety, aimed, and started shooting.

Two bullets hit a tree, but one nailed a thug right in the head.

The remaining thugs quickly took cover behind trees.

With a pale face, Leo smiled. "Didn't know you were such a good shot."

Isabella's expression was serious. "I used to play with guns at the shooting club, but this is my first time shooting at real people."

"Then think of it as a shooting club. It's not much different, just no respawns," Leo said, raising his gun and taking out two more thugs.

Clearing the gun smoke, Leo laughed. "It's been a while since I worked as a bodyguard, but I guess my shooting skills are still sharp."

Seeing more thugs charging at them, Isabella raised her hand and fired, hitting one thug in the arm.

Leo squinted and tried to shoot again, but his gun was empty.

"Damn it, are we gonna die here today?" Leo gritted his teeth, feeling a wave of despair.

Suddenly, a thug hurled a round object towards them. Leo's eyes widened, adrenaline surging through his veins. Ignoring the pain, he jumped up and shielded Isabella with his body.

It was a grenade.

The grenade exploded, sending fragments everywhere.

Leo lay motionless on top of Isabella.

###chapter 310 Emergency Rescue

Isabella was totally floored by the blast from the grenade.

Even though Leo took most of the hit, she still felt like puking, probably from some internal injuries.

But then she saw Leo sprawled on top of her, blood trickling from his mouth, eyes shut, looking dead as a doornail.

"Leo, hang in there! Don't you dare die on me!" Isabella yelled.

No matter how much she screamed, Leo just wouldn't wake up.

Furious, Isabella grabbed a gun and started firing at the thugs. She managed to hit two of them, but most of her shots just hit the trees.

When she ran out of bullets, she broke down, clutching Leo and crying.

"You bastards, if I survive this, I swear I'll hunt every one of you down," she snarled, her eyes blazing with hatred.

Just as the thugs closed in, guns aimed at her, a bullet suddenly took out the guy in front. More shots followed, coming from all directions.

Cops in uniform started shooting, hitting the thugs in their hands and feet, making sure they couldn't run.

Michael came rushing in with a gun, and his face went pale when he saw Isabella and Leo on the ground.

"Get them to the ambulance, now!" Michael shouted, and two officers quickly lifted them and ran towards the ambulance.

"Michael, you finally made it. Please, save Leo. He got hurt protecting me," Isabella sobbed, collapsing into Michael's arms.

"Don't worry, he'll be okay," Michael assured her, carrying her out of the forest and signaling to the officers.

One of the officers nodded.

After Michael left, the officer said, "Mr. Williams is pissed we didn't protect Mrs. Williams. We can't screw up again. Get all the info he wants in 3 minutes!"

Soon, the screams of the thugs echoed through the woods.

Isabella stayed by Leo's side until the ambulance left the forest. Consumed with sadness and worry, she failed to notice that those suspicious officers were not driving police cars.

Outside the operating room, Isabella sat quietly, waiting. Michael was right there with her.

The doctor checked her out and found her internal organs were a bit shaken up but not too bad. Her worst injuries were just some scrapes and bruises.

Isabella cried in Michael's arms, "Leo got hurt because of me. He has a wife and kids. If he dies, I don't know how I'll face his family."

Michael hugged her tight, "He'll be fine, I promise."

"Leo's just a driver, but he protected me like a real bodyguard. His family thought being a bodyguard was too dangerous, so they made him a driver. And now I've put him in danger again," Isabella said, feeling guilty.

Michael felt a pang of guilt. He hadn't been honest with Isabella about Leo. The whole story about Leo being a driver with a family was a lie; Leo was always a bodyguard and didn't have a family.

'If something happens to Leo, I might have to hire a couple of actors to play his family,' Michael thought, feeling helpless.

Just then, the lights in the operating room went out, and the doctor walked out.

Isabella rushed over, her voice trembling, "How is he, doctor?"

The doctor looked calm. "Don't worry, the surgery went well. The grenade was low-quality and not very powerful. The worst injuries were from the two gunshots, which caused him to lose some blood. The grenade fragments only got into his muscles and didn't reach any vital organs. We've removed all the shrapnel. He just needs plenty of rest now."

"Thank goodness, thank you, doctor," Isabella said, feeling a wave of relief wash over her.

Michael hugged her and smiled. "See, I told you he'd be okay. Now we just need to take care of Leo and figure out how to get back at those who did this."

Michael quickly changed the subject, worried Isabella might try to contact Leo's non-existent family.

Sure enough, Michael successfully diverted her attention, and a look of determination flashed in her eyes.

"You're right, I need to find out who tried to kill me! I won't let them get away with this," Isabella said, clenching her fists.

Michael nodded. "The police must have caught some of the thugs. Maybe they can tell us who's behind all this."

Just then, Michael's phone rang. It was Jerry.

Michael's eyes narrowed. If he was right, Jerry's call was probably about the thugs.

"Mr. Williams, I just got back from the police station. They found out the person targeting Isabella is from her company. They arrested him. It's kind of funny, he was about to jump off a building but chickened out, and the firefighters nabbed him," Jerry said.

Michael squinted. "How could a coward like him hire hitmen to kill someone?"

Isabella nodded. "Exactly, Jerry, did you find out anything else?"

Jerry was startled. He had guessed Isabella was probably with Michael, so he tried to avoid mentioning Michael's identity. It seemed he was right.

Jerry continued, "Mrs. Williams, we did find something else. This guy is just a regular employee at your company, with no money to hire hitmen. But last night, a large sum of money was deposited into his account. We traced it back to someone named Duncan."

Anger flashed in Isabella's eyes. "I know him. That jerk caused the death of a female employee. The first thing I'll do as CEO is take him down!"

###chapter 311 Arrest the Culprits

Meanwhile, Duncan was at home, pacing around the kitchen with his phone, waiting for any news.

"This has to work, right? The big payout should lure some desperate folks to take out Isabella. She can't survive this," Duncan muttered, clenching his teeth.

Last night, after the group who wanted to take out Isabella met up, they put their money together to hire a team of hitmen, just as Duncan suggested.

Duncan thought he was being smart, using a scapegoat he had dirt on to contact the hitman. He figured the guy wouldn't refuse, even if it meant suicide. But he didn't know that guy was a total coward.

Suddenly, Duncan's phone rang. He glanced at the caller ID and immediately answered. 

"How's it going?" he asked eagerly.

"Don't worry, sir. We've confirmed Isabella's dead," came the voice on the other end-Duncan's scapegoat.

"Great job!" Duncan exclaimed, hanging up the phone. He was so excited that he rushed to the liquor cabinet and opened a bottle of his prized red wine to celebrate.

Meanwhile, the man who had just hung up carefully approached the police officer. "I did what you asked. Will I get a reduced sentence?" 

The officer nodded curtly before leaving the interrogation room. Their goal in making that call was to keep Duncan calm and prevent him from fleeing.

Twenty minutes later, the door to Duncan's apartment was kicked open, startling him as he sipped his wine. When he got to the doorway, he was met with an arrest warrant.

"Duncan, you're suspected of hiring a hitman to commit murder. You're coming with us," an officer said, practically shoving the warrant in Duncan's face.

"No way, you must be mistaken. I couldn't have done that," Duncan protested, but the officers slapped handcuffs on him.

All the way to the station, Duncan kept shouting. But no one paid him any mind.

It wasn't until he was locked in an interrogation room that he started to face reality.

Officer Brenda Pena, who had met Isabella several times before, was part of the interrogation team this time.

Brenda came out of the interrogation room with a list in hand.

She walked into Chief Alan Savage's office and handed him the list.

"Chief Savage, these are the names Duncan gave us. Should we start making arrests?" Brenda asked.

Alan nodded. "This incident is serious. They fired guns and used bombs in crowded areas. We need to arrest them."

Brenda muttered under her breath, "If the four major families could just chill for a bit, the crime rate in this city would definitely drop."

Alan coughed, giving Brenda a warning look. "Alright, mind your words. Our station is funded by the four major families. Even your uniform is thanks to these 'philanthropists.'"

When Alan mentioned the philanthropists, his tone sharpened, showing his frustration with the recent actions of the four major families.

Brenda rolled her eyes and asked, "Chief Savage, did you lend police uniforms to others?"

Alan nodded. "Those uniforms are old, so I lent them to some models for their fashion show."

Leaning on the table, Brenda glared at Alan and said, "So you're telling me the people who brought in those armed criminals today are all models? Those criminals should be in the hospital first, not prison!"

Alan shrugged, "Some things are better kept to yourself. They did save us some hassle. If we interrogated them by the rules, these desperados might not have confessed this quickly. But our victims need to know the truth ASAP."

Brenda took a deep breath and whispered, "Which family is it this time?"

Alan raised an eyebrow and looked at Brenda. "It's tied to Isabella. Who do you think it could be?"

After that, Alan waved his hand and started organizing the files on his desk. "You can go now. Remember, I know you have issues with the four major families, but even the weakest one, the Brown Family, isn't someone we can mess with. If you really want out of this mess, go find Jasper. At least that job seems easier."

Annoyed, Brenda said, "Where do I even find him? That jerk might have already skipped the country. Are you gonna pay for me to investigate abroad?"

Alan sighed and put down the files. "If you're willing to take a break abroad, I can help you out. Your aunt wants to see you. When are you planning to visit?"

Brenda seemed to lose all her energy. She didn't say anything and just left the office.

With the list in hand, Brenda joined the team heading to Isabella's company for the arrests.

The company execs were caught off guard by the sudden police raid. They turned pale as they were handcuffed and dragged out of the building.

Carol raised an eyebrow at the scene. "Is Isabella moving this fast? I gave her the info yesterday, and today she's already making arrests?"

Carol's confusion was shared by many employees. Someone had posted about the arrests online, and soon reporters swarmed in for interviews.

At the same time, news broke that Isabella had been attacked on her way home. "The new CEO of the Taylor Group, Isabella was attacked by her father's subordinates. Isabella escaped, but the driver was seriously injured and unconscious."

When Carol saw this, she suddenly understood why Isabella acted so quickly.

"These impulsive idiots, the investigation on Isabella just started, and they couldn't wait to hand over the evidence," Carol muttered about Duncan and his crew.

By the time everyone targeting Isabella was arrested, she was back at the company, handling business. She needed to reassure those innocent employees and keep them from feeling unsafe.

While Isabella was busy stabilizing the company, Michael was on the phone with Jerry, setting up a new task.

"My wife almost died in that forest this time. You know what to do, right?" Michael said coldly.

Jerry promised over the phone, "Don't worry, Mr. Williams. Once they're in prison, I'll make sure they regret it!"

Satisfied, Michael hung up and waited for the police interrogation.

###chapter 312 Suspecting Bianca

Michael couldn't wrap his head around the idea that Duncan would try to take out Isabella just because of something she said at a press conference.

There had to be more to it.

Isabella was on the same page. When she got back from work, she shared her thoughts with Michael.

"This has Bianca written all over it. No one else wants me dead more than she does," Isabella said, her voice icy.

Michael gently dabbed medicine on Isabella's wound. He looked at her and asked, "So, what's the plan? We might not have proof, but we can still give her a hard time."

"She's like a cockroach. One day, I'll squash her," Isabella fumed. With John protecting Bianca, she couldn't go after her directly.

Just then, Michael's phone rang. He glanced at the screen and ignored the call.

"Who's that?" Isabella asked, curious.

Michael showed her the caller ID. It was Jerry.

"Jerry probably wants to talk about a case, but you need me more right now," Michael said with a smile.

Isabella frowned at him. "The case is more important. I'm not as fragile as you think."

She took Michael's phone and called Jerry back. Michael just smiled and let her.

"Jerry, what's up? Any new leads on the case? Is someone pulling Duncan's strings?" Isabella asked.

Jerry hesitated before saying, "Yeah, we've got something. The cops found out Duncan got a call telling him to kill you to avoid being targeted. The caller said Bianca would protect him. The number's been deactivated, so we can't trace it. Also, Mason's been digging into this."

Michael's eyes narrowed. Jerry's last comment was a hint that Mason needed to talk to him. Michael's phone had a special program that hid calls from Mason, leaving no trace.

Jerry's message was clear: Mason couldn't reach Michael and had to go through Jerry.

"Sweetheart, you stay put. I'm heading to the police station," Michael said, pocketing his phone.

"Aren't you supposed to be comforting me? How can you leave now?" Isabella pouted.

Michael playfully pinched her nose. "But you just said the case is more important. Jerry's good, but he can miss things. I need to dig into this, see if Bianca's behind it, and figure out our next move."

After thinking it over, Isabella nodded. The security here was solid, so she wasn't too worried about being targeted. She just reminded Michael to be careful and keep a low profile.

Michael kissed Isabella on the forehead before heading out of the villa.

Instead of going straight to the police station, he took a detour and ended up at the Williams Villa.

Mason had just gotten back from the hospital and needed some rest. The Williams Villa was the perfect place for him to recover.

In the living room, Mason sat on the sofa, looking stern and leaning on a cane. John was on the other side of the room when Michael walked in.

"Mason, what's up? You wanted to talk?" Michael asked, taking a seat.

Mason's face was grim. "I heard Isabella was attacked and almost killed. You know about this?"

Michael nodded. "Yeah, I'm on it. The cops have already nabbed the guy."

Mason nodded, tapping his cane in frustration. "Isabella's family is a mess. She's the only decent one among them."

John frowned. Mason's harsh words stung, especially since they included Bianca, the woman he cared about.

Noticing John's reaction, Michael asked, "John, has Bianca been in touch with anyone lately?"

Mason paused and turned to John, frowning.

John glared at Michael. "What are you getting at?"

Michael stayed calm. "Duncan confessed that someone pushed him to go after Isabella and said Bianca would protect him. The contact was careful, using a single number that's now deactivated-a burner phone."

John's face darkened. "You think Bianca's behind this?"

Michael met John's gaze without flinching. "We have to consider who benefits the most. If Isabella's out of the picture, Bianca stands to gain the family shares without competition."

"Enough. You've got the wrong idea about Bianca. She might have been misled, but that doesn't make her evil," John snapped, standing up to defend her.

Mason looked at John, clearly angry and disappointed.

John turned to Mason. "Grandpa, you need to see the bigger picture. Someone might be trying to frame Bianca by taking out Isabella, stirring up trouble between us. Instead of pointing fingers at Bianca, why not check what the other three major families are up to?"

"You think the other families are trying to divide us with this scheme?" Michael asked.

"Isn't that a possibility?" John shot back coldly.

###chapter 313 Warning John

John had a hunch that the three big families were stirring the pot to ramp up the tension between him and Mason. But Michael wasn't buying it.

"The three families have always thought the Taylor Family's got some secret recipe to revive the family business. No way they'd let Bianca get her hands on it to boost the Williams Family. And Isabella? She's the last person that would team with us. They should be protecting her, not going after her," Michael said, cool as a cucumber.

John scoffed, "Our family's been helping Isabella for ages. Why wouldn't she work with us?"

"Get real, it was your grandpa who helped her, not you. Remember what you did to her? It's not like you can forget," Michael shot back, giving John a cold stare.

John squirmed under Michael's gaze.

Mason frowned. "What are you two on about? Is there something I don't know?"

Mason glared at both of them, clearly annoyed.

Michael caught the pleading look in John's eyes and smirked, "I'm talking about John blowing off Isabella for eight years and ditching their engagement to be with her sister. Women don't take betrayal lightly. Isabella must find John repulsive, that's all."

John was pissed but kept his mouth shut. He didn't dare tell Mason about the time he almost took Isabella's kidney.

Mason might blow a gasket and end up back in the hospital.

"Got it, that makes sense." Mason glared at John and tapped his cane.

"Alright, Michael, you handle the Isabella situation. Make sure no one messing with her gets away with it," Mason ordered.

Michael nodded.

After leaving the Williams Villa, John headed back to his vineyard.

Bianca had a meal ready and was hanging up his clothes.

"What's up? You look stressed," Bianca asked softly.

John hesitated, then sat down at the table, looking at Bianca's sweet face.

"Did you see the news? Isabella was almost killed. She got attacked, and her driver was seriously hurt and taken to the hospital," John said casually.

Bianca feigned shock. "Isabella got hurt? Is she okay? Should we go see her at the hospital?"

John studied Bianca's face but saw nothing out of the ordinary.

He had no idea Bianca was a pretty good actress. Plus, he was too smitten with her to think straight.

John was convinced Bianca had nothing to do with it, so he relaxed and said, "The cops caught the attackers, and they led to a bunch of arrests at the Taylor Group. Someone said they were put up to it. My grandpa and Michael think it might be you."

'Idiots!' Bianca cursed silently in her heart.

On the surface, Bianca's face went pale. "Mason and Michael suspect me? Why? Oh, if Isabella dies, I'd be the biggest beneficiary. I guess I do have a strong motive."

She started to cry, walked over to John, and held his hand. "It's not me, you have to believe me. I couldn't do something so stupid. If anything happens, everyone will suspect me. Maybe someone's trying to frame me or target your family?"

Bianca quickly shifted the focus to the internal conflicts of the Williams Family.

"I don't know, but I already told my grandfather you wouldn't do something like this," John said, gently hugging her.

"Don't worry, as long as I'm here, no one can harm you," he said earnestly.

Bianca hugged him tightly, but there was a hint of resentment in her eyes.

'Damn Isabella, you escaped again. It's getting harder to kill you,' she thought.

The next morning, after a night's rest, Isabella showed up at the company. Reporters were already swarming downstairs.

Isabella looked at them without any nervousness or surprise. She knew these vultures would definitely come for her after what happened yesterday.

Soon, they surrounded her, firing off questions about the previous day's events.

"Isabella, it's said this incident happened because you were going to fire a group of employees. What do you say about this?"

"Isabella, after such an incident, will you still continue with the original standards?"

"Isabella, do you suspect this incident is related to Bianca?"

Isabella looked at the reporters and said calmly, "Justice will never bow to evil. Those fools tried to assassinate me because they fear the truth. I'll dig deeper and kick out the rotten apples in the company. Their moves just fuel my fire. As for whether it's related to Bianca, I can only say trust the police and let them investigate."

After speaking, Isabella went back into the company.

On her way to the office, many employees greeted her, feeling lighter after she cleared out the bad apples.

Isabella smiled and responded to them. When she arrived at her office, Carol was already waiting for her.

"You told me before that you were on the brink of death many times. I didn't quite believe it, but now I do. There are indeed many people who want to kill you," Carol said emotionally.

Isabella smiled, "Such things might happen in the future. If there's nothing urgent, try not to get too close to me, or misfortune might come your way."

Carol nodded. "You're right, I don't want to die so soon. Here are the documents you wanted."

She placed the prepared documents in front of Isabella.

Isabella opened the folder and looked through it for a while, nodding in satisfaction. "I've investigated this before, and your lists match mine. Looks like you're up for the task, no problem."

###chapter 314 Jasper's Whereabouts

Isabella's always quick to dish out compliments to Carol.

As the CEO, Isabella'd have to clean house, getting rid of the dead weight and making room for fresh talent. She was all about promoting the right people and, if needed, bringing in new blood.

She'd already gone over the list of staff Carol put together and thought it was spot on. These talents could really help turn things around for the company.

"With all this praise, I might just get a promotion tomorrow," Carol joked, grinning.

Isabella nodded earnestly. "If you want, once this task is done, you can get a promotion, and I'll even throw in some company shares."

Carol was stunned, "You're giving me your shares? Nah, wait until you catch your dad and get all his shares, then you can give me some. Better not mess with what you have now, or I might just sell them to Bianca."

Isabella chuckled, knowing Carol was kidding, but she didn't mind. "I trust you wouldn't do that."

"Even though I appreciate you, your charm hasn't reached that level yet," Carol said bluntly.

"Alright, let's drop the shares talk for now. By the way, heard anything about your dad lately?" Carol asked.

Isabella shook her head. "I hired a private detective, but the cops are still on his trail. It's like he vanished. I'm starting to wonder if he's even still in the country or if he's dead."

"That sounds more like a curse than a blessing." Carol shrugged with a smile.

Isabella waved her hand dismissively, "Just thinking about him annoys me. Let's not talk about him. Let's focus on this task. What's your plan?"

Carol pointed to the thick stack of files and grinned, "I'm thinking of giving a decent position and a good salary to the most mediocre person to attract more talent."

Isabella looked intrigued, crossing her arms. "Is it psychology? Make people think if someone like him can get a great position, then why can't I? With that mindset, we can attract more talent?"

Carol nodded. "Exactly, what do you think?"

Isabella clapped her hands. "Great, I believe in you! Can't wait to see you get that promotion and raise."

Meanwhile, Jasper had just gotten off the ship.

Someone handed him a paper bag. "Here's your new ID and some cash. It's enough for a plane ticket. The rest is up to you. Good luck!"

The person glanced at the plastic bottle and bag in Jasper's hand with a look of disgust and left quickly.

Jasper didn't give a damn about the other guy's rude attitude. He'd been holed up in a container for the past two days, peeing in a bottle, puking in a plastic bag, and dealing with his own crap.

He looked like a total mess, like some homeless dude off the street.

Jasper chucked those gross bottles and bags into a trash can, then headed into a convenience store to grab a sandwich and a cup of coffee.

"Finally free. I can live in peace now," Jasper muttered, almost tearing up.

Little did he know, someone had their eyes on him.

Back in Avalonia, a young guy stormed into the police station, slamming Jasper's wanted poster on the desk. "Officer, you need to take this seriously. This guy stole my phone and wallet!"

The cop's face changed when he saw the poster. He immediately reported it.

Soon enough, all four major families got wind of this.

Mason's expression darkened as he listened to Charles's report.

"Did that guy really say that? He reported it ages ago, but the cops didn't take it seriously?" Mason asked, frowning.

Charles nodded with a bitter smile. "Yeah, because that area has a lot of robberies, the local cops didn't pay much attention. The kid didn't expect to get his phone and wallet back. But he stumbled upon Jasper's wanted poster and reported it again. The reward for info on Jasper is worth more than what he lost."

Mason waved his hand, exasperated. "Alright, cut to the chase. Where's Jasper now?"

Charles got serious. "The man said Jasper was calling someone to help him leave the country from a dock. The cops checked his phone records and confirmed the person Jasper called was involved in shady stuff."

"So Jasper's already out of the country?" Mason's brow furrowed even more. If he was, finding him would be a nightmare.

Other the other side, John was fuming.

"Damn it, that bastard played me!" John yelled, smashing the cup in his hand.

John had also gotten the info from the police. When he found out Jasper had contacted someone shady to leave the country, he immediately thought of the contact info he had given Jasper.

The phone records the cops checked confirmed it.

John remembered calling the guy named Joe, who swore he wouldn't help Jasper leave. But the facts showed Joe had lied.

John couldn't reach Joe by phone, so he ordered his guys to bring Joe in.

###chapter 315 Joe on the Run

Not only did John get the scoop, but the other three big families also sent their guys to track down Joe.

But by the time they hit the dock, Joe had already scattered his crew.

When John's guys showed up at Joe's place, the room was empty except for a piece of paper pinned to the wall.

The note read:

"Sorry, Mr. Williams. I did say I wouldn't help Jasper skip town without cash. But he had a few gold teeth. I had no choice but to take his offer and get him out. So don't hold it against me! Always respectful, Joe."

John's men rolled their eyes at the note and brought it back.

John ripped it to shreds after reading it.

Meanwhile, Joe was chilling in Mike's office, munching on ice cream.

Joe grinned. "John must be losing it right now, huh? Think he'll just tear up the note?"

Mike leaned back in his chair, smirking, "I bet what he really wants to tear up is you."

Joe shrugged. "Nah, I'm worth way more than that note. Besides, I didn't lie. No money, no help for Jasper. It's all about the gold!"

Mike waved his hand dismissively. "Alright, enough about those gold teeth. Every time I see your bling, I think of Jasper's nasty mouth, and it grosses me out."

Joe flashed his gold ring and necklace. "You don't get it. Gold's got a charm. Those pretty ladies might find your face gross, but when they see the gold around your neck, they'll be all smiles and fall right into your arms."

Mike rolled his eyes. "Mr. Williams said you should lay low for a while, so no chasing after those curvy beauties."

"No way, I just set up a date with a hottie," Joe grumbled.

But just then, Mike's phone rang.

Mike glanced at the caller ID, his expression turning serious.

"Shut up, it's John," Mike hissed at Joe.

Joe, still chuckling, clamped his hand over his mouth.

Once Joe quieted down, Mike answered the call.

"Mr. Williams, what can I do for you?" Mike asked, his voice dropping to a serious tone.

On the other end of the line, John asked icily, "Has my uncle been up to anything lately? Did he send anyone to the dock?"

Mike feigned surprise and shook his head. "Nope, our guys haven't been near the dock recently. Why do you ask?"

John sneered, "Are you kidding me? The only people at the Moonlit Lounge that night, besides me, were your guys. You know Jasper had the contact info for some human smuggler, right?"

Mike's tone turned frosty. "Mr. Williams, it was you who gave Jasper that contact info. Isn't it funny you're asking me now?"

John replied coldly, "The person I originally set up is dead, and Joe took his place. Are you seriously saying Joe has no ties to you guys?"

"Never heard of him before, Mr. Williams. Think about it. Isabella took Jasper to the hospital. She's the one most likely to have the contact info. Why don't you ask her?" Mike retorted.

John went silent. He couldn't believe Isabella would do something like that. In his mind, she wasn't that clever or sneaky.

John did suspect Michael. But if it was really Michael, wouldn't that mean he helped Jasper escape from the hospital?

However, everyone had analyzed Jasper's escape, and it was full of holes. If it weren't for the fact that all the guards had let their guard down, he wouldn't have been able to escape at all. If it was Michael, he wouldn't have made such a rookie mistake.

"Looks like you've figured something out, Mr. Williams. I won't keep you. Think it over. Anyway, if it wasn't me, why should I admit it?" Mike said, ready to hang up.

Mike was being blackmailed by John with a contract, so he didn't need to be polite.

But just then, John coldly snorted into the phone. "You better not be involved. When I catch that Joe, I'll tie him up and feed him to the crocodiles."

Joe, covering his mouth, widened his eyes in horror at John's words.

Mike smiled slightly. "Telling me won't help. You need to find Joe and talk to him."

Mike hung up the phone after saying that.

Joe finally let his hands drop. He had been too nervous to breathe. Now, breathing heavily, his face turned pale with fear.

"I was just messing with him. John actually wants to feed me to the crocodiles. That's too harsh," Joe said unhappily.

Mike smirked and said, "Don't you want to find a hottie? Go ahead! Have a great night."

Mike tried to push Joe out, but Joe refused to leave.

Joe clung to Mike's leg, crying, "No, I don't want to get killed. Those hotties might be planning to off me and collect a reward from John. It's safer to stay with you."

###chapter 316 Tracking Jasper

Joe wasn't up for running around town, hooking up with girls anymore.

From the phone call, it was clear John was hunting him down, probably wanting to kill him.

Scared out of his mind, Joe stuck with Mike and refused to leave. Michael had already tipped Mike off that the big four families were likely after Joe. He told Mike to keep an eye on Joe and not let him wander off.

After Mike left, he called Michael.

"Mr. Williams, it's all sorted. Joe's promised not to run off again. I didn't even have to tell him about the four families. Just one call from John, and he was clinging to my legs, begging for protection," Mike laughed, remembering Joe's fear.

Michael chuckled, "Keep him safe for now. Once things calm down, send him abroad."

"Got it, Mr. Williams." Mike's face turned serious as he remembered something.

"Mr. Williams, remember that media company that spread rumors about Isabella and Mason?" Mike asked.

Michael nodded. "Yeah, I remember. Didn't you say those guys fled abroad? Something new come up?"

"Yeah, one of them came back under a fake name. An acquaintance recognized him and tried to shake us down for money. We've lost track of him, but we're on it," Mike informed Michael.

Michael squinted, tapping the table lightly. Those rumors were probably Bianca's doing. But she couldn't have done it alone; there had to be someone backing her. Maybe this time they could catch those guys.

"Keep tabs on them. Once you find them, dig into who's behind them." Michael hung up, confident Mike could handle it.

Meanwhile, after John finished his call with Mike, he didn't get any useful info. He couldn't be sure if Joe was set up by Michael.

"Could it really be like Joe said, that Jasper bribed him with gold teeth?" John frowned, thinking it over. Of course, he had someone looking into Joe's whereabouts.

Not just John, but the other three big families were also on Joe's trail, along with Mason's crew.

"Any luck finding Joe?" Mason asked Charles.

Charles shook his head. "We only found some clues about how he joined the gang."

Mason, leaning on his cane, said seriously, "Spill it, I want to know how this guy showed up."

Because of his maturity, he became the gang leader's confidant. Then, a conflict broke out between this gang and another controlling the docks. During the struggle, the gang leader was killed. So Joe took over the gang and the illegal emigration business."

Mason lightly rubbed his cane, then suddenly smiled. "Joe's no simple guy, playing all four major families like that. Who do you think Joe's working for?"

Charles, with his head down, thought for a moment and said, "The info about that human smuggler came from Mr. John Williams. The only ones who saw Jasper that night were Mr. John Williams, Mr. Michael Williams, and Isabella. Isabella's the most likely, since she took Jasper to the hospital and had access to that info."

Mason shook his head slightly. "You're missing someone."

Charles suddenly remembered and exclaimed, "Are you talking about Isabella's husband?"

Mason nodded. "Isabella's husband has always been a mystery. She claims he's just an ordinary guy, but how could an ordinary person escape the scrutiny of the four major families?"

Charles nodded in agreement. "You're right. We've also suspected that Isabella's husband might be connected to a major force abroad. If that's the case, pulling off something like this is possible."

Mason stood up, leaning on his cane, and started pacing. "If this is Isabella's husband's doing, we don't need to worry. He'll have people keeping an eye on Jasper until they find the hidden funds."

Charles nodded. "Should we look into Isabella's husband's identity?"

Mason shook his head. "Forget it. We've found nothing so far, and we might not find anything this time either. Let's see how this plays out."

Mason suddenly remembered something. "By the way, what are the other three families up to?" he asked Charles.

"Paxton and the other two families have had several meetings recently. They even suspect that Jasper has hidden the family's secrets and embezzled funds together. So they're also looking for Joe. However, they seem to have shifted their focus and are now looking for clues on that departing cargo ship," Charles reported.

Mason smiled. "They're not fools. Joe's just a human trafficker. Their real target is Jasper."

Charles sighed. "But Mr. John Williams still sent most of the manpower to find Joe."

Mason sneered. "John's just too arrogant. Apart from me, his uncle, and his father, he looks down on everyone else. He got played by Jasper and Joe, so he can't handle his anger now. I'm getting more and more disappointed in him."

Mason sighed and walked to the potted plant in the living room, taking a small pair of scissors to trim the withered branches.

"The flowers in the greenhouse need a good trim before being transplanted to the wild. It's the only way they'll thrive in the harsh wind and rain." Mason abruptly cut off the thickest branch.

###chapter 317 Investigation of the Three Major Families

Charles watched as Mason snipped off a perfectly healthy branch, his brow furrowing before he quickly caught on.

"Mr. Mason Williams, are you saying that if Mr. John Williams doesn't kick these bad habits, even if he thrives, he'll end up choked out like this branch?" Charles asked.

But Mason just shook his head. "I'm getting old, my eyesight's not what it used to be. I meant to cut the dead branch next to it but messed up."

Mason sighed, tossed the scissors aside, and headed back inside, looking pretty down.

Charles sighed too, watching Mason walk away.

All three major families were just waiting for Mason to kick the bucket, and his time was running out.

Meanwhile, Jasper, who had already fled the country, used some cash to change into new clothes and then hopped on another plane.

Sitting on the plane, Jasper watched the scenery shrink below, feeling a rush of excitement.

'Finally, I'm outta here! Now I can live it up as a rich guy,' Jasper thought.

What Jasper didn't know was that, not far from his seat, a young guy with a lazy look was hiding behind a newspaper, pretending to sleep.

But if you looked closely, you'd see the young guy sneaking peeks at Jasper from behind the paper.

'Jasper looks pretty pleased with himself, huh? Thinks he's in the clear? What an idiot, he has no clue what's inside him,' the young guy thought.

This was Tim, who had been tailing Jasper all along.

After silently mocking Jasper, Tim hid behind the newspaper again. Up in the air, he didn't have to worry about Jasper making a run for it. He needed to rest and get used to the time difference.

'Gotta rest up if I'm gonna keep tracking him. I really hope Jasper's hiding spot for the public funds is interesting. If he's just got it all piled up in one room, I'm gonna be so disappointed,' Tim thought.

On the other side, after a thorough investigation, the three major families finally tracked down the cargo ship. It had set sail for Lumaria.

Only the Davis Family could intercept the ship, so Richard sent his people.

After hours of turbulence, the helicopter finally landed on the cargo ship. The people sent by the three major families quickly took control of everyone on board and searched the entire ship.

But they found nothing, just some of Jasper's hair and poop in a red container.

"Tell me, where did the guy in that container go? Wasn't he supposed to head to Lumaria?" a tough-looking guy demanded, glaring at the captain.

The captain gulped, at first thinking they were pirates, but then realizing they were from the four major families he couldn't mess with.

"That guy didn't go to Lumaria. Joe told me he only had enough fare for the first stop, so he got off the ship right after we left the country. I don't know where he went after that. I'm just a boatman," the captain said with a nervous smile.

"Damn it, we've been tricked again!" The tough guy shoved the captain aside and stormed back to the helicopter.

The three major families came up empty-handed, only finding out that Jasper had jumped ship halfway. They headed back to report the bad news.

The captain watched the helicopter take off and let out a sigh of relief. His shipping company wasn't tied to the four major families, but his boss couldn't afford to cross them. Plus, with all three families working together, it was best to just go along with it.

"Mr. Williams, you should've seen the looks on their faces when they found out. It was priceless," Joe called Michael, laughing heartily over the phone.

Even though Joe had bailed from the dock and disbanded his gang, he still had a few guys left on the cargo ship.

After the three families' people left, one of Joe's guys called him and spilled everything.

Michael chuckled. He knew Joe would have to lay low in the safe house for a while, which would be boring, so he didn't mind Joe acting a little crazy.

"Next, the three families will keep digging around that port. But that country's pretty close to us. The three families still have some pull there, so it won't be too hard to find out the truth. I just hope Jasper isn't dumb enough to stash the public funds somewhere easy to find. He better hide it far away, somewhere even the four families can't reach," Michael said with a faint smile.

After Michael and Joe wrapped up their call, another call came in.

Michael glanced at the phone, saw it was Mike, and picked up.

"What's up, Mike? Did you find out who that man from the media company is?" Michael asked.

Mike nodded. "Yeah, Mr. Williams, we figured out who he is and found something interesting."

"What's so interesting? Spill it," Michael said, intrigued.

Mike continued, "Remember when Mrs. Williams was holding her first press conference, and a masked journalist barged in at the end, asking her questions? Then Mrs. Williams got attacked."

Michael's expression turned serious. "Are you saying those two are the same person?"

"Yep, Mr. Williams, they're the same guy. And we know where he's staying. We're about to nab him," Mike said, eyeing a nearby hotel.

After a lot of digging, they finally confirmed he was staying at this hotel. Now, they just needed to get in, find him, and make him talk about who he was working for.

After making sure Mike and the team were safe, Michael hung up.

Meanwhile, the journalist, who was about to get busted, was chilling in his room, playing with his phone.

Suddenly, there was a knock at the door. The journalist got up, looked through the peephole, and saw an old janitor outside.

"I don't need any cleaning," the journalist said, opening the door with a frown.

But then a gun was pointed at his head, followed by a gunshot.

###chapter 318 The Dead Journalist

When Mike and his crew got to the hotel, they walked in like regular guests and were hit by the loud hum of a vacuum cleaner as soon as they stepped out of the elevator.

"This place is crazy noisy," Mike grumbled, eyeing the bent-over janitor.

They didn't give the janitor much thought.

When they got to the journalist's room, they used a key to get in.

Right away, a weird smell, kinda like blood, hit them.

Mike's face changed, and he dashed into the room.

On the bed was someone wrapped in blood-soaked sheets.

Mike went over and pulled back the sheets. The journalist had a bullet hole in his forehead, eyes shut like he was sleeping.

Furious, Mike slammed his fist on the bed, then stormed to the next room and banged on the door.

After a few seconds of knocking, a young guy with messy hair and dark circles finally opened up, looking like he hadn't slept all night.

"What's the deal? Waking me up like this, who are you guys?" the young guy snapped at Mike.

Mike grabbed him by the collar, yanked him out of the room, shoved him against the wall, and growled, "Next, I'll ask and you'll answer. Say one more stupid thing, and I'll cut off one of your fingers!"

Scared stiff, the young guy just nodded.

"Someone next door got killed. Did you hear any gunshots?" Mike asked.

The young guy's eyes went wide, and he yelled, "Someone got shot next door? It wasn't me! I don't even have a gun!"

"I'm not saying it was you. Did you hear any gunshots?" Mike barked, smacking the guy's head.

The young guy shook his head. "No, I didn't hear any gunshots. All I heard was that damn vacuum cleaner; it was so loud I even cursed at it."

"The vacuum cleaner?" Mike muttered, piecing it together.

"Damn, the vacuum cleaner covered the gunshot!" Mike's face darkened. He led his team to find the janitor.

But by the time they got downstairs, the janitor was gone.

Mike got in touch with the hotel manager and found the vacuum cleaner. Inside, they discovered a bullet casing.

Mike quickly reported back to Michael.

Michael didn't blame Mike and his team. He knew how ruthless the other side could be.

Whether it was Odette getting poisoned in the hospital or the shootout with John in the abandoned factory, it just proved how savage they could get.

Mike and his team finding the journalist shot as soon as they arrived meant he was being watched. When the other side sensed trouble, they sent someone to take him out.

"I'm getting more curious about the folks backing Bianca. Who's got the guts to pull off such ruthless moves here?" Michael mused, his eyes cold and calculating.

Meanwhile, after a long day at work, Isabella was about to head out when the cops showed up again.

Seeing the familiar face of Officer Brenda, Isabella sighed, "Officer Pena, how many times have we met this month?"

Brenda shrugged. "Honestly, I don't want to be here either. Frequent police visits aren't exactly a good look."

Brenda plopped down on the sofa like she owned the place. She'd been here so often, it was almost routine.

Isabella sighed and told Juliet, "Go get Officer Pena a cup of coffee."

Juliet nodded but Brenda waved her off.

"Let's skip it. I just need to ask a few questions and then head back to the station." Brenda rubbed her forehead, looking exhausted. She'd been swamped with cases, one after another.

Isabella waved Juliet away and sat across from Brenda. "What's up this time?"

Brenda wiped her face and said, "A journalist who interviewed you got killed. Our investigation shows he was spreading false stuff about you and Mason online."

Isabella's brows knitted together. Half-joking, she said, "So now you're saying I have a motive to kill?"

Brenda sighed, "Guess who found the body first?"

Isabella raised an eyebrow, "I have no idea. Just tell me, I hate guessing games."

Rolling her eyes, Brenda said, "It was someone from the Williams Family. Naturally, they called the cops."

Isabella looked at Brenda. "Now I'm curious. You're talking about Mason's guys, not John's, right?"

Brenda nodded. "See my problem? Mason's got a motive too. When will these big families chill out? The complaints at the station are endless."

Isabella ignored Brenda's griping. She thought for a moment and said, "Mason's guys wouldn't be that sloppy. If they wanted someone gone, they'd make them disappear quietly, not in a busy hotel."

"Yeah, only people from big families know their own tricks," Brenda teased, a hint of sarcasm in her voice.

Isabella threw up her hands. "You don't always have to zero in on me and Mason. Sure, we have motives, but think about why this guy was spreading those nasty rumors and who put him up to it. I doubt a journalist would take on big families solo. Someone had to be behind him, and now they want him to shut up."

Brenda nodded, showing she was on the same page.

###chapter 319 Good News

Brenda didn't hang around Isabella's office for long. She just popped in for a routine check and didn't expect to get much out of it.

After work, Isabella headed home with her new driver and bodyguards in tow.

Michael had already wrapped up his day and was cooking when Isabella walked in. She wasted no time telling him about Brenda's visit.

Isabella grabbed a tomato from the fruit bowl, popped it into her mouth, and leaned against the kitchen counter, thinking out loud, "The only person I can think of is Bianca. But there's no way John framed Mason, so it must be those shady people behind Bianca."

Michael calmly set a freshly cooked dish on the dining table. "Let's eat first. No point in stressing over it now."

Isabella plopped down at the table, clearly frustrated. "I'm so sick of these people lurking in the shadows! Sometimes I just want to hire a hitman to take out Bianca so she stops messing with me."

Michael watched as Isabella angrily hacked at her steak. He chuckled and shared some good news.

She stayed there for over a week and then came straight back, which is super fishy. No way medical science allows for such a quick recovery," Michael said, a bit sarcastically.

Isabella put down her utensils, looking pleasantly surprised. "Really? That's awesome. Once we find the company's funds, I can go after Bianca fast! Next, we just need Benjamin to check out those doctors. I can't wait to throw the evidence in John's face and see if he can still play dumb."

Michael smiled, then suddenly thought of something.

Looking at Isabella curiously, Michael asked, "I gotta know, why is John so into Bianca? What kind of love makes him go against his grandfather? Did Bianca do something that made John willing to risk everything for her?"

Isabella shook her head. "I want to know that too. Why would John rather be a fool than face the truth?"

Michael pursed his lips, lowered his head, and started eating. He made a mental note to have someone look into it.

Meanwhile, after a series of investigations, the three major families finally tracked down Jasper.

"Our people infiltrated the airline company. After combing through the surveillance videos, we finally found Jasper. He boarded a flight to Novaria," Jonah said, handing the report to Paxton.

Paxton looked at the printed photo of Jasper on the report, a slight smile forming on his face.

"Finally, we found Jasper. He really made us work for it," Paxton said, tossing the document onto the table.

"Share this news with the other two families. We'll send people to track Jasper together," Paxton instructed Jonah.

Jonah hesitated for a moment and suggested, "Mr. Brown, since we already know where Jasper is, why not handle it ourselves? That way, whatever Jasper finds will be ours alone."

Paxton shot Jonah a cold look. "Are you questioning my decisions?"

Jonah quickly lowered his head. "No, sir. I'm sure you have your reasons."

Paxton snorted. "Do you think we're the only ones who can find this clue? The other two families are just as capable. Sharing it shows we're serious about cooperation. Plus, we have no influence in that country; we need their help."

Jonah nodded. "Understood, Mr. Brown. I'll deliver the documents now."

As Jonah was about to leave, Paxton stopped him.

"Also, share the information we found with the Williams Family's informants," Paxton said, a sly smile on his lips.

Jonah was momentarily surprised but quickly caught on.

Paxton's plan was devious; he wanted to stir up trouble between the Williams Family and the other two families to weaken them.

A small, ambitious family would have to find ways to weaken their rivals before they grew big. That way, everyone could stay on the same level.

Jonah smiled and immediately went to make arrangements.

Soon, all these families received the news and sent people to Novaria.

Novaria was a country with a coalition system, where the wealth gap between member countries was unbalanced. It was a paradise for criminals and a playground for the rich.

With money, you could enjoy an excellent life here. There was no need to worry about threats from criminals because the protected areas here had very strong firepower to suppress them. Therefore, it attracted a large number of evil capitalists and corrupt officials.

On the outskirts of the wealthy area was a street. Although it was not under the jurisdiction of the wealthy, it was relatively safe and orderly due to its proximity. Here, people didn't need to worry about being robbed or being assaulted for no reason.

Jasper walked out of a luxurious store, his expression sour.

"Darn it, why did the gold price drop again?" Jasper muttered to himself as he discreetly touched the stack of bills in his pocket, feeling a bit frustrated.

If Jasper opened his mouth wide, you'd see that he had lost a few more teeth.

Anyone who dared to open a jewelry store here had a powerful background. This was also a prime spot for money laundering and selling stolen goods.

Not long after Jasper left the gold shop, another young man walked out.

This young man was Tim, who had been tracking Jasper. Instead of following him, he went in the opposite direction.

Tim wasn't worried about losing track of Jasper; Jasper still didn't know that there was a tracker inside him.

"How many gold teeth does Jasper have? How obsessed is he with gold?" Tim muttered.

###chapter 320 Michael's Speculation

Tim had heard from Joe earlier that Jasper had given him a bunch of gold teeth.

Back then, Tim thought Jasper had handed over all of his gold teeth, but he was shocked to find out there were still some left in his mouth.

Tim headed back to his hotel and flopped onto the bed. Jasper's place was just across the street. To avoid suspicion, he took a bit of a detour.

He pulled out his phone and called Michael to fill him in on Jasper's latest antics.

"So, you're telling me Jasper's out there selling gold teeth again?" Michael's brow furrowed, his eyes flickering with thought.

Tim nodded. "Yeah, Mr. Williams. Jasper checks the gold price every day. Honestly, I feel like prying open his mouth to see how many gold teeth he's still got."

After Tim finished talking, he noticed Michael had gone quiet on the other end. Figuring Michael was deep in thought, he stayed silent and waited.

A few minutes later, Michael's voice came through the phone.

"Do you think Jasper might have turned all his embezzled money into gold?" Michael asked.

Tim was caught off guard. "Turned it all into gold? Well, it's not impossible, but considering how much he embezzled, that'd be a ton of gold, right?"

Michael chuckled. "If that's what he did, then Jasper's a real idiot. There are so many ways to hide assets, and he picked the dumbest one."

Tim scratched his head with a sheepish grin. "Honestly, Mr. Williams, if I were trying to hide money, I'd probably invest in some valuable items and stash them away."

"You don't get business and finance, and that's okay. But Jasper, running a company and not thinking of better ways, just shows he's got the business sense of a rock," Michael grumbled about Jasper again.

"The price of gold is going up in two days. Keep a close watch on Jasper. If he really turned all that money into gold, he'll definitely make a move soon," Michael instructed Tim before hanging up.

After the call, Tim scratched his head and muttered with a wry smile, "Mr. Williams knows his stuff, but Jasper really does seem like a fool in camparison."

Meanwhile, members of the four major families were trickling into Novaria. Despite the chaos, they had some connections here to help them handle shady business.

They reached out to their contacts, and with the help of local gangs, started hunting for Jasper.

With the gangs on the lookout, it was only a matter of time before they found Jasper. Despite his disguises, he wasn't completely safe.

Two days later, Jasper showed up at the jewelry store again. This time, his eyes lit up when he saw the gold prices.

"Awesome, it's even higher than before! I'm finally gonna strike it rich!" Jasper was so excited he almost teared up. He quickly looked down to hide his emotions.

Not far away, Tim was watching the whole scene unfold, a smirk playing on his lips. He thought, 'Looks like Mr. Williams was right. Jasper really did turn all that embezzled money into gold.'

After leaving the jewelry store, Jasper headed straight back to his place and stayed in for the rest of the day.

Tim lay in his room, quietly monitoring the location updates on his phone. He was patient, knowing Jasper would make a move eventually. Based on human nature, Jasper was likely to act late at night.

Tim stayed alert, ready to spring into action at any moment.

Suddenly, his phone vibrated. Tim's eyes snapped open, and he saw a red dot flashing on the screen, indicating Jasper was on the move.

'Is he finally making a move? Let's see where he's hiding all that money,' Tim thought, a glint of excitement in his eyes as he quickly left the hotel.

Meanwhile, under the cover of night, Jasper made his way to a rundown warehouse.

Jasper was super cautious, constantly checking his surroundings to make sure he wasn't being followed.

With the tracking device, Tim didn't need to get too close, avoiding the risk of being spotted.

Tim found that Jasper had stayed in one spot for a very long time before finally leaving. He followed the tracker to the rundown warehouse.

The warehouse door was locked and reeked of chemicals, a smell so bad even the homeless avoided it.

Covering his nose, Tim approached the door and found a lock. Picking it was no big deal for him.

He pulled out a thin wire, inserted it into the lock, and soon enough, the door clicked open.

Inside, the smell was even worse. Tim lifted his shirt to cover his nose and started searching.

But all he found were some old plastic barrels.

"Damn, there's nothing here! Did we guess wrong? Did Jasper turn all that money into plastic barrels? Is he planning to sell scrap?" Tim muttered in frustration.

Just as he was about to leave, he suddenly stopped.

"Wait a minute. This place doesn't add up. The warehouse looks huge from the outside, but the inside seems smaller." Tim squinted, suspecting there was a hidden room.

He searched again and accidentally pushed an ornament on a shelf, triggering a mechanism.

A wall slowly slid open, revealing several cars behind it.

"Could it be? If so, Jasper really surprised me." Tim could hear his heartbeat pounding in his chest.

He walked over to one of the cars, pulled out a small knife, and scraped the surface. Under the paint, gold gleamed!

"These cars are made of gold! I was right after all," Tim's face lit up with excitement.

###chapter 321 Replace them with Counterfeits

Michael's hunch was spot on. Jasper had turned all the public funds into gold and used the metal's unique properties to craft them into cars.

When Tim stumbled upon the gold cars, he couldn't contain his excitement. He scraped off the paint from each one, confirming they were all solid gold. Without wasting a second, he called Michael.

Michael was in bed with Isabella when the phone rang, waking them both. Isabella groaned in annoyance as Michael reluctantly answered the call.

"Who is it, babe? Who's calling you this late?" Isabella mumbled, still half-asleep.

Michael rubbed his eyes, checked the caller ID, and after a moment's hesitation, picked up the phone.

"Mr. Williams, we have a lead. I found where Jasper stashed the public funds. You were right; he turned them into gold!" Tim's voice buzzed with excitement.

Michael's eyes lit up, and Isabella, hearing the commotion, perked up.

"Did I hear my dad's name? Is this the private detective you hired?" Isabella asked, surprised.

Michael nodded. "Yeah, I had the PI team up with my dad's old contacts. They managed to track down your dad using their international connections."

Michael leaned back against the headboard, pulling Isabella close, and switched to speakerphone.

Isabella's eyes sparkled with mischief. "That's a bit naughty, but I love it. I can't wait to see his face when he realizes his precious cars are fakes. It'll be priceless."

After hanging up, Tim wanted to drive the cars out but realized there were no keys. Jasper must've hidden them.
