The next night, local car dealerships were buzzing with orders from a young man buying up a bunch of cars.

Similarly, a repair shop got a bizarre request from the same young man, asking for all the cars to be gold-plated!

"What kind of request is this? Do these people have too much money to burn? Gold plating isn't even real gold," one repair shop employee grumbled.

The shop owner walked over and smacked the employee on the head. "The customer is king. They've paid us a fortune, so get to work and stop whining!" the owner barked.

The employees got to work immediately.

Meanwhile, Jasper was blissfully unaware that his secret had been uncovered. He was busy contacting wealthy businessmen to sell the gold cars at a good price.

Finding someone willing to buy that much gold at once wasn't easy. Jasper had painstakingly accumulated the embezzled public funds and had the gold cars made one by one.

If he had the patience, he could sell the cars individually like before. But given the current gold prices, even if selling them all at once meant a slightly lower price, it was still acceptable. The main thing was that he could quickly move into a wealthy area and live the high life without worrying about safety.

In another city, members of the three major families gathered. This time, it wasn't the leaders but their reps.

Tanner slammed the table and shouted at the others, "Didn't we have a lead on Jasper? Why the hell hasn't he been nabbed yet?"

###chapter 322 Clues Found by the Three Major Families

Tanner was fuming. Just a few minutes ago, their gang stumbled upon a big lead: someone had spotted Jasper hanging around a jewelry store.

With this hot tip, the local gang quickly tracked down the hotel where Jasper was crashing.

Jay Belle, the Davis Family's rep, was a tall, skinny middle-aged guy with glasses. He adjusted his specs and shot a glance at the woman next to him. The woman, Hadley Ruth, had short hair and looked pretty average. She was the Brown Family's rep.

To make it all look legit, Tim even swapped out the tires on the gold-plated cars with new ones. Now, even if Jasper stood right in front of them, he wouldn't suspect a thing. No need to worry about the smell difference between new and old cars; the place already reeked enough.

After the switch, Tim had the real gold cars shipped near the dock and got in touch with an export manager. Using his connections, the cars were loaded into containers. Before long, Isabella and the crew would get this shiny gift.

The witness Tim was talking about was Jasper. They needed to bring back the public funds and Jasper, who was now a wanted man and could fetch a nice bounty.

Meanwhile, the four families had started digging into Jasper's whereabouts.

Jasper had just left the wealthy district and finally found a rich guy who could buy all that gold at once.

"Sweet, I can finally ditch this broke life! Once I get the cash, I'm getting a gold tooth, hiring a hitman to take out those who messed with me, and finding some women! I'm so done with Mia's wrinkled body." Jasper whistled happily as he got to his place.

Jasper planned to grab his car keys from his room and have the rich guy's people pick up the gold cars.

Jasper had always been cautious because the security sucked here. Every time he went out, he'd leave a hair stuck in the door.

When he got to the door, he saw the hair on the ground, meaning someone had been in his room.

Jasper had already put the keys in the lock, but he pulled them out.

"Damn it, how could I leave such an important thing outside?" Jasper pretended to have lost something and quickly walked away.

Just as he was about to leave, the door behind him swung open, and a voice roared.

"Jasper, don't even think about running. You're coming back with us."

###chapter 323 Fooled Again

Jasper heard a noise behind him and didn't even dare to look back. He picked up the pace, and as he rushed downstairs, he unexpectedly ran into another group of people heading his way.

###chapter 324 The Scam of the Scavenger

###chapter 325 They All Got Tricked

The three families went dead quiet.

This just made them buy into Jay's story even more. Peter might've just wanted to lure them here and then take them out.

Tanner scratched his head. "Maybe we drove too fast for them to set up an ambush?"

Hadley rolled her eyes. "Seriously?"

Tanner pointed at Hadley, fuming. "I can't stand it when people roll their eyes at me. Do it again, and I'll gouge your eyeballs out, you ugly woman."

"I'd love to rip out your tongue, asshole," Hadley shot back, hating being called ugly.

"Enough! Is this really the time to argue? Maybe Tanner's right. Peter didn't want to kill us; he wanted to lure us away so he could go after Jasper. He might really know where Jasper is," Jay analyzed.

But then Hadley raised another point. "But it still doesn't add up. If Peter wanted to lure us away, why not just tell all three of us directly? Why talk to us one by one? Isn't that a waste of time?"

"Why do you have so many questions? The main thing now is where Peter is. We need to find Jasper before he does," Tanner snapped at Hadley.

Hadley fired a shot beside Tanner's feet, sending debris flying.

"You crazy woman!" Tanner yelled, raising his gun and aiming at Hadley.

"Enough, stop it! Now's not the time," Jay said, stepping between them and pushing their gun barrels down.

"I think I've figured out Peter's plan. He wants to create rifts to break our alliance," Jay guessed, but unfortunately, this wasn't Peter's goal-it was Tim's.

Hadley sneered, "Is that even necessary? We all want Jasper's hidden family treasure for ourselves. Once we find him, we're definitely going to end up fighting each other for it."

"I'll gouge your eyeballs out and stuff them up your ass!" Tanner snarled.

"Enough, you idiots!" Jay roared. "We represent our families! The family heads ordered us to cooperate. Do you dare disobey?"

Hadley and Tanner went silent after hearing Jay's words. Even though each of the three families had their own agendas, they still needed to keep up appearances.

"So, what do we do next?" Hadley asked quietly.

Tanner was also waiting for Jay's instructions.

"Next, we head back and have someone track down Peter. He might've already found Jasper," Jay said seriously.

Hadley and Tanner nodded in agreement.

Jasper, hiding in the secret room, felt a wave of relief as the voices outside died down.

"Looks like they didn't find these secret rooms. Must've been a routine check by the gang members. Dodged a bullet there," Jasper muttered, wiping the cold sweat from his forehead.

But then, Jasper heard gunshots outside, followed by the roar of car engines.

"What's going on out there? Should've installed a surveillance camera," Jasper grumbled.

He had thought about setting up surveillance but figured it would draw too much attention to the rundown plant. Plus, he didn't have the cash for it.

Before selling those gold cars, Jasper was pretty much broke, only having a bit left from selling his gold teeth.

The place where Jasper had been staying wasn't as safe as the rich neighborhoods, but it wasn't a total warzone either, and it was pricey.

As Jasper cursed his luck, so did the people outside the factory.

"Damn it, did you guys plant moles around me? Why are you all here?" Peter yelled at the three in front of him.

Peter had gotten Jasper's whereabouts from a scavenger and was thrilled to bring his crew over, only to find folks from the other three families there too.

When Jay saw Peter, they were just as shocked.

Peter showing up here blew all their previous theories out of the water.

"Wait, were you also tricked by the scavenger to come here?" Hadley asked, stunned.

Peter frowned. "What do you mean? You got tricked too?"

Jay nodded. "Looks like someone is targeting all four of our families. But what's this guy's endgame?"

Peter smirked at Jay, "I don't care about their purpose. I just know Jasper's definitely hiding here."

With that, Peter waved his hand, and his men rushed towards the warehouse.

Peter had brought a lot of guys, mostly gang members. Jay and the others felt outnumbered, as they only had a few family hitmen, not as many as Peter's gang.

However, Hadley and the others weren't eager to confront Peter; they had already searched the warehouse and found nothing.

But Peter wasn't buying it. He pulled out his gun, fired a shot into the sky, and then pointed it at Jay and the others.

"Speak up, did you hide Jasper?" Peter asked coldly.

Hadley sneered, "If we found Jasper, why would we still be here?"

Peter shot back, "Because I got here too fast, you didn't have time to leave!"

Hadley laughed and looked at Tanner, "This jerk is even more annoying than you."

###chapter 326 Discovering the Secret Room

Peter was convinced that Hadley and his crew had stashed Jasper away, which was why he couldn't track him down. Peter's cockiness, fueled by his connections to the Williams Family, was pretty obvious.

Being the head of the big four families, a bit of arrogance was expected.

But Peter's attitude really got under Hadley, Jay, and Tanner's skin.

Tanner brushed off Hadley's grumbling and stepped up, jabbing a finger at Peter's face, "Got any proof we're hiding him, or are you just making stuff up? We've got limited people and cars. Go ahead, search if you want. If you come up empty, I'll blow your brains out."

Tanner's fiery temper made Peter's face darken instantly.

Peter slowly raised his gun. Tanner, just as stubborn, lifted his own gun and aimed it right at Peter's head.

The tension in the air was thick.

"Even if you've got more people, so what? We've got enough too! Hadley, Jay, let's take Peter down together." Tanner's lips curled into a cold smile, trying to rally his buddies.

But Hadley and Jay didn't back him up. Instead, they stepped back, acting like they didn't even know him.

"What the hell are you guys doing?" Tanner was fuming at his friends' reaction.

Peter sneered, "Looks like your buddies don't want to back you up."

Tanner, red with rage, shouted, "Why are you two doing this? Have you forgotten our family's leader said we're allies now?"

Jay and Hadley just rolled their eyes.

"Tanner, if anyone ever calls you brainless, count me in. You really thought dragging our ally into this mess was a good idea? What are you thinking?" Hadley said sarcastically.

Tanner's face got even redder, and he looked like he wanted to shoot Hadley.

Jay, more calmly, said, "Tanner, why'd you have to rile up Peter for nothing? The fact is, we haven't found Jasper. If he doesn't trust us. If he doesn't believe us, let him search. And we would find nothing. We can't give him what we don't have. Why stir the pot now? Can't you see we're already on the back foot?"

Tanner's face fell, while Peter looked confused.

"Wait, you really haven't found Jasper?" Peter asked, eyeing everyone suspiciously.

Jay shrugged. "We really haven't found Jasper. If you don't believe us, go ahead and search. We don't mind."

Peter frowned, but he was beginning to trust Jay because of his calm demeanor.

Seeing Peter's doubt, Jay stepped forward, positioning himself between Peter and Tanner.

"Alright, guys, let's put the guns down. Why don't we think about why four scavengers came to us at the same time to sell out Jasper's whereabouts? Doesn't that seem fishy to you?" Jay said to the group.

With Jay playing peacemaker, the tension eased, and Peter and Tanner slowly lowered their guns.

Peter frowned and said, "Are you saying someone's trying to mess with us? But who'd have the guts to go after the four major families?"

Jay shook his head. "I'm not sure, but if that scavenger's photo is legit, it means Jasper was here. The fact that we can't find him is weird."

Hadley glanced at the abandoned warehouse, hesitating. "You think there might be a hidden room in there?"

As soon as Hadley said it, the other three guys were stunned.

Peter waved to his crew. "Search thoroughly and see if there's a hidden room."

Hadley and his men headed into the warehouse, with Jay and Tanner right behind them.

Inside the hidden room, Jasper heard the noise outside gradually fade, thinking they'd left. But just as he started to relax, he heard even louder footsteps, more people than before.

Jasper thought, 'Are these guys nuts? It's just a rundown warehouse. You can see there's nothing here. Why are they still searching?' He was worried sick they might figure out there was a hidden room.

Trembling, Jasper pulled out his gun, nervously eyeing the door. This was his last resort. If the cars behind him were found by the four major families, they wouldn't spare him. He was doomed.

Even though the warehouse was big, with so many people searching, they were bound to find something odd.

Soon, someone noticed a spot on a shelf that looked like it had been touched a lot.

"Mr. Jade, this part seems a bit off," someone reported to Peter.

Peter walked over, with Hadley and the others following.

Peter saw that this part was cleaner than the rest, which were covered in dust.

Peter smirked, grabbing and turning the part.

As Peter moved his hand, a hidden door slowly opened, revealing the hidden room.

Everyone's eyes were glued to the entrance, and Jasper felt a wave of despair.

"Damn bastards, I'll fight you to the end!" Desperate, Jasper pulled the trigger, firing wildly.

Bullets hit two unlucky guys, but most were dodged.

Peter shot Jasper's gun, knocking it out of his hand. Hadley and the others started firing back.

Their aim was way better than Jasper's, each shot hitting his limbs.

Jasper collapsed, blood pouring from his wounds, pain searing through his limbs, unable to move. He knew he wouldn't die now; what awaited him was endless torture.

"Damn it! What have I done to deserve this? Why give me hope and then take it away? I've given up everything. Why can't you let me live out the rest of my life in peace?" Jasper shouted in despair.

###chapter 327 Golden Cars

The reps from the four big families barged into the secret room right after roughing up Jasper. They all wanted to nab Jasper and get their hands on the Taylor Family's secret, but Peter wasn't about to let the other families in on it.

So, Peter just up and shot Tanner.

Tanner took a bullet to the chest but didn't even bleed. Peter quickly figured out Tanner was wearing a bulletproof vest.

Just as Peter was about to fire again, Tanner ducked behind a car.

Peter's bullet hit the car's hood and bounced off, showing a flash of gold where it hit.

Peter's crew quickly noticed something was off with the cars. One guy scraped off some paint with a knife and found gold underneath. "Guys, these cars are gold! We're rich!" he yelled, all excited.

His shout was like throwing a match into gasoline. The whole place went nuts.

The gang members, hearing the cars were solid gold, got this hungry look in their eyes, like wolves spotting a meal.

They all ignored Peter's orders and started fighting over the cars.

Peter looked around, stunned. He had the numbers, but now his advantage was gone. Against the other three families, he didn't have enough guys left.

"You idiots, stop! Can't you wait until we finish this fight? Then you can grab the cars!" Peter yelled, grabbing one of his guys.

The guy shoved Peter away and ran for the nearest car.

The once-loyal henchmen didn't care about their boss anymore. If they could snag a car, they could ditch this risky life and live like kings.

Peter raised his gun at the guy but then lowered it, frustrated.

Jasper, lying on the ground, watched his cars get snatched up, tears streaming down his face. He felt his life slipping away, his body getting colder. He knew he wouldn't make it, so he let himself die in despair. After all, he couldn't take the gold with him.

"Looks like Jasper traded all his embezzled funds for these cars," Hadley whistled at the gang members.

The four family reps were tempted too. Those gold cars were worth a fortune, more than they could ever afford.

But the family reps valued order and discipline more than the gang members.

The sight of the gold cars put a temporary pause on the battle between the four families.

But that didn't mean the four major families were about to sit down and calmly discuss who got to claim Jasper.

Out of nowhere, a bullet hit Tanner in the chest at the secret room's entrance.

Tanner hit the ground again, yelling, "Peter, you jerk! Why do you always go for me first? Everyone, take him out!"

Tanner fired his gun, and the other three family reps started shooting at Peter too, like they were all on the same page.

Peter thought, 'Damn it, these guys are ganging up on me. I'm outnumbered, but I'm not gonna let myself die here.' He ducked behind a car, not giving a damn about his gang members.

The gang members didn't care about each other either. They were just glad there were fewer people to compete with for the cars.

Each bullet was a potential death sentence for a gang member.

The remaining gang members were still fighting over the driver's seats.

Peter, with morale in the gutter, used his gang members as human shields, hiding behind them and shooting at the three family reps, actually managing to take a few of them out.

The three family reps weren't about to keep taking hits and launched an even fiercer counterattack.

"Fight, keep fighting. The more people die, the better," Jasper muttered with a grim smile. His vision blurred, and he saw a figure in front of him.

"You can't die. Your fate should be in prison, not lying here waiting to die," Tim whispered, then quickly dragged Jasper out of the secret room.

The bullet that flew out of the secret room door was fired by Tim, to stir up the fight among the four families again. Without the chaos, he couldn't get Jasper out.

Tim quickly got Jasper out of the chemical plant, heading for the nearest hospital. They needed to patch Jasper up, save his life, and then send him back for legal judgment.

Back in the secret room, the four family reps were still going at it, and their numbers were dwindling.

Peter, with the least loyal family hitmen in tow, was losing his guys fast, and his anger was boiling over.

Peter hated the three families, Jasper, and his own disloyal gang members. "You damn bastards, all of you can go to hell!"

Peter fired a shot at a car's gas tank.

The bullet hit the gas tank, causing an explosion.

The flames and shockwave took out the nearest gang members.

"Damn it, Peter's lost it, run!" Jay shouted, leading his men out of the secret room.

"You think you can run? Think again!" Peter laughed, firing at the gas tanks of the remaining cars.

###chapter 328 For the Gold

Bullets ripped through the gas tanks, and boom! The cars went up in flames, turning the whole abandoned warehouse into a fiery inferno.

Screams echoed as Hadley and Tanner bolted out with their crew. More gang members, engulfed in flames, stumbled out only to collapse and die moments later.

Peter didn't make it. Looked like he got caught in the blast.

The three families' faces were grim. They survived but lost a lot of men and gained nothing. They dreaded the punishment waiting for them back home.

Hadley sighed, staring at the blazing warehouse. "Guys, let's head back. With a fire this big, Jasper's probably toast. We got zilch."

Tanner's face was tight with pain. His bulletproof vest had stopped the bullets, but his chest hurt like hell-probably a couple of broken ribs.

He glanced at Hadley and Jay. Their faces were just a bit sooty, no major injuries.

Tanner knew their alliance was done for. No common interests meant no friendship.

Without a word, Tanner turned and left with his remaining men.

Hadley and Jay didn't care. They exchanged a look and left with their people too.

But after a while, they all came back at the same time.

Hadley and Jay eyed Tanner. "Weren't you leaving? Why are you back?" they asked.

Tanner snorted, "Why didn't you leave?"

Jay shrugged. "Looks like we all have the same goal."

Hadley ran a hand through his hair and smirked, "Alright, let's be real. We're all after the gold here. I counted about six cars inside. Perfect-each family gets two. No more fighting, and it covers some of our losses."

Jay and Tanner exchanged glances and nodded. This was the best they could do for now.

But when the flames died down and they rushed in to check, their eyes went wide.

"Damn it! Weren't these cars supposed to be gold? Why are they just iron?" Tanner yelled, furious.

Jay and Hadley looked just as pissed.

Hadley frowned. "With Jasper's stolen funds, he could've built these with solid gold. Did he stash the money somewhere else?"

Tanner snorted and pointed at the charred bodies. "If you wanna know, go ask Jasper. See if you can figure out which one of these crispy critters is him."

The explosion had left so many charred bodies, it was impossible to tell which one was Jasper.

Hadley sighed, looking at the bodies. "Some of these are our guys. We need to clean up and find Jasper's body. We should bring back his DNA report to convince our leaders."

His men quickly rushed him to the hospital.

"You sound like a philosopher," Hadley said, rolling his eyes.

Jay seemed to recall some bad memories, shook his head, and walked away. They had a lot to do next.

Hadley also left, leaving behind the burning wreckage.

Meanwhile, Tim had taken the unconscious Jasper to the nearest hospital, shelling out a lot of cash to save his life.

Tim didn't plan to leave Jasper there, worried the four families would find out he was alive and start more trouble. To avoid that, he called Michael for help.

"Mr. Williams, we've found Jasper, but he's in bad shape and needs medical help. Otherwise, we'll only be able to bring his body back," Tim informed Michael.

On the other end of the line, Michael quickly gave instructions. He'd send Tim some money to get Jasper to a hospital in the wealthy area first for treatment. Then he'd arrange a private plane to bring Jasper back home.

After getting the money, Tim moved fast, taking Jasper to the wealthy area and waiting for Michael's plane.

After a rough journey, Jasper slowly opened his eyes and looked at Tim, his voice hoarse. "Which family are you from? What happened to my cars?"

Tim shrugged apologetically. "Sorry, your warehouse caught fire. Those gold cars couldn't be saved."

Jasper's eyes looked empty, like he'd lost his soul.

Gold doesn't burn, but it can be stolen. Even without the fire, his gold wouldn't have been safe.

"I don't want to live, let me die," Jasper said softly, looking at Tim.

Tim flat-out refused. "What are you thinking? You can't die. You're still on the wanted list, and I need you for the bounty!"

Jasper sighed softly, closed his eyes, and said nothing more.

As the private plane landed and the medical team took Jasper on board, Michael got the news and informed Isabella.

###chapter 329 All Good News

Isabella was still at work when Michael suddenly called her home.

As for John's bet with Mason, he couldn't use their money to cover the debts, but John didn't care about that at all.

After all, John had already sent people to find Jasper, and he could just claim that the money was transferred by Jasper before he died.

It was just a matter of going through a few more steps to prove that the money wasn't his, which wasn't hard for him. The reason he hadn't done it before was just to beat Mason fair and square, but now he didn't care about that anymore.

Meanwhile, Bianca was dreaming about stepping on Isabella with John's help.

But little did Bianca know, on the other side, Benjamin had already arrested all the doctors and nurses who had treated her before.

Although Benjamin's family wasn't as prominent as the four major families, they held absolute authority in the medical field.

For these medical staff, in some ways, Benjamin's words were even scarier than those of the four major families.

"Alright, everyone, I hope you tell the truth. What did Bianca offer you to help her like this?" Benjamin's calm words sent shivers down their spines.

###chapter 330 Confident Bianca

The medical staff knew Bianca was faking her illness. All those diagnostic reports? They were from other uremia patients, just with Bianca's name slapped on them.

Benjamin figured it all out. At first, some of the medical staff didn't want to admit it because they were scared of pissing off John.

But then Benjamin dropped a bomb on them. "You're scared of John? You should be more scared of me and Mason."

That shut them up real quick.

Benjamin went on, "You know how much Isabella means to Mason, right? Because you faked Bianca's records, John thought about taking Isabella's kidney to save Bianca. Let me tell you, Mason might seem nice now, but back in the day, he killed more people than you can count."

One nurse just crumpled to the floor.

"Please, don't let me die! I don't want to die!" she cried. She'd helped Bianca fabricate her illness and fool John.

Seeing her reaction, Benjamin nodded, satisfied. "If you come clean, I'll give you a way out. I won't let John destroy you."

Once one person confessed, the rest followed, spilling everything to Benjamin.

Soon enough, Benjamin had all the dirt on Bianca's scam.

As a private plane flew into the city's night sky, the medical staff took Jasper to the hospital after it landed.

On the call, Isabella told Brenda they had to keep a close watch on Jasper and make sure he didn't bolt from the hospital again.

"I'll make sure Jasper gets back on his feet and faces the music in court once he's better," Brenda said, standing by his bed with a steely look.

The city settled down for a bit, just like John had predicted. The three major families broke off their alliance when they heard Jasper might die, and no one was gunning for John anymore. He could finally chill and ease up on the economic pressure.

The three families' guys abroad-Jay, Hadley, and Tanner-got chewed out by their family heads. They were told to come back as soon as they got the DNA test results.

Other than that, things seemed to go back to normal in the city, with the four big families keeping a low profile.

But some sharp folks could feel something brewing. The whole city seemed like it was on the edge of another storm.

And right in the middle of it were Isabella and Bianca, fighting over shares.

This calm didn't last a week. When a cargo ship docked, Isabella took the upper hand completely.

Brenda went with Isabella to the dock. When they got back, Brenda's eyes were wide with shock.

The other officers were dying to know what Brenda saw, but all she said was that Isabella had won.

John finally got his financial mojo back and started making moves. After a bunch of twists and turns, the money ended up in Bianca's account. Soon, Bianca would be able to use this money to cover the public funds and become the largest shareholder of the Taylor Group.

That day, John called a meeting with the company's execs, skipping Isabella, and ran the show himself.

The execs didn't know what John was up to, but they couldn't afford to piss him off, so they showed up to see what was going on.

Carol got an invite too and immediately told Isabella.

"It's fine, let him do his thing. Today, I'll give everyone a surprise, including John," Isabella said with a sly smile.

Carol felt a weird vibe from Isabella's laugh, thinking this meeting was going to spell trouble for Bianca and John.

All the execs were in the conference room, with Bianca sitting at the head of the table. John, as usual, sat on the other side of her.

"Long time no see, everyone," Bianca greeted the execs with a smile.

The execs didn't respond, knowing Isabella was the president now.

Bianca didn't care about the awkward silence. She smiled and said, "According to the previous agreement, whoever finds Jasper's embezzled public funds gets his shares and becomes a major shareholder in the company."

The execs had mixed feelings, seeing Bianca's confidence. They figured she had gathered some money but didn't know if it was the embezzled fund or John's money.

Just then, the conference room door swung open, and Isabella walked in with her bodyguards.

"Why hold a meeting without telling me, the president? Bianca, is that your seat? Move your butt out of there right now," Isabella said coldly.

###chapter 331 John, the Storyteller

Bianca's face changed the second she spotted Isabella.

Her eyes flashed with resentment, but she quickly pulled herself together when John glanced her way.

"Isabella, what are you even talking about?" Bianca said, looking hurt but staying put in the president's seat.

"I didn't mean to keep you in the dark. I just wanted to wait a bit before sharing the news with you. But since you're here now, I'll spill the beans," Bianca said with a faint smile.

Isabella sneered, not really caring, and took her usual seat across from Bianca.

"For you information, I am the CEO here, and you called this meeting with notifying me. What's in your mind? Worried I'm too busy to show up?" Isabella smirked.

The execs in the room kept their heads down, feeling the tension like a ticking bomb.

"Isabella, you used to be the CEO, but after today, that might change," Bianca said coldly, tapping the table.

Isabella tapped the table back, looking at Bianca with a playful grin, and ran her hand through her hair. "Sorry, cousin, I don't get what you're saying. How am I not the CEO? If I remember right, I'm the only shareholder now, right?"

Bianca's smile turned icy. Just as she was about to say more, John slammed the table impatiently.

"Enough with the fake niceties," John shot a diapproving glance at Bianca.

Bianca pouted, frustrated. Her plan was to rile Isabella up and then crush her.

She had the funds and could become the biggest shareholder anytime.

John looked at Isabella and said calmly, "Isabella, let's cut to the chase. According to the agreement, whoever covers your father's debt gets his shares and becomes the largest shareholder."

The execs in the room eyed Isabella, curious about her next move. Was she going to borrow money from Mason?

"If I'm not mistaken, the deal is whoever finds the money my dad embezzled becomes the largest shareholder. Are you saying you found it?" Isabella said with a faint smile.

John nodded. "Yes, we found the money your dad hid in Novaria. Sadly, he died in a local gang conflict. When our people found him, he was almost dead and handed over the money before he passed away."

The execs in the room stared at John in shock. Jasper dead? And in a gang conflict? It sounded ridiculous.

Everyone knew Jasper had crossed John before. With John's temper, it wasn't far-fetched to think he might've had Jasper killed and blamed it on a gang. But even if they suspected, no one dared to voice it. That'd be career suicide.

Isabella raised an eyebrow, giving John a once-over like she was seeing him for the first time.

"Since when did you become a storyteller?" Isabella laughed.

The old John wasn't kind to Isabella, but he never lied to her. Maybe he thought she wasn't worth lying to.

The execs were amazed; only Isabella had the guts to mock John like that!

Bianca smirked at Isabella, eager to see how long she'd keep her cool.

John felt a twinge of discomfort under Isabella's mocking gaze.

"Believe it or not, that's what your father said," John snorted.

He signaled to Bianca, who pulled out her laptop.

She connected it to the big screen in the room, showing bank transfer details.

"Look closely," Bianca said, pointing to the screen. "The transfer's from a Novaria bank, and the amount matches what Jasper embezzled."

Bianca watched for Isabella's reaction, but she stayed calm.

Isabella's eyes shifted to the execs' faces.

Their expressions were telling. Except for Carol and a few others who stayed neutral, most seemed to side with Bianca.

A male exec smiled and said, "I believe Ms. Bianca Taylor and Mr. Williams wouldn't lie about this. It seems Jasper did hide the money in Novaria."

With one person backing Bianca, others quickly followed.

"Yes, since Ms. Bianca Taylor recovered the embezzled money, she's the largest shareholder."

"Ms. Isabella Taylor, from now on, Ms. Bianca Taylor is our true CEO."

"Ms. Isabella Taylor, unless you find another stash of money, you have no right to stay in this company."

Some execs even started mocking Isabella.

Carol watched Isabella, expecting anger, but she stayed calm.

Suddenly, Isabella clapped her hands and smiled.

Her demeanor silenced the bickering execs.

Isabella's gaze swept over them indifferently. "I gave you all a chance, but it seems you can't handle it. So, it's not my fault."

Then she looked at John. "You said my father gave you the money. So, where's his body?"

###chapter 332 Exposing Your Lies

Isabella's question left John speechless for a moment.

"Come on, speak up! My dad handed over all his embezzled funds to you, and you couldn't even bring back his body?" Isabella taunted, crossing her arms.

Carol raised an eyebrow, surprised at Isabella's boldness. She thought, 'John probably can't prove Jasper gave him the money, but Isabella's attempt to bring him down by this is pretty naive.'

John took a deep breath and said, "The gang conflict was intense. Our people got the funds' location from Jasper, but there was a huge explosion after they left. Your father's body was destroyed, so we couldn't retrieve it."

John continued to weave his story, mixing lies with the truth. He figured there was no way Isabella could actually dig into the truth of this.

A cold smile crept onto Isabella's lips as she watched John spin his tale.

Bianca suddenly felt a bit uneasy. She worried that dragging this out might lead to more complications. Worst of all, if Mason helped Isabella sort out the public funds issue now, all her preparations would be for nothing.

Bianca stood up, looking at Isabella with a serious expression. "Enough, Isabella. I know you're heartbroken over losing your father, but this meeting is about the CEO position. According to our agreement, if I secure the public funds, I get to be the chairwoman and appoint the CEO."

John chimed in, "Exactly. These three companies need the public funds to keep going. We don't have time to argue about evidence and bodies. If you want to investigate, go to Novaria yourself."

Isabella stayed silent.

The executives in the room thought Isabella had run out of tricks and started getting excited again.

"Ms. Isabella Taylor, you need to face reality. The company really needs those public funds."

"Yeah, Ms. Isabella Taylor, if you can't cough up the money, don't stand in the way of others who can. It's not a good look, and people will laugh at you."

"That's right, Ms. Isabella Taylor, just give up the CEO position. Besides, Ms. Bianca Taylor is your sister. She won't make things too hard for you. You can still be a senior executive in the company."

Isabella looked at the executives backing Bianca, a faint smile on her lips. "So you're already acknowledging her as the CEO?"

"Well, can you produce the public funds?" a senior executive sneered.

Isabella shook her head lightly. "I can't produce them now. But give me some time, and I will."

Some executives showed disdainful expressions. To them, Isabella was just stubbornly holding on, but the best way to deal with her was to completely crush her.

To these executives, Isabella was just one step away from being finished.

Isabella's eyes scanned the room, taking in the smug faces of these executives. She knew exactly what they were up to. These guys had been skimming public funds and causing chaos in the company for years.

These execs had all done some shady stuff. Isabella had already dealt with a bunch of people who wanted her gone, but there were still more lurking around.

They hadn't made a move before because they didn't want to push Mason too far. But now, with a legit reason, even Mason couldn't fault them.

Plus, with John backing Bianca, they felt pretty safe.

Bianca felt her chances of winning were getting better, especially with so many execs on her side. Even though some hadn't spoken up yet, she was confident she'd win them over eventually.

"Isabella, I think they're right. We're sisters, after all. I won't let you stay as CEO once I'm chairwoman, but I'll give you another position. How about the PR department? It suits your image since you used to design packaging. Working in PR would be a good fit for you," Bianca said with a smug smile.

Isabella snorted, "I really appreciate your generosity."

"Don't be so formal, Isabella. We're sisters. How about a supervisory role? It's not a manager position, but with your skills, you could get there in a few years." Bianca finally showed her true colors, just to get under Isabella's skin.

Isabella stared at Bianca without a word. Just then, her phone buzzed. She glanced at the message and a playful smile spread across her face.

"Alright, enough games. Let's get to the point. I seriously doubt the public funds you have are the ones my father embezzled," Isabella said, crossing her arms and giving John a cold smile.

John, looking annoyed, furrowed his brow and said, "How many times do I have to say it? Your father's body is abroad. If you're not too busy, go check it out yourself."

Isabella shook her head. "No need for that. Who told you my father is dead? He's in the hospital. He did get caught in a gang conflict a few days ago, but I had a private detective bring him back."

As soon as Isabella said that, John's face went white as a sheet, and the execs looked shocked.

A smile crept onto Carol's lips. She knew Isabella wouldn't lie about this, sealing their victory.

"Impossible! John's men confirmed your father was dead! Did you hire actors to impersonate him?" Bianca screamed, unable to believe it.

Isabella looked at John's dark expression and sneered. "The private detective told me everything. Your men got beaten by the three major families and set off a bomb in desperation, trying to take them down with them. But my father was hiding in the least affected area, so the detective managed to sneak him out while everyone was fleeing."

###chapter 333 The Police's Entrance

After Isabella finished talking, the execs looked like they'd just swallowed a lemon.

If what Isabella said was true, then Jasper must have been in her hands by now. As long as Jasper said that the money John had wasn't embezzled public funds, then John and Bianca were gonna be the laughingstock today.

John's face turned dark as a storm cloud. He clenched his fists so tight his knuckles went white, glaring at Isabella like he wanted to tear her apart.

Today, John lied to Isabella for the first time. If this lie got exposed, he would lose all his credibility.

"No way, I don't believe my people would lie to me. What proof do you have that your dad's in the hospital?" John gritted his teeth and asked Isabella.

Isabella coldly clapped her hands and called towards the door, "Officer Pena, could you come in, please?"

All eyes turned to the big door. It swung open, and in walked Brenda, decked out in her police uniform.

Brenda's gaze swept around the room, ignoring John's dark look and Bianca's pale face. She said seriously, "I'm here today on behalf of the police department to award Isabella a medal and to back up her story."

Brenda held up a medal and smiled at everyone in the room, saying, "The police department really appreciates Isabella for spending a lot of money to bring back Jasper, a wanted criminal, from abroad. The chief sent me to thank her and clear up the rumors about Jasper's death."

After Brenda finished, she pulled out her tablet and played a video.

The video showed Jasper lying in a hospital bed. He looked a bit pale, but he was definitely breathing.

"This is a video call between me and my colleague, who's now watching over Jasper in the hospital. We believe there's no way he's getting away this time." Brenda finished and turned off her tablet, looking at the senior execs.

Isabella looked at John and Bianca, smiling, "Didn't you say my dad told you about the hidden public funds before he died? Well, guess what? He's still alive."

Bianca's face went even paler.

Isabella glanced at the senior execs who had just backed Bianca. Some of them looked down, while others still clung to hope.

"Mr. Williams just got your dad's situation wrong. Even so, it doesn't prove that the money in Ms. Taylor's hands isn't the public funds your father hid!" Some senior execs still argued, trying to defend John.

But just then, someone in a bank uniform walked in.

John's face changed when he saw the newcomer.

"Mr. Claire, please share your information," Isabella said to the newcomer, Paul Claire, with a smile.

Paul nodded, holding a laptop.

"Just yesterday, a sum of money went missing from Mr. Williams' account. It was transferred through multiple foreign banks and ended up in Ms. Taylor's account. Here are the transfer records we investigated and testimonies from other banks." Paul opened the laptop and showed the evidence he had.

Everyone in the room was stunned to see Paul daring to cross John. John's face twisted with anger and a touch of bitterness.

"Did my grandfather send you here?" John asked Paul.

John knew Paul; he worked at the Williams Family bank and was one of Mason's most trusted people.

Paul nodded and said calmly, "Mr. Mason Williams said that you, Mr. John Williams, have broken the terms of your agreement. He's very disappointed in you."

John slumped in his chair, his whole plan falling apart.

Bianca looked from the defeated John to Isabella.

"Even so, have you really won?" Bianca pointed at Isabella, her eyes flashing with hatred.

Isabella's face twisted into a mocking smile. "Don't you feel like you've lost now?"

Bianca glared at Isabella coldly. "Your company has taken huge financial hits. Without that embezzled money, it's on the brink of bankruptcy. Look at your father's condition; he probably won't wake up. Even if he does, would he really be willing to hand over the money to you?"

Some of the senior execs started to look serious, realizing the company's dire situation. Even though Isabella had removed a bunch of harmful people and confiscated their illegal gains, it didn't solve the company's current crisis because Jasper had embezzled the most money.

Carol looked at Isabella, trying to read her expression. But Isabella remained calm.

"Bianca, your biggest mistake was overestimating yourself and underestimating me. Do you really think I don't know where my father's hidden funds are?" Isabella's mouth curled into a cold smile.

"Officer Pena, are the things I asked for ready?" Isabella suddenly looked at Brenda and asked.

Brenda nodded. "We've identified everything, and all the evidence is now downstairs in your company."

Isabella waved to the people in the conference room. "Now, everyone, look out the window and witness something shocking."

The execs, confused, went to the window. When they saw the six cars parked below, they were all stunned.

In the sunlight, six cars emitting a golden glow were parked under the company building, surrounded by police officers.

"Are those cars made of gold?" Carol was also shocked by the scene below. She had guessed that Isabella might have Jasper's embezzled money, but she didn't expect it to be presented this way. It was truly shocking.

After seeing the golden cars, Bianca's face turned pale. "How is this possible? Those cars must be fake."

Brenda calmly said, "Ms. Taylor, after our assessment, all these cars are made of gold. And we found a lot of Jasper's DNA inside the cars."

###chapter 334 Shocking Events

Brenda's words hit everyone like a bombshell. The cops confirmed that the golden cars were bought with Jasper's embezzled funds. With the current gold prices, the cars not only cover the stolen money but also leave a surplus.

Bianca slumped in her chair, looking defeated, while John wasn't faring any better.

Isabella stood there, arms crossed, giving John and Bianca a smug look. She was the real winner here.

Isabella's gaze swept over the room.

Those who had backed Bianca earlier were now slumped in their chairs, realizing they'd completely crossed Isabella. They were looking at either getting fired or even facing jail time for embezzlement.

Isabella turned to John and said, "Sure, the gold covers the public funds, but it takes time to cash it out. I've already talked to Mason and mortgaged the gold to him to pay off the funds. This doesn't break the bet between you and your grandpa, right?"

John glared at Isabella, slammed the table, and stormed out.

He was too embarrassed to stick around. He'd lost this round and now had to give up a tenth of his assets to Mason.

"Wait up, John. I'll come with you," Bianca said, getting up to follow him.

But just as they reached the door, Isabella stopped them.

"Why the rush? I'm not done yet. There's more drama to come," Isabella said with a cold smile.

Bianca felt a bad vibe. "Enough, Isabella. Have you humiliated us enough? John is Mason's grandson. Don't push it," she said, looking gloomy.

John also thought Isabella was trying to make more fun of him, and his face darkened.

But Isabella shook her head, "No, I'm not here to humiliate you. I need to talk to Bianca."

The company execs were all curious, especially Carol, who looked intrigued.

Even Brenda was curious. She'd achieved her goal for today but was eager to see the family's internal drama.

Bianca's sense of doom grew stronger. She screamed and tried to push Isabella. "Enough, Isabella! I won't take your humiliation anymore! Let's go, John."

Bianca opened the door, only to be stopped by a stern-faced Benjamin.

Seeing Benjamin, Bianca felt like she'd been struck by lightning. She guessed Isabella's plan, remembering Benjamin had been investigating her illness.

John knew Benjamin too. He was friends with Michael and had performed Bianca's kidney transplant surgery last time.

"Dr. White, what are you doing here? Did my uncle send you?" John frowned, thinking Benjamin was here on Michael's orders to back up Isabella.

Benjamin nodded and smiled. "Yep, your uncle sent me, but not to speak for Isabella. I'm here to talk about something concerning Bianca."

"We have nothing to talk about!" Bianca suddenly screamed, trying to pull John away, but the bodyguard behind Benjamin stopped her.

Benjamin pointed to the conference room and said with a smile, "Mr. Williams, why don't we sit down and talk? It's rude to leave me standing here."

John sensed something was off. He looked at Bianca and saw her trembling with fear. He took a deep breath, feeling that something big was about to go down.

"Alright, let's hear what you have to say," John said, heading back to the conference room and sitting down. Bianca's legs were shaking so much that she almost fell off her chair.

Bianca thought, 'Is Benjamin going to talk about that? Does he have proof? No way, it must be fake.' She prayed silently, but Benjamin's next words shattered her hopes.

Benjamin held up two diagnostic reports. "These are Ms. Taylor's health reports. One is from her hospitalization, the other is recent. It's unbelievable-Ms. Taylor was a severe uremia patient, but now she's recovered to a normal level. This defies medical logic!"

"What are you trying to say? Are you suggesting I was faking my illness? I've told you, I met a medical expert, took the medicine he gave me, and that's why I recovered so quickly," Bianca argued.

Benjamin looked at her coldly. "There's no medicine in the world that can make a uremia patient who just had a kidney transplant recover to normal in a week," he said.

Bianca grew more frightened, noticing the suspicion in John's eyes.

Benjamin then produced a second report. He held it up and said, "There were rumors that Ms. Taylor and Isabella were a match for kidney donation, but our tests show their kidneys don't match at all. If Ms. Taylor really had Isabella's kidney transplanted into her, it would be fatal."

Everyone in the room seemed to realize something, some looking at Bianca in shock.

Carol couldn't help but ask, "Bianca, were you trying to get Isabella's kidney?"

Bianca stayed silent.

Isabella sneered. "She doesn't just want my kidney, she wants my life! Bianca has been pretending to be a uremia patient and has mentioned in front of John more than once that she needs my kidney to survive. John even told me that if I donated my kidney to Bianca, he would agree to marry me! After I refused, they even tried to kidnap me and take my kidney by force."

###chapter 335 Shocking Story

After Isabella finished talking, the room practically buzzed with tension.

The execs who had pissed off Isabella were sweating bullets about their futures, but after hearing such a shocking story, their attention was completely diverted!

Carol gasped, finally getting why Isabella had said she'd faced death more than once. She was betrayed by her lover and sister, who even tried to steal her kidney and kill her. Insane!

"No wonder Isabella dumped Mr. Williams before. With a story like that, who could blame her?" Paul muttered, still in shock.

Paul had planned to leave after nailing John for his violations, but his curiosity kept him glued to the spot. He never expected to hear such explosive news.

Brenda was floored too. She'd been hoping for some juicy gossip, but this was way more intense. As a cop, it made sense to arrest a kidnapper and would-be murderer.

Brenda's eyes locked onto Bianca, making sure she didn't bolt.

"If you don't believe me, I've got proof," Isabella said with a cold smirk, lifting her shirt just enough to show a scar on her stomach.

"John, check out this scar. The doctor was out to kill me. A simple surgery turned into a bloodbath. If Benjamin hadn't kicked the doctor out, I'd be dead," Isabella said, glaring at John with pure hatred.

John stared at the scar, then turned to Bianca, his disbelief clear.

"Is she telling the truth?" John asked Bianca, his voice shaky.

"No, she's lying! None of this is true. John, you have to believe me," Bianca pleaded, clutching his hand and defending herself desperately.

Benjamin looked at John and said calmly, "Mr. Williams, I can back up everything Isabella said. You brought me in to ensure the surgery's success, but I was sidelined almost immediately. I could only watch until Isabella was in critical condition, then I had to step in and stop it."

John's doubt grew as he looked at Bianca, despite her frantic denials.

Isabella's gaze was icy. "An heir to a big family, fooled by a woman like an idiot. I've told you more than once that my kidney isn't a match for Bianca's, but you never believed me. You thought I was trying to mess up your relationship. Well, today, everyone's here to see the truth. So, Mr. Williams, let's do another matching test for me and Bianca."

"Enough, Isabella! What are you trying to do? Why are you slandering me like this? All your so-called evidence is fake. I don't know why you're making this up, but if you think you can hurt me with these lies, you're dreaming," Bianca shouted, pointing at Isabella.

Isabella stayed silent, just staring at John.

Everyone's eyes were glued to John, waiting to see what he'd do next.

Under all that pressure, John took a deep breath and dialed a number on his phone.

"Get my medical team here ASAP. I want to test the kidneys of Bianca and Isabella," he said before hanging up.

Bianca went pale and took a step back. "John, you don't believe me anymore?"

John looked at her with a cold expression. "Does it even matter if I believe you now? The test results will show who's telling the truth."

Bianca's face turned ghostly white; she knew she was in deep trouble.

Just then, Benjamin chimed in.

"While we wait for the medical team, let's chat about something else," Benjamin said with a smile, clapping his hands.

Soon, a bunch of medical staff in uniforms were escorted in by bodyguards. Bianca's eyes filled with despair when she saw them.

John thought these medical staff looked familiar.

Pointing at them, Benjamin grinned at John, "Look familiar? These are the folks who diagnosed and treated Bianca. All those medical reports you saw? They came from these guys. Guess how much Bianca paid them?"

As soon as Benjamin finished, one of the medical staff broke down crying.

"Mr. Williams, we were forced by Bianca. She said if we didn't do what she wanted, she'd ruin us with her connections."

"Yeah, Mr. Williams, Bianca used your favor to make us do things we didn't want to. We had no choice."

"Mr. Williams, we messed up, but Bianca was the mastermind."

Bianca shook with anger. The people who once sucked up to her were now throwing her under the bus.

At this point, Isabella pulled out another piece of evidence-a USB drive. She had someone plug it into a computer and play it on the big screen.

The screen showed Bianca casually shopping.

"The time this video was taken matches Bianca's supposed kidney surgery at Lumaria. More importantly, it was her first day off the plane, and she went shopping. Does she look like a uremic patient to you?" Isabella pointed at the screen, laughing coldly.

The screen showed not only photos of Bianca shopping but also a police report about her phone getting stolen during the shopping trip, leading to a dispute with the thief. The police body camera clearly captured Bianca's face.

After watching all this, John fell silent, not even glancing at Bianca.

Bianca didn't dare look at John either.

The room was dead silent. After a while, John turned to Brenda.

"Officer, since Isabella accuses Bianca and me of harming her, let's head to the police station and sort this out," John said, standing up and walking to the door without looking back at Bianca.

###chapter 336 Isabella's Reminder

Bianca's face was ghostly white; she knew she'd completely blown it with John.

She felt like checking the kidney match was more like a death countdown.

Brenda walked up to Bianca and pulled out some handcuffs. "Ms. Taylor, hands out, please."

Shaking and pale, Bianca put her hands out. She needed to get out of there fast, feeling the stares of everyone around her like they were ripping her apart.

Bianca needed to bolt, even if it meant going to the police station. John was thinking the same thing. Everyone knew it, but no one was saying it out loud. They figured John would be out of the station soon enough.

Once Bianca was cuffed, Brenda told her colleagues to take her downstairs. Benjamin and the medical staff, who were also heading down, needed to go to the station for questioning as participants and witnesses.

After Bianca was gone, Brenda looked at Isabella with a wry smile. "Ms. Taylor, you really caught me off guard."

Isabella grinned. "Officer Pena, you must be thrilled about nabbing a bunch of troublemakers, right?"

Isabella's words made Brenda smile bitterly again.

"John will be fine. I bet he'll just sit there, waiting for his lawyer at the station," Brenda said, shrugging.

Isabella just smiled and kept quiet. Some things were better left unsaid; they both got it.

"So, Isabella. As a victim and witness, I need you to come with me to the station," Brenda said.

Isabella nodded. "Sure, but Officer Pena, give me a sec. I need to talk to someone."

"Okay, I'll wait for you downstairs," Brenda said, then turned and left the room.

Isabella turned to Paul, "Mr. Claire, please keep Mason in the dark about what Bianca and John did to me. His health isn't great, and I don't want to upset him."

Paul nodded. "Don't worry, Isabella, I won't tell Mr. Williams."

Even without Isabella's reminder, Paul wouldn't spill the beans.

Last time John landed Mason in the hospital just for mouthing off to him. Paul would tell Charles at most, at least Charles looked tougher than Mason.

Paul left the room, and Isabella then looked at the company execs.

Those who met Isabella's gaze felt their hearts skip a beat, while the innocent stayed calm.

"I'll give you one last chance. If you embezzled funds, return the money and resign, and I'll pretend this never happened. If not, I'll send you to the cops," Isabella said before leaving the room.

Carol shot a mocking glance at the grumpy executives before standing up and leaving the room.

While Isabella and the others were on their way to the police station, Paul filled Charles in on what had gone down, including how Bianca and John almost hurt Isabella.

Charles was stunned by the news.

Paul sighed into his phone. "I had to tell you first because I was worried Mr. Williams might end up in the hospital again. But there were a lot of people there, and I can't promise this won't leak to the media."

Charles agreed. "You're right, Mr. Mason Williams must not find out about this. I'll get in touch with Mr. Michael Williams now to help manage the media and the police, warning them to keep this under wraps."

With that, Charles hung up. He had to handle this quickly because once the three major families got wind of it, they'd spread it everywhere.

Meanwhile, on the way to the police station, Isabella called Michael.

"Sweetheart, we did it," Isabella said, her voice full of joy.

"Congrats, honey, you finally did it," Michael's tone was as gentle as ever.

Isabella recounted the day's events to Michael, from entering the meeting room to Bianca being taken away by the cops. She even cried at the end.

"Sweetheart, do you know how long I've been waiting for this day?" Isabella sobbed.

Michael comforted her softly over the phone, "I knew you'd win today. You took down John and Bianca, and now Bianca will face the law. Okay, stop crying now. When you get back tonight, let's celebrate with a big dinner. You're heading to the police station next; you can't let them see a crying CEO."

"Okay, dear, make sure you clean yourself up when I get back," Isabella joked before quickly hanging up.

Michael's breathing quickened. If he was right, tonight would be the most passionate night between him and Isabella.

"Darn it, I only planned to hold out for two weeks, and now it's been almost a month. I've almost finished all those pills. I can finally enjoy myself without holding back," Michael grinned.

But his smile quickly faded. Rationally, he knew it wasn't time to celebrate and let loose just yet. He had other things to handle.

Michael always remembered there was another force behind Bianca. Now that she was arrested, that force would surely make a move. This time, he had to expose those lurking in the shadows.

Just as Michael was plotting his next steps, his phone rang. He glanced at the screen and was surprised to see Charles calling.

###chapter 337 Charles's Concern

Michael picked up Charles' call and asked what was going on.

Charles, sounding serious, filled Michael in on how John and Bianca had set up Isabella.

To Charles' surprise, Michael stayed cool as a cucumber.

"Mr. Williams, did you already know about this?" Charles asked, shocked.

Michael didn't beat around the bush and nodded. "Yeah, I knew for a while, but I didn't tell Mason because I didn't want to stress him out."

Charles let out a sigh. "Got it. Please handle this and keep it on the down-low. We don't want the other families finding out."

Michael agreed to take care of it.

"Isabella probably didn't want this to blow up. If she did, she would've told Mason herself, and we wouldn't be in this mess," Michael sighed, then made another call to get things under control.

He told Jerry and Mike to keep a close eye on the police station and Isabella's company, thinking those were the hotspots for trouble.

There were always spies from the big families at the police station. News of Bianca and John being taken in would spread fast. The goal was to squash it before the spies got wind of it.

Even though Isabella had told Michael that only Officer Brenda was in the meeting room at the time, and the other officers just followed her orders without knowing what was up, Michael wasn't fully convinced Brenda could keep it all under wraps.

As for the higher-ups at Isabella's company, they were even sketchier.

The ones who stayed on were more likely to keep quiet to stay on Isabella's good side. But those about to get the boot might spill the beans to the other big families out of spite.

Who wanted Mason gone the most? Definitely the other three big families. If Mason went down, the Williams Family would lose its backbone, making it easier for them to strike.

While Michael was setting things in motion, Isabella finally got to the police station.

When she arrived, she found out John hadn't said a word in the interrogation room.

Just like Brenda guessed, John's first words at the station were, "I want my lawyer."

Hearing this, Isabella just shook her head and smiled, not too worried.

Given John's status, even with solid evidence, arresting him wouldn't be a walk in the park. But having Bianca under control was a win.

As a witness, Isabella was questioned by Brenda. She told Brenda to keep it hush-hush and not to tell her colleagues.

Brenda nodded, getting the picture. "Don't worry, I'm not that naive. A lot of people still don't know why Bianca and John were arrested. If the other three major families catch wind of this, they might use it against Mason. If Mason gets hurt, the Williams Family won't let it slide, and we could see riots in the city."

Brenda sighed, sometimes thinking the city would be better off without the four major families.

Isabella was pleased with Brenda's approach and started explaining how Bianca and John had set her up.

The interrogation didn't take long. When Isabella stepped out, she saw John getting into a car and leaving.

Brenda frowned. Even with John's influence, he shouldn't have been released so quickly; something was up.

Brenda quickly asked who had interrogated John and was shocked to find out it was the police chief, Alan.

"Isabella, wait here. I'm going to talk to Mr. Savage," Brenda said before storming into Alan's office.

"Alan, I need an explanation. Why did you let John go? He's still a suspect, isn't he?" Brenda demanded, glaring at Alan.

Alan barely looked at her and waved dismissively. "The evidence you have only ties Bianca to faking illness, bribing medical staff, and trying to take Isabella's kidney. None of it links John to these actions."

Brenda was almost laughing in disbelief. "Alan, are you serious? Without John's go-ahead, would Bianca have the guts to harm Isabella?"

Alan sighed, "Let me repeat, you have no evidence."

Brenda coldly asked, "Just tell me, what did John give you in return?"

Alan slammed the table in anger. "Do you think I'm corrupt? How many times do I have to say it? Unless Bianca accuses John of ordering her, you'll never catch him!"

Brenda stared at Alan, then turned and left, fuming.
