Michael shrugged. "Don't think too highly of Benjamin. He was always a prankster in school. Those two are definitely a pair of jokers."

Isabella got back into bed and pulled up the covers. "Alright, babe, let's not talk about them anymore. It's time to rest."

Michael lay down and turned off the light.

About an hour later, Isabella quietly slipped out of bed.

She walked to the door and gently opened it. Just as she was about to leave, she heard Michael's voice behind her.

"It's late. Where are you going? And don't tell me you're going to the bathroom; there's no need to sneak around like a thief," Michael joked, walking up behind her.

Isabella turned around with an embarrassed smile. "Would you believe me if I said I was afraid of waking you up?"

Michael shook his head.

After a moment of silence, Isabella sighed, "Okay, I actually wanted to eavesdrop outside Amelia's room. They did it to us, so it's only fair."

Michael turned her around, grabbed her shoulders, and looked into her eyes. "What you're doing isn't right."

Isabella spread her hands in resignation. "You're right. Eavesdropping is really rude."

Michael shook his head. "I didn't mean that. I meant, why didn't you bring me along when you were planning to eavesdrop?"

###chapter 351 You Are Worse Than An Animal

After Michael finished talking, Isabella was taken aback for a second, then let out a helpless laugh.

"So, people really do laugh when they're feeling helpless," Isabella said, shaking her head. She then walked with Michael towards Benjamin's room. They pressed their ears against the door but heard nothing except steady breathing.

"Looks like they're asleep," Isabella said, sounding a bit let down.

Michael shrugged. "Let's go. They're probably just wiped out from the flight. We should get some rest too."

Isabella and Michael headed back to their room. Not long after they left, the door creaked open. Benjamin peeked out cautiously, then sighed in relief.

"You were right, they were definitely eavesdropping outside our door," Benjamin said, turning to Amelia with a grin.

Amelia smirked, then pulled Benjamin back inside and shut the door.

"I know Isabella too well. We're best friends, after all," Amelia said, lying down in her pajamas.

Benjamin lay on the other side of the bed, both of them under separate blankets, neither saying a word.

The room was super quiet, with only the sound of their breathing and heartbeats.

Benjamin's heart was pounding. He asked tentatively, "Babe, are you cold? I'm feeling kinda warm. If you're cold, I can be your pillow."

Amelia turned away from him. "Don't think I don't know what you're up to. You better drop your little schemes. We're still in the evaluation stage."

Benjamin sighed and shook his head, pushing all his thoughts deep down.

The room went silent again. After a while, Amelia said, "I'm warning you, don't sneak into my blanket while I'm asleep. If you do, you'll be the dumbest creature on earth!"

Benjamin rolled his eyes. "Are you questioning my character?"

Amelia didn't respond, just snorted.

Benjamin snorted back, turned his back to her, and eventually fell asleep, determined to prove his character that night.

But the next morning, they were woken up by their phone alarms. Benjamin got up and turned off the alarm. He noticed their blankets were still separate.

"See, I told you I have good character. I didn't do anything!" Benjamin said proudly.

But Amelia didn't look pleased. She grabbed a pillow and chucked it at him.

"You're worse than an animal!" Amelia snapped, then got up and headed to the bathroom to freshen up.

Benjamin scratched his head, holding the pillow. "Why is she mad? I didn't sneak into her blanket. My character is solid! Shouldn't she be praising me for being a gentleman?"

Benjamin was still puzzled about why Amelia was angry. Even after they freshened up, got dressed, and were ready to head to the snowy mountains, he was still mulling over the question.

They had already planned out their entire trip and even lined up a photographer while staying at the hotel. This time, a travel agency at the base of the snowy mountains picked them up.

Isabella and Amelia had carefully chosen this travel agency as the best one. They handled all the travel details, and the photographers were top-notch, having worked with some international celebrities.

During the car ride, the tour guide in the front seat was going on about safety tips, beautiful spots, local snacks, and attractions.

Michael wasn't really into it. He'd been to this country a few times for business and knew the culture pretty well. Right now, he was more worried about Benjamin.

Benjamin seemed lost in thought.

Isabella and Amelia were all ears to the tour guide, chatting about where to take photos next and what outfits to wear for different poses.

Michael, sitting next to Benjamin, leaned in and asked softly, "What's up? You seem really down."

Benjamin sighed. "I don't know what I did to make Amelia mad."

He quietly filled Michael in on what happened last night.

Michael looked at him in surprise and asked quietly, "So you really didn't sneak into Amelia's blanket last night?"

Even though Michael's voice was low, Benjamin could still sense the shock in his tone.

Frowning, Benjamin looked at Michael, annoyed. "Even if Amelia doubts my character, you shouldn't! Without her permission, I would never sneak into her blanket at night."

Michael looked at him helplessly. "I really don't get why I ever asked you for advice on relationships."

Benjamin could see the disdain in Michael's eyes, which made him even more confused and annoyed.

"What's going on? Do you know something? Spill it," Benjamin asked softly.

Sensing Benjamin's anxiety, Michael rolled his eyes and explained, "If Amelia really minded you sneaking into her blanket, why would she share a bed with you? It means she's accepted you, and you just need a bit of boldness and courage."

Benjamin was stunned. He looked at Michael in disbelief.

"Are you saying Amelia actually wanted me to sneak into her blanket last night?" Benjamin asked, shocked.

Michael nodded, patting Benjamin's shoulder. "Looks like I was wrong before. You might have some unique insights into pursuing women, but when it comes to love, you're not as sharp as me. Remember, when a woman says no, it often means yes."

Benjamin finally got it. He regretfully tapped his head and said angrily, "No wonder she called me worse than an animal this morning. I really am! Don't worry, I know what to do now."

###chapter 352 Taking Photos

Benjamin had made up his mind; tonight was the night he was going to give it a shot.

After a long drive, Isabella and her crew finally pulled up at the base of the snowy mountain. The photographer and wardrobe team were already there, waiting for them.

"Where do we go to try on the clothes? I want to pick out some nice outfits," Isabella asked the photographer, her excitement bubbling over.

The photographer pointed to a nearby truck. The back of the truck opened up, revealing a row of clothes hanging inside.

"Don't worry, we've got everything you need, all in your size. Feel free to try on whatever you like," the photographer said with a respectful nod.

Isabella was blown away by the selection. She picked up a gown and gasped, "Isn't this the haute couture gown from that bridal fashion magazine? You have it here too?"

"Of course, we're internationally renowned photographers. We can get any clothes, and they're all the real deal," the photographer replied, still respectful.

Michael was pleased with the photographer's words. He had arranged for these clothes to be delivered ahead of time.

No one knew Isabella's size better than Michael. Amelia might have known before, but now she didn't, as Isabella's size had changed with love's nourishment.

"This travel agency is really something. So, when do we start?" Amelia asked eagerly from the side.

Benjamin couldn't understand why Amelia was so excited about Isabella taking wedding photos.

"Stop looking so confused. Whatever she does, just nod, smile, and agree. Women's matters are way more complicated than ours," Michael whispered to Benjamin.

Benjamin straightened up immediately, giving Amelia a gentle smile.

The photographer smiled and said, "Taking photos is actually pretty exhausting, so we need to save our energy today. We'll drive up the mountain later. But there might be some spots with better views that we'll have to walk to. Also, it's cold up there, and these gowns aren't warm, so be ready to throw on a coat at any time."

"Hand the coat to me. I'll take care of my friend's coat and make sure she doesn't catch a cold," Amelia said, raising her hand excitedly.

"Thank you so much, my dear friend," Isabella said, hugging Amelia tightly.

"Women's emotions are so delicate. Sometimes seeing their good friends in wedding gowns is even more exciting than wearing one themselves," Michael said, a bit emotional.

Benjamin looked at Michael and asked, "So, what should I do now?"

Michael sighed, seeing the eagerness in Benjamin's eyes. "When they're chatting or excited, it's best to do nothing. Don't even show up, or you'll become the topic."

Benjamin's mouth twitched slightly, but he didn't argue. It made sense.

The crew piled back into the car and headed up the snowy mountain.

The air was crisp, and the scenery was breathtaking.

Halfway up, the photographer pulled over, got everyone out, and started scouting for the perfect spot for Isabella's photos.

"This spot is gorgeous. I suggest the ice blue dress for the lady and the vintage brown suit for the gentleman," the photographer said, handing the outfits to Isabella and Michael.

They ducked into the truck to change.

When they emerged, everyone was floored.

Michael looked dashing, like a nobleman from a bygone era in his vintage suit.

Isabella was stunning, like the Snow Queen straight out of a fairy tale.

"Isabella, you look amazing, like a real Snow Queen!" Amelia gushed, grabbing Isabella's hand.

Isabella smiled wryly, "I know I look good, but can you wait to hug me until after the photos? I'm freezing."

Amelia quickly let go, and the photographer started directing them.

"Sir, smile more. The lady is doing great. Put your hand on his shoulder and look at him like you're melting the snow with your passion," the photographer instructed, changing angles and even lying on the ground to get the perfect shot.

"Look at his dedication, completely ignoring his own comfort for the sake of beautiful photos," Benjamin said, impressed.

Amelia shot Benjamin a look. "Why are you focusing on that? Shouldn't you be amazed at how handsome Michael looks and how beautiful Isabella is?"

Benjamin instinctively replied, "I already knew that, why be amazed?"

Realizing his mistake, he quickly added, "Of course, their outfits today really caught my eye. It's like seeing them anew, like a prince and queen from the snow falling in love in the human world."

Amelia's frown softened.

When the photographer finished the set, Amelia rushed over and draped a coat over Isabella.

"Oh, it's so cold, I'm freezing," Isabella said, her breath visible in the air.

Amelia hugged her and praised, "Fantastic, Isabella! The photos must be amazing. You two look like a prince and queen in love on the snowy mountain."

Benjamin was taken aback, realizing Amelia was echoing his words.

Isabella blushed, "Don't say that, you'll make me shy."

"Alright, time for the next set," the photographer said, handing out more outfits.

Benjamin was stunned by the new outfits.

###chapter 353 Give Kenna Some Shock

The photographer held up two sets of clothes, one looking like a Western cowboy getup and the other a casual yellow dress.

"These don't look like the usual wedding photo outfits. They seem more like everyday clothes," Amelia said, confused.

Isabella also gave the photographer a curious look.

The photographer blinked, thought for a moment, and said, "Ladies, love isn't just about the big, romantic wedding moments. It's also about the little, everyday things. These outfits represent that everyday warmth and affection. It's kind of our specialty here."

After explaining, the photographer nervously glanced at Isabella.

Actually, Michael had sent these outfits over, insisting Isabella wear them for the shoot.

The photographer silently hoped Isabella would go along with it.

Benjamin whispered to Michael, "I think I've seen these outfits in your parents' photos."

Michael nodded. "Yep, when my parents got together and married, their first photos were in matching outfits like these."

Benjamin looked at Michael, a bit exasperated. "Are you trying to make Isabella like your mom?"

Michael rolled his eyes. "This is for my dad. He once said Isabella looks like my mom from a certain angle."

"But these outfits don't really fit the snow mountain theme today. Shouldn't you suggest something else to Isabella?" Benjamin asked.

Michael shook his head, his eyes soft as he looked at Isabella. "I have a feeling she'll pick these."

Isabella looked at the outfits, thought for a moment, then nodded. "You make a good point. I'll go change."

She took the clothes and called out to Michael, "Honey, come over and change too."

Isabella waved at Michael, who shot Benjamin a smug look before heading into the carriage.

Benjamin rolled his eyes. "Look at you, all smug! You need a horse with that cowboy outfit!"

Just as Benjamin finished speaking, the photographer had someone bring over a horse.

The red horse was already saddled and looked very calm.

The photographer looked at Benjamin triumphantly. "We are professionals!"

Benjamin smirked, impressed.

Soon, Isabella and Michael hopped down from the truck. Under the photographer's direction, they rode the horse and took several photos with a grassy background.

"Alright, don't worry, our horse is very gentle. Sir, place your hands on your wife's abdomen. Ma'am, turn your head and smile at your husband. Perfect, your expressions are full of love!" The photographer praised them continuously, snapping away with his camera.

Once the new photos were taken, the photographer sent a couple of them to Michael's phone, just like they had agreed.

Amelia draped the coat over Isabella again, and they chatted about the photos they had just taken.

Meanwhile, Michael stepped aside and sent the new photos to Kenna.

Kenna, who was reading a newspaper in a villa abroad, heard his phone ring. He glanced at it and then his eyes widened.

Kenna picked up the phone from the table, his hands trembling.

After examining the photo carefully several times, Kenna's voice choked up. "It's... it's so much like her!"

At that moment, Kenna's phone rang again. It was Michael calling.

Taking a deep breath, Kenna answered the call.

On the other end, Michael's somewhat playful voice came through. "So, Dad, did it bring back some good memories?"

Taking another deep breath, Kenna said angrily, "If I'm not mistaken, the background in your photos is a snow mountain, right? Listen, if Isabella catches a cold from this, I won't let you off the hook!"

Michael fiddled with his phone. "Don't worry, I'll take good care of my wife. You don't need to worry."

Kenna snorted. "Spit it out, why did you suddenly send me these photos? Are you just showing off?"

Michael chuckled, feeling a bit embarrassed. "Last time we talked, you were upset about me marrying Isabella. I sent the photos to cheer you up."

Kenna let out a long sigh. He knew what Michael was worried about and said calmly, "Don't worry, I won't stop you from being with Isabella. After all, she's my daughter-in-law now. In a way, I'm not losing out, but gaining."

Michael grew more curious. He had always wanted to know about Kenna's past, but Kenna never told him.

"Can you at least tell me, based on the expression in the photos, what did Isabella's grandmother do? Why is my uncle so good to Isabella?" Michael asked curiously.

Kenna snorted heavily. "You remind me of my dear wife. I'm feeling very sad now! So don't expect any information from me. If you want to know, ask your uncle. I can't be bothered to explain to you, you're not worthy of knowing!"

After saying that, Kenna hung up the phone. He then wiped away his tears, looked at Isabella's photo, and turned around to continue chatting with his wife's photo.

On the other side, Michael looked at the ended call screen, rubbed his nose with a wry smile. "They say old people act like children. I hope I won't be like that. If I am, I'll definitely tease my son or grandson!"

Mischievous thoughts filled Michael's mind. However, at that moment, the photographer had already started getting them to change into the third set of clothes.

###chapter 354 Benjamin's Speculation

In this scene, Isabella and Michael spent over two hours changing outfits before heading to their next spot.

In the car, Isabella and Amelia were checking out the photos on the photographer's camera, making comments and cheering every now and then.

Benjamin and Michael were chilling in the back seat.

Benjamin leaned over to Michael and whispered, "So, how'd the talk with your dad go? Did he get all emotional, maybe even cry?"

Michael nodded, "Yeah, he probably cried, but he'd never admit it. I bet he's in his room right now, holding a photo of my mom, wiping away tears and reminiscing."

Benjamin chuckled. "Why do you always mess with your dad like that? That's not cool."

Michael shrugged, "He won't tell me the truth. Every time I ask him about what went down between Mason and Isabella's grandma, he clams up!"

Benjamin was taken aback for a second before saying, "Wait, something happened between Mason and Isabella's grandma? Seriously, do you really need to dig into that? What could've happened between a man and a woman?"

Benjamin's eyes sparkled with curiosity. He loved gossip, especially when it involved celebrities. And if those celebrities were their elders, even better.

"Let me guess," Benjamin's eyes lit up. "Mason and Isabella's grandma were a thing, but they couldn't be together. It became Mason's obsession. When he saw Isabella, she reminded him of her grandma, so he wanted her to marry John. It's like he's trying to fix his past regrets!"

Because that's how it always goes in movies and TV shows.

Michael sighed. He had thought the same thing but wasn't ready to confront Mason about it yet.

Suddenly, a car pulled up next to theirs, and through the window, they saw a bride in a wedding dress.

The photographer pointed to the car and said with a smile, "They're here for wedding photos too. The next spot we're heading to has even better scenery, so it's pretty popular. We might have to wait for a good spot."

Isabella curiously rolled down her window, and the other bride did the same. Their eyes met.

"Hey, it's fate that we meet. Wanna swap bouquets?" The bride from the other car looked even younger than Isabella, with an innocent vibe.

The bride held a pure white bouquet that matched her look perfectly.

Isabella looked at the bride, feeling nostalgic. She thought of herself eight years ago, young and innocent, dreaming of marrying John. But reality had shattered those dreams.

"Sure, I wish you a happy marriage." Isabella handed over her bouquet, and the other bride did the same.

Their bouquets met in the air, like a little exchange of love vibes between the past and the present.

"Your flowers smell amazing, thanks! I wish you a happy marriage," the other bride said, waving to Isabella.

Isabella nodded, "Thanks, I hope you have a happy marriage too."

With the cold in the snowy mountains, the two brides quickly rolled up their windows after the bouquet swap. They only got out when both cars reached the photo spot.

Once out of the car, Isabella exhaled, her breath turning into a white mist in the chilly air.

Michael walked over and hugged her, rubbing her hands to warm them up.

"Still cold?" Michael asked with a smile.

Isabella shook her head, "Not anymore, your hands are warm."

Michael grinned and pulled out a lounge chair. "Sit and relax. The car was cramped, and we might have to wait a bit because of the crowd."

Isabella looked around. The scenery was stunning, with several couples taking wedding photos.

She didn't refuse and lay down on the lounge chair.

"Do you want to lie down too? Did you only bring one chair?" Isabella asked curiously.

Michael squatted beside her and smiled, "It's okay, I don't mind. I'm not tired, but you seem a bit weak. Your legs are shivering from the cold. Let me massage them for you."

Michael rubbed his palms together and started massaging Isabella's legs.

People around them glanced over with gentle smiles. Isabella blushed a bit but didn't refuse.

Just then, the bride who had swapped bouquets with Isabella walked over with her husband.

The groom looked a bit shy and chubby but kind-hearted.

The bride pointed at Michael and said, "Honey, do you notice anything about this gentleman?"

The groom scratched his head and said in surprise, "Honey, are you feeling sorry for him?"

The bride rolled her eyes. Isabella couldn't help but laugh, covering her mouth and shaking her shoulders on the lounge chair.

Michael looked up and gave the groom a side-eye. This guy's emotional intelligence was almost as bad as Benjamin's.

Benjamin and Amelia saw the whole thing.

Amelia laughed, holding her stomach. "This is hilarious. Honey, isn't this scene funny?"

Benjamin smirked, thinking his emotional intelligence was way better than the groom's.

"Honey, do you need to lie down too? Should I massage your legs?" Benjamin joked with Amelia.

Amelia rolled her eyes, "Oh, please, I don't want people to think you're pitiful."

Amelia laughed again.

Everyone was laughing, except for the groom, who looked embarrassed. Did he really say something wrong?

###chapter 355 Strange Message

Isabella and her crew hung around for a bit before finally getting their photos taken. After the shoot, it was time for the couple to exchange flowers.

They also snapped some group shots with the bride and groom. It felt like making new friends in a far-off place.

After saying their goodbyes, Isabella's group kept climbing higher up the snowy mountain. They spent the whole day there, capturing all the shots they needed.

The mountain scenery was stunning, and there were plenty of tourists around. Where there are tourists, there are always restaurants and shops, so food wasn't an issue.

Once they wrapped up the photo session, they headed back to the hotel by car.

"I can't wait to see those pics," Isabella said, grinning as she hugged Michael's neck.

Michael pulled her closer and said, "Didn't the photographer mention? They need to edit the photos first to make them perfect."

Isabella pouted. "But the photographer also said we're already good-looking, and the photos would be great even without editing."

Michael kissed her forehead and then suddenly lifted her, placing her on the bed. "Didn't the photographer already send you the photos?"

"I'm gonna take a shower and then grab some dinner. Wanna join me?" Michael asked with a grin.

Isabella playfully swatted his waist. "Are you sure?"

Michael smirked. "Actually, I think it's better if we shower separately. We did splurge on this presidential suite, so no need to worry about the water bill."

With that, Michael headed into the bathroom with a towel.

Isabella covered her mouth, a mischievous smile spreading across her face. Teasing Michael was always fun.

She pulled out her phone and checked the photos the photographer had sent. Even unedited, they looked amazing against the snowy backdrop.

Stranger: [Your husband is a fraud. He's not just your husband; he's mine too.]

Isabella glanced towards the bathroom and then typed a reply.

Isabella: [Are you sure you have the right person?]

Stranger: [I'm not mistaken. Your husband's name is Michael. He's my husband too.]

Isabella's frown deepened. She suddenly remembered being mistaken for a mistress when they arrived at the hotel yesterday.

Elise, who came to blow the lid off the affair, caused this mess because her husband had tied the knot in two different countries.

Isabella: [I don't know who you are, but without solid proof, I'll sue you.]

Stranger: [You want proof? Fine, I'll give it to you.]

A moment later, the stranger sent a photo. Isabella's jaw dropped. It was a wedding photo of Michael with another woman, her face blurred out. Isabella knew it wasn't her; their wedding was in the snowy mountains, not by the seaside.

Isabella's eyes turned icy. She quickly typed back.

Isabella: [You think you can fool me with this photo? In this day and age, even videos can be faked. Why should I believe this?]

The stranger didn't reply right away but instead retracted all the previous messages.

But Isabella was quick and saved the photo before it disappeared.

Then, another message popped up.

Stranger: [If you don't believe me, check the local government records. There's a whole industry helping men get married abroad. You might find info about their other marriages.]

Isabella's frown deepened.

Isabella: [Why are you saying "these men"? Are you implying my husband has multiple wives?]

Stranger: [I know of at least two, but I won't send you more. The power behind your husband is scary, and I don't want to put other women in danger.]

Another message followed.

Stranger: [I'm telling you this as a fellow woman. Be cautious and don't get fooled by marriage. If you still don't believe me, good luck.]

The stranger retracted the message shortly after. No more messages came through.

Isabella tried calling the number, but no one picked up.

She narrowed her eyes and opened the saved photo again. In it, Michael wore a wedding suit, looking all charming. The woman next to him, though blurred, seemed to be smiling.

Isabella suddenly grinned, saved the photo to her email, and put her phone away.

Just then, Michael walked out of the bathroom, drying his hair with a towel.

"Everything okay, babe? You seem a bit off," Michael asked, puzzled.

Isabella shook her head with a smile. "I was just thinking, only taking photos in the snowy mountains might be a bit boring. Maybe we should take some by the sea too."

Michael nodded, smiling. "This country has a coastline. If you want, we can take some seaside photos. And remember? I was planning to propose to you on a cruise last time."

Isabella stared at Michael's face but saw nothing suspicious.

"Our schedule is already packed, so let's wait until the end of the trip," Isabella said, smiling as she grabbed her clothes and headed into the bathroom for a shower.

###chapter 356 Benjamin's Ex-Girlfriend

As Isabella's husband, Michael could sense there was something off behind her smile, but she wasn't talking, and he had no clue how to bring it up.

Lila's eyes narrowed slightly, sensing Amelia's determination. She knew she wasn't dealing with a pushover.

Even though men aren't usually as emotionally intuitive as women, Michael could still pick up on the underlying tension between Lila and Amelia.

By bringing up her past with Benjamin and their shared club activities, Lila was trying to stir up jealousy in Amelia and drive a wedge between her and Benjamin.

Amelia, by pointing out that Benjamin had never mentioned his ex, was subtly telling Lila that Benjamin had moved on and didn't care about her anymore.

Michael watched Lila closely, curious about her next move.

Lila didn't get angry at Amelia's words; instead, she complimented her. "Ms. Martinez, you are absolutely stunning! Only someone as beautiful as you could be a match for Benjamin, such an amazing surgeon!"

Amelia flipped her hair and smiled at Lila. "Thanks for the compliment. I think so too. I'm lucky to have found such a great guy like Benjamin. Right, darling?"

She looked at Benjamin as she spoke.

Benjamin was at a loss for words and awkwardly scratched his head. "Yeah, it's my luck too. And Lila, you're very beautiful as well."

A spark appeared in Lila's eyes as she walked over to Amelia and said with a smile, "I think we have a lot in common, Ms. Martinez. Standing together, we look like sisters."

"Are you implying that Benjamin chose me as a replacement for you?" Disgust flashed in Amelia's eyes as she stepped away from Lila.

But Benjamin shook his head. "No, Lila, Amelia looks nothing like you. In fact, I think she's even more beautiful."

Benjamin was being honest; he truly thought Amelia was more beautiful.

Amelia was naturally pleased, but Lila's expression darkened.

A flicker of emotion crossed Lila's face, but she quickly regained her composure. She patted Benjamin's shoulder and said with a smile, "You're still as funny as ever."

Lila tried to brush off the topic as a joke and smoothly transitioned to asking when they had arrived in the country.

Meanwhile, Isabella leaned over to Michael and whispered, "Why do I feel like you're not very happy? Have you noticed something?"

###chapter 357 Opposing the Lila Alliance

Isabella noticed Michael's face change when Lila brought up Benjamin's college days.

When Isabella asked about it, Michael just nodded.

"Remember when Lila said Benjamin's now a top-notch surgeon?" Michael asked quietly.

Isabella nodded. Of course, she remembered.

Michael went on, "Back in college, Benjamin was studying medicine, but no one really knew what he'd become. He was so low-key that no one knew his background. Lila started dating him because he was good-looking, though not as good-looking as me."

Isabella rolled her eyes at Michael's smug look and playfully tugged his ear.

"Yeah, yeah, you're handsome. But can you stop bragging for a second? I'm more interested in what happened next," Isabella said, rolling her eyes again.

Michael shrugged and continued, "Everyone thought he was just some poor student with no future. When graduation came around, Lila figured he was going nowhere, so she dumped him for the school leader's son. Benjamin was crushed."

Isabella quickly caught on. Lila must have seen how successful Benjamin had become and wanted to get back with him, pushing Amelia aside to be his girlfriend.

With that in mind, Isabella had another question.

She looked at Michael curiously and asked, "If Lila picked boyfriends based on looks, why didn't she go for you?"

Michael rolled his eyes. "Did you forget about Scarlett? She was always around, scaring off any girl who showed interest in me. I was single all through college."

Isabella laughed, covering her mouth. "Well, I guess I should thank Scarlett for saving me such a great husband."

Michael sighed and patted her hand. "What are you talking about? Why thank Scarlett? Even if someone had pursued me, I would've turned them down. I never found women like Lila attractive. Only someone as naive as Benjamin would fall for her."

Just then, the waiter started serving food to Benjamin and the others, and Benjamin looked pretty stressed about the tension between the two women.

The waiter gave him an out.

"Lila, let's eat first. We have plans later. How about we grab coffee another day?" Benjamin was hinting for Lila to leave.

Lila didn't want to go, but she knew it wasn't the right time to push her agenda.

"Alright, I won't bother you guys. Enjoy your meal, I'll head out." Lila waved and left the restaurant.

After she left, Benjamin sighed in relief, and Amelia let go of his arm.

"Come on, babe, don't give me that look. I haven't talked to Lila in ages," Benjamin said with a sheepish grin.

Amelia kept eating, her voice calm. "You don't need to explain, I trust you."

"But your face says otherwise," Benjamin muttered under his breath.

Isabella watched the awkward scene unfold, with Benjamin looking all stressed out while Amelia stayed cool as a cucumber. It was clear to everyone there was some tension, but Benjamin seemed clueless about what was really going on.

"Hey, babe, want something to drink? I found this coffee shop earlier, and their coffee is amazing. Want me to grab you some?" Michael suddenly asked Isabella.

Isabella was confused at first, but then she caught on to Michael's hint. She turned to Amelia and said, "Amelia, that coffee shop Michael mentioned is really good. Want to try some too?"

Amelia was surprised but quickly nodded. "Sure, let's give it a shot."

Michael gave Benjamin a look, and he got the message right away.

"You guys hang tight. I'll go get it. Be right back." Benjamin eagerly ran out, seeing it as a chance to score some points with Amelia.

As soon as Benjamin left, Amelia's calm facade crumbled.

"Ugh, Benjamin is so clueless. Sure, he complimented me, which was nice, but I can't stand seeing him all chummy with Lila! He should've just sent her packing," Amelia fumed.

Michael, still eating, said calmly, "Benjamin's a nice guy. He probably won't do what you expect, but I trust him. He knows what Lila's up to, so you don't have to worry about them getting back together."

Amelia sighed, "I trust him too, but he really needs to change his ways."

Isabella suddenly perked up, leaning in excitedly. "How about we form an Anti-Jerk Alliance? We can crush Lila's hopes and show her that Benjamin's off the market."

Amelia's eyes lit up. "That's a fantastic idea! With you two on board, it'll definitely work."

Michael shrugged, "I'm in. I always listen to my wife."

Amelia looked at Isabella with a hint of envy. "I wish Benjamin understood me like your husband does."

Michael said calmly, "Give Benjamin more chances. When I was trying to win over Isabella, Benjamin gave me a lot of advice. He's great with theory but not so much with practice. Lila messed with his head all through college, so he's kind of lost when it comes to love."

Hearing Michael's words, Amelia felt a pang of sympathy for Benjamin.

Just then, Benjamin came back with the coffee, and everyone quickly changed the subject.

###chapter 358 Annoying Woman

After dinner, they decided to hit up the most popular shopping street nearby to soak in some local vibes.

While they were browsing, Amelia clung to Benjamin's arm, making them look super close.

Benjamin was pretty stoked; it seemed like Amelia was stepping up her game because of Lila's sudden appearance.

Amelia wasn't dumb. She knew that if she kept being bratty and blaming Benjamin, it would just push him away and straight into Lila's arms.

Since Lila was trying to win Benjamin back with their old memories, Amelia figured she'd make him stay by creating new, sweet moments together.

When they wrapped up their shopping spree and got back to the hotel, they were shocked to see Lila standing there with a suitcase.

Lila looked just as surprised. "What are you guys doing here? Oh, right, you're staying at this hotel too. What a small world!"

Lila, all excited, rushed towards Benjamin like she was about to hug him.

Amelia frowned and stepped in front of Benjamin, while Isabella shoved Michael aside.

Lila instinctively hugged the guy in front of her but quickly realized something was off-this guy felt way more muscular than Benjamin.

"Have you hugged enough? Can you let go now? My wife is watching," Michael's cool voice cut through the moment.

Lila looked up and saw Michael's icy expression.

Frightened by his cold stare, Lila quickly let go and stepped back.

Michael moved to stand next to Isabella, glaring at her with annoyance.

"This is the first time I've seen someone push their husband away to help a friend," Michael grumbled.

Isabella casually patted his arm. "Of course, because I trust you won't get involved with this woman!"

Michael rolled his eyes. "Yeah, thanks for the vote of confidence."

Lila was taken aback that she had hugged Michael instead of Benjamin. Sure, Michael was good-looking, but his vibe made her think twice about getting close.

But when Lila tried to hug Benjamin again, she found Amelia already guarding him.

Lila was a bit miffed but didn't want to cause a scene.

"We're planning to go skiing," Benjamin said, then noticed Amelia shooting daggers at him with her eyes.

Benjamin blinked, realizing he might've messed up.

Lila's face lit up with excitement. "That's awesome! I came here just for the skiing! I heard the snow here is the best powder snow! Skiing here must be amazing! Let's hit the slopes together tomorrow. Since I'm solo, I can join you guys."

Amelia glared at Benjamin, hoping he'd say no.

But Benjamin just scratched his head awkwardly, not sure how to turn Lila down without hurting her feelings.

Amelia looked disappointed at Benjamin, then turned to Lila with a smile. "Sure, but just so you know, all four of us are couples. If you feel weird being the odd one out, maybe you can find another guy to join you."

Amelia was trying to hint that Lila shouldn't crash their couple time.

Lila got the hint but decided to ignore it. She wasn't about to let a little thing like pride get in the way of chasing after the guy who left her.

"No worries, maybe I'll find a great guy at the ski resort tomorrow. See you then." Lila waved, grabbed her room key, and headed for the elevator.

As soon as Lila was out of sight, Amelia stomped on Benjamin's foot and stormed off to the other elevator.

Benjamin winced in pain, hopping around a bit, then looked helplessly at Isabella and Michael.

"This isn't my fault. You know I'm kinda slow with this stuff. It was just a reflex. Besides, no matter what we plan, Lila's gonna tag along. It'd be even more awkward if she caught us lying, right?" Benjamin tried to explain, but Isabella just stomped her foot in frustration, crossed her arms, and got into the elevator.

"What's going on? Why are the girls so mad?" Benjamin asked, looking to Michael for answers.

Michael sighed. "Honestly, I think you're right. With how shameless Lila is, no matter what you say, she'd probably just camp outside your door and pretend to bump into you, hoping you'd invite her along."

Benjamin nodded eagerly. "Exactly! You get me."

Michael shook his head and then stepped on Benjamin's other foot.

"What the hell? Why are you copying Amelia?" Benjamin yelped, hopping on one foot and glaring at Michael.

Michael shrugged, looking a bit helpless. "Remember how my wife stomped her foot before getting into the elevator? She actually asked me to step on you. She felt too embarrassed to do it herself since you two aren't that close yet. So, I had to."

Benjamin stood there, stunned. "You guys have that level of understanding?"

Michael nodded. "Yep, that's love. When you really get it, you understand a woman's mind."

Michael patted Benjamin's shoulder. "You've got a lot to learn. Take it slow. For now, just focus on handling how Lila's gonna deal with Amelia tomorrow while skiing."

Benjamin pushed Michael's hand away, saying confidently, "No matter what Lila does, I'll back Amelia up."

Michael gave him a thumbs up. "Well said, you're finally catching on."

###chapter 359 Sneaking into Your Blanket

After getting back to the room, Benjamin flopped onto the bed, wide awake. Michael's words from earlier on the snowy mountain kept replaying in his head.

"When a woman says no, she actually means yes, got it?"

Benjamin glanced over at Amelia, who was fast asleep. After a moment of hesitation, he bit his lip and slowly lifted her blanket.

He moved carefully, his eyes glued to Amelia's face, watching her breathing. He'd stop if she stirred.

Her breathing stayed steady, and Benjamin let out a sigh of relief.

"Come on, Benjamin, you can do this. Amelia's been waiting for this, right?" he kept telling himself.

His nerves were so shot that he didn't even notice his hands shaking as he lifted the blanket. The trembling only made things harder. Amelia's eyebrows twitched slightly, but Benjamin missed it in the dim light.

"Just a little more, and I can get in," he thought, watching the blanket rise as he inched closer to Amelia.

Getting under a blanket with someone takes three steps: lift the blanket, get in, and cover up. But these simple steps felt like they took forever for Benjamin.

He reached out, gently touching the outside of Amelia's pajamas, feeling her warmth, which only made him more nervous. He paused, watching her closely. When she didn't wake up, he felt a bit more at ease and slowly slid under the blanket.

"Almost there. Come on, Benjamin, you got this," he kept encouraging himself.

After what felt like an eternity, Benjamin finally managed to get under Amelia's blanket, though it mostly covered her, leaving him only half-covered.

"Good thing the room's warm, so being half-covered won't be too bad," he thought, trying to reassure himself.

He turned to look at Amelia's peaceful face, feeling a wave of warmth wash over him.

"If only it could stay like this forever, just quietly watching her," he thought, smiling to himself. Feeling her warmth, he wanted to hug her but held back.

The human heart is greedy; once you get something, you always want more. Even though he was under her blanket and lying next to her, he wanted more, like holding her.

"Should I try to gently hold Amelia? What if she wakes up? No, she must be expecting this, right? But what if she questions me? How should I respond? 'I accidentally slipped in'?" Benjamin's mind raced, leaving him feeling completely lost.

He desperately tried to remember everything he'd learned, but his mind was a complete blank.

Just then, Amelia rolled over, draping her arm and leg over Benjamin.

Her sudden movement made him freeze up instantly.

Benjamin was a bundle of nerves, praying she wouldn't wake up or realize he had snuck under her blanket.

"Oh God, what do I do? Or better yet, what would Michael do? Damn it, why am I thinking about him? Amelia's my girlfriend!" His mind was racing, his body heating up, his breathing quickening, and his heart pounding.

The only silver lining was that Amelia's movement had pulled more of the blanket over him, covering his other half.

"Am I seriously thinking about the blanket right now? How do I talk to Amelia? What do I do next?" His tense body was trembling slightly.

Suddenly, he felt Amelia patting his chest.

"Benjamin, you're just like Michael said: all theory, no practice!" Amelia's annoyed voice broke the silence.

Benjamin was stunned. He turned to her and asked, "You weren't asleep?"

Rolling her eyes, Amelia said, "The way you lifted my blanket, if you'd done it any more, I could've done a backflip."

Embarrassed, Benjamin scratched his face, not expecting his carefulness to wake her.

Sighing, Amelia hugged him tightly and pulled the blanket more over him.

Excited, Benjamin hugged her back and looked at her face, asking, "So, are you okay with this now?"

Rolling her eyes again, Amelia kissed him on the corner of his mouth. "You're such a fool when it comes to love, or Lila wouldn't have tricked you. If I don't agree now, she might steal you away!"

"Darling, believe me, I have no feelings for Lila!" Benjamin said earnestly.

Amelia kissed him again, caressing his face. "I believe you. You're just not good at saying no. I'll be your shield against any woman who tries to get close."

Benjamin's mouth twitched, but he happily kissed her. "Thank you so much, darling."

Amelia smiled and hugged him tighter.

Meanwhile, outside the bedroom, Isabella and Michael had their ears pressed against the door, grinning.

"I knew they'd make progress tonight," Isabella whispered.

Michael nodded, "Eavesdropping really is a thrill!"

They smiled at each other and headed back to their own bedroom.

###chapter 360 Embarrassing Moments in College

The next morning, Isabella and the gang spotted Lila hanging out in the lobby.

"I had no idea you studied medicine! That's impressive. Is there anything you can't do?" Isabella asked, curious about Michael's talents.

Isabella rolled her eyes and playfully pinched his waist. "Are you hinting at something? It's not my fault we haven't had kids yet! I've been checked out, and everything's fine. So why can't I get pregnant?"

She patted her stomach, feeling frustrated.

Michael wrapped an arm around her shoulders and smiled. "It's okay, babe. No need to stress. Getting pregnant isn't always easy, but we'll keep trying and it'll happen."

Isabella gave him a look. "You think it's just about your body? Let's give it another shot tonight then."

Michael hesitated for a second, then nodded. He was game for another try.

Isabella chuckled. As they neared the parking lot, something clicked in her mind.

Michael froze, thinking, 'Crap, I messed up.'

Isabella tilted her head. "If anyone grew up with Benjamin, it would be John's uncle. Could it be that you..."

###chapter 361 The Past Michael Refuses to Mention

Isabella shot Michael a suspicious glance.

Michael gulped, feeling a bit jittery.

Right then, Benjamin's voice cut through the tension.

"Everyone's in the car, what are you two still doing here?" Benjamin urged them to hurry up.

Isabella watched Benjamin, waiting for an explanation.

Benjamin smiled at her and said, "Actually, Michael and I go way back. We were not just high school classmates but also college buddies. We even grew up together. Our families lived far apart, so we mostly hung out at school."

Benjamin looked even more embarrassed, almost grim.

Isabella and Michael walked slowly towards the car.

Isabella looked at Michael in shock, then gave him a thumbs up. "Darling, you're amazing! Turning the tables like that!"

Michael smiled faintly, "Honestly, I don't care much about others' mockery. It was April Fools' Day, and I don't care about others' opinions of me. That's why I didn't remember this incident."

Isabella chose to believe Michael because she felt he was that kind of person.

"Can you tell me more about your college experiences?" Isabella asked, getting into the car, her eyes shining with excitement.

However, Benjamin didn't feel as good during this skiing trip.

###chapter 362 The Bet

The beginner ski slope was filled with the sound of someone screaming.

"Aren't you two skiing?" Benjamin asked with a smile.

Benjamin quickly caught on.

Just as Benjamin agreed to Isabella's bet, a scream came from the beginner slope.

"Oh my god, I think my leg is broken! Can someone help me?" It was Lila's voice.

###chapter 363 Detached Benjamin

Benjamin sprinted over to Lila and Amelia when he heard Lila's cry.

Benjamin waved his hand, and the two staff members carried Lila away from the ski resort.

After Lila left, Benjamin approached Amelia, took her hand, and smiled, "Darling, I never doubted you."

Amelia was very satisfied with Benjamin's response and lowered her head, a hint of shyness on her face.

By this time, Isabella and Michael had walked to the other side. They headed towards the intermediate ski slope.

"Looks like I lost. I'll give you $100 after we change clothes," Michael said with a smile.

"Don't forget to remind Benjamin about my jewelry," Isabella reminded with a grin.

As they reached the intermediate ski slope, Michael suddenly asked, "How do you understand what Lila is thinking?"

Isabella shook her head. "I don't understand what Lila is thinking, but I guess bitches think alike. Back when Bianca tried to frame me in front of John, she used the same tricks. So I understand their tactics. But John, that idiot, is not like Benjamin. Forget about him, a fool and a bitch, let them live together forever and not harm others."

***Valentine's Day Special***

"What do you want to show me? Why all the secrecy?" Isabella asked, her curiosity piqued as she held Michael's hand, following his lead. She knew whatever it was, it would be a delightful surprise because Michael never let her down.

"We're here! Happy Valentine's Day!" Michael said, removing her blindfold.

As the darkness lifted, Isabella gasped, covering her mouth in astonishment at the sight before her.

The sky danced with deep blue ripples, like a flowing river of light suspended in the heavens. It was as if the Northern Lights were weaving a tapestry of color, painting the night with ethereal brushstrokes, while the stars twinkled like diamonds, adding their own brilliance to the cosmic canvas.

"This is like a fairy tale," Isabella exclaimed in delight.

Michael held Isabella's hand as they walked through the snow, their feet crunching on the thick blanket beneath them. The cold night couldn't extinguish the warmth in their hearts. Isabella reached up toward the sky, as if the auroras were flickering in her palms. She watched the beams of light dance above, her eyes sparkling with their brilliance.

Seeing Isabella so happy, Michael knew his gift was perfect. Fancy jewelry never caught her interest, but this fairy-tale innocence suited her perfectly.

"Sweetheart, this is just so beautiful! Thank you! How did you know there would be auroras tonight?" Isabella said, her voice trembling with emotion, almost on the verge of tears.

"I did a lot of research to find this spot. It seems even the heavens are celebrating our love," Michael replied with a smile, wrapping his arms around Isabella from behind. Together, they stood in awe of the enchanting scene before them.

"How can I ever repay you for such a wonderful gift?" Isabella wondered, feeling a bit overwhelmed.

"Darling, you don't need to worry about that. When I'm holding you, I already have the whole world," Michael's gentle voice whispered in Isabella's ear.
"Sweetheart, you're my world too," Isabella replied, turning to wrap her arms around Michael's neck, pulling him in for a deep, heartfelt kiss.

The auroras in the sky became more vibrant, casting a magical glow that wrapped around them, adding an extra touch of romance to the moment.
###chapter 364 Bianca Starts a Company

Michael pulled Isabella into a gentle hug after hearing what she said.

"Babe, honestly, if you had shown up earlier, I probably wouldn't have been interested in you at all," Isabella said with a smile, touching his face.

Michael blinked, thinking he might have misheard.

Isabella softly stroked his cheek. "I had plenty of handsome guys chasing me back then. But I didn't care for any of them. If you had come around earlier, it might have been the same story."

Michael was surprised, then let out a wry laugh. "Well, that actually makes sense."

Isabella kissed his cheek. "Fate has its own way of working things out. If I hadn't been hurt by Bianca and John, I wouldn't have met someone as amazing as you. I just had to go through the pain first to get to the good part."

Michael felt a warmth spread through him after hearing her words. He realized their meeting was a result of Isabella being deeply hurt by John, leading her to marry a random guy, and he was lucky enough to be that guy, bringing them to where they were now.

It was like a scene from a crazy romantic comedy.

Meanwhile, on the other side of the world, John and Bianca, who had been insulted by Isabella, were together.

John came home from work, took off his coat, and walked into the living room.

The cozy living room had a soft carpet, with a chaise lounge at the edge. Bianca was lying on it, barefoot, holding a parenting book.

Bianca put down the book and smiled at John as he walked in. "Hey, you're back."

John nodded, walked over to Bianca, and gently touched her face.

"Don't tease me, your hands are cold," Bianca said, playfully tapping his hand.

John chuckled, then placed his hand on her belly and asked, "How are you feeling? Any discomfort today?"

Bianca shook her head, a maternal glow on her face. "I'm healthy, and I can feel the baby is too. It's just my emotions are a bit all over the place."

A hint of sadness crossed her eyes.

John frowned slightly. "Is it because of your mom? I've got people looking for her, we should hear something soon. Try not to worry too much; she's an adult."

Bianca's father had committed suicide, and her mother had gone insane and disappeared. John had been sending people to find her.

In reality, Bianca knew her mother wasn't missing but was being held captive as leverage against her.

"I'm worried about my mom, but that's not what I wanted to talk about," Bianca said, settling back in the chair.

Bianca shook her head. "I want to start something new. You lost a chunk of your assets in that bet with your grandfather, and I want to help you out."

John was about to say that with Bianca's skills, starting a company wouldn't make much of a difference. But considering she was pregnant and sensitive, he held back.

"Honestly, I don't care much about that loss. The rest of my assets are still substantial, and we can always make more. But if you want to start a company, I'll support you. What kind of company are you thinking about?" John asked.

"I want to start a clothing company, create a new fashion brand," Bianca said, her eyes lighting up.

John frowned slightly. He remembered Isabella had a big clothing company. Was Bianca trying to compete with her?

Bianca seemed to read his mind and smiled, "I chose fashion for a reason. Isabella once said I had no business sense, and maybe she's right. But as a woman, I have a natural eye for fashion. I can always tell if an outfit looks good."

After a moment of thought, John nodded. Building a luxury brand wasn't easy, but if Bianca was passionate about it, he could help.

"Alright, I'll have someone handle the trademark and set up the company. Where do you want to base it?" John asked.

Bianca smiled, "You have so many buildings. Just find me a vacant floor. I don't need a big team for my small company."

John sighed in relief, thinking she might want to set up near Isabella's company. It seemed Bianca had thought this through and wasn't looking to provoke Isabella.

"No problem, we have plenty of vacant floors. I'll have someone pick the best one for you," John said, smiling at her.

"Great, dear. I'm going to rest for a bit. Being pregnant makes me so tired," Bianca yawned and headed to the bedroom.

Once in the room, Bianca's expression turned serious. "John, are you worried about me clashing with Isabella again and causing trouble, or that I might develop feelings for her again?"

John's thoughts were too naive; Bianca had never let go of her hatred for Isabella. Moving on wasn't that simple.

###chapter 365 Familiar Woman

Isabella had no clue that Bianca was gunning for her again. After their trip to the ski resort, they headed straight back to the hotel. Skiing was a blast, but it was tiring.

The doors opened, and in stumbled Elise, reeking of alcohol.

Isabella wrinkled her nose at the smell. Elise noticed and gave a goofy smile. "Sorry, miss. Can you help me to my room? Here's my key."

Elise was speaking a foreign language, but she had a translation device on her ear and chest, translating her words perfectly.

After fumbling around, Elise found her room key and handed it to Isabella.

Isabella looked at the key, confused, and the next moment, Elise collapsed on her, clearly having drunk too much.

Isabella glanced at the room number on the key card, and when the elevator arrived, she helped Elise to her room.

Isabella rolled her eyes and rubbed her sore arms. "It's nothing. If there's nothing else, I'll be on my way."

Just as Isabella was about to leave, Elise called out.

"Wait, can you stay and chat with me?" Elise's voice had a hint of pleading.

After a moment of hesitation, Isabella nodded.

Isabella could probably guess what Elise wanted to talk about-it had to be about her and her husband.

Actually, Isabella felt pretty bad for Elise, and since she had some free time, she figured she could sit and listen for a bit.

As Elise lay on the bed, staring blankly at the ceiling, she started talking about her and her husband's love story and all the beautiful plans she had for their future.

"But it was all a lie. He deceived me. He's a jerk! That jerk got married abroad without telling me! Damn it, from now on, I'm only marrying someone local, never someone from abroad!" Elise finished, tears streaming down her face.

Isabella furrowed her brows, thinking about some mysterious info she had heard. Someone had told her that Michael got married abroad, but she had dismissed it.

Elise sat up and looked at Isabella. "Your husband loves you. I hope you never go through what I did. God bless you."

Elise burst into tears again.

Isabella handed Elise a tissue, exchanged a few casual words with her, and then left the room.

Once Isabella was gone, Elise's sorrow vanished.

Elise took off the translation device, tossed it on the bed, and made a call.

"I've done as planned. I should have planted the seed of doubt in her heart," Elise smirked, speaking fluent Avalonian.

A voice came from the other end of the phone, "You did well. I'll transfer the money to you next. Are you heading back to your country?"

Elise shook her head. "There are still many fun places here. I want to keep traveling."

"Have a pleasant journey." Scarlett hung up the phone and transferred the agreed payment.

###chapter 366 Isabella's Question

###chapter 367 Have You Ever Lied to Me?

###chapter 368 Private Detective?

###chapter 369 Isabella's Determination

"It doesn't really concern you what charges I use, right? I didn't expect Mrs. Brown to care so much about me. Thank you, it reminds me of my mother," Isabella smiled at Zoey, but her words were like a bombshell.

Isabella deliberately mentioned her mother, indirectly referring to Pearl, who was still in the ICU.

Pearl's situation was a sore spot for Zoey. Every time she saw Pearl's miserable state in the hospital, she couldn't help but tremble with sadness and anger.

Indeed, after Isabella mentioned this, Zoey's face turned pale again, with anger brewing in her eyes.

Estella felt uneasy. She didn't expect to run into Isabella while buying a car. Zoey always got worked up around Isabella. Estella knew she had to calm Zoey down, or things might get out of hand and be hard to explain to Michael.

"Mrs. Brown, I think that car over there looks good too. Let's go check it out," Estella pointed to a car, planning to pull Zoey over to distract her.

But Zoey just glanced at the car and shook her head. "Ms. Foster, that car doesn't suit your style. This SUV is more your speed!"

Zoey pointed to the SUV in front of them. Isabella's face darkened, and Avery's expression soured because they had seen the car first. Most importantly, there was only one in the whole store.

Isabella said to Zoey coolly, "Mrs. Brown, I hope you understand that we saw this car first."

Zoey chuckled, crossing her arms. "Seeing it first doesn't make it yours. Can I pay more if I like it?"

"Do you think this is an auction? It's not like I can't afford it, you nouveau riche," Avery shot back, mocking Zoey.

In the eyes of the other three major families, the Brown Family was just nouveau riche, always trying to solve everything with money.

The manager of the dealership wasn't stupid. Letting the highest bidder buy the car would offend other wealthy clients. While they wanted to make money, integrity was also important.

Avery's words provoked Zoey, but she couldn't find anything to target Avery with. Avery didn't have embarrassing incidents known to everyone like Isabella did-pursuing John for eight years only to be abandoned, marrying an ordinary guy, being betrayed by family, and sending loved ones to prison.

In the end, Zoey decided to target Isabella.

"I heard your sister Bianca was released from prison by John again. I really didn't expect that. Did she save his life or something? Why does he always love her so much and look down on you?" Zoey continued to mock, crossing her arms.

Estella covered her face in annoyance. After spending time with Zoey, she had learned that Zoey's daughter Pearl had deep conflicts with Isabella. As a mother, Zoey naturally sided with Pearl and kept targeting Isabella. Estella felt Zoey targeted Isabella not just because of Pearl, but also to vent her own resentment.

Isabella looked at Zoey coldly and said, "I also want to know why John does this, but his feelings don't matter to me. I don't rely on him to live. Besides, John looks down on you too. Have you pursued him too? Does Paxton know about this?"

After hearing Isabella's words, Avery burst into laughter. "This is hilarious. Zoey pursuing John? Even the most unreliable journalist couldn't write such a story. But that scene must have been really funny."

Avery's imagination ran wild, and she couldn't help but laugh out loud at the thought of Zoey and John together.

Estella also covered her mouth, trying hard not to laugh, but her shaking shoulders gave her away.

Laughter is contagious. Although Isabella was just mocking Zoey, Avery's laughter was so infectious that Isabella couldn't help but laugh too.

Among the four women, only Zoey didn't laugh.

###chapter 377 The Resentment of Luke

Zoey couldn't help but feel frustrated. She had planned to use Bianca and John's relationship to rile up Isabella, but Isabella didn't seem to care at all and even turned the tables on her.

"Enough, stop laughing! Is it polite to make such jokes in front of me?" Zoey snapped at Isabella, her eyes blazing with anger.

Estella took a deep breath, finally managing to stifle her laughter.

"Alright, Mrs. Brown, we don't need to stay here any longer. Isabella, I think there might be some misunderstanding between us. Actually, I don't have to insist on choosing an SUV; it was just a sudden idea. I can look at another car," Estella said with a gentle smile towards Isabella.

Estella always remembered Michael's warning not to tarnish his reputation by using his name outside. She thought she had done well in this regard. Besides promoting film projects, she rarely appeared in public or discussed her marriage.

Michael was very satisfied with Estella's performance, providing her with ample resources. Recently, she had another new movie to shoot, which made her very grateful to Michael.

Estella wanted to take Zoey elsewhere to look at cars, but Zoey stood still like a pillar, refusing to move.

Estella was very annoyed. If it weren't for Michael's task for her to get close to Zoey and gather information about the Brown Family, she wouldn't want to deal with her at all.

"Ms. Foster, you are too gentle! If it weren't for your husband's protection, you would definitely be at a disadvantage in front of others! Just like today! Are you going to keep backing down when others bully you?" Zoey said to Estella, clearly annoyed.

Estella widened her eyes, almost swearing out loud. Zoey's deliberate targeting of Isabella had caused the conflict. This wouldn't have happened if she was alone.

"Mrs. Brown, I think that's enough. I don't need an SUV. I like other cars as well, there's no need to choose this one." Estella's tone carried a hint of warning. She didn't want to stay here any longer. She saw customers looking over in their direction, worried that someone might capture this scene and post it online, which would damage her reputation.

However, Zoey clearly didn't want to let Isabella off so easily.

The argument attracted the manager of the car dealership.

The manager of the store was Luke Riddick, a long-time employee under John's command, so he knew who the four women in front of him were.

Isabella had been engaged to John before, although they had broken up, she still had Mason as a backer. Estella was John's uncle's wife, also considered part of the Williams Family. The other two women were important figures in the four major families.

Luke smiled bitterly; he couldn't afford to provoke any of these women."Ladies, is there anything I can help with?" Luke approached, trying to keep his cool. He really didn't want to be in the middle of this, but as the manager, he had to step in.

Zoey pointed at Estella and said to Luke, "You know her; she's John's uncle's wife. She wants to buy this car, but these two say they saw it first. Who should buy it?"

Luke wished he could just disappear. Zoey was making things way too complicated. He was just a small fry; why should he get involved in a fight he couldn't win? He cursed Zoey in his head but kept a professional smile plastered on his face.

"Ladies, I'm sorry to inform you that this SUV is not for sale. It's just for display and has been touched by many customers. Considering your distinguished status, you wouldn't want a car that's been handled by so many people. If you really like it, you can leave a deposit, and we'll deliver a brand new one to your home soon," Luke said respectfully.

In Luke's mind, it was better not to offend anyone. Instead of giving the car to one person and making enemies of the others, it was fairer for no one to get it. As for the dealership losing out on a sale, that wasn't his problem. Luxury cars always had buyers, even if the four major families didn't buy, there were plenty of other wealthy customers.

Luke's plan seemed perfect, but reality had other ideas. Zoey wasn't buying it.

"Who said this car isn't for sale? I asked before, and your store never had such a policy. Are you deliberately targeting us?" Zoey glared at Luke, her expression icy.

If looks could kill, Luke would be six feet under.

Luke took a deep breath and forced a smile. "Ma'am, even if this car is for sale, do you really want to drive one that's been used by so many people?"

He looked at Estella, Isabella, and Avery.

All three women shook their heads. To them, a car was like a personal item.

Some men even joked online that cars and wives were not for lending, equating cars with partners.

A car that had been experienced by many people felt uncomfortable to them, given their status.

Luke felt a wave of relief seeing Isabella and the others' reactions. Especially Estella's; since the car was for her, if she didn't want it, Zoey couldn't argue.

But then Zoey said, "I don't mind if many people have used this car. Since Ms. Foster doesn't like it, I'll buy it for my husband; he doesn't mind anyway."

Luke was stunned.

Avery, standing nearby, sneered, "That makes sense. My brother Joseph happens to want a new car. I'll give this one to him! Consider it sisterly love for my brother."

###chapter 378 Luke's Savior

Luke was feeling pretty down. After all that effort, he was right back where he started.

Even though Isabella and Estella weren't involved this time, the families backing them were not ones he could mess with.

As Luke was mulling over his next move, he spotted someone walking in from outside, and his eyes lit up.

"Sorry, ladies, I need to step away for a moment. Mr. Williams just arrived, and I need to deliver the car he ordered," Luke said, quickly heading towards John.

'If I can't handle this, I'll find someone who can,' Luke thought, feeling a bit relieved. But he knew he couldn't just dump the problem on John directly.

Bosses hate it when their employees pass problems up the chain; it makes them look bad. Luke knew this all too well.

"Mr. Williams, your car is here. Also, Isabella and your uncle's wife are here. Do you want to go say hi?" Luke asked, testing the waters.

Luke's question was like bait, dropping Isabella and Estella's names to spark John's interest. If John took the bait, Luke could hand the problem over to him.

John glanced over to where Luke was pointing and saw Isabella and Estella.

"What are they doing here?" John asked.

Luke gave a wry smile and said, "Isabella and her friend are here to buy a car. Ms. Davis wants the latest off-road vehicle we have. But Ms. Foster and Mrs. Brown also want that car. Mrs. Brown is now arguing with Ms. Davis over it."

John frowned slightly, sensing Luke was trying to rope him in.

Luke stayed calm, leaning in a bit, waiting for John's next move.

John walked over to the four women and greeted them. Avery, Zoey, and Estella responded, but Isabella just gave him a glance and stayed silent.

John looked at Isabella, feeling a bit of tension.

"Sorry, ladies, Luke doesn't know the full story. Actually, this car is mine now and won't be sold to anyone. If you like this model, Luke can help you reserve one," John said smoothly.

If Estella wanted the car, he'd definitely give it to her since they were closer. But from what Luke had said, it seemed like Zoey was the one really interested, so John didn't need to step in.

Luke followed behind John, feeling pretty pleased. With someone powerful backing you, tough situations could get a lot easier.

Luke had thought about saying the same thing as John before, but he didn't have the guts to make that call.

Zoey was still pretty unhappy, but she knew she couldn't use this car to get at Isabella anymore.

"Sorry for the hassle. How about this: pick any car you like, and I'll give you a fifty percent discount," John said with a casual smile. That's the kind of confidence that comes with having money.

These women could afford a car, but John's offer showed he respected them as customers.

"That's awesome, John, thanks. Mrs. Brown, let's go check out that red sports car. It looks pretty sweet," Estella said, smiling at John before dragging Zoey along.

This time, Zoey didn't resist and just followed Estella.

Once Estella and Zoey were gone, Isabella took Avery to look at other cars.

John wanted to chat with Isabella, but seeing Avery with her, he decided to let them go.

Isabella and Avery walked over to another car.

Pointing at an SUV, Avery asked Isabella, "I've had my eye on this one. What do you think?"

Isabella checked out the SUV and then glanced at a white sedan nearby. "From my point of view, the white sedan looks better, but if you like the SUV, go for it."

Avery looked at the white sedan. "You're right, the sedan is really nice, but I already have too many like that. I'll go with the SUV."

Avery called Luke over to finalize the purchase.

John, standing nearby, overheard their conversation and also eyed the white sedan.

After Luke and Avery wrapped up the paperwork, John called Luke over. "When the cars are ready, give that white sedan to Isabella."

Luke was surprised for a moment but then nodded. Since the dealership belonged to John, he could give away cars as he pleased, and it wasn't Luke's concern.

When the two cars were ready, Isabella heard that John wanted to give her a car, and she frowned.

"Looks like John still has feelings for you! But he's never given you a car or any gifts before, not even on your birthday. Why so generous now?" Avery teased, curious.

Isabella snorted. "I don't care why he's giving me such an expensive gift. I'm married and can't accept his affection. I'll just return the keys."

Isabella walked back into the dealership and found John, tossing the keys to him.

"I don't need your charity. This is my final warning. I'm married and can't accept your love. You already have Bianca, so leave me alone," Isabella said coldly.

John held the keys, smiled bitterly, and shook his head. "Isabella, you've got it wrong. I'm not giving you this car to pursue you, but to show my gratitude."

###chapter 379 Thank Isabella

Isabella stopped for a second after hearing what John said. She couldn't think of any reason why John would be thanking her.

John handed the keys back to Isabella. "I appreciate you not telling my grandpa about what Bianca and I did. He's too old to handle that kind of news."

John shook his head, knowing a car wasn't enough. It couldn't make up for what Isabella had been through.

"The car is just a small thank you. So, what kind of compensation do you want?" John asked.

Without missing a beat, Isabella said, "Just like before, I want one of Bianca's kidneys!"

John's brows furrowed, and he immediately shook his head. "That's not happening. You must have heard by now. Bianca is pregnant. She's carrying my child."

"Then I don't need any compensation. Bianca almost killed me. No amount of money can erase the trauma in my heart." Isabella sneered and then walked away with the keys.

Since it was just a small token of gratitude, Isabella didn't refuse.

Isabella drove back to the company with Avery.

Once Isabella got to the company, Carol called her in.

Isabella walked into Carol's office with a smile and said, "Sometimes I feel like I'm your employee, not the CEO. What's up?"

Carol looked up and rolled her eyes. "Do you hear yourself? This company isn't my family's business. If it were, I wouldn't be as relaxed as you."

Carol handed a document to Isabella. "The celebrity who used to endorse our clothing line wants to end the contract. We need a new endorser."

Isabella opened the document and saw information about their clothing brand's philosophy and the reasons for the previous female celebrity's contract termination.

"She's quitting because she's having a baby and doesn't want to work or endorse anything?" Isabella looked at Carol, surprised.

Carol shrugged, "That's what she said. Since we don't have maternity items, it's normal for her not to endorse us. We need to shoot new ads regularly, which isn't ideal when pregnant."

Isabella set down the document and asked Carol, "Shouldn't you handle finding a new endorser? You have the authority to choose who will be the new celebrity endorser. So, why did you call me in? Is there another reason?"

Carol nodded and snapped her fingers. "You're indeed a smart CEO. I want you to sign Ms. Foster. She's very popular right now, not only starring in several big movies but also backed by a mysterious man. Her popularity can definitely boost our products."

As Carol spoke, Isabella understood. Carol wanted to leverage Isabella's relationship with John or maybe delegate to Mason to have Estella endorse their company. After all, they had such resources.

But Isabella shook her head. "I don't want to bother anyone from the Williams Family. And have you thought about the fact that Estella is close to Zoey?"

"Zoey?" Carol repeated, suddenly remembering that she was Paxton's wife.
