But given their good relationship, they might be willing to endorse some products for the Brown Family. My relationship with the Browns isn't great, and I don't want to put Ms. Foster in a difficult position."

Isabella shrugged. She had a good impression of Estella, a gentle and kind woman. If Isabella asked Mason to have Estella endorse for them, it would put her in an awkward position between friends and family, which would be embarrassing.

Carol sighed, crossed her arms, and leaned on the desk. "So, what do we do now? This celebrity doesn't have any scandals at least. Finding a new one could take days, and I'll need to dig into their background for any dirt."

Lately, too many celebrities have been exposed for outrageous actions, like tax evasion, drug use, infidelity, or involvement in sensitive political topics. These could have a significant impact on our products.

Isabella patted Carol's shoulder with a smile. "It's okay, I believe you can do it! You'll definitely find the right person!"

Carol rolled her eyes, pushed Isabella's hand away, and sat back at her desk. "You can go back to your office and play. I need to get back to work."

Carol waved her hand dismissively and lowered her head to continue working on the documents. Isabella wasn't offended and left with a smile.

Meanwhile, across the ocean, Michael was already dealing with the company's affairs.

To Michael, the trouble caused by Ryan this time wasn't significant. He could easily handle it, but the only hassle was the time-consuming process of contacting those clients, which kept him away from Isabella.

"Have you found Ryan yet?" Michael asked Jerry.

Michael had just left a client's company, the third one he had visited. He was very annoyed by the trouble caused by Ryan.

Jerry smiled bitterly and shook his head. "I'm sorry, Mr. Williams, we still haven't found Ryan."

Michael nodded calmly, his expression unreadable.

Jerry hesitated and said, "Mr. Williams, it's suspicious how our client list got leaked this time. I suspect someone inside is working for Ryan, or maybe..."

Jerry trailed off.

Michael coldly finished his sentence, "You mean someone has betrayed me, right?"

Jerry nodded.

###chapter 380 Strategy

Michael's top brass, the ones with access to customer info, have been with him forever. Jerry can't wrap his head around the idea that someone would stab Michael in the back.

Michael glanced up at Jerry, a grin spreading across his face. "So, who do you think did it?"

Jerry frowned, shaking his head. "I don't know, but I've got a few suspects. I've had them watched. I bet Ryan offered a fat paycheck to the traitor, and they couldn't resist."

"Human desires are like a snowball rolling down a hill; once it starts, it just keeps going. Is that what you're getting at?" Michael kept grinning at Jerry.

Jerry nodded but then went quiet for a bit. "Or maybe the traitor got caught in a bind, and Ryan blackmailed them. That's totally Ryan's style."

Jerry probably remembered that time Isabella strong-armed those minority shareholders into giving up their shares.

Michael stretched and got up from the couch. "Both your theories are solid, but I've got a third one."

"What other theory?" Jerry looked puzzled.

Michael walked over to the liquor cabinet and poured two glasses of wine.

"Isabella always brings work home and sometimes asks me about tricky business stuff. So, I've got a pretty good handle on what's going on at her company," Michael said with a smile.

Jerry caught on quickly. Holding his glass, he asked, "Mr. Williams, are you saying a senior manager took files home and their family spilled the beans?"

Michael nodded. "We can't rule it out. You know what to do now, right?"

Jerry nodded. "Got it. I'll put more eyes on the families of those senior managers."

Michael shook his head, still smiling. "If word gets out, it'll drive a wedge between us and the other senior managers. Ryan might be banking on that."

Jerry hesitated, a cold sweat breaking out on his back. If he went through with his plan, he might catch the mole, but the other senior managers would think Michael was threatening their families, causing a rift and maybe even pushing them towards Ryan.

Jerry looked at Michael, wanting to ask what to do next.

But Michael's calm gaze made Jerry's heart race. He knew Michael was testing him.

Frowning, Jerry thought for a moment, then his eyes lit up. "Tracking takes too long. Maybe we should go for a simpler approach, like direct questioning. I'll get the best psychologist to grill those senior managers."

Michael nodded, pleased. "Sounds like a plan. Go for it."

Jerry downed his wine and left the office.

After Jerry left, Michael sipped his wine and let out a soft sigh. He was really hoping it was the third scenario he mentioned, rather than the first two Jerry brought up.

He had a soft spot for these long-time employees who had been with him through thick and thin. The last thing he wanted was to find a traitor among them.

After spending nearly a week abroad, Michael finally wrapped up those pesky matters.

After sealing the deal with the last client, Michael booked a flight home that night. He couldn't wait to see Isabella.

As soon as Michael got in the car, Jerry hit him with some news.

"Mr. Williams, after a week of digging, we've got our prime suspect." Jerry handed a document to Michael.

Michael raised an eyebrow as he looked at the document. "Anson and his wife? They've been married for less than a year, right?"

Michael remembered Anson Church, the youngest and most promising employee.

Anson was a hardworking guy. Thanks to Michael's promotion, Anson had always been loyal and would never betray the company. Plus, he had a clean record, so no one could have any dirt on him.

When Jerry handed over the info about Anson's wife, Michael knew she had to be the problem.

Jerry nodded. "Yeah, Anson was too busy with work to get married until he met his wife at a banquet, and then they tied the knot. You even went to his wedding."

Michael nodded, signaling Jerry to go on. "I consulted the best psychologist, Mr. Rojas. We questioned different senior managers. When we asked Mr. Church about bringing work files home, he hesitated for a moment and then claimed he left the files at the office that night. Mr. Rojas picked up on that hesitation." Jerry recounted the interrogation process.

Michael listened calmly and finally sighed. "Anson has always been all about his work. Now that he finally has a woman he loves deeply, he wouldn't give that up easily. Maybe he's still holding out hope and wants to ask his wife if she did anything to harm the company."

Jerry asked seriously, "Should we punish Anson and his wife?"

Michael shook his head. "Don't worry about Anson betraying us. With his character, he wouldn't do such a thing. Once he finds out his wife betrayed him, he'll probably resign and leave this profession."

Michael rubbed his forehead and then smiled. "Never thought I'd have to worry about my employees' marriages as a boss."

Michael shook his head with a smile, then his expression turned serious. "Go find Anson and tell him I don't blame him for this. Ryan will likely use this to threaten Anson with his wife as leverage. That sneaky fox likes to hide in his den, so I need someone to go in and flush him out."

Jerry got it. Anson would be the perfect pawn to deal with Ryan.

###chapter 381 You Can Be a Spokesperson

After making plans, Michael and Jerry hopped on the plane back home.

Later that night, Isabella got home and noticed the lights were on, which made her a bit uneasy.

She cautiously stepped inside, gripping a baseball bat she grabbed from behind the door, only to see Michael coming out of the kitchen with a plate in his hand.

"Planning to whack me with that bat?" Michael asked, grinning.

Isabella rolled her eyes. "Why didn't you tell me you were coming back today? I thought there was a burglar in the house."

She dropped the bat on the floor and walked over to hug Michael.

With one hand holding the plate and the other ruffling Isabella's hair, Michael kissed her on the forehead.

"When you think there's a thief in the house, the first thing you should do is call security, not charge in with a bat, got it?" Michael said, sounding a bit scolding.

Nodding in his arms, Isabella realized how much she had missed him. Even though they talked on the phone sometimes, it just wasn't the same.

"The weather's nice today. I hope you bring me some good news," Bianca said, sitting down and popping a piece of candy into her mouth.

Lying on the lounger, the sunlight warming her face, Bianca felt very comfortable.

After hearing Daphne's words, Bianca nodded lightly.

"Oh, by the way, how's Isabella's company doing?" Bianca asked with a smile.

###chapter 382 Bianca's Threat

Daphne's face was a bit tight. John had moved her over to Bianca's team, and she was well aware of the beef between Bianca and Isabella. She'd also heard that John didn't want Bianca to keep butting heads with Isabella.

Bianca could read Daphne's mind from her hesitant look.

With a slight smile, Bianca asked, "Ms. Rose, do you know why I picked you when John suggested you as my assistant?"

Daphne shook her head, honestly clueless.

When John was picking an assistant for Bianca, he showed her a bunch of resumes. Bianca took her time and eventually chose Daphne. John was confused since Daphne's resume wasn't anything special.

Bianca smiled again and said, "You should know there were plenty of candidates with fancy degrees, while you're just a girl from the sticks. Even though you work hard and have some recommendations, have you ever thought that without me, your whole career would be just another office job, sharing a cheap apartment, and maybe not even affording the handbags you like?"

Daphne swallowed hard, knowing Bianca was right. In this world, hard work alone doesn't cut it without connections and a bit of luck.

Seeing Daphne's reaction, Bianca continued with a smile, "I know what you're worried about, and you might have even thought about telling John what I asked you. But then what? Do you think he'll thank you? Or give you a promotion?"

Daphne's face went pale; she had indeed thought about it.

Bianca walked over to Daphne and whispered in her ear, "Even if you tell John, what difference will it make? I'm his beloved, carrying his child. He won't blame me. But if you cross me, what do you think will happen to you?"

Daphne's legs started to shake.

"Alright, don't freak out. I'm not a monster." Bianca laughed, covering her mouth, and then sat back down.

"I asked you about my sister not to target her. She's my competitor now, and we need to take market share from her. It's just business." Bianca smiled faintly.

Daphne felt a bit relieved hearing that. At least Bianca's reasons seemed legit.

"The spokesperson for Isabella's company has ended their contract, and they're looking for a new one. Rumor has it they want to get Ms. Foster as their new spokesperson," Daphne said.

Bianca tapped her fingers on the table. She knew Estella. If Bianca ended up marrying John, Estella would be her aunt.

Bianca asked Daphne to dig up some info on Estella.

After hearing what Daphne found, Bianca smiled and said, "Looks like Estella would be perfect as our spokesperson."Daphne was caught off guard. Wasn't this all about competing with Isabella for a spokesperson? And yet, Bianca claimed it wasn't about targeting Isabella.

For now, Daphne decided not to tell John about this. After all, the spokesperson decision wasn't hers to make. Even if John got upset, he'd go to Bianca, not her.

###chapter 388 Movie Script

###chapter 389 Sky-High Endorsement Fee

###chapter 395 Meeting and Confession

The bodyguard stayed outside while Isabella grabbed a seat by the window. Not long after, Avery and Joseph walked in.

Isabella's eyes widened a bit when she saw Joseph, but she quickly masked her surprise.

"Hey, Avery, Joseph, good afternoon," Isabella greeted them.

"Hey there, Isabella, or should I say the endorsement queen now," Avery teased as she sat down.

Isabella cringed a little. "Please, don't call me that. It's super embarrassing."

"I think it fits you perfectly. You're stunning and graceful, just like a top model. Having you as the face of the company is a genius move," Joseph gushed.

Suddenly, Joseph winced as Avery stepped on his foot under the table.

Avery shot him a look that said it all. Years of friendship had made their silent communication flawless. Joseph got the message loud and clear.

'Shut up, you idiot! Can't you see you're making her uncomfortable?' Avery's eyes screamed.

Joseph clammed up immediately.

Isabella fiddled with her coffee cup, a telltale sign she was feeling awkward.

"Avery, you didn't just come here to call me a goddess, did you?" Isabella smiled, trying to steer the conversation elsewhere.

Avery glanced at Joseph, feeling a bit awkward. She was just the go-between; Joseph had the real reason for the meet.

"My sister's here to talk business," Joseph jumped in smoothly, breaking the tension. "With you being a CEO and her having a bunch of companies, there might be some room for collaboration."

Isabella paused, not expecting a business pitch. She thought about Avery's companies and frowned a bit.

"The three companies I run don't really overlap with yours, and I don't see any obvious opportunities for collaboration," Isabella said, puzzled.

Isabella's businesses were in fashion, food and beverage, and software development. Avery's were all about real estate, so there didn't seem to be any common ground.

Avery switched gears. "I'm thinking about starting a new company, but I'm still figuring out the details. I'm leaning towards the food and beverage industry, maybe opening a unique restaurant. I'd love to get your take on it."

Isabella thought for a moment. Right now, her focus was on fashion, food and beverage, and cosmetics. The two companies she inherited from Jasper were barely staying afloat. Despite some financial backing, they were just breaking even, no profits in sight.

Isabella planned to fully develop her fashion business before using the profits to expand the other two companies.

"Sorry, Avery. It's not that I don't want to help, but my food and beverage business isn't exactly booming. I don't have much experience in that area," Isabella said with a rueful smile.

Avery nodded, brushing it off. "No worries, I get that your focus isn't on food and beverage right now. I just wanted to throw it out there. Maybe we can team up in the future when you're ready."

As Avery finished talking, she felt something nudge her foot. Looking down, she realized it was Joseph's foot.

Catching her eye, Joseph gave her a subtle look that said it was time for her to leave - he wanted to talk to Isabella alone.

"Isabella, why don't you stay and chat with Joseph?" Avery rolled her eyes. "I need to hit the restroom."

With that, she got up and walked away.

After Avery left, Joseph let out a sigh of relief, but Isabella felt a bit uneasy.

Isabella wasn't naive; if Avery really wanted to discuss business, she wouldn't have brought Joseph along.

"Isabella, there's something I need to tell you," Joseph said earnestly.

Isabella looked at Joseph quietly. Since she couldn't avoid it, she decided to be straightforward.

She reached into her bag and pulled out a ring.

Not the one Mason gave her, but the pink diamond ring from Michael.

Because this ring was so precious, Isabella rarely wore it, saving it for special occasions and public events.

When Joseph saw Isabella put the ring on her finger, he seemed to understand, but the words he wanted to say got stuck in his throat.

"Joseph, are you saying you like me?" Isabella asked calmly.

Joseph felt like his heart was being squeezed, it was really uncomfortable.

"If I say yes, would you believe me?" Joseph asked with a pained smile.

Isabella nodded. "I believe you. Look into my eyes, I've seen it before."

Joseph was taken aback for a moment but then got a bit hopeful. "Where did you see it?"

Joseph thought Isabella was talking about when they first met.

But what Isabella said next made Joseph feel a chill.

"I saw it in my husband's eyes. Every time he looked at me, it was the same way you look at me, but his love was stronger," Isabella said calmly.

Joseph's hands trembled as he struggled to speak. "You know what? I've had feelings for you since we were kids. Finding out about your engagement to John while I was away... it crushed me."

###chapter 396 Refusal

Joseph finally spilled the beans about his crush on Isabella.

He'd been keeping this secret locked up for way too long. Sometimes, he wondered if it was all just a figment of his imagination.

His dad shipped him off abroad when he was just a kid, so he missed out on getting close to Isabella. When he heard she was getting engaged to John, he drowned his sorrows on the side of the road.

At first, Joseph had zero plans to come back home because he couldn't stand the thought of seeing Isabella and John tie the knot. But then he got wind that Isabella wanted to call off the wedding.

Joseph was over the moon when he heard the news. He literally jumped up and did a couple of backflips. But when he found out she called it off because she was already married, he crashed back down to earth.

In that moment, it felt like his whole world went dark. But then rumors started flying that Isabella's so-called husband was a no-show, and people began to think she made up the marriage just to ditch John. Turns out, she wasn't married at all.

With a mix of hope and doubt, Joseph hopped on a plane back home. Married or not, he was dead set on going after his love. He figured his charm could win her over.

But boy, was he wrong.

Joseph totally underestimated the bond between Isabella and Michael.

"I don't get why you're so upset. If I hurt you, I'm sorry, but I don't see what I did wrong," Isabella said with a calm shrug.

"Do I really have no shot?" Joseph suddenly grabbed her hand, his eyes pleading.

Isabella frowned and tried to pull her hand away, but Joseph's grip was firm. She tried a couple more times but couldn't break free.

She sighed, "Can you let go? I only see you as a friend. I've never felt that way about you."

Joseph's lips quivered as he searched her eyes for any sign she was lying, but all he saw was calm sincerity.

Taking a deep breath, he slowly let go of her hand. "I'm sorry, I got carried away."

Isabella shook her head, rubbing her wrist. "It's okay. Emotions can make us do crazy things. We can't be a couple, but we can still be friends."

Joseph shook his head. "I can't just be your friend, not with how I feel about you. Maybe things will change someday, for you or for me. But if your marriage ever falls apart... just know I'll be here, waiting like a fool for my chance."

A flicker of annoyance crossed Isabella's face at his words, feeling like he was jinxing her marriage to Michael.

"Alright, Joseph, your sister's been in the bathroom forever. You should go check on her. I've got stuff to do at the office," Isabella said, getting up and leaving the coffee shop.

Joseph sat there quietly for a long time.

Until a hand landed on his shoulder, and Avery sat down next to him.

"My poor little brother, have you given up now?" Avery asked.

Joseph glanced at Avery, then got up and walked out of the coffee shop without a word.

Avery watched him leave and sighed. "I shouldn't have agreed to this. Now he's all upset, and Isabella's probably mad too. She might even be pissed at me. I need to explain things to her, or our friendship's toast."

Avery sighed again and started dialing Isabella's number to apologize.

Isabella, already in her car, saw Avery's call. She hesitated for a moment before picking up.

"Hey, Isabella. I'm really sorry. As his sister, I had to look out for Joseph's feelings. But please believe me, I didn't encourage him to go after you or mess with your marriage. He just wanted some closure, so I helped set up the meeting," Avery explained.

Isabella chuckled. "I believe you. It's just that my charm is too irresistible, making your brother fall head over heels. It's a shame I met my husband first. If Joseph had come along earlier, who knows what might've happened."

Avery gave a wry smile and shook her head. "It's all fate, something Joseph can't fight. Anyway, I'll apologize in person next time we meet. And don't worry, he won't be tagging along."

After expressing her regret, Avery hung up.

Isabella looked at her phone and sighed softly. She had been a bit annoyed with Avery, but the quick call to explain things made her forgive her friend.

Just like Avery said, being a sister sometimes means making tough calls.

Isabella glanced out the window and spotted a familiar figure.

"Bianca? Am I seeing things?" Isabella muttered, watching the figure disappear down the street.

Little did Isabella know, Bianca had already set her sights on causing more trouble for her.

In fact, Bianca was just out shopping to blow off some steam. But when she glanced through the mall window, she saw the drama unfold at the coffee shop.

Bianca put away her phone, which now held a video of Joseph holding Isabella's hand.

"Isabella, aren't you supposed to be a role model? I want everyone to see a married woman like you getting cozy with another guy, betraying your marriage, your husband, and your love. Let's see how long your endorsements last when everyone despises you," Bianca sneered.

Bianca also noticed Avery in the video and knew there was more to the story. But that didn't matter.

All Bianca needed to do was edit the video, post it online, and let the internet do the rest.

After filming, Bianca left the mall and headed to the coffee shop.

Standing at the door, she called her two bodyguards to go inside and get the surveillance footage.

"This time, you won't have a chance to explain," Bianca said coldly.

###chapter 397 Online Public Opinion

As Isabella was about to head out from work, she heard the rapid clacking of high heels echoing down the hallway.

She frowned and glanced at the office door. Before long, there was a loud, urgent knock.

"Come in," Isabella called out, and Carol burst in.

"Ms. Taylor, do you know you've been exposed? Were you meeting a guy at a café today?" Carol blurted out as soon as she stepped in.

Isabella was caught off guard. "Are you talking about Joseph?"

Carol paused, then snapped, "You actually went on a date with a guy? Do you realize this is all over the internet? It's going to seriously affect our products."

Isabella's brow furrowed as she quickly pulled out her phone to check the news. Soon enough, she found a video making the rounds online.

In the clip, Joseph was holding Isabella's hand, and it looked like they were talking, but there was no sound.

The video was short, showing Joseph holding Isabella's hand and then letting go, but it was clear to everyone that there was a loving look in his eyes.

Given Isabella's popularity, the comments below the video were numerous.

Many were shocked, accusing Isabella of having an affair.

Some made snide remarks, suggesting that once people had money, they engaged in extramarital affairs regardless of gender.

Others were stunned that the man in the video was Joseph.

Some recognized Joseph as a well-known heir of one of the four major families, leading to wild speculation about the relationships between John, Joseph, and Isabella.

"Look at the way he's holding your hand. Oh my, you didn't really cheat, did you?" Carol asked nervously.

Isabella shook her head. "How could I betray my husband? This is clearly someone targeting me. I wasn't alone with Joseph; we were with his sister Avery."

"Then why was Joseph holding your hand?" Carol asked.

Isabella shrugged. "He wanted to confess to me, but I turned him down."

Carol smirked. "Wow, you really are something. You even managed to catch the eye of the second heir of one of the four major families."

Isabella spread her hands helplessly. "There's no point in mocking me now. They must have the full video, probably with Avery in it, but they haven't released it. They're clearly targeting me."

"Who could it be?" Carol asked.

Isabella furrowed her brow, thinking hard, and suddenly remembered seeing someone who looked like Bianca that day.

"It might be Bianca. I think I saw her that day, but Avery called me over, so it must have been a chance encounter." Isabella sighed, feeling like she was cursed. It seemed like the universe didn't want her to have an easy time.

Carol furrowed her brow. "We should send someone to that café now; maybe we can find some surveillance footage to clear your name."

Isabella shook her head. "It's too late. Bianca's not dumb; she probably already got her hands on the footage."

Isabella was stumped. "I guess I can call Joseph and ask him to clear things up. But he might not agree, considering I turned him down."

"Well, it's worth a shot. Hurry up and call him. I want to hear what he has to say," Carol urged.

Isabella pulled out her phone and dialed Joseph's number, but it just kept ringing.

"What's going on? Why isn't he picking up?" Isabella frowned and double-checked the number.

"Maybe he's upset because you rejected him and blocked your number? Try calling from my phone," Carol suggested, handing her phone to Isabella.

Isabella took Carol's phone, dialed Joseph's number again, but still no answer.

"Maybe he's drunk and can't hear his phone. People do that when they're emotionally wrecked," Carol said, sounding a bit defeated.

"Forget it, I'll call Avery and see if she can help," Isabella sighed and dialed Avery.

Avery picked up quickly.

"What's up, Isabella? What's going on?" Avery asked, sounding curious.

Isabella quickly filled her in on the situation.

"I'm sorry, Isabella, my brother might really be drunk. When I called him, he didn't answer, and the last time I reached him, he seemed to be at a bar," Avery explained with a wry smile.

Feeling frustrated, Isabella scratched her head. "Can you help me release a statement to prove I didn't cheat?"

Avery nodded. "Sure, I'll do that now, but will the public believe it?"

"Doing something is better than nothing," Isabella sighed and hung up.

After hanging up, Avery turned to Joseph, who was sitting silently.

"What are you doing? Isabella's in trouble because of you, do you get that?" Avery glared at him angrily.

In reality, Joseph hadn't gone to a bar; he had been at home the whole time. Avery had lied again, and it made her feel a bit guilty.

"Do you think this misunderstanding might cause a rift between Isabella and her husband, giving me a chance?" Joseph's eyes flashed with a hint of madness as he looked at Avery expectantly.

Avery's response was a slap across his face.

###chapter 398 Emotional Lunatic

Avery smacked Joseph right across the face.

"You're acting crazy! I'm not gonna help you wreck someone's marriage. Anyone who does that deserves to burn in hell," Avery snapped before storming off.

Even though Avery posted proof on social media that she was at the café that day, people still swarmed her account, asking why her brother was holding Isabella's hand with such a loving look in his eyes.

Avery had no clue how to respond to all the questions.

After all, Joseph was the face of the family. It was super embarrassing for the heir to be chasing after someone else's wife and getting turned down.

"What am I supposed to say? Should I tell them Joseph is practicing for an acting gig with Isabella?" Avery muttered, scratching her head in frustration. The idea was ridiculous.

The café owner couldn't say no to Bianca.

But Michael didn't buy it. He quickly figured out it was all Joseph's doing.

Michael immediately called Jerry.

"Find out where Joseph is right now and let me know," Michael said calmly.

Jerry, who answered the phone, shivered. He knew Michael well, and the calmer he sounded, the angrier he was. Michael was like a volcano about to blow. Jerry knew Joseph was in deep trouble.

Bianca, scrolling through the online comments, felt pretty pleased with herself. Most of the comments were trashing Isabella. It was clear that if Isabella couldn't come up with evidence, the products she endorsed would definitely take a hit.

"If the movie company doesn't hire you as a screenwriter, it's their loss," Michael said, rolling his eyes.

Isabella pouted. "Really? Are you becoming cunning just for me?"

Michael didn't want to argue and nodded, rolling his eyes again. "Okay, dear. You're right. I'm a cunning man using my schemes to win back your love."

"I knew it, you sly man," Isabella joked, pinching his nose.

Michael swatted her hand away. "Stop pinching my nose, I'll turn into Pinocchio."

"Even if you were a puppet, I'd still love you," Isabella said, smiling.

Michael smirked. "If I were really Pinocchio, I'm afraid you'd ride on my face," he said, looking at her.

"Why?" Isabella asked, puzzled.

Michael's smile turned mischievous. "Because Pinocchio's nose would keep growing and shrinking with lies and truths."

Isabella tilted her head, quickly catching on. Her face turned red instantly.

"You're always thinking dirty," she said, annoyed, picking up a spoon and lightly tapping him on the head.

Michael rubbed his forehead, waving his hand with a smile. "Alright, dear, I was just joking. Let's talk about the company. How did that thing you were dealing with go?"

Isabella put down the spoon, looking a bit helpless. "Avery testified for me, but it didn't help much because she couldn't explain why Joseph was holding my hand. As the heir, they wouldn't want such a shameful incident publicized."

"So Joseph is keeping quiet now, right?" Michael asked calmly.

"Yeah, how could he possibly clarify this to the media?" Isabella nodded helplessly, a piece of meat skewered on her fork, but she had lost her appetite.

At that moment, Michael's phone lit up with a message from Jerry, revealing Joseph's location.

###chapter 399 Beating Up the Love Rival

Joseph was slumped over the bar, drowning his sorrows and knocking back drinks like there was no tomorrow.

###chapter 400 Online Evidence

Isabella's husband has always been a mystery to the four major families. Despite all their efforts, they couldn't dig up any info. So, how on earth did Joseph manage to find out?

"Isabella is loyal to love; she has never betrayed it. Listen to how she rejected that guy! 'The love in my husband's eyes is even more intense than yours!' Oh my, it's so touching!"

###chapter 401 Win-Win Cooperation

Bianca's latest stunt set the internet on fire with mockery.

"If anyone's gunning for Isabella, it's gotta be her sister."

"Here we go again, and of course, it's Bianca. Not even shocked."

"Bianca's tricks are so obvious. Whenever something goes down with Isabella, you can bet she's the one pulling the strings!"

Some folks even turned Isabella and Bianca into cartoon characters with a scoreboard in the middle. It reads 4:0, meaning Bianca's lost four times.

"Damn bastards! I'll kill everyone who trashes me online! These disgusting bugs, I'll kill them all!" Bianca screamed, throwing everything on the table to the floor.
