"Stop! Don't call John. That'll just piss me off more. I'll handle my own emotions," Bianca snapped, stopping the bodyguard.

If she made that call, John would rush over, and then she'd be locked up again. She might even get banned from the internet.

Bianca had convinced John to let her have some personal space-like the bedroom and the office-where the bodyguards didn't have to shadow her every move.

This was the biggest concession John had made, as Bianca had let him down time and time again.

The two bodyguards exchanged glances and nodded. Bianca sat down, massaging her forehead, taking deep breaths, and slowly calming down.

Seeing her relax, the bodyguards left the office.

Bianca lay back in her chair, staring at the ceiling. "I never expected there'd be a spy. If I'd known, I would've checked the surveillance footage first."

She felt a pang of regret; she'd made some mistakes.

Suddenly, an idea hit her, and her eyes lit up.

"How foolish of me," Bianca muttered, her eyes brightening with realization. "I can't take on Isabella alone - I need allies. And Joseph would be perfect." She remembered she'd need to track down his contact info first.

Bianca hit up some old friends to track down Joseph's number. It didn't take long before she got a reply.

She looked at the number and dialed it right away, ready with her pitch.

Joseph had just left the hospital and was about to head home when his phone rang.

Sitting in the back seat, he signaled the driver to start driving and glanced at the unfamiliar number. Curious, he answered.

"Hello, who is this?" Joseph asked.

Bianca smiled slightly. "Joseph, you might've heard of me. I'm Bianca."

As soon as she said her name, Joseph hung up.

Bianca's smile vanished. She stared at the screen in disbelief, then her face twisted with anger.

"Damn Joseph, how dare he hang up on me. He'll never win Isabella's approval!" she fumed.

She was so mad she almost threw her phone, but she knew the noise would bring the guards running, and if John showed up, things would get even worse.

Bianca took a deep breath and called Joseph again.

Seeing the same number, Joseph frowned. He regretted not blocking it earlier.

After a moment's hesitation, he answered. "Bianca, I have nothing to say to you. Why are you calling?"

Bianca's voice turned icy. "I know you like Isabella. I can help you get her."

Joseph laughed. "You help me? With your 4:0 track record?"

Bianca nearly crushed her phone. She could feel the sarcasm dripping from his words.

"Enough, Joseph. You know my status. I understand Isabella better than you do! With my help, you can easily get rid of her husband and win her heart," she said confidently.

Joseph was silent for a moment. "Honestly, if I can't have her, I'd rather let go. At least I can still be friends with her. But if I team up with you, she might hate me."

Bianca sneered. "Do you really think you can still be friends with her now? If you wanted to be her friend, why didn't you stand up for her when she was falsely accused?"

Joseph rubbed his forehead, a look of regret on his face. "That was my bad. After we left the café yesterday, I ended up drinking too much, and by the time I sobered up, it was too late to sort things out. Anyway, let's not dwell on that. What's your plan to help me?"

Hearing that Joseph seemed interested, Bianca's face lit up. "You need to fix your image in her eyes. I'll set up a situation where Isabella needs saving, and you can swoop in like a hero. If you get a little hurt in the process, even better. She'll forgive you, and you'll have more to bond over."

###chapter 402 Betrayed

Bianca kept chatting away on the phone, laying out her plan.

Joseph's face was dripping with sarcasm.

Wasn't this just another 'hero saves the damsel' story? Total cliché, right out of every movie and TV show when a guy's trying to win over a girl.

Bianca went on for a solid ten minutes, detailing how to deal with Isabella's bodyguards, when Joseph should make his move, and even suggesting he might want to fake some injuries for effect.

"You know, you should really consider being a screenwriter. You'd be great at it," Joseph said, sounding sincere.

"No way! That job's so boring! Those poor writers have no say, they just do whatever the money people tell them to. All their dreams get crushed by cash. Anyway, since you're in, let's figure out when to pull this off," Bianca said, all smug.

But Joseph wasn't having it.

"Nope, I'm out. I don't want to mess with Isabella anymore. She's happy with her husband. I'm not gonna keep wrecking their marriage; that's just cruel," Joseph said, calm as ever.

Bianca was baffled, "Don't you like Isabella? Why are you bailing now? Do guys give up on girls that easily?"

Joseph teased, "If John heard that, he'd be pretty bummed."

Bianca sneered, "You think I'm dumb enough to let him find out? And by the way, when I say guys, I don't mean John."

Joseph said casually, "Now that you mention it, I'm curious about John's reaction. Maybe I'll let him hear our call. See if he's the kind of guy you think he is."

Bianca froze for a second, then jumped up, shouting, "What did you say? You recorded our call? What are you up to?"

Joseph laughed like he'd just thought of the funniest joke, his body shaking. "I just had a prank idea. You wanted to get closer to Isabella with this hero act, but I've got a better plan."

Bianca didn't want to hear about this "better plan"; it definitely involved her.

Joseph ignored her silence and grinned, "If I give this recording to Isabella or post it online, we'd have a common enemy. That could really improve our relationship. At least we could be friends. And all you have to do is make a little sacrifice."

Joseph's words made Bianca shake with rage.

"You jerk! What's wrong with you? What's so special about Isabella that you'd help her like this?" Bianca screamed.

Joseph said coolly, "Because Isabella's my friend, and I can't stand women like you. Plus, I hate being told what to do. You're not worth it."

With that, Joseph hung up.

Bianca lost it. She threw her phone to the ground, smashing it to pieces.

She kept screaming in the office, her voice echoing down the hallway.

The office door flew open, and two female bodyguards rushed in. They relaxed a bit when they saw Bianca wasn't in any immediate danger. One of them quickly called John.

"Mr. Williams, you need to come here. Ms. Taylor is really upset," one of the bodyguards said into the phone, then exchanged a look with her partner and moved closer to Bianca.

"Ms. Taylor, please calm down. It's not good for the baby," one of the bodyguards said, trying to stay calm.

"Get out! I don't need you telling me what to do," Bianca snapped, glaring at her.

The bodyguard didn't flinch. She just put the phone on speaker. John's voice came through loud and clear.

"Bianca, have you had enough? Go with the bodyguards to the hospital for a check-up. I'm on my way," John said before hanging up.

Bianca's face went pale. She knew John must be furious and disappointed. The days ahead weren't looking too good for her.

Meanwhile, Joseph looked at the recorded audio file on his phone, a faint smile playing on his lips.

"Should I send this to Isabella, or just post it online?" Joseph mused, tilting his head. After a moment, he decided to post it online.

He wasn't sure if Isabella had blocked him, and he didn't want to risk the message not getting through.

Actually, Isabella hadn't blocked Joseph. They had some history, and because of Avery, Isabella didn't want things to get too messy.

Joseph posted the recording of his call with Bianca on his social media, adding a caption: [Not everyone is cut out to work with me.]

He wasn't concerned about ticking off Bianca or John. His family might not hold as much power as John's, but they didn't need to meddle in every little thing. Young people should handle their own problems.

As soon as Joseph posted the recording, it blew up online. The drama was still hot news.

"Bianca just can't stay out of trouble. First a scandal, now plotting against Isabella?"

"Why does Bianca hate Isabella so much? She's pregnant with John's kid and has a high status. What's her beef with Isabella?"

"There must be some bad blood between them. Isabella must've done something to piss Bianca off."

The internet was buzzing with arguments. The news even reached the Olympic Committee.

###chapter 403 The Irritated Man

John had a big meeting today with a VIP client.

Garry Britton, a top dog at the Olympic Committee, was the guy John needed to talk to about a potential partnership.

John, being the savvy businessman he is, knew the Olympics were a goldmine for exposure and ad revenue.

"Mr. Britton, I want to talk to you about my girlfriend's designs for the Olympic uniforms. I really hope you can help us out. The designers she's collaborating with are top-notch and can truly make our athletes stand out at the opening ceremony," John said, his confidence shining through.

There's no such thing as true fairness in this world. John has status, power, and influence-so why should he compete on equal footing with anyone else?

Only the weak beg for fairness because it's their only shot. The strong don't need to, and it would be dumb if they did.

Garry was toying with an antique John had gifted him, something from the 19th century.

It was obvious Garry was into it.

Just as Garry was about to agree, someone walked in and whispered something to him.

Garry's face changed, and he looked at John with a hint of annoyance.

John had a bad feeling, sensing that whatever was coming next involved him.

"I get it, you can leave now," Garry waved off his subordinate.

Turning to John, Garry said, "Mr. Williams, we're good friends. Normally, I'd help out a friend. But this time, it's tricky."

Garry put the antique on the table, signaling John to take it back.

John glanced at it but didn't pick it up. Instead, he smiled and asked, "Mr. Britton, since we're friends, you should tell me what made you misunderstand me."

Garry sighed, shook his head, and said, "Mr. Williams, if you have time, you should go and talk to your girlfriend."

John frowned. He knew Garry was talking about Bianca.

Feeling uneasy, John pulled out his phone and searched for news about Bianca. He found out she had been caught taking unauthorized photos.

John's face darkened.

The Olympics are a huge deal, and everyone involved needs to uphold a positive image. The company designing the athletes' outfits can't afford any scandals. Bianca's actions were like giving their competitors a loaded gun. The Olympic Committee would definitely take this seriously.

Forcing a smile, John said, "Mr. Britton, those photos only show my girlfriend using her phone in the building across the street. They don't prove she was taking unauthorized photos."

John felt more and more embarrassed, lying to cover for Bianca, convinced she was behind the whole mess.

Garry looked John straight in the eye and said, "Mr. Williams, this isn't a joke. The public will ultimately decide how to handle this. If I stick with your girlfriend's designs, it could cost me my job."

Garry's tone made it clear that Bianca's designs were out of the running for the Olympics.

John's face grew darker. The only solution he could think of was to get the PR team to handle the Bianca situation fast. Maybe then they could save face and get her designs back in the game.

Just then, John's phone rang. It was his female bodyguard.

Worried about Bianca, John answered immediately.

After hearing what the bodyguard had to say, John's expression turned even grimmer.

"Bianca, get to the hospital right now. I'll be there soon," John said before hanging up.

As soon as he did, Garry's subordinate walked in again.

The subordinate was about to whisper something to Garry, but Garry, knowing it was about John, told him to speak up.

"Joseph Davis, the heir of the Davis Family, just posted a phone call recording on social media. It's a conversation between him and Bianca. In it, Bianca conspires with Joseph to sabotage Isabella, trying to get her to divorce and marry him instead. But..." Before the subordinate could finish, John cut him off.

"That's enough. I get it," John said, standing up and looking at Garry.

"I'm really sorry, Mr. Britton. Because of my girlfriend's stupidity, I no longer want her involved in this design competition," John said, pointing to the artifact on the table.

"This artifact was a gift to a friend. You keep it. We still have other business to discuss," John said, then turned and walked out of Garry's office.

Garry shrugged, waved for his subordinate to escort John out, then carefully picked up the artifact, examining it.

John was right. Despite Bianca's foolishness, John himself wasn't tainted by it, and there was still potential for them to work together.

"A successful man shouldn't have a foolish woman dragging him down," Garry sighed.

Meanwhile, at Bianca's company, the designers who had been excited about their Olympic designs were furious after seeing the reports about Bianca on social media.

"Damn it, we didn't sign up for this embarrassment!"

"The company's facing a scandal right after starting! Will our designs even sell now?"

"We never should've taken John's offer. Now it's all ruined."

"Bianca clearly isn't cut out for business. I'm quitting, what about you?"

"Count me in, I'm out too. No point sticking around here."

The designers collectively handed in their resignations and walked out of Bianca's company.

###chapter 404 Happy Isabella

The designers bailed on Bianca's company. They were brought in by Bianca, using John's name. They weren't too worried about pissing off John, figuring they'd land on their feet somewhere else.

Meanwhile, after her hospital check-up, Bianca found out her baby was fine despite her stress. She felt a bit better, but then the dread set in, knowing John would be furious. And boy, was he mad. When he saw Bianca, his face was like a thundercloud.

"Sweetheart, I'm sorry. I just lose it every time I see Isabella," Bianca said, looking down, sounding really sorry.

John's voice was icy. "Starting tomorrow, no phone or smart devices for you. The radiation isn't good for the baby. Grab some books if you're bored, but don't cause me any more trouble."

John was barely keeping his cool, trying not to blow up right then and there.

Tears filled Bianca's eyes as she looked up at him. "I know I messed up. I'll take the company's stuff seriously from now on, and I won't go against Isabella again."

John waved her off. "No need to say more. Your company's done. Because of what you did, the Olympic Committee rejected all your entries. Even my other Olympic-related businesses are affected. It's gonna cost a lot to fix."

Bianca was shocked. She hadn't realized how bad things had gotten.

"I'm so sorry, honey. I didn't think it would get this bad. I didn't think it through," Bianca said, holding John's hand, her voice full of regret.

"Please don't let my company go under. I really want to do something for you," she pleaded, looking at John.

John's grip on her was tightening, and she couldn't afford to lose her last bit of leverage against Isabella.

John looked at her coldly, and just then, Daphne burst into the hospital room.

"Mr. Williams, this is the resignation report from the design department," Daphne said, holding a stack of papers, looking a bit awkward. She wanted to hand them to John but hesitated.

Bianca glared at Daphne. "Can't you see we're in the middle of something? If the design department wants to quit, let them."

Daphne smirked and reluctantly handed the papers to John. "It's a collective resignation. They're really disappointed with Ms. Taylor."

"What? Are they nuts?" Bianca snatched the papers and looked through them, confirming the whole design team had quit.

Bianca shook with anger.

John shot a disappointed glance at Bianca before handing the documents back to Daphne. "Let those designers know that if they stick around, I'll give them a 50% raise. And Bianca, you're off the hook from all your duties starting today."

Daphne nodded and quickly left the room, sensing the tension and not wanting to stick around.

Bianca sat on the hospital bed, feeling utterly defeated.

"I don't get it. You have everything you need and a higher status. Why do you keep going after Isabella? Am I not enough for you?" John asked, his voice full of frustration.

Bianca closed her eyes, tears streaming down her face.

"You don't get it. You're the only heir, always the favorite of your grandfather. But I've never felt that way. My grandpa only has eyes for Isabella. She's always been the star, and I've been stuck in her shadow. We're both family, so why does she get all the love?" Bianca's eyes were red as she stared at John.

"So this is all about jealousy? You're jealous she's more popular?" John sighed deeply.

Bianca stood up, glaring at John. "Shouldn't I be angry? We love each other, but your grandpa wants you to marry Isabella! Has he ever thought about our feelings? Why does my grandpa favor Isabella over me? And why does your grandfather prefer her too?"

Bianca shouted, grabbing John's clothes and shaking him.

John fell silent. "I'm sorry. If I had told my grandfather earlier, maybe he wouldn't have arranged the engagement with Isabella."

"As the heir, there are things you can't just do because you want to." Bianca wiped her tears, a bitter smile on her face.

"I don't see any point in living. Maybe I'm just here to get back at Isabella." Bianca sneered, shrugged, and walked out of the room.

John stood quietly, facing the door, and sighed after a long time.

Meanwhile, Isabella was working in her office when Carol burst in.

"Isabella, come with me. Stop what you're doing. I need to introduce you to some people." Carol urgently pulled Isabella from her desk and headed to the meeting room downstairs.

"What's going on? Why the rush?" Isabella asked, her heels clicking on the floor as she was pulled along.

In the elevator, Carol said excitedly, "Bianca's company is going under. The Olympic Committee canceled their participation because of a scandal."

"And?" Isabella asked, confused. The news was satisfying, but she didn't see how it related to her.

Carol grinned. "The designers from Bianca's company have resigned, and they're here to apply for jobs."

###chapter 405 Similar Cases

Isabella's eyes widened when she heard what Carol had to say.

John had shelled out a ton of cash to hire top-notch designers for Bianca.

But now, thanks to Bianca's mess, those designers would be in hot water if they stuck around.

Fashion designers crave recognition. For them, having their work celebrated worldwide is the ultimate prize.

But Bianca had wrecked it all.

Some designers got scooped up by the other big three families, while others went straight to Isabella, hoping she'd get where they were coming from as a fellow designer.

And they were right. Isabella was in dire need of designers. She'd been running the company for a while, but all the big names had been snatched away, leaving her with just the rookies.

It's not that the newbies weren't talented, but they still needed to polish their skills. Given time, they could become world-famous designers. But Isabella didn't have that luxury.

A lot of Isabella's work involved designing clothes and promo materials as a part-time gig in the design department.

With so many designers flocking to her, Isabella wasn't about to let them down.

"Thanks so much for trusting me, everyone. Given the company's situation, I can only offer you the same pay Bianca did for now. But I promise, once we're back on our feet, your salaries will definitely increase," Isabella assured them.

The designers knew Isabella's company was struggling. John's salaries were already above average, but Isabella still wanted to match them. They felt her sincerity and decided to stick around and give it a shot.

With these designers on board, Isabella could finally catch her breath.

"Finally, a moment to chill. Sometimes I feel more like a busy gardener than a CEO," Isabella said, stretching.

Carol grinned and slid two documents in front of Isabella. "Since the design department is sorted, I'll leave the catering and medical aesthetics industries to you."

Isabella's relaxed look vanished. "Who's the CEO here, you or me? Can't I get one easy day? Just an hour?"

Isabella shot Carol a resentful look.

Carol shrugged and rolled her eyes. "This is your family's company, not mine. If I could find someone else to handle things, I wouldn't need your help."

Isabella sighed. Talent is always the rarest commodity, no matter the time.

Just then, Isabella's phone rang.

"Looks like you've got business to handle. I'll head out," Carol said with a smile and left the office.

Isabella glanced at the caller ID. It was Brenda.

Isabella racked her brain and realized there hadn't been any recent criminal cases. The only thing she was involved in was Bianca's peeping incident, but that was minor and didn't need Brenda's attention.

Isabella picked up the call and asked, "What's up, Officer Pena?"

Brenda chuckled on the other end. "Hey, just wanted to give you a heads-up-your dad's all set to be discharged from the hospital. They're getting him ready to transfer to prison. Thought you'd want to know."

Isabella was taken aback, suddenly realizing she hadn't visited Jasper in the hospital for ages. Since he was brought back from abroad, she'd only gone once to talk about shares.

After she got all the shares, she never went back.

Now she remembered it had been a while since Jasper returned.

"Hopefully, my dad can figure out his mistakes in prison. By the way, what about my mom?" Isabella suddenly thought of Mia, the woman who reported her husband.

"You really don't keep tabs on your parents, do you?" Brenda teased.

"Your mom's a witness now, plus with your bail, she's volunteering at an orphanage. She wasn't great at it at first, but she's getting the hang of it. At least she doesn't call us every day to complain about the kids anymore," Brenda said, sounding a bit nostalgic.

Isabella smiled and was about to say something when she heard an airport announcement in the background.

"Sounds like you're at the airport. Chasing down a criminal?" Isabella asked curiously.

Brenda shook her head, "Nah, a criminal got caught in Avalonia, and we have an extradition treaty with them. I'm heading there to bring him back. The guy's a scam artist who ripped off a bunch of elderly folks. He'll probably get at least 40 years. By the time he's out, he'll be old himself."

Isabella said indifferently, "I have zero sympathy for those guys, but I do feel bad you have to work overtime again."

"Technically, it's a business trip. But it's cool, I get to check out the local police station, see how they handle things, maybe learn something new, and see if there are any interesting cases. Gotta use my eyes to find something exciting," Brenda joked, clearly in good spirits.

"Alright, thanks for the heads-up. I've got work to do. Good luck on your trip," Isabella said, smiling before hanging up.

On the other side, Brenda was about to board her flight. After the journey, she finally landed in Avalonia.

The local police gave Brenda a warm welcome and even invited her to exchange case information.

They showed her some of their solved cases, and one, in particular, caught her eye.

It was about a sadistic serial killer who tortured young women. The victims were dismembered, their eyes gouged out, and tongues cut off.

This case reminded Brenda of Pearl.

###chapter 406 Received News

Pearl's case is still a mystery. Brenda and her team always knew there were some deep, dark secrets behind it.

Brenda's been dying to find out who the killer is, but her uncle Alan, the chief, has always warned her to back off.

She suspects the killer is from one of the big four families, but dealing with them is no walk in the park. Plus, all the info on Pearl's case is locked up tight in the archives.

Then, out of the blue, Brenda stumbles upon a similar case in another country. If the person who hurt Pearl isn't the same as this killer, they must be connected somehow.

"Sir, can I meet this killer and ask him some questions?" Brenda asks the local police chief.

The chief looks at the killer's file, shrugs, and says, "Sorry, Officer Pena, this guy died in prison from a sudden heart attack."

Brenda is floored; she didn't see that coming.

But she's still got questions.

"So, sir, when did this criminal die?" Brenda asks.

The chief thinks for a moment. The criminal's brutal methods made him memorable. "Hold on, I think I kept a newspaper about this guy."

After digging through a bunch of papers, the chief finally finds the newspaper reporting the criminal's death.

He hands it to Brenda. She checks the date of death and realizes that Pearl was harmed shortly after this criminal died.

Brenda has a wild theory. 'Maybe this criminal didn't die at all but was sent to our country.'

"Sir, can I see the death report of this criminal?" Brenda asks again.

The chief frowns. "Officer Pena, why are you so interested in this criminal?"

Brenda hesitates, then explains the similar case they had back home.

The chief's eyes flicker. He shakes his head and says, "Sorry, Officer Pena, our archives were renovated, and some info got lost. We didn't pay much attention to this guy's data because he was already dead, so we didn't bother to submit the report. I can't help you."

Brenda wants to ask more, but the chief waves her off and makes an excuse to leave.

'This guy definitely knows something, but if he's not talking, what can I do? I have no jurisdiction here.' Brenda thinks to herself.

She looks at the newspaper in her hand, which has a photo of the criminal. Brenda quickly goes to her computer, logs into her social account, and emails the photo to her colleague.

"Emma, can you look into this guy for me? I need to know if he's shown up domestically ASAP," Brenda calls her colleague to stress the urgency.

"Don't worry, Brenda, I'll dig into it," Emma Kate assures her.

After hanging up, Brenda started asking other officers about the killer, hoping to dig up more clues.

Meanwhile, Emma got right to work on the investigation after receiving Brenda's email.

It was lunchtime, and a colleague came by to invite Emma to join them.

Emma's stomach growled. She hadn't eaten breakfast and had been busy all morning. She was starving and feeling a bit lightheaded.

"Emma, let's go eat! They've got meat pies today, and they're really good," a colleague said with a smile.

Emma glanced at her computer and hesitated. "Okay, but I need to finish Brenda's task first."

She stretched, left her desk, and headed to the cafeteria. In her hunger-induced haze, she forgot to close the document on her computer.

A passing officer noticed the open report on Emma's screen. The details of the murders were eerily similar to Pearl's case. The officer's eyes widened, and he quickly left the station.

Soon, word spread through the station that Brenda might have found Pearl's attacker.

The police chief and Brenda's uncle, Alan, immediately called her.

In Avalonia, Brenda got Alan's call before she had any solid info.

"You promised me you'd stop investigating this. Why are you still digging?" Alan demanded over the phone.

Brenda winced at the yelling. She rubbed her ear and replied, a bit annoyed, "I'm not trying to investigate, but the clues are falling into my lap. What am I supposed to do?"

"Regardless, you need to back off. Now that the news is out, the four major families know. Especially Paxton. He might be waiting for you at the airport to interrogate you. Don't come back yet. Stay there; I'll arrange it as a learning exchange," Alan said, hanging up before Brenda could argue.

Brenda stared at her phone, frustrated. "Is this a joke? Now I can't even go home? Emma, how could you be so careless?"

She felt a wave of frustration; she was caught between two police chiefs.

Back at the Avalonia police station, the officers seemed to have been briefed by the chief and were tight-lipped around Brenda.

As Alan predicted, the four major families, especially Paxton, were already in the loop.

"When is Officer Brenda coming back?" Paxton asked Jonah, his face dark.

Jonah shook his head. "According to the station, Brenda will be staying there for a few months to learn their advanced crime-solving techniques. But I think she's worried about the danger waiting for her here."

Paxton sneered, "It doesn't matter. Now that we know who the killer is, I just need to find out who hired him."

###chapter 407 Unlucky Illegal Emigration people

Paxton wasted no time and had Jonah send someone to dig into the leaders behind the illegal emigration racket. He couldn't wrap his head around the idea that a killer could just waltz into the country pretending to be a regular Joe.

Jonah and his crew hit the streets right away, and let's just say their investigation methods were a bit more... unconventional than the cops'.

Meanwhile, other families were getting wind of the same news.

Mason squinted at Charles and asked, "You sure it's this guy, Marshall Banks?"

"Yeah, we uncovered some news from Avalonia, and the victims' stories line up with Pearl's. We even consulted some forensic experts, and the wounds the cops released look like they're all from the same guy," Charles said, his tone dead serious.

Mason got up from the couch, leaning on his cane. "How does a guy locked up in prison end up here? Who's got the pull for that?"

Charles had a hunch but didn't dare voice it.

Avalonia was Michael's turf. With his clout, springing someone from prison wouldn't be a big deal.

"I know what you're thinking. I suspect Michael too," Mason said, like he'd just put the pieces together.

After a pause, Charles asked, "Should we bring Mr. Williams in for a chat?"

Mason shook his head. "No need. He's probably already got the message and knows what to do."

Mason then cracked a smile. "If this is his doing, he played us all. Shifting the blame to the big four families is a slick move."

Mason kept quiet, figuring Michael had already gotten the police's message.

"Mr. Williams, the info about the murderer you found is out. What's our next move?" Jerry asked, all business.

Michael stayed cool. He wasn't rattled; he hadn't used illegal emigration to get the killer in, but another way.

"Get in touch with Estella and have her reach out to Zoey. Tell them I'm interested in teaming up," Michael said, a sly smile playing on his lips.

Jerry got the drift right away. "Got it, Mr. Williams. I'll handle it," he said, hanging up and getting to work.

Michael pocketed his phone and stepped out onto the balcony. The weather was grim, with strong winds whipping around.

Standing there, he listened to the wind howl when a snowflake landed on his forehead.

Michael reached out, catching the swirling snowflakes. "The weather's getting colder, and the Brown Family should be going under about now. Consider this my anniversary gift to my wife."

A smile crept across Michael's face, but his eyes were as cold as the ice and snow.

On a freezing winter night, a nasty storm was brewing.

Francis Vasquez was sprinting through the snow, blood dripping from his wounds and staining the white ground a vivid red.

A group of gunmen was hot on his heels, aiming for his legs and arms. They didn't want him dead-just captured.

That was the only reason Francis was still alive.

But then he slipped and hit the ground hard. The gunmen pounced, pinning him down and tying up his hands and feet.

"You psychos, I swear I don't know the guy you're after! He didn't use my channels!" Francis yelled, but the gunmen weren't buying it.

"We don't believe you. We'll make you talk," one of them sneered, dragging him into a van.

The van sped off and stopped at a warehouse.

Inside, the place was divided into sections, and you could hear screams of pain echoing from behind the doors.

"I swear, I don't know who this guy is, please don't hurt me."

"Paxton, you bastard, if I get out of this, I'll take you and your whole family down!"

"You maniacs, you won't get away with this!"

The gunmen hauled Francis out of the van and into the warehouse.

The air was thick with the smell of blood. Francis was shaking, his face ghostly pale.

A man, looking half-dead and covered in blood, was dragged out of one of the compartments. His body was a mess of whip marks and branding burns.

"Royce, did he spill?" one of the gunmen asked the guy dragging the body.

Royce Castillo, with his spiky hair, spat on the ground. "This guy's clean. I whipped him for three minutes, doused him with pepper water, and he still didn't crack. He's telling the truth."

Francis shivered even more.

"You lunatics! Is this the only way you know to get the truth?" he screamed.

One of the gunmen slapped him hard. "You illegal emigration folks aren't saints, and we're not the cops. We don't need to play by the rules."

They dragged Francis into a compartment.

He glanced at the torture devices, his legs almost giving out from fear.

Sharp iron hooks, still bloody, looked like they were meant for hanging meat. He didn't want to think about their last use.

There were whips with barbs, red-hot branding irons, and even an electric chair.

"Let's see which one to use on you," the gunman said, eyeing the tools before settling on the electric chair.

They strapped Francis into the chair, binding his hands and feet.

"Trust me, this'll be a real shocker," the gunman grinned wickedly.

"Wait! I'll tell you everything! I know who this guy is!" Francis screamed, terrified.

###chapter 408 Unlucky Joe

Francis's terrified scream pissed off the gunmen. They didn't just drag people here for the truth; they got a kick out of torturing them too.

"Hold up, if I remember right, you just started this illegal emigration gig, didn't you? How the hell do you know this guy? You trying to pull one over on me?" The gunman eyed Francis suspiciously.

'You know I just started this, and you still nabbed me. You guys are total psychos,' Francis thought, but he kept a friendly look on his face.

"Sir, yeah, I just got into the illegal emigration game. After Joe disbanded the gang, I got my old crew back together to take over his business." No sooner had Francis finished talking than he got a punch to the gut.

The gunman glared at him, cursing, "You piece of crap, rot in hell! You think I'm an idiot? Joe only showed up after Ms. Brown got hurt - you really think you can pin this on him?"

Francis felt a sharp pain in his stomach, like he was about to puke up his breakfast. He shook his head frantically. "Please, believe me. Even though Joe didn't bring Marshall into the country, he got the old boss's diary when he took over. It listed everyone he helped with illegal emigration. Marshall's name was in there, and I've seen it."

The gunmen paused, considering what Francis said.

Francis used to be in Joe's gang, but when Joe disbanded it to dodge John's pursuit, Francis, being ambitious, reassembled his crew and took over Joe's business.

Tears streaming down his face, Francis pleaded with the gunmen, "I swear I'm telling the truth. Just find that diary. It has all the contact info for everyone involved in illegal emigration. Once you get your hands on it, you'll know who brought that murderer into the country."

The gunmen's faces turned serious. If Francis was telling the truth, they couldn't keep torturing him; they had to find Joe.

"I hope you're not lying, or I'll make you wish for hell," one gunman sneered before heading off to report to Paxton's butler, Jonah.

They let Francis out of the electric chair.

'Phew, they bought it. I'm safe for now. Sorry, Joe. Stay hidden and don't let these guys find you, so we both stay safe,' Francis thought. In reality, there was no diary; he made it up to save his skin.

When Paxton heard about the diary, he immediately ordered a search for Joe.

Meanwhile, Joe was hiding out in Mike's apartment, dodging John's pursuit.

With Jasper back in his own country, John had more of his anger to vent on Jasper. He was less pissed about Joe's past actions, and the hunt for Joe started to die down.

Joe was lounging on the sofa, playing video games. He'd beaten the game a bunch of times already, but he still couldn't leave the apartment.

"Mike, can I get out of here already? Damn, it's been ages since I chatted up those gorgeous women! I hope they haven't moved on to other guys while I've been stuck here." Joe shot Mike a resentful look.

Mike rolled his eyes. "What's the rush? John's guys haven't come sniffing around for a week. If they don't show up by the end of today, you're probably in the clear for now. I'll get you out of the country ASAP. You can party all you want once you're abroad."

Joe put down the game controller, clearly annoyed. "I like it here. The women are more passionate and wild."

Mike gave Joe a cold stare.

Joe met his gaze but eventually threw up his hands in surrender.

"Alright, Mike, I'll do what you say. I'll leave the country." Joe flopped back onto the sofa, defeated.

Mike was about to smile when his phone rang.

"What? Paxton's looking for Joe? Got it." Mike hung up.

Joe sat up straight when he heard his name.

"Did you just say my name? What's going on? Why is Paxton looking for me?" Joe asked, confused.

Mike shrugged and patted Joe's shoulder as he walked over to the sofa. "Looks like you'll be staying here a bit longer, Joe."

"Wait, explain what's happening. Why is Paxton after me?" Joe stood up, staring at Mike.

Mike sighed. "Remember Paxton's daughter, Pearl? And that psycho killer?"

Joe nodded. Only Michael, Jerry, Mike, Joe, and Tim knew the truth about that.

"The truth about the killer's out, and Paxton's desperate to find who brought the killer back, hoping to trace Mr. Williams through them," Mike explained.

Joe immediately shouted, "Is Paxton an idiot? When his daughter got hurt, I wasn't even running the illegal emigration gig."

Joe was fuming, feeling unjustly targeted.

Mike looked at Joe sympathetically. "Do you have a guy named Francis working for you?"

Joe furrowed his brow, trying to remember. He vaguely recalled a subordinate by that name.

When Joe was about to become the new gang leader, Francis had been a pain, mouthing off, and Joe had given him a harsh reprimand.

"After you disbanded the gang, Francis took over and now Paxton's after him too. But he mentioned you have the old leader's diary with all the contact info for the illegal emigration folks," Mike explained.

"Francis, you damn bastard! I swear, I want to shove your foul mouth up your own ass," Joe shouted angrily.

###chapter 409 Joe Accused

Mike stood there, arms crossed, just watching Joe curse up a storm. He wasn't too worried about anyone hearing; the soundproofing in his place was top-notch.

When Joe finally ran out of steam, Mike handed him a glass of water.

Joe took a sip, calming his throat and stopping the cursing.

"Why'd you stop? I was kinda enjoying the show. Ten minutes and not a single repeat. I gotta say, I'm impressed," Mike teased, still with his arms crossed.

Joe waved him off. "Right now, I just wanna put a bullet in that bastard. Where is he?"

Mike tilted his head, thinking. "Francis is probably under Paxton's watch. Taking him out won't be a walk in the park. But I'm more curious, do you really have that diary?"

Joe's anger flared up again at the mention of the diary.

"Zane had a diary, but it didn't have any customer info. What was he doing, gathering evidence for the cops? It was just a list of all the women he slept with, their breast sizes, how round their butts were, who knew the most positions, and whose husband was never home," Joe ranted.

Mike's eyes widened as Joe went on for over 20 minutes.

When Joe finally stopped, Mike asked with a weird look, "Did you read the whole thing?"

Joe nodded, looking smug, and took another sip of water. "Why do you think I was in such a hurry to leave? I wanted to see if what was in that diary was true!"

Mike rolled his eyes. "You're risking your neck for women. Paxton's gone nuts. Do you know how many illegal immigrants he's killed?"

Joe shook his head. "A lot? I know at least a dozen from the groups I know."

Mike smirked. "There won't be any more smuggling or illegal immigration in this city for the next decade."

Joe's eyes widened in horror. "All those immigrants are dead? Paxton's really lost it! I need to lay low again."

Joe flopped onto the couch, grabbing a game controller. He was gearing up for a long hideout.

Mike chuckled at Joe's scared expression. Despite his tough talk, Joe was a real coward at heart.

Mike quickly called Michael to update him on Joe's situation.

"Mr. Williams, I've confirmed with Joe that the diary thing was all made up by Francis. He probably cracked under Paxton's beating and lied," Mike explained.

Michael nodded. "Keep Joe safe."

Mike reassured him, "Don't worry, Mr. Williams. Joe's been reminded of what it's like to be under John's thumb and he's behaving."

Michael nodded, told Mike to keep an eye on Joe, and then hung up.

"Jerry should be in action by now. Hopefully, he'll infiltrate Paxton's crew quickly and take over the whole Brown Family," Michael muttered, tapping his fingers on the table.

Meanwhile, Paxton got a call from Zoey.

"What did you say? Michael wants to meet? To talk about working together?" Paxton's voice was excited; this was what he'd been waiting for.

But after hanging up, doubt flickered in Paxton's eyes.

Just then, Jonah came in with an update. Paxton stopped him and asked, "I need to ask you something. I've had Zoey trying to get Michael to open up foreign markets, but he never agreed. Why would he suddenly want to work together now, while I'm investigating the killer?"

Jonah thought for a moment, then shook his head. "Mr. Brown, maybe you're overthinking it? Mrs. Brown and Estella have been getting along better, maybe Estella finally convinced Michael. As for the timing, it could just be a coincidence."

Paxton considered Jonah's words and thought they made sense. Maybe it was just a coincidence.

He waved Jonah off and went to change clothes. He had to look sharp for this meeting.

News of Paxton looking for Joe eventually reached John's ears.

John was helping Bianca cut some fruit and casually waved his hand. "If Paxton wants to find Joe, let him. Pull our guys back. That lunatic Paxton is way more ruthless than me."

A cold smile crossed John's lips as he dismissed his subordinate.

Bianca looked at John curiously. "Honey, what's going on? Why does Paxton want to find Joe?"

Being closely monitored by John, Bianca had no clue what was happening outside.

John filled her in about Paxton's hunt for the killer.

Bianca was shocked. She had no idea things were so intense outside.

"This has nothing to do with us. Just focus on taking care of yourself and the baby. I've got some things to handle at the company," John said, kissing her forehead before leaving.

As John walked outside the winery, he saw security carrying boxes towards the house.

"What's in those boxes?" John asked, puzzled.

The security guy explained, "These are baby products Ms. Taylor ordered, along with some books."

John nodded, not thinking much of it, and got into his car, driving away.

As the security team brought the boxes inside, Bianca started unpacking them.

Suddenly, she paused. In one of the books, she found a hidden compartment with a cellphone.

###chapter 410 Mysterious Phone Call

Bianca snapped the book shut as soon as she spotted the phone inside, shooting a nervous glance at the two female bodyguards. Luckily, they didn't notice a thing.

Feigning a stretch with the book in hand, Bianca casually strolled towards the bedroom.

The bodyguards barely gave her a second look. The bedroom was her and John's private space, strictly off-limits to them.

Once inside with the door securely closed, Bianca quickly retrieved the phone from the book's hidden compartment and powered it on. She didn't buy for a second that the bookstore owner had gifted her a phone out of kindness; someone else had to be behind it.

Instead of diving into the contacts, Bianca went straight to the photo gallery.

There was a single video. As she watched it, her eyes softened immediately.

The video was surveillance footage of a middle-aged woman watching TV. That woman was Bianca's missing mother.

Tears welled up in Bianca's eyes as she saw her mom on the screen. Suddenly, the phone vibrated, and she answered it right away.

"It's been a while. How've you been?" a man's voice came through.

Resentment flashed in Bianca's eyes. This was the guy who had driven her dad to suicide and was holding her mom hostage to manipulate her.

"I don't want to chit-chat. Just tell me, why'd you send the phone?" Bianca's voice was cold.

The man on the other end sighed. "Don't be so mad. I just wanted your dad to record a video, make it look like an escape, but he ended up killing himself. I underestimated his love for you and your mom."

Bianca's fists clenched, her tone icy. "You hypocrite, talking about understanding emotions?"

The man chuckled. "Looks like John's got you on lockdown, even took your phone. I went through a lot of trouble to get this to you, and you don't even thank me. Do you know how hard it is to fool John?"

Bianca's eyes narrowed. Not many people knew about her restrictions, so this guy had to have a spy close to her.

She fell silent, trying to figure out who the mole could be.

"Why so quiet? Trying to guess who my inside man is?" the annoying man laughed again, mocking her.

If it weren't for the guards outside, Bianca would've cursed and smashed the phone.

Sensing her thoughts, the man said calmly, "This is your last chance. Lose this phone, and you lose the chance to see your mom."

Bianca felt a sharp pain in her abdomen, the stress affecting her unborn baby.

She took a deep breath to calm down. "Why'd you reach out now? What do you want from me?" she asked.

The man dropped the jokes. "I need you to go after Isabella. Take control of those three companies ASAP," he said bluntly.

Bianca scoffed. "Are you even listening to yourself? I'm on lockdown, can't leave the house. How am I supposed to take over those companies?"

"Use someone else, like Paxton," the man suggested.

Bianca frowned. "Why Paxton? Wait, are you saying I should use the killer Paxton's investigating? The one who hurt Pearl-was that you?"

Anger surged through Bianca. If it hadn't been for that sudden urge to be with John at the hotel last time, that car bomb would've killed her.

The man denied it. "I've done a lot of bad things, but not that. Think about it, I don't play those torture games; I'm not a psychopath!"

Bianca paused, considering his words. Maybe he was telling the truth; he had no reason to lie about this.

"Do you want to frame Isabella for this? How exactly?" Bianca asked, trying to stay calm.

The man sounded surprised. "Isn't framing people your thing? Why ask me?"

"Everyone thinks I'm an idiot. I'm tired of thinking, and this pregnancy is making me dizzy. Just tell me your plan," Bianca said impatiently.

Every plan she made against Isabella had failed, so she preferred others to come up with solutions.

The man stopped mocking and laid out his plan. "I can have my people plant some evidence for Paxton to find, but we'll need John's help."

Bianca sneered. "So you do have a spy close to him."

"Now's not the time to argue. John doesn't want to get involved, so you have to push him. Tell him about the bomb incident; he'll have to agree for your sake and the baby's. Then my people can plant the evidence," the man said calmly.

Bianca took a deep breath and nodded. "Got it. I'll tell him. But why are you getting involved now? You've never let your people get involved in my fight with Isabella before."

Bianca wasn't stupid; she sensed the man was more anxious this time.

"Don't ask questions that don't concern you. Just follow my instructions, and your mother will be safe," the man said before hanging up.

Bianca stared at the ended call screen, took a deep breath, hid the phone, and walked out.

"Call John and tell him to come back. I have something important to discuss," Bianca instructed the bodyguard at the door.

###chapter 411 A Slap

Bianca gave John a call back.

John was in the car, almost at the office when his female bodyguard called.

"I've got stuff to handle. If it's not urgent, tell Bianca to wait at home," John said, sounding annoyed.

With the Olympics coming up, his company had a ton of important projects with the Olympic Committee. He loved Bianca, but he couldn't put all his energy into her right now.

The female bodyguard didn't give much detail, just said Bianca needed to talk to him.

Bianca, who was nearby, couldn't wait any longer. She thought the bodyguard was taking too long.

"Can't you see how urgent this is from my face?" Bianca snapped, grabbing the phone from the bodyguard. It took a lot of guts for her to make this call.

"Darling, come back quick. I have something super important to tell you, and it's about that car explosion we had last time," Bianca said to John.

John's brows knitted together. He still hadn't gotten any solid info on the car explosion. All he knew was those three guys never came out after going into a community.

Rumors among the big families suggested Michael might be behind it, trying to take John out and become the family heir.

But a lot of people doubted it because John's dad, Owen, was still capable of having kids. After John's mom passed away, Owen never remarried, but he could still have another kid to keep the family line going.

In short, John was important, but not irreplaceable.

John rubbed his temples, feeling annoyed. "Alright, I'm coming back now. I hope you have a good explanation," he said.

After hanging up, John told the driver to turn around and head back.

Bianca walked over to the sofa and sat down, her fingers twisting together, showing how nervous she was.

'Forget it, this is gonna come out sooner or later. My reputation can't get any worse. Everyone already thinks I'm a bad person, so no point in pretending,' Bianca thought.

John told the driver to hurry up and got to the winery as fast as possible.

As soon as the car stopped, John jumped out and headed inside.

He saw Bianca sitting on the sofa and frowned. "Didn't you have something to tell me? What's going on? Do you know anything about the explosion last time?" he asked, clearly annoyed.

Bianca looked up at John, her eyes a bit shifty. She hesitated, then finally spilled the truth.

"I think Paxton was behind the explosion last time," Bianca said, looking at John.

"Paxton? No way. Is he nuts? Why would he bomb me?" John stared at Bianca, not believing her because Paxton had no reason to do that.

Bianca shook her head. "Actually, Paxton wasn't trying to kill you; he was after me. He thinks I had something to do with what happened to his daughter."

"You? How could that be? You were in the hospital at the time. There's no way you could've done it," John said, eyes wide with shock.

Bianca looked down and said quietly, "The kidnapping of Isabella was planned by Pearl and me. We didn't expect Pearl to get hurt while I stayed safe. Paxton probably thought it was unfair and wanted revenge."

John stared at her, disbelief all over his face.

Bianca kept her head down, avoiding his gaze.

John's body shook slightly. He took a deep breath, his eyes bloodshot as he asked, "Is what you're saying true? Answer me."

After a moment of silence, Bianca finally nodded.

John slapped her hard across the face, angrier than he'd ever been.

Bianca covered her face, looking at John in shock. He rarely hit her.

With bloodshot eyes, John jabbed a finger at her and demanded, "You said all of this was because Jasper and Mia pressured you, but now you're claiming you conspired with Pearl? How can you be so heartless? You didn't just want Isabella's kidney; you wanted her life too!"

Bianca covered her face. Having revealed everything, there was no point in hiding anymore.

"Yes, it was me. I wanted Isabella dead! Do you still love her? If you do, avenge her now." Bianca tilted her head back, a hint of madness in her voice.

John trembled with anger, unable to speak for a while as he pointed at her.

After a long pause, John sighed deeply.

He sat down on the sofa, his expression heavy.

"So you told me this today because you were worried Paxton wouldn't find the real culprit and would come after you again, right?" John looked up, asking indifferently.

Bianca nodded. "That's what I was thinking."

John rubbed his temples wearily and lay back on the sofa.

Seeing John's exhausted appearance, Bianca realized he had been working tirelessly for her and his company. He must have been under a lot of pressure.

Feeling guilty, Bianca walked over to John, hugged him, and cried, "I'm sorry, darling. It's all my fault for being too weak to tell you about this."

John didn't push her away but sighed deeply. "At least you've told me now. I don't have to worry about being blown up on the street."

John rubbed his temples wearily and then took out his phone.

"Immediately investigate Paxton's whereabouts. Also, look into the recent activities of the Brown Family's subordinates and Joe's whereabouts." After instructing his subordinates, John suddenly remembered someone.

John called Mike and asked him to help find Joe as well.

###chapter 412 The Eccentric Family

After getting John's message, Mike didn't put up a fight. John had dirt on him, so Mike had no choice but to go along with it.

After hanging up, Mike let out a sigh and glanced over at Joe, who was lounging on the couch, munching on snacks and playing video games. Then he dialed Michael's number.

Meanwhile, Michael was at the office, listening to Jerry give an update on their latest projects.

Jerry stood beside Michael, clutching a notebook filled with the latest updates. "Our company just landed deals with Avalonia and a few local athletes to showcase our ads on their uniforms. We also managed to secure some ad space from the Olympic Committee, but it's not as much as what John got due to some territory issues," Jerry explained.

Jerry then pulled out a small notebook from his pocket, flipped to a page, and said, "Estella managed to work out a partnership with Zoey. They're going to use our channels to help Paxton sell products from their family business."

Michael listened to Jerry's report with a calm, unreadable expression. When Jerry finished, Michael shook his head.

"This is still too slow," Michael said flatly.

Jerry chuckled, "Mr. Williams, you gotta give us some time. Our people aren't superheroes; perfect infiltration takes time."

"That's why I said it's too slow. Have Paxton's guys found anything?" Michael asked.

Jerry shook his head, "Joe destroyed a lot of stuff before he left. They can't find Joe or that so-called diary."

"Sometimes you don't need to find it, just need some false accusations. Just like what we did to Bianca." Michael stretched and got up from his chair.

Jerry paused for a moment, then quickly caught on to what Michael meant.

Following Michael to the balcony, Jerry asked, "So, are you worried someone might fake a diary to mess with Mrs. Williams?"

Michael nodded. "It's possible, right? Paxton's guys are all shady, easy to bribe and infiltrate. If we can get info about the diary, so can other families. A crazy dad is an easy tool to manipulate."

Jerry, standing behind Michael, looked concerned. "If that's the case, we need to find a way to turn the tables. If we have to, we can just take out Paxton, that mad dog."

Michael smiled, "Paxton's still useful to us. At least until we completely take over his family, he can't go down."

Just then, Michael's phone rang. Jerry walked over to the table, curious, picked up the phone, and handed it to Michael.

During this, Jerry saw the name "Mike" on the screen.

Michael answered the call, "What's up, Mike? Why the sudden call?"

Mike said into the phone, "Mr. Williams, John just called me and asked me to help him track down Joe."

Michael frowned. "Did he say why?"

Mike shook his head. "No, Mr. Williams, John didn't give any details. He had eased up on looking for Joe, but now he's suddenly all over it again. Feels like there's something we're missing."

Michael quickly pieced it together.

"Bianca probably spilled the beans to John about what she did and that the car explosion was meant for her. John had to step in to protect his woman and kid," Michael said with a cold smile.

"So, what do we do? Should we keep laying low or maybe throw out some fake info to stir up trouble between Paxton and John's guys?" Mike suggested.

Michael thought for a moment and nodded. "Yeah, let's go with that. We need to buy some time; our people need more time to fully infiltrate the Brown Family."

Mike agreed and hung up.

But just as Michael put his phone away, Jerry's phone rang.

Jerry glanced at the caller ID and answered the call right in front of Michael.

"What's up? Why the emergency call?" Jerry asked, looking serious.

The call was from Tim, who had infiltrated the Brown Family's business. Jerry had told them not to call unless it was urgent, as it could blow their cover.

Tim, on the other end, sounded worried. "Sir, I think I've been made, but they haven't outed me yet. I found out the Brown Family has other issues."

Michael and Jerry both frowned.

"What do you mean? You got made but you're still there and found more problems? Explain," Jerry demanded coldly.

Tim quickly said, "I suspect the Brown Family has been infiltrated by others. I looked into the employees and found many used to work for the Taylor Family. After Paxton took over, he kept a lot of them. Many top execs are still former Taylor Family people."

Michael grabbed Jerry's phone and asked, "Wait, I get it. You're saying the person who found you out is from the Taylor Family? But they didn't report you, right?"

Tim hesitated. "Mr. Williams, you're there too? Yes, that's exactly it."

Michael narrowed his eyes. "Paxton's no idiot. Even though he took over the Taylor Family's company, he must've put his own people in charge. Got any other intel?"

###chapter 413 Infiltrated

Tim was sharp and perfect for undercover work. He noticed details better than Joe.

After just a few days at Paxton's company, Tim had already dug up some juicy info.

"Yeah, I've found some other stuff. There are four top dogs at the company I infiltrated. Paxton's right-hand man is pretty powerful, while the other three are just there for support. They all used to be part of the Taylor Family. I found out Paxton's guy got bought off with cash," Tim told Michael.

Tim had secretly tailed Paxton's right-hand man and discovered that he and the other three top execs were knee-deep in corruption and bribery.

"Now those four are thick as thieves. Paxton's guy won't turn on the others to save his own skin," Tim said over the phone.

A grin spread across Michael's face. He leaned back in his chair, tapping his fingers on the desk.

"These Taylor Family folks are pretty interesting. Looks like we underestimated them," Michael chuckled, realizing he needed to rethink his plan.

Isabella had told Michael about Patrick dissolving the family. Michael had always suspected that the senior members loyal to the Taylor Family wouldn't be easily swayed, and it seemed he was right.

"Mr. Williams, these Taylor Family members showing up is a wild card. What should we do? Should we reach out and see if we can work together?" Jerry asked, sensing an opportunity.

The Taylor Family members had been working at the Brown Family's company for years. They were probably more integrated and had more control over the Brown Family's power than their own people.

Michael looked thoughtful. "It seems the Taylor Family might be on our side, but Isabella is now the company's president, and they haven't reached out to her. They might have other motives. We need to figure out what they're thinking."

Jerry nodded. "You're right, Mr. Williams. If they have other motives, contacting them could put your wife in danger."

Michael narrowed his eyes. "When a flock scatters, hungry wolves pick them off one by one. To avoid chaos, there needs to be a leader. These people must have someone they're loyal to, someone organizing them."

"So, even if we reach out, they won't listen unless we find their leader?" Jerry asked.

Michael nodded.

Jerry sighed. "But we have no clue who the leader is. How do we find them?"

Michael smiled. "There's someone who might know."

"Who?" Jerry asked, curious.

Michael mentioned the name, "Carol, the head of HR at Isabella's company."

He pulled out some info on Carol from his drawer and handed it to Jerry. "You should've looked into her before. She's got a secret info channel, probably set up by Patrick from the Taylor Family."

Jerry skimmed through the file and closed it. He'd seen it before and wondered why Michael was bringing it up now.

"Get someone to reach out to Carol and find out where the leader is," Michael said casually.

Jerry got the idea but was a bit uneasy.

"Mr. Williams, Carol's not that simple. Asking her outright could tip her off. Who do you think is best for this job?" Jerry asked.

Michael hesitated. The best guy for the job was Joe because he was great with women and a good actor.

"I'd go with Joe, but you know, he's currently wanted by the authorities," Michael said, a bit helpless.

Jerry frowned and thought for a moment. "I agree, Joe's perfect for this. Maybe we can disguise him?"

After some thought, Michael decided to let Joe decide. Disguising Joe wasn't the best idea because even the best disguise could be seen through, especially by someone sharp like Carol. Plastic surgery was an option, but it took too long, and they needed to act fast.

Without wasting time, Michael called Mike and asked him to pass the phone to Joe.

Joe was puzzled when he got Michael's call.

"What's up, Mr. Williams? Need something?" Joe asked curiously.

Michael smiled and said, "I have a task for you. You need to make contact with a woman."

Joe's eyes lit up. "How old is she? Is she hot? What's her bust size?"

Michael smirked. He had Carol's info, but not those details.

He looked at Jerry.

Jerry hesitated and said, "Joe, you know Black Widow from the Avengers?"

"Oh my god, are you saying I get to meet a babe who looks like Black Widow?" Joe's tone was full of excitement.

Jerry nodded. "Something like that, she's pretty stunning."

Joe jumped up from the couch. "Don't worry, Mr. Williams. I'll take this seriously and won't let you down."

Jerry shrugged at Michael, who found it a bit amusing.

"Joe, you know your situation. John and Paxton are after you. If you show up, you could be in danger," Michael warned.

Joe waved it off. "Don't worry, Mr. Williams. I'm not stupid. I like beautiful women, but I'm careful. Send me her info, and I'll figure out a way to approach her."

Michael nodded, trusting Joe's caution.

###chapter 414 Joe's Identity

Michael asked Jerry to take Carol's info to Joe, then he started planning the next steps.

After getting Carol's info, Joe thought it over for a bit and decided to join Isabella's company as a job seeker to get in touch with Carol.

Joe put on a white shirt, a blue tie, black-framed glasses, fixed his hair, and finally shaved his beard.

Joe posed in front of the mirror. Now he looked like a fresh college grad getting ready for an interview at Isabella's company.

"Something's missing," Joe frowned, checking out his reflection.

Suddenly, Joe had an idea. He closed his eyes in front of the mirror and opened them again, with a look of youthful enthusiasm and eagerness.

"Now it feels right. A young grad should have a sense of wonder and curiosity about the world. Can't be looking like a thug," Joe smiled at his reflection.

Joe had previously played a thug to blend in with a gang. The laid-back, slightly rebellious vibe made him feel at ease.

Even after the gang broke up, Joe hadn't completely shaken off his gangster vibe. Now, with a new mission, he needed to disguise himself again.
