With a stern look, Alan said, "Your bosses told you not to cause trouble here. I suggest you listen. This is a police station, and any fighting here will make us look bad."

The guys from both sides looked a bit sheepish and mumbled apologies.

They might be tough, but they weren't stupid. Neither Paxton nor John would want to piss off the police chief over a petty fight.

Alan nodded, satisfied, and walked into the lab. The forensic exam was just wrapping up.

The forensic examiner took off his mask and gloves and handed a report to Alan.

"Mr. Savage, based on my examination, this body matches the notorious serial killer Avalonia. The bone age, dental marks, and tattoos all line up with the data Officer Pena sent over," the examiner said.

Alan nodded; he had a hunch this was the case.

"How did he die?" Alan asked.

"He was shot in the head, no other major injuries. Looks like someone took him out cleanly," the examiner said, pulling out an evidence bag.

"I found some stone fragments on him. My research suggests these are coal mine stones," the examiner said, handing Alan the bag of small black stones and debris.

"Why would he have these? Was he hiding in a mine or something?" Alan asked.

The examiner nodded and pulled up a map on his phone, pointing to a spot. "There's a small coal mine on the outskirts."

Alan gave the forensic examiner a satisfied pat on the shoulder and handed the autopsy report back. "Print me two copies of these reports."

The forensic examiner nodded, knowing Alan planned to give the reports to Paxton and John.

A few minutes later, Alan walked out of the lab with two reports in hand. "Here are the autopsy reports. Take them to your bosses," he said, handing the reports to the henchmen.

The henchmen quickly pulled out their phones and called John and Paxton.

As soon as they got the message, John and Paxton rounded up their guys and headed straight for the mine.

Both groups left the police station and made their way to the mine.

Watching them leave, Alan let out a sigh of relief. "Finally, some peace and quiet around here."

Then it hit him, and he slapped his forehead. "Damn it, I need to send people to follow them, make sure they don't cause trouble for the workers at the mine."

Alan had to gather a team and send them to the mine.

Paxton and John arrived at the mine at the same time.

They got out of their cars, exchanged a quick glance, and then got down to business, arranging their men to surround the area.

This was a small open-pit coal mine, and the person in charge wasn't connected to the four major families. The mine's low output hadn't caught their attention before.

It was nighttime, and the coal miners were resting. The sudden commotion woke a lot of them up.

Some miners, annoyed, got ready to go outside and see what was going on. But when they saw the tough-looking guys with guns, they decided to stay put.

The noise soon alerted the mine's boss.

The boss, a short and chubby middle-aged man named Gareth Bishop, started sweating nervously when he heard that reps from the four major families had shown up. He was worried he might have done something to piss them off.

"Is there something I can help you with, Mr. Brown and Mr. Williams?" Gareth asked nervously.

Paxton pulled out a photo of the serial killer and asked, "Do you know this guy?"

Gareth looked at the photo and shook his head. "I don't know him. We have a lot of workers here; I can't possibly know them all."

Gareth was telling the truth. But he knew there had to be something up with the guy in the photo, so he gathered all the workers to see if anyone recognized him. Soon, they had a lead.

One worker said, "This guy used to live in a house not far from the mine. It was an old junk room, but I haven't seen him in a while. A few days ago, when we passed by there to use the restroom, it looked like someone else had moved in."

Guided by that worker, Paxton and John led their crew to a wooden house near the cliff.

When they got there, they came face to face with someone coming out.

"Joe? So you've been hiding here!" John shouted angrily.

###chapter 428 Four Diaries

Joe shot John a quick glance, then slammed the door shut with a smirk.

"Open this damn door!" John bellowed.

Joe had really pissed John off before because of Jasper, and now John was out for blood. He finally had Joe cornered.

John's crew started pounding on the door, kicking and ramming it like madmen, making the whole thing shake.

Paxton stood back, watching. He knew if Joe was here, so was that diary. And that diary had the goods on bringing the criminal back to the country.

Finally, Paxton's guys managed to bust down the flimsy wooden door, but to their shock, there was an open window in the house.

Joe was outside, backpack slung over his shoulder, waving. "See ya, Mr. Williams. Got a little present for you."

With a wicked grin, Joe pulled out a lighter and tossed it through the window.

John's crew caught a whiff of gasoline and their faces went pale. They yanked John out of the house in a hurry.

Just as they got clear, flames erupted, smoke billowing out of every crack.

Paxton started to freak out. He needed that diary.

"Get in there and find anything useful!" Paxton barked at his men.

But they hesitated, staring at the raging fire. Charging in now was a death wish.

John sneered at Paxton's crew and waved his hand. "Get in there and find the diary."

Without a second thought, John's guys dove into the flames.

Paxton glared at his men. "Whoever finds the diary gets a million bucks."

That did the trick. Paxton's guys sprang into action, even more determined than John's.

Screams echoed from inside, and some couldn't take the heat, bolting out of the house.

As more and more people fled, both John and Paxton started to lose hope.

Then, out of nowhere, someone burst from the flames clutching a diary, shouting, "I got it! I finally got it!"

John and Paxton's eyes lit up, and they both rushed towards the guy. His face was so blackened by the fire, they couldn't tell whose side he was on.

The guy looked at both of them, then headed straight for Paxton, handing over the diary.

John clenched his teeth in fury. Paxton, on the other hand, grinned like a Cheshire cat as he took the diary.

John watched Paxton's smug grin, a slight smirk forming on his own lips.

Just then, another guy burst out of the burning house.

"I found the diary!" he shouted, beaming.

Paxton's smile vanished.

The guy handed the diary to Paxton, eyes gleaming with expectation.

Paxton blinked, confused by the two identical diaries. "Did Zane have a bunch of diaries?"

The two guys who brought out the diaries glared at each other, both hungry for that $1 million reward.

"Maybe Zane's been keeping diaries for years," one of Paxton's men suggested.

Paxton nodded, thinking that made sense. He shot a smug look at John and patted the two guys on the back.

"Good job, both of you get $1 million," Paxton announced.

The two guys grinned from ear to ear.

Then, another person came running out, also holding a diary.

"Mr. Brown, I found the diary," the guy said, looking confused at the two diaries in Paxton's hands.

Paxton's face darkened. He was starting to feel like he was being played.

John seemed to catch on and smirked at Paxton. "Congrats, Mr. Brown. Looks like you found the diary from two years ago."

Paxton shot John a deadly glare, then snatched the third diary from his guy.

He flipped through it and saw it was similar to the others. All three diaries were from the same year, but which one was the real deal?

"Think there's a fourth diary?" John taunted.

"Mr. Williams, I found the diary!" one of John's men shouted, running out with yet another diary.

John's smile froze, his lips twitching as he took the diary.

He looked at the diary in his hand, then at Paxton's, realizing they all looked the same.

John's face darkened. They'd both been duped.

As John flipped through the diary, he searched anxiously for clues about the serial killer. He dreaded seeing Bianca's name, even though he suspected she was being framed.

Finally, he found the name of the serial killer. But when he saw the info about the intermediary who brought the killer back to the country, he was stunned.

"Joseph? How could it be him? Could Isabella be right-was this all orchestrated by the other two major families?" John thought, his brow furrowing deeply.

###chapter 429 Four Goals

Paxton noticed John's face change, and his curiosity piqued.

What Paxton didn't see coming was that John was also questioning the diary's authenticity.

"Could it really be Joseph? He doesn't seem like the type! Is he a gentleman on the outside but a total creep underneath?" The more John thought about it, the more uneasy he got.

Whether it was Joseph or his family, even Joseph's dad, Richard, they all seemed pretty low-key and steady, treating everyone kindly. Could the whole family be a bunch of undercover weirdos?

John couldn't wrap his head around it, but then he felt a light poke. Frowning, he looked over and saw one of his guys pointing at Paxton.

John turned and saw Paxton on his tiptoes, trying to sneak a peek at the diary.

John smirked and shut the diary. Paxton looked less like the head of a big family and more like a kid trying to cheat on a test.

Paxton was just about to see what was in John's diary when John snapped it shut, leaving him frustrated.

"Mr. Williams, you know how important that notebook is to me. Name your price. How much for the diary?" Paxton asked coldly.

John sneered, "What? Another million bucks? Do you think I need it? Do you remember how you and the other two families tried to screw me over?"

Paxton shot back, standing with his hands behind his back, staring at John. "You know this was a plot by the three major families, not just me. The Brown Family's status isn't on par with yours. Go to the Davis Family and the Larson Family for this."

John clapped his hands, mocking Paxton. "You're really something. Do you think I don't know you teamed up with the Davis Family and the Larson Family to target me? Are you trying to weasel out of this?"

Paxton glared at John, raised his hand slightly, and all his henchmen behind him loaded their guns, aiming at John.

John's guys shielded him and raised their guns too.

The situation between the two sides went south again. The already shaky cooperation fell apart instantly.

"Mr. Williams, you should know that the game between the major families isn't that simple. You should understand why we're stopping you. I won't waste more words. Will you hand over the diary for 10 million dollars?" Paxton's voice was cold and indifferent.

"You think you can scare me?" John sneered, though he couldn't help but glance at his right-hand man nearby.

This guy knew John well and got the message right away. John didn't really want to argue with Paxton over this, but he had to make a stand to get Paxton to back down.

The subordinate immediately shouted, "Mr. Williams, let's all chill out. Mr. Brown is just trying to get justice for his daughter. Soon you'll be a dad too, so you should get where he's coming from. Why don't we all sit down and talk this out like fathers?"

Paxton glanced at the guy who spoke, a hint of approval in his eyes. This guy was pretty smooth, but too bad he wasn't on his team.

John hesitated for a moment, looking somewhat convinced by his subordinate.

"What kind of person do you take me for?" John sneered. "As if I couldn't afford a measly million dollars."

The subordinate's eyes lit up. He turned to Paxton and shouted, "Mr. Brown, we get it, but the diary was saved by our guy from the fire. Asking for 10 million dollars doesn't really match Mr. Williams' status."

Paxton figured out that John's goal was to make him yield, to get back at him for the past actions of the three major families.

Paxton didn't mind. He asked loudly, "Mr. Williams, how much money do you want?"

John looked at the subordinate who had saved the diary from the fire.

The subordinate hesitated for a moment, then extended five fingers.

Paxton glanced at the man's hand and shouted, "Alright, let's make it 50 million dollars! I'll transfer the money now, you give me the diary."

Paxton took out a check, filled in a number, and had someone deliver it to John.

John looked at the check, raised an eyebrow, and handed it to the subordinate.

The subordinate swallowed nervously, with a hint of confusion in his eyes. He had only wanted to add 5 million dollars. He didn't expect Paxton to raise the price directly to 50 million dollars. This was an unexpected surprise.

Paxton watched John's actions with a hint of dissatisfaction. John handed the check to the subordinate in front of him, indicating that he didn't care about the 50 million dollars. It was just pocket money to reward the subordinate.

'Just a flower grown in a greenhouse, without experiencing any storms, thinking that this way can provoke me? Simply foolish.' Paxton mocked John's actions in his mind.

John handed the diary to Paxton.

Paxton took the diary, a hint of surprise in his eyes.

Neither Paxton nor John left. They waited quietly until the cabin was completely burned down. They had people search for a while but found no trace of any papers; everything had been burned.

Seeing that nothing useful could be found, Paxton directly returned with his subordinates and the diary.

After Paxton left, John looked at the subordinate who received the money. "Hand over the 50 million dollars, that money is too much, I have other uses for it. I'll give you 1 million dollars as a reward."

###chapter 430 Locking the Target

John's crew reluctantly handed the check back to him.

Poor check, didn't even get a chance to warm up in the pocket.

Going from 50 million bucks to just 1 million? No one's gonna be thrilled about that.

John didn't give a damn about his crew's grumbling. If he hadn't made that bet with Mason, he'd still be the Williams Family heir, swimming in cash. Fifty million would've been pocket change.

But now, John had to cough up ten percent of his assets to Mason. Sure, he still had plenty left, but 50 million was no joke. Plus, he'd already blown 100 million on Estella's endorsement.

To top it off, thanks to Bianca, his whole clothing company was in shambles. Even though he brought in PR to patch things up, it was gonna take a while to bounce back. That 100 million? Down the drain. And with the Olympic projects needing funds, John was seriously strapped for cash.

John stuffed the 50 million dollar check in his pocket, scribbled out a 1 million dollar check, and handed it to his crew. Then he and his team bounced from the coal mine.

As they were leaving, John asked if anyone had seen Joe. He hadn't forgotten that jerk who nearly roasted him alive with a lighter.

But with all the flames and smoke, no one had a clue where Joe went. John figured Joe must've jumped off the cliff, but he was sure the guy had a plan.

Just like John thought, they found witnesses who saw a big parachute coming down from the cliff. Probably Joe. The backpack he had must've been the parachute.

John kept hunting for Joe, knowing their beef was only gonna get worse.

Meanwhile, Paxton, after heading out with his crew, went straight home to check out the 4 diaries.

Paxton cracked open the diaries, zeroing in on the folks who brought in the serial killer.

Isabella, Joseph, Colin Brown, Kurt Lowe?

"Seriously? A serial killer with four middlemen? They're playing me for a fool." Paxton laughed, more pissed than amused.

Paxton wasn't dumb. Out of these 4 diaries, maybe one was real, or they were all fake, with the real one already torched. Someone wanted to use Paxton to take out the people listed.

Isabella's name in the diary could be real or a setup by Bianca. Their beef was no secret. One of John's guys was at the fire today, maybe planted there by John.

Joseph's name could be there to stir up trouble between the Davis Family and Mason. Or it could be John's ploy to pit the Brown Family against the Davis Family.

Colin, a Brown Family member, controlled some of the family's resources. If Paxton bit the dust, Colin would be the top contender to take over. If Paxton lost it over Pearl and pissed off the other families, Colin could push him out as family head. John might be trying to spark a family feud within the Browns.As for the last name, Kurt, nobody had a clue who this guy was. None of the big four families had anyone by that name; it seemed totally made up.

Paxton put down the diaries and let out a deep sigh, his eyes showing just how tired he was. He rubbed his forehead, feeling like a dad trying to get justice for his daughter, but someone was playing him.

Paxton slammed the table, his eyes blazing with anger.

Honestly, checking if the diaries were legit was pretty straightforward. They had records of other illegal immigrants and middlemen. By comparing those, he could figure out if the diaries were real.

Paxton snapped some pics of each diary's contents and sent them to different subordinates to investigate.

After handing out the tasks, Paxton called Pearl's doctor, Allan Jennings.

"Doc, I need to know how stable my daughter's emotions are right now. Can I talk to her?" Paxton asked over the phone.

Pearl could hear external sounds through a cochlear implant, but her mental state was so fragile that she could easily break down. Paxton had been hesitant to ask her about the killer.

Allan hesitated and said, "Pearl's condition has improved a lot, but there's still a risk of her losing control. My advice is to wait another year."

"I can't wait any longer. Please set it up for next week. I have some questions for her." Paxton clenched his fist, his eyes fierce.

Allan sighed and agreed.

After hanging up, Paxton contacted his subordinates again. He gave them just a week to verify the diaries' authenticity.

The subordinates could hear the anger in Paxton's voice and pulled out all the stops to gather information. They reported back before the week was up.

Paxton looked at the summarized info in his hand, a hint of mockery in his eyes.

"These guys have really outdone themselves," Paxton smirked.

Three out of the four diaries turned out to be real. The illegal immigrants and middlemen matched the contents.

These guys who faked evidence, if the info they found was handed over to the cops, they'd probably get a medal for being outstanding citizens.

Paxton wasn't dumb and knew how crucial it was to hide one percent of false info among ninety-nine percent of true info.

What Paxton didn't expect was that there were actually idiots who prepared 100% fake info.

The diary mentioning Kurt's name was a total fake, with not a single piece of matching info.

Paxton remembered who had brought out this diary. He directly interrogated the guy and quickly got an answer that made him both angry and amused.

This diary was actually cooked up by a member of the Brown Family. These scaredy-cats were worried Paxton would pick a fight with someone he couldn't handle, so they forged a diary and made up a name.

They thought they had pulled it off, but the subordinate who was supposed to plant the diary at the scene, upon hearing that Paxton was offering a 1 million dollar reward, greedily brought the diary back out.

###chapter 431 Interrogation

After figuring out where the fourth diary came from, Paxton felt totally lost. To him, these so-called family members were just like parasites, no real family bond at all.

"Since you didn't die in the fire, I'll finish what you started," Paxton muttered, tying up his lying subordinate and soaking him in gasoline. He struck a match. The poor guy's screams echoed as the flames lit up Paxton's face, the heat doing nothing to melt the ice in his eyes.

Now, Paxton had three more diaries. He could only hope the truth was in one of them. He needed to know which one was the real deal.

To figure out if the diaries were legit, besides Joe, maybe only Francis could help.

Since Paxton's goons caught him, Francis had been locked up. They hadn't beaten him or anything because he gave them some important clues. But Francis was always a bit scared because he had made up all the stuff in the diaries. He didn't even know if such a diary existed.

The only thing Francis did right was that his confession helped some people escape the country illegally without getting caught by Paxton's men. The survivors were grateful to Francis, the unlucky guy. As for those who died, they were probably cursing Paxton and wondering why Francis didn't speak up sooner.

Francis was tied up, with a rope around his neck to keep him from escaping.

Even though he was treated like a tied-up stray dog, at least they fed him every day. It was just fast food, but hey, he was still alive.

One day, Francis got a sandwich. He had just unwrapped it and was about to take a bite when he heard hurried footsteps outside.

He froze. The next moment, the door burst open, and a bunch of guys rushed in, untying the rope around his neck.

"What are you doing? Are you letting me go?" Francis asked, his voice full of hope.

"Mr. Brown wants to see you. Whether you live or die depends on him," one of the guys said with a cold, grim smile.

Francis suddenly felt his legs go weak, almost collapsing. They had to drag him out of the room.

Francis wasn't stupid. He knew Paxton wanting to see him out of the blue was bad news. Most likely, his lies had been found out.

"I'm not going. I don't want to see Paxton. I'm fine staying here. I'm scared to see him. I don't want to go," Francis cried, clinging to the doorframe, refusing to leave.

The thugs pulled and yanked at him, but he wouldn't budge. One of them kicked his arm hard, the pain making him let go.

"If you don't come with us, you'll die right here," one thug threatened, his voice menacing.

Francis turned pale with fear and shut up.

They shoved him into a car. As it bumped along the road, he closed his eyes in despair, silently counting down the moments of his life.

Francis had no clue how many turns the car took or how far they had gone. He was barely conscious, slumped weakly against the seat.

It wasn't death that scared him the most; it was knowing he was about to die.

The car finally stopped at a steel mill.

The door opened, and Francis was yanked out.

Since he could barely walk, two thugs grabbed his arms and dragged him inside.

The machines in the steel mill were roaring, and the heat was intense. One furnace was blazing, molten steel flowing inside.

Paxton stood in front of the furnace, his back to Francis, lost in thought.

Francis was thrown to the ground behind him.

He looked up nervously at Paxton's back.

Paxton turned around, his face calm and unreadable.

"I heard you didn't want to see me. Why?" Paxton asked, his voice steady.

Francis shook his head frantically. "No, that's not it. I just... I just feel nervous."

Seeing the coldness in Paxton's eyes grow, Francis shrank back in fear.

Paxton didn't ask any more questions. He turned to his subordinate and waved his hand. Four diaries were tossed in front of Francis.

Francis stared at the diaries, stunned.

Paxton looked down at him. "I've found the diaries you mentioned, but I don't know which one is real. Now, tell me which one is true!"

Francis trembled. The diaries were just lies he had made up to buy time. He never thought there would be actual diaries.

Seeing Francis hesitate, Paxton snapped, "I don't have time for this. Tell me which one is real!"

Swallowing hard, Francis, with shaking hands, opened one of the diaries.

'Thank God I remember Zane's handwriting. If it matches, I should know which one is real,' Francis thought, feeling a glimmer of hope.

As he flipped through the first diary, a spark of excitement flashed in his eyes; the handwriting was almost identical to Zane's.

Paxton noticed and pointed to the other three diaries. "Are you sure it's this one? What about the others?"

Francis hesitated, then started to look through the other diaries. Sweat dripped from his forehead; the handwriting in the other diaries was almost the same. It seemed like all the diaries had Zane's handwriting.

'Why is all the handwriting the same? Did Zane write diaries for four years? No, the dates are the same too. Could three of them be fake?' Francis's mind raced.

In reality, even without the love poems provided by Joe, Michael and the others could have found Zane's handwriting with a bit of effort. John, Bianca, the masterminds behind the scenes, and the members of the Brown Family had all figured it out this way.

"Which one is it?" Paxton demanded coldly.

'Damn it, I'll just pick one. Paxton won't know the truth anyway,' Francis thought, choosing one of the diaries.

###chapter 432 The Crazy Father

Francis noticed Paxton suddenly shut his eyes after he picked that diary.

"Did I make the right call?" Francis thought, feeling a bit smug.

"You sure it's this one?" Paxton asked, a faint smile playing on his lips.

Francis nodded eagerly. "Yeah, I'm positive. I remember it clearly."

Paxton grabbed the diary, flipped through it nonchalantly, and then tossed it straight into the furnace with a grin.

Flames roared up, and the diary turned to ashes.

Francis's smile vanished, and a sense of dread washed over him. Maybe he picked the wrong one.

"Wait, Mr. Brown, I think I messed up. It should be this one," Francis said, grabbing another diary, trying to look apologetic.

But Paxton's smile faded, and his face turned icy. He glared at Francis with a murderous look.

"There were never any diaries, were there? You were just playing me," Paxton said, staring Francis down.

Francis panicked, shaking his head frantically. "No, there are diaries, I swear."

Paxton closed his eyes and sighed deeply. "At first, when I heard about the diaries, I was thrilled. I thought I finally had a lead on avenging my daughter. But then I started to doubt if they even existed. I searched with doubt until I saw the first diary."

Paxton opened his eyes, his voice as cold as a winter wind, sending chills down Francis's spine.

"But when my guys brought out the second, third, and fourth diaries from that burning house, I knew I was being played," Paxton said, his voice laced with barely contained rage.

Paxton's men sensed what was coming and quickly pinned Francis to the ground.

"It wasn't me, I didn't deceive you, really, there are diaries, please," Francis begged, tears streaming down his face. He'd rather be shot than endure torture.

"I just wanted to avenge my daughter. Why do all of you want to use me? You're exploiting a father's love for his daughter, twisting a father's hatred! Why? Why did you do this?" Paxton roared.

Paxton kicked Francis in the head, over and over, shouting.

"Why is everyone-John, Michael, Isabella, Bianca, and the rest of the family-targeting me? Am I a fool? I just wanted to avenge my daughter! But you're all playing me! Why is this happening?" Paxton's kicks grew more brutal, and Francis's face was a bloody mess.

"I really didn't lie to you, please don't kill me," Francis managed to say.

Feeling drained, Paxton finally stopped."You know, I still had a sliver of hope. That obviously fake diary was set up by my family. They were worried I'd stir up trouble with enemies I couldn't handle, so they made up a name to throw me off. But I figured it out. I kept that fake diary on purpose, hoping you wouldn't pick it. That would've at least meant the other three were legit. But you went and chose the one dead end!" Paxton said coldly, raising his hand.

Francis felt a wave of fear. He couldn't believe his luck was this bad. A twenty-five percent chance, and he picked the wrong one. If he'd chosen any other, he might've made it out alive.

"I'm sorry, Mr. Brown, I just want to live. Honestly, I don't even know if that psycho killer really used our channels. Your guys have killed so many people, I'm terrified. I just want to live, please," Francis cried, looking at Paxton with pleading eyes.

Paxton smiled and pulled out a handkerchief, wiping the blood off his shoes.

After cleaning up, Paxton stuffed the blood-stained handkerchief into Francis's pocket. "You know what? I was planning to make you suffer like my daughter did, to let you feel her pain."

Francis trembled with fear. Everyone in the city knew the horror Paxton's daughter had gone through, and he didn't want to end up like that. It was too terrifying.

"No, please, don't do this. Just kill me, give me a bullet, let me go quickly," Francis begged, hoping Paxton would either spare him or give him a quick death.

What Paxton said next gave Francis a glimmer of hope.

"But in the end, I changed my mind. I shouldn't make you suffer like my daughter, because that would remind me of her pain. As a dad, I can't bear to see that," Paxton sighed deeply.

"Yes, you're a kind dad, and if you want, I can call you dad too," Francis said eagerly.

Paxton smiled at Francis. "I don't have a son like you. Even though I don't want to make you suffer like my daughter, I've thought of other ways. Like this..."

Paxton pointed to the huge furnace behind him. Francis's heart, which had just started to calm down, began to race again.

"You're not thinking of throwing me in there, are you? Mr. Brown, please don't," Francis forced out a very ugly smile, hoping Paxton was joking.

But Paxton's smile had completely vanished.

"Throw him in," Paxton ordered, and his men immediately dragged Francis to the platform above the furnace.

"No, I don't want to die, please! I can work for you, I can do illegal stuff for you, whatever you want, please," Francis pleaded, but no one listened.

Realizing begging was useless, Francis started cursing at Paxton. "Paxton, you bastard, you're a demon! You'll go to hell after you die, just like your daughter! Wait for you and your daughter in hell."

"Get in there," Paxton's subordinate said, kicking Francis into the furnace.

###chapter 433 Pearl's Death

Francis let out a scream and tumbled off the platform into the furnace, sending molten iron splashing everywhere. His screams echoed, making Paxton's crew shiver.

Paxton stayed cool. "Alright, let's head to the hospital."

With that, Paxton turned and walked out, his crew trailing behind him.

Once they were gone, a shadowy figure emerged from the corner, grabbed the three diaries, and slipped out of the steel mill.

Paxton arrived at the hospital and made a beeline for the ICU.

Pearl's doctor, Allan, was already there waiting for him.

"Mr. Brown, are you sure about this? Ms. Brown's condition has just started to improve. With more treatment, she could get better," Allan tried to persuade him.

Paxton glanced through the glass at Pearl, a flicker of pain in his eyes quickly replaced by a steely resolve.

"Your idea of improvement is just that she hasn't had another breakdown. It doesn't mean she's accepted her situation," Paxton said coldly, his voice devoid of any warmth.

Allan took a step back, sensing Paxton was about to do something drastic.

Paxton looked at Pearl lying in the hospital bed and said, "My daughter cares a lot about her looks. If she ever realizes what she's become, she'd rather die. Maybe I should help her with that. But first, I need to find out who did this to her."

With that, Paxton pushed open the ICU door and walked in, not bothering with protective gear.

Allan was stunned. It seemed Paxton was determined to end Pearl's life today. He wanted to intervene but was stopped by one of Paxton's men.

"Doc, maybe you have a conscience, but please respect the wishes of the patient and her family. And think about your own safety," one of Paxton's men warned.

Allan slowly calmed down. He couldn't bear to watch what was about to happen, so he turned away and closed his eyes.

Paxton reached Pearl's bedside. She still had a cochlear implant. Hearing the familiar footsteps, her body twitched.

"Pearl, it's Dad. I know you can hear me. I'm going to say some names, and if one of them hurt you, give me a sign," Paxton said. Pearl's body started to tremble.

"Was it Joseph who hurt you?" Paxton asked.

Pearl's trembling stayed the same. Disappointment flashed in Paxton's eyes. Joseph wasn't the one; he was innocent.

"Was it Bianca? Did she hurt you?" Paxton continued.

When Pearl heard Bianca's name, her trembling increased slightly, but Paxton could tell it was still within her tolerance.

A shadow crossed Paxton's face. Earlier, when Pearl heard Bianca's name, she had twisted violently. It seemed that with the new information and her emotional instability, Paxton had mistakenly thought Bianca was involved too.
